Upon [my]0-i word , [I]0-i once or twice thought that [they]749-the first hippopotami that we had ever seen were coming into [the boat]3322-the boat to gratify it . [Leo]108-leo wanted to fire at [them]749-the first hippopotami that we had ever seen , but [I]0-i dissuaded [him]108-leo , fearing the consequences . Also , [we]735-we saw hundreds of crocodiles basking on [the muddy banks]752-the muddy banks , and thousands upon thousands of water - fowl . Some of these [we]735-we shot , and among [them]749-the first hippopotami that we had ever seen was a wild goose , which , in addition to the sharp - curved spurs on [its]753-its wings , had a spur about three - quarters of an inch long growing from the skull just between the eyes . [We]735-we never shot another like it , so [I]0-i do not know if it was a ' sport " or a distinct species . In the latter case this incident may interest [naturalists]3363-naturalists . [Job]137-job named [it]753-its the Unicorn Goose .[0-i]

About midday the sun grew intensely hot , and the stench drawn up by it from [the marshes which [the river]621-the river drains]754-the marshes which the river drains was something too awful , and caused [us]735-we instantly to swallow precautionary doses of quinine . Shortly afterwards the breeze died away altogether , and as rowing [[our]735-we heavy boat]756-our heavy boat against stream in the heat was out of the question , [we]735-we were thankful enough to get under the shade of a group of trees - a species of willow - that grew by the edge of [the river]621-the river , and lie there and gasp till at length the approach of sunset put a period to [our]735-we miseries . Seeing what appeared to be an open space of water straight ahead of [us]735-we , [we]735-we determined to row there before settling what to do for the night . Just as [we]735-we were about to loosen [the boat]3322-the boat , however , [a beautiful waterbuck , with great horns curving forward , and a white stripe across the rump]759-a beautiful waterbuck , with great horns curving forward , and a white stripe across the rump , came down to [the river]621-the river to drink , without perceiving [us]735-we hidden away within fifty yards under the willows . [Leo]108-leo was the first to catch sight of [it]759-a beautiful waterbuck , with great horns curving forward , and a white stripe across the rump , and , being [an ardent sportsman]761-an ardent sportsman , thirsting for the blood of big game , about which [he]108-leo had been dreaming for months , [he]108-leo instantly stiffened all over , and pointed like a setter dog . Seeing what was the matter , [I]0-i handed [him]108-leo [his]108-leo express rifle , at the same time taking [my]0-i own .

" Now then , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered , " mind [you]108-leo do n't miss . "[0-i]

" Miss ! "[108-leo] [he]108-leo whispered back contemptuously ; " [I]108-leo could not miss it if [I]108-leo tried . "[108-leo]

[He]108-leo lifted the rifle , and the roan - coloured buck , having drunk [his]108-leo fill , raised [his]108-leo head and looked out across [the river]621-the river . [He]108-leo was standing right against the sunset sky on a little eminence , or ridge of ground , which ran across [the swamp]729-the swamp , evidently a favourite path for game , and there was something very beautiful about [him]108-leo . Indeed , [I]0-i do not think that if [I]0-i live to a hundred [I]0-i shall ever forget that desolate and yet most fascinating scene ; it is stamped upon [my]0-i memory . To the right and left were [wide stretches of lonely death - breeding swamp]764-wide stretches of lonely death - breeding swamp , unbroken and unrelieved so far as the eye could reach , except here and there by [ponds of black and peaty water]765-ponds of black and peaty water that , mirror - like , flashed up the red rays of the setting sun . Behind [us]766-us and before stretched the vista of [the sluggish river]767-the sluggish river , ending in glimpses of [a reed - fringed lagoon]768-a reed - fringed lagoon , on the surface of which the long lights of the evening played as the faint breeze stirred the shadows . To the west loomed the huge red ball of the sinking sun , now vanishing down the vapoury horizon , and filling the great heaven , high across whose arch the cranes and wildfowl streamed in line , square , and triangle , with flashes of flying gold and the lurid stain of blood . And then [ourselves]766-us - [three modern Englishmen in [a modern English boat]770-a modern english boat]769-three modern englishmen in a modern english boat - seeming to jar upon and look out of tone with that measureless desolation ; and in front of [us]766-us the noble buck limned out upon a background of ruddy sky .

Bang ! Away [he]108-leo goes with a mighty bound . [Leo]108-leo has missed [him]108-leo . Bang ! right under [him]108-leo again . Now for a shot . [I]0-i must have one , though [he]108-leo is going like an arrow , and a hundred yards away and more . By [Jove]165-jove ! over and over and over ! " Well , [I]0-i think [I]0-i 've wiped [your]108-leo eye there , [Master Leo]108-leo , "[0-i] [I]0-i say , struggling against the ungenerous exultation that in such a supreme moment of one 's existence will rise in [the best - mannered sportsman]771-the best - mannered sportsman 's breast .

" Confound [you]0-i , yes , "[108-leo] growled [Leo]108-leo ; and then , with that quick smile that is one of [his]108-leo charms lighting up [his]108-leo handsome face like a ray of light , " [I]108-leo beg [your]0-i pardon , [old fellow]3147-old fellow . [I]108-leo congratulate [you]0-i ; it was a lovely shot , and [mine]108-leo were vile . "[108-leo]

[We]772-we got out of [the boat]3322-the boat and ran to the buck , which was shot through the spine and stone dead . It took [us]772-we a quarter of an hour or more to clean it and cut off as much of the best meat as [we]772-we could carry , and , having packed this away , [we]772-we had barely light enough to row up into [the lagoon]774-the lagoon - like space , into which , there being [a hollow in [the swamp]729-the swamp]775-a hollow in the swamp , [the river]621-the river here expanded . Just as the light vanished [we]772-we cast anchor about thirty fathoms from [the edge of [the lake]779-the lake]778-the edge of the lake . [We]772-we did not dare to go [ashore]780-ashore , not knowing if [we]772-we should find dry ground to camp on , and greatly fearing the poisonous exhalations from [the marsh]730-the marsh , from which [we]772-we thought [we]772-we should be freer on [the water]538-the water . So [we]772-we lighted a lantern , and made [our]772-we evening meal off another potted tongue in the best fashion that [we]772-we could , and then prepared to go to sleep , only , however , to find that sleep was impossible . For , whether [they]783-they were attracted by the lantern , or by the unaccustomed smell of [a white man]784-a white man for which [they]783-they had been waiting for the last thousand years or so , [I]0-i know not ; but certainly [we]772-we were presently attacked by [tens of thousands of the most blood - thirsty , pertinacious , and huge mosquitoes]785-tens of thousands of the most blood - thirsty , pertinacious , and huge mosquitoes that [I]0-i ever saw or read of . In clouds [they]783-they came , and pinged and buzzed and bit till [we]772-we were nearly mad . Tobacco smoke only seemed to stir [them]783-they into a merrier and more active life , till at length [we]772-we were driven to covering [ourselves]772-we with blankets , head and all , and sitting to slowly stew and continually scratch and swear beneath them . And as [we]772-we sat , suddenly rolling out like thunder through the silence came the deep roar of a lion , and then of a second lion , moving among the reeds within sixty yards of [us]772-we .

" [I]108-leo say , "[108-leo] said [Leo]108-leo , sticking [his]108-leo head out from under [his]108-leo blanket , " lucky [we]772-we ai n't on [the bank]710-the bank , eh , [Avuncular]166-avuncular ? "[108-leo] [Leo]108-leo sometimes addressed [me]0-i in this disrespectful way . " Curse it ! a mosquito has bitten [me]108-leo on the nose , "[108-leo] and the head vanished again .

Shortly after this the moon came up , and notwithstanding every variety of roar that echoed over the water to [us]772-we from the lions on [the banks]690-the banks , [we]772-we began , thinking [ourselves]772-we perfectly secure , to gradually doze off .

[I]0-i do not quite know what it was that made [me]0-i poke [my]0-i head out of the friendly shelter of the blanket , perhaps because [I]0-i found that the mosquitoes were biting right through it . Anyhow , as [I]0-i did so [I]0-i heard [Job]137-job whisper , in a frightened voice -

" Oh , [my]137-job stars , look there ! "[137-job]

Instantly [[we]772-we all of [us]772-we]787-we all of us looked , and this was what [we]772-we saw in the moonlight . Near [the shore]788-the shore were two wide and ever - widening circles of concentric rings rippling away across the surface of [the water]538-the water , and in the heart and centre of the circles were two dark moving objects .

" What is it ? "[0-i] asked [I.]0-i

" It is those damned lions , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] answered [Job]137-job , in a tone which was an odd mixture of a sense of personal injury , habitual respect , and acknowledged fear , " and [they]790-they are swimming here to heat [us]772-we , "[137-job] [he]137-job added , nervously picking up an " h "[137-job] in [his]137-job agitation .

[I]0-i looked again : there was no doubt about it ; [I]0-i could catch the glare of [their]790-they ferocious eyes . Attracted either by the smell of the newly killed waterbuck meat or of [ourselves]772-we , the hungry beasts were actually storming [our]772-we position .

[Leo]108-leo already had [his]108-leo rifle in [his]108-leo hand . [I]0-i called to [him]108-leo to wait till [they]790-they were nearer , and meanwhile grabbed [my]0-i own . Some fifteen feet from [us]772-we the water shallowed on [a bank]791-a bank to the depth of about fifteen inches , and presently [the first of [them]790-they]792-the first of them - it was [the lioness]793-the lioness - got on to it , shook [herself]793-the lioness , and roared . At that moment [Leo]108-leo fired , the bullet went right down [her]793-the lioness open mouth and out at the back of [her]793-the lioness neck , and down [she]793-the lioness dropped , with a splash , dead . The other lion - [a full - grown male]794-a full - grown male - was some two paces behind [her]793-the lioness . At this second [he]794-a full - grown male got [his]794-a full - grown male forepaws on to [the bank]710-the bank , when a strange thing happened . There was a rush and disturbance of the water , such as one sees in [a pond in [England]15-england]796-a pond in england when a pike takes a little fish , only a thousand times fiercer and larger , and suddenly the lion gave a most terrific snarling roar and sprang forward on to [the bank]710-the bank , dragging something black with [him]794-a full - grown male .

" Allah ! "[794-a full - grown male] shouted [Mahomed]158-mahomed , " a crocodile has got [him]799-the lion by the leg ! "[794-a full - grown male] and sure enough [he]794-a full - grown male had . [We]798-we could see the long snout with its gleaming lines of teeth and the reptile body behind it .

And then followed an extraordinary scene indeed . [The lion]799-the lion managed to get well on to [the bank]710-the bank , the crocodile half standing and half swimming , still nipping [his]794-a full - grown male hind leg . [He]799-the lion roared till the air quivered with the sound , and then , with a savage , shrieking snarl , turned round and clawed hold of the crocodile 's head . The crocodile shifted [his]794-a full - grown male grip , having , as [we]798-we afterwards discovered , had one of [his]794-a full - grown male eyes torn out , and slightly turned over ; instantly the lion got [him]794-a full - grown male by the throat and held on , and then over and over [they]801-they rolled upon [the bank]710-the bank struggling hideously . It was impossible to follow [their]801-they movements , but when next [we]798-we got a clear view the tables had turned , for [the crocodile , whose head seemed to be a mass of gore]803-the crocodile , whose head seemed to be a mass of gore , had got the lion 's body in [his]794-a full - grown male iron jaws just above the hips , and was squeezing [him]799-the lion and shaking [him]799-the lion to and fro . For [his]799-the lion part , [the tortured brute , roaring in agony]804-the tortured brute , roaring in agony , was clawing and biting madly at [[his]799-the lion enemy]805-his enemy 's scaly head , and fixing [his]799-the lion great hind claws in the crocodile 's , comparatively speaking , soft throat , ripping it open as one would rip a glove .

Then , all of a sudden , the end came . The lion 's head fell forward on the crocodile 's back , and with an awful groan [he]799-the lion died , and the crocodile , after standing for a minute motionless , slowly rolled over on to [his]794-a full - grown male side , [his]794-a full - grown male jaws still fixed across the carcase of the lion , which , [we]798-we afterwards found , [he]794-a full - grown male had bitten almost in halves .

This duel to the death was a wonderful and a shocking sight , and one that [I]0-i suppose [few men]806-few men have seen - and thus it ended .

When it was all over , leaving [Mahomed]158-mahomed to keep a look out , [we]798-we managed to spend the rest of the night as quietly as the mosquitoes would allow .

VI

AN EARLY CHRISTIAN CEREMONY

Next morning , at the earliest light of dawn , [we]798-we rose , performed such ablutions as circumstances would allow , and generally made ready to start . [I]0-i am bound to say that when there was sufficient light to enable [us]798-we to see [each other]417-each other 's faces [I]0-i , for one , burst out into a roar of laughter . [Job]137-job 's fat and comfortable countenance was swollen out to nearly twice its natural size from mosquito bites , and [Leo]108-leo 's condition was not much better . Indeed , of the three [I]0-i had come off much the best , probably owing to the toughness of [my]0-i dark skin , and to the fact that a good deal of it was covered by hair , for since [we]798-we had started from [England]15-england [I]0-i had allowed [my]0-i naturally luxuriant beard to grow at its own sweet will . But the other two were , comparatively speaking , clean shaved , which of course gave [the enemy]808-the enemy a larger extent of [open country to operate on]809-open country to operate on , though in [Mahomed]158-mahomed 's case the mosquitoes , recognising the taste of [a true believer]810-a true believer , would not touch [him]158-mahomed at any price . How often , [I]0-i wonder , during the next week or so did [we]798-we wish that [we]798-we were flavoured like an Arab !

By the time that [we]798-we had done laughing as heartily as [our]798-we swollen lips would allow , it was daylight , and the morning breeze was coming up from [the sea]593-the sea , cutting lanes through [the dense marsh mists]812-the dense marsh mists , and here and there rolling them before it in great balls of fleecy vapour . So [we]798-we set [our]798-we sail , and having first taken a look at the two dead lions and the alligator , which [we]798-we were of course unable to skin , being destitute of means of curing the pelts , [we]798-we started , and , sailing through [the lagoon]774-the lagoon , followed the course of [the river on the farther side]814-the river on the farther side . At midday , when the breeze dropped , [we]798-we were fortunate enough to find [a convenient piece of dry land on which to camp]815-a convenient piece of dry land on which to camp and light a fire , and here [we]798-we cooked two wild - ducks and some of the waterbuck 's flesh - not in a very appetising way , it is true , but still sufficiently . The rest of the buck 's flesh [we]798-we cut into strips and hung in the sun to dry into " biltong , "[0-i] as , [I]0-i believe , [the South African Dutch]816-the south african dutch call flesh thus prepared . On [this welcome patch of [dry land]818-dry land]817-this welcome patch of dry land [we]798-we stopped till the following dawn , and , as before , spent the night in warfare with the mosquitoes , but without other troubles . The next day or two passed in similar fashion , and without noticeable adventures , except that [we]798-we shot a specimen of a peculiarly graceful hornless buck , and saw many varieties of water - lily in full bloom , some of them blue and of exquisite beauty , though few of the flowers were perfect , owing to the prevalence of a white water - maggot with a green head that fed upon them .

It was on the fifth day of [our]798-we journey , when [we]798-we had travelled , so far as [we]798-we could reckon , about one hundred and thirty - five to a hundred and forty miles westwards from [the coast]819-the coast , that the first event of any real importance occurred . On that morning the usual wind failed [us]798-we about eleven o'clock , and after pulling a little way [we]798-we were forced to halt , more or less exhausted , at what appeared to be the junction of [[our]798-we stream]820-our stream with another of a uniform width of about fifty feet . Some trees grew near at hand - the only trees in all [this country]302-this country were along [the banks of [the river]621-the river]822-the banks of the river , and under these [we]798-we rested , and then , [the land]670-the land being fairly dry just here , walked a little way along the edge of [the river]621-the river to prospect , and shoot a few waterfowl for food . Before [we]798-we had gone fifty yards [we]798-we perceived that all hopes of getting further up [the stream]826-the stream in [the whale - boat]3319-the whale - boat were at an end , for not two hundred yards above where [we]798-we had stopped were a succession of shallows and mudbanks , with not six inches of water over them . [It]828-it was [a watery cul de sac]829-a watery cul de sac .

Turning back , [we]798-we walked some way along [the banks of [the other river]831-the other river]830-the banks of the other river , and soon came to the conclusion , from various indications , that it was not [a river]3213-a river at all , but [an ancient canal , like the one which is to be seen above [Mombasa]51-mombasa , on [the Zanzibar coast]834-the zanzibar coast , connecting [the Tana River]52-the tana river with [the Ozy]53-the ozy , in such a way as to enable the shipping coming down [the Tana]54-the tana to cross to [the Ozy]53-the ozy , and reach [the sea by]835-the sea by [it]52-the tana river , and thus avoid the very dangerous bar that blocks [the mouth of [the Tana]54-the tana]836-the mouth of the tana]833-an ancient canal , like the one which is to be seen above mombasa , on the zanzibar coast , connecting the tana river with the ozy , in such a way as to enable the shipping coming down the tana to cross to the ozy , and reach the sea by it , and thus avoid the very dangerous bar that blocks the mouth of the tana . [The canal before [us]798-we]837-the canal before us had evidently been dug out by [man]3189-man at some remote period of [the world]252-the world 's history , and the results of [his]3189-man digging still remained in the shape of the raised banks that had no doubt once formed towing - paths . Except here and there , where [they]840-they had been hollowed out by the water or fallen in , these banks of stiff binding clay were at a uniform distance from each other , and the depth of [the stream]826-the stream also appeared to be uniform . Current there was little or none , and , as a consequence , the surface of [the canal]842-the canal was choked with vegetable growth , intersected by little paths of clear water , made , [I]0-i suppose , by the constant passage of waterfowl , iguanas , and other vermin . Now , as it was evident that [we]798-we could not proceed up [the river]621-the river , it became equally evident that [we]798-we must either try [the canal]842-the canal or else return to [the sea]593-the sea . [We]798-we could not stop where [we]798-we were , to be baked by the sun and eaten up by the mosquitoes , till [we]798-we died of fever in [that dreary marsh]846-that dreary marsh .

" Well , [I]0-i suppose that [we]798-we must try it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; and [the others]847-the others assented in [their]847-the others various ways - [Leo]108-leo , as though it were the best joke in [the world]252-the world ; [Job]137-job , in respectful disgust ; and [Mahomed]158-mahomed , with an invocation to [the Prophet]167-the prophet , and a comprehensive curse upon [all unbelievers]849-all unbelievers and [their]849-all unbelievers ways of thought and travel .

Accordingly , as soon as the sun got low , having little or nothing more to hope for from [our]798-we friendly wind , [we]798-we started . For the first hour or so [we]798-we managed to row [the boat]3322-the boat , though with great labour ; but after that the weeds got too thick to allow of it , and [we]798-we were obliged to resort to the primitive and most exhausting resource of towing [her]3322-the boat . For two hours [we]798-we laboured , [Mahomed]158-mahomed , [Job]137-job , and [I]0-i , who was supposed to be strong enough to pull against [the two of [them]847-the others]851-the two of them , on [the bank]710-the bank , while [Leo]108-leo sat in the bow of [the boat]3322-the boat , and brushed away the weeds which collected round the cutwater with [Mahomed]158-mahomed 's sword . At dark [we]798-we halted for some hours to rest and enjoy the mosquitoes , but about midnight [we]798-we went on again , taking advantage of the comparative cool of the night . At dawn [we]798-we rested for three hours , and then started once more , and laboured on till about ten o'clock , when a thunderstorm , accompanied by a deluge of rain , overtook [us]798-we , and [we]798-we spent the next six hours practically under water .

[I]0-i do not know that there is any necessity for [me]0-i to describe the next four days of [our]798-we voyage in detail , further than to say that they were , on the whole , the most miserable that [I]0-i ever spent in [my]0-i life , forming one monotonous record of heavy labour , heat , misery , and mosquitoes . All that dreary way [we]798-we passed through [a region of almost endless swamp]854-a region of almost endless swamp , and [I]0-i can only attribute [our]798-we escape from fever and death to the constant doses of quinine and purgatives which [we]798-we took , and the unceasing toil which [we]798-we were forced to undergo . On the third day of [our]798-we journey up [the canal]842-the canal [we]798-we had sighted [a round hill that loomed dimly through the vapours of [the marsh]730-the marsh]856-a round hill that loomed dimly through the vapours of the marsh , and on the evening of the fourth night , when [we]798-we camped , [this hill]858-this hill seemed to be within five - and - twenty or thirty miles of [us]798-we . [We]798-we were by now utterly exhausted , and felt as though [our]798-we blistered hands could not pull [the boat]3322-the boat a yard farther , and that the best thing that [we]798-we could do would be to lie down and die in [that dreadful wilderness of swamp]860-that dreadful wilderness of swamp . It was an awful position , and one in which [I]0-i trust [no other white man]861-no other white man will ever be placed ; and as [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i down in [the boat]3322-the boat to sleep the sleep of utter exhaustion , [I]0-i bitterly cursed [my]0-i folly in ever having been [a party to such a mad undertaking]863-a party to such a mad undertaking , which could , [I]0-i saw , only end in [our]798-we death in [this ghastly land]864-this ghastly land . [I]0-i thought , [I]0-i remember , as [I]0-i slowly sank into a doze , of what the appearance of [the boat]3322-the boat and [[her]3322-the boat unhappy crew]866-her unhappy crew would be in two or three months ' time from that night . There [she]3322-the boat would lie , with gaping seams and half filled with fœtid water , which , when the mist - laden wind stirred [her]3322-the boat , would wash backwards and forwards through [our]798-we mouldering bones , and that would be the end of [her]3322-the boat , and of [those in [her]3322-the boat who would follow after myths and seek out the secrets of Nature]867-those in her who would follow after myths and seek out the secrets of nature .

Already [I]0-i seemed to hear the water rippling against the desiccated bones and rattling them together , rolling [my]0-i skull against [Mahomed]158-mahomed 's , and [his]158-mahomed against [mine]0-i , till at last [Mahomed]158-mahomed 's stood straight up upon its vertebræ , and glared at [me]0-i through its empty eyeholes , and cursed [me]0-i with [its]158-mahomed grinning jaws , because [I]0-i , [a dog of [a Christian]869-a christian]868-a dog of a christian , disturbed the last sleep of [a true believer]810-a true believer . [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes , and shuddered at the horrid dream , and then shuddered again at something that was not a dream , for two great eyes were gleaming down at [me]0-i through the misty darkness . [I]0-i struggled up , and in [my]0-i terror and confusion shrieked , and shrieked again , so that the others sprang up too , reeling , and drunken with sleep and fear . And then all of a sudden there was a flash of cold steel , and a great spear was held against [my]0-i throat , and behind it other spears gleamed cruelly .

" Peace , "[0-i] said a voice , speaking in Arabic , or rather in some dialect into which Arabic entered very largely ; " who are [ye]0-i who come hither swimming on [the water]538-the water ? Speak or [ye]0-i die , "[0-i] and the steel pressed sharply against [my]0-i throat , sending a cold chill through [me]0-i .

" [We]3368-we are [travellers]3369-travellers , and have come hither by chance , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered in [my]0-i best Arabic , which appeared to be understood , for [the man]271-the man turned [his]271-the man head , and , addressing [a tall form that towered up in the background]872-a tall form that towered up in the background , said , " [Father]168-father , shall [we]3368-we slay ? "[271-the man]

" What is the colour of [the men]532-the men ? "[271-the man] said a deep voice in answer .

" White is [their]532-the men colour . "[271-the man]

" Slay not , "[271-the man] was the reply . " Four suns since was the word brought to [me]271-the man from ' [She]3371-she - who - must - be - obeyed , ' ' [White men]3372-white men come ; if [white men]3372-white men come , slay [them]3372-white men not . ' Let [them]3372-white men be brought to [the house of ' [She]3371-she - who - must - be - obeyed]3374-the house of ' she - who - must - be - obeyed . ' Bring forth [the men]532-the men , and let that which [they]532-the men have with [them]532-the men be brought forth also . "[271-the man]

" Come , "[271-the man] said [the man]271-the man , half leading and half dragging [me]0-i from [the boat]3322-the boat , and as [he]271-the man did so [I]0-i perceived [other men]875-other men doing the same kind office to [[my]0-i companions]876-my companions .

On the bank were gathered [a company of some fifty men]877-a company of some fifty men . In that light all [I]0-i could make out was that [they]877-a company of some fifty men were armed with huge spears , were very tall , and strongly built , comparatively light in colour , and nude , save for a leopard skin tied round the middle .

[Presently Leo]108-leo and [Job]137-job were bundled out and placed beside [me]0-i .

" What on earth is up ? "[108-leo] said [Leo]108-leo , rubbing [his]108-leo eyes .

" Oh , [Lord]3376-lord ! [sir]3126-sir , here 's a rum go , "[137-job] ejaculated [Job]137-job ; and just at that moment a disturbance ensued , and [Mahomed]158-mahomed came tumbling between [us]878-us , followed by [a shadowy form with an uplifted spear]879-a shadowy form with an uplifted spear .

" [Allah]159-allah ! [Allah]159-allah ! "[158-mahomed] howled [Mahomed]158-mahomed , feeling that [he]158-mahomed had little to hope from [man]3189-man , " protect [me]158-mahomed ! protect [me]158-mahomed ! "[158-mahomed]

" [Father]168-father , it is [a black one]3378-a black one , "[271-the man] said a voice . " What said ' [She]3379-she - who - must - be - obeyed ' about [the black one]3380-the black one ? "[271-the man]

" [She]3379-she said naught ; but slay [him]3380-the black one not . Come hither , [[my]271-the man son]3150-my son . "[271-the man]

[The man]271-the man advanced , and the tall shadowy form bent forward and whispered something .

" Yes , yes , "[882-the other] said [the other]882-the other , and chuckled in a rather blood - curdling tone .

" Are [the three white men]3382-the three white men [there]3168-there ? "[883-the form] asked [the form]883-the form .

" Yes , [they]3382-the three white men are there . "[271-the man]

" Then bring up that which is made ready for [them]3382-the three white men , and let [the men]532-the men take all that can be brought from the thing which floats . "[271-the man]

Hardly had [he]271-the man spoken when [men]516-men came running up , carrying on [their]516-men shoulders [neither more nor less than palanquins]885-neither more nor less than palanquins - [four bearers]886-four bearers and [two spare men]887-two spare men to a palanquin - and in these it was promptly indicated [we]888-we were expected to stow [ourselves]888-we .

" Well ! "[108-leo] said [Leo]108-leo , " it is a blessing to find [anybody]3032-anybody to carry [us]888-we after having to carry [ourselves]888-we so long . "[108-leo]

[Leo]108-leo always takes a cheerful view of things .

There being no help for it , after seeing [the others]847-the others into [theirs]847-the others [I]0-i tumbled into [my]0-i own litter , and very comfortable [I]0-i found it . It appeared to be manufactured of cloth woven from grass - fibre , which stretched and yielded to every motion of the body , and , being bound top and bottom to the bearing pole , gave a grateful support to the head and neck .

Scarcely had [I]0-i settled [myself]0-i when , accompanying [their]847-the others steps with a monotonous song , [the bearers]890-the bearers started at a swinging trot . For half an hour or so [I]0-i lay still , reflecting on the very remarkable experiences that [we]888-we were going through , and wondering if [any of [[my]0-i eminently respectable fossil friends down at [Cambridge]2-cambridge]892-my eminently respectable fossil friends down at cambridge]891-any of my eminently respectable fossil friends down at cambridge would believe [me]0-i if [I]0-i were to be miraculously set at the familiar dinner - table for the purpose of relating [them]847-the others . [I]0-i do not want to convey any disrespectful notion or slight when [I]0-i call [those good and learned men fossils]893-those good and learned men fossils , but [my]0-i experience is that [people]454-people are apt to fossilise even at a University if [they]454-people follow the same paths too persistently . [I]0-i was getting fossilised [myself]0-i , but of late [my]0-i stock of ideas has been very much enlarged . Well , [I]0-i lay and reflected , and wondered what [on earth]895-on earth would be the end of it all , till at last [I]0-i ceased to wonder , and went to sleep .

[I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must have slept for seven or eight hours , getting the first real rest that [I]0-i had had since the night before the loss of the dhow , for when [I]0-i woke the sun was high in the heavens . [We]896-we were still journeying on at a pace of about four miles an hour . Peeping out through the mist - like curtains of the litter , which were ingeniously fixed to the bearing pole , [I]0-i perceived to [my]0-i infinite relief that [we]896-we had passed out of [the region of eternal swamp]897-the region of eternal swamp , and were now travelling over [swelling grassy plains]898-swelling grassy plains towards [a cup - shaped hill]899-a cup - shaped hill . Whether or not it was [the same hill that [we]896-we had seen from [the canal]842-the canal]900-the same hill that we had seen from the canal [I]0-i do not know , and have never since been able to discover , for , as [we]896-we afterwards found out , [these people]902-these people will give little information upon such points . Next [I]0-i glanced at [the men who were bearing [me]0-i]903-the men who were bearing me . [They]903-the men who were bearing me were of a magnificent build , few of [them]903-the men who were bearing me being under six feet in height , and yellowish in colour . Generally [their]903-the men who were bearing me appearance had a good deal in common with that of [the East African Somali]904-the east african somali , only [their]903-the men who were bearing me hair was not frizzed up , but hung in thick black locks upon [their]903-the men who were bearing me shoulders . [Their]903-the men who were bearing me features were aquiline , and in many cases exceedingly handsome , the teeth being especially regular and beautiful . But notwithstanding [their]903-the men who were bearing me beauty , it struck [me]0-i that , on the whole , [I]0-i had never seen a more evil - looking set of faces . There was an aspect of cold and sullen cruelty stamped upon [them]903-the men who were bearing me that revolted [me]0-i , and which in some cases was almost uncanny in its intensity .

Another thing that struck [me]0-i about [them]903-the men who were bearing me was that [they]903-the men who were bearing me never seemed to smile . Sometimes [they]903-the men who were bearing me sang the monotonous song of which [I]0-i have spoken , but when [they]903-the men who were bearing me were not singing [they]903-the men who were bearing me remained almost perfectly silent , and the light of a laugh never came to brighten [their]903-the men who were bearing me sombre and evil countenances . Of what race could [these people]902-these people be ? [Their]902-these people language was a bastard Arabic , and yet [they]902-these people were not [Arabs]170-arabs ; [I]0-i was quite sure of that . For one thing [they]902-these people were too dark , or rather yellow . [I]0-i could not say why , but [I]0-i know that [their]902-these people appearance filled [me]0-i with a sick fear of which [I]0-i felt ashamed . While [I]0-i was still wondering another litter came up alongside of [mine]0-i . In [it]906-it - for the curtains were drawn - sat [an old man]907-an old man , clothed in a whitish robe , made apparently from coarse linen , that hung loosely about [him]907-an old man , who , [I]0-i at once jumped to the conclusion , was [the shadowy figure that had stood on the bank and been addressed as " Father]3386-the shadowy figure that had stood on the bank and been addressed as " father . "[907-an old man] [He]907-an old man was [a wonderful - looking old man , with a snowy beard , so long that the ends of it hung over the sides of the litter]908-a wonderful - looking old man , with a snowy beard , so long that the ends of it hung over the sides of the litter , and [he]907-an old man had a hooked nose , above which flashed out a pair of eyes as keen as a snake 's , while [his]907-an old man whole countenance was instinct with a look of wise and sardonic humour impossible to describe on paper .

" Art [thou]0-i awake , [stranger]3387-stranger ? "[907-an old man] [he]907-an old man said in a deep and low voice .

" Surely , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered courteously , feeling certain that [I]0-i should do well to conciliate this ancient Mammon of Unrighteousness .

[He]907-an old man stroked [his]907-an old man beautiful white beard , and smiled faintly .

" From [whatever country [thou]0-i camest]3389-whatever country thou camest , "[907-an old man] [he]907-an old man said , " and by the way it must be from one where somewhat of [our]3390-we language is known , [they]3391-they teach [[their]3391-they children]3392-their children courtesy there , [[my]907-an old man stranger son]3393-my stranger son . And now wherefore comest [thou]0-i unto [this land]3394-this land , which [scarce an alien foot]3395-scarce an alien foot has pressed from the time that [man]3189-man knoweth ? Art [thou]0-i and those with [thee]0-i weary of life ? "[907-an old man]

" [We]3390-we came to find new things , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered boldly . " [We]3390-we are tired of the old things ; [we]3390-we have come up out of [the sea]593-the sea to know that which is unknown . [We]3390-we are of [a brave race who fear not death]3398-a brave race who fear not death , [[my]0-i very much respected father]3399-my very much respected father - that is , if [we]3390-we can get a little information before [we]3390-we die . "[0-i]

" Humph ! "[909-the old gentleman] said [the old gentleman]909-the old gentleman , " that may be true ; it is rash to contradict , otherwise [I]909-the old gentleman should say that [thou]0-i wast lying , [[my]909-the old gentleman son]3150-my son . However , [I]909-the old gentleman dare to say that ' [She]3401-she - who - must - be - obeyed ' will meet [thy]0-i wishes in the matter . "[909-the old gentleman]

" Who is ' [She]3401-she - who - must - be - obeyed ' ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , curiously .

[The old man]910-the old man glanced at [the bearers]890-the bearers , and then answered , with a little smile that somehow sent [my]0-i blood to [my]0-i heart -

" Surely , [[my]910-the old man stranger son]3393-my stranger son , [thou]0-i wilt learn soon enough , if it be [her]3401-she pleasure to see [thee]0-i at all in the flesh . "[910-the old man]

" In the flesh ? "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " What may [[my]0-i father]3091-my father wish to convey ? "[0-i]

But [the old man]910-the old man only laughed a dreadful laugh , and made no reply .

" What is the name of [[[my]0-i father]3091-my father 's people]3405-my father 's people ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" The name of [[my]913-the people of the rocks people]3406-my people is [Amahagger]171-the amahagger "[913-the people of the rocks] [the People of [the Rocks]55-the rocks]913-the people of the rocks .

" And if [a son]3039-a son might ask , what is the name of [[my]913-the people of the rocks father]3091-my father ? "[913-the people of the rocks]

" [My]913-the people of the rocks name is [Billali]137-job . "[913-the people of the rocks]

" And whither go [we]3409-we , [[my]913-the people of the rocks father]3091-my father ? "[913-the people of the rocks]

" That shalt [thou]3411-thou see , "[910-the old man] and at a sign from [him]910-the old man [[his]910-the old man bearers]914-his bearers started forward at a run till [they]914-his bearers reached the litter in which [Job]137-job was reposing with one leg hanging over the side . Apparently , however , [he]910-the old man could not make much out of [Job]137-job , for presently [I]0-i saw [[his]910-the old man bearers]914-his bearers trot forward to [Leo]108-leo 's litter .

And after that , as nothing fresh occurred , [I]0-i yielded to the pleasant swaying motion of the litter , and went to sleep again . [I]0-i was dreadfully tired . When [I]0-i woke [I]0-i found that [we]916-we were passing through a rocky defile of [a lava formation with precipitous sides , in which grew many beautiful trees and flowering shrubs]917-a lava formation with precipitous sides , in which grew many beautiful trees and flowering shrubs .

Presently this defile took a turn , and a lovely sight unfolded itself to [my]0-i eyes . Before [us]916-we was a vast cup of green from four to six miles in extent , in the shape of [a Roman amphitheatre]918-a roman amphitheatre . The sides of this great cup were rocky , and clothed with bush , but the centre was of [the richest meadow land]919-the richest meadow land , studded with single trees of magnificent growth , and watered by meandering brooks . On [this rich plain]920-this rich plain grazed herds of goats and cattle , but [I]0-i saw no sheep . At first [I]0-i could not imagine what [this strange spot]921-this strange spot could be , but presently it flashed upon [me]0-i that [it]921-this strange spot must represent [the crater of [some long - extinct volcano]923-some long - extinct volcano which had afterwards been [a lake]924-a lake]922-the crater of some long - extinct volcano which had afterwards been a lake , and was ultimately drained in some unexplained way . And here [I]0-i may state that from [my]0-i subsequent experience of this and [a much larger , but otherwise similar spot , which [I]0-i shall have occasion to describe by - and - by]925-a much larger , but otherwise similar spot , which i shall have occasion to describe by - and - by , [I]0-i have every reason to believe that this conclusion was correct . What puzzled [me]0-i , however , was , that although there were [people]454-people moving about herding the goats and cattle , [I]0-i saw no signs of any human habitation . Where did [they]454-people all live ? [I]0-i wondered . [My]0-i curiosity was soon destined to be gratified . Turning to the left the string of litters followed [the cliffy sides of [the crater]928-the crater]927-the cliffy sides of the crater for a distance of about half a mile , or perhaps a little less , and then halted . Seeing [the old gentleman]909-the old gentleman , [[my]0-i adopted " father]3412-my adopted " father , "[909-the old gentleman] [Billali]137-job , emerge from [his]909-the old gentleman litter , [I]0-i did the same , and so did [Leo]108-leo and [Job]137-job . The first thing [I]0-i saw was [[our]930-we wretched Arab companion]931-our wretched arab companion , Mahomed , lying exhausted on the ground . It appeared that [he]931-our wretched arab companion had not been provided with a litter , but had been forced to run the entire distance , and , as [he]931-our wretched arab companion was already quite worn out when [we]930-we started , [his]931-our wretched arab companion condition now was one of great prostration .

On looking round [we]930-we discovered that the place where [we]930-we had halted was a platform in front of [the mouth of [a great cave]933-a great cave]932-the mouth of a great cave , and piled upon [this platform]934-this platform were the entire contents of [the whale - boat]3319-the whale - boat , even down to the oars and sail . Round [the cave]936-the cave stood [groups of [the men who had escorted [us]930-we]938-the men who had escorted us , and [other men of a similar stamp]939-other men of a similar stamp]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp . [They]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp were all tall and all handsome , though [they]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp varied in [their]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp degree of darkness of skin , some being as dark as [Mahomed]158-mahomed , and [some as yellow as a Chinese]940-some as yellow as a chinese . [They]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp were naked , except for the leopard - skin round the waist , and each of [them]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp carried a huge spear .

There were also [some women among [them]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp , who , instead of the leopard - skin , wore a tanned hide of a small red buck , something like that of the oribé , only rather darker in colour]941-some women among them , who , instead of the leopard - skin , wore a tanned hide of a small red buck , something like that of the oribé , only rather darker in colour . [These women]942-these women were , as [a class]943-a class , exceedingly good - looking , with large , dark eyes , well - cut features , and a thick bush of curling hair - not crisped like a negro 's - ranging from black to chestnut in hue , with all shades of intermediate colour . [[Some]3218-some , but very few of [them]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp]945-some , but very few of them , wore a yellowish linen garment , such as [I]0-i have described as worn by [Billali]137-job , but this , as [we]930-we afterwards discovered , was a mark of rank , rather than an attempt at clothing . For the rest , [their]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp appearance was not quite so terrifying as that of [the men]532-the men , and [they]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp sometimes , though rarely , smiled . As soon as [we]930-we had alighted [they]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp gathered round [us]930-we and examined [us]930-we with curiosity , but without excitement . [Leo]108-leo 's tall , athletic form and clear - cut Grecian face , however , evidently excited [their]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp attention , and when [he]108-leo politely lifted [his]108-leo hat to [them]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp , and showed [his]108-leo curling yellow hair , there was a slight murmur of admiration . Nor did it stop there ; for , after regarding [him]108-leo critically from head to foot , [the handsomest of [the young women]948-the young women]947-the handsomest of the young women - [one wearing a robe , and with hair of a shade between brown and chestnut]949-one wearing a robe , and with hair of a shade between brown and chestnut - deliberately advanced to [him]108-leo , and , in a way that would have been winning had it not been so determined , quietly put [her]947-the handsomest of the young women arm round [his]108-leo neck , bent forward , and kissed [him]108-leo on the lips .

[I]0-i gave a gasp , expecting to see [Leo]108-leo instantly speared ; and [Job]137-job ejaculated , " The hussy - well , [I]137-job never ! "[137-job] As for [Leo]108-leo , [he]108-leo looked slightly astonished ; and then , remarking that [we]950-we had clearly got into [a country where [they]937-groups of the men who had escorted us , and other men of a similar stamp followed the customs of [the early Christians]952-the early christians]951-a country where they followed the customs of the early christians , deliberately returned the embrace .

Again [I]0-i gasped , thinking that something would happen ; but , to [my]0-i surprise , though [some of [the young women]948-the young women]953-some of the young women showed traces of vexation , [the older ones]955-the older ones and [the men]532-the men only smiled slightly . When [we]950-we came to understand the customs of [this extraordinary people]957-this extraordinary people the mystery was explained . It then appeared that , in direct opposition to the habits of almost [every other savage race in [the world]252-the world]958-every other savage race in the world , [women among [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger]960-women among the amahagger are not only upon terms of perfect equality with [the men]532-the men , but are not held to [them]960-women among the amahagger by any binding ties . Descent is traced only through the line of [the mother]962-the mother , and while [individuals]963-individuals are as proud of a long and superior female ancestry as [we]950-we are of [[our]950-we families]964-our families in [Europe]16-europe , [they]963-individuals never pay attention to , or even acknowledge , [any man]965-any man as [[their]963-individuals father]966-their father , even when [their]963-individuals male parentage is perfectly well known . There is but [one titular male parent of [each tribe]968-each tribe]967-one titular male parent of each tribe , or , as [they]963-individuals call it , " Household , "[965-any man] and [he]965-any man is [[its]967-one titular male parent of each tribe elected and immediate ruler]969-its elected and immediate ruler , with the title of " [Father]331-father . "[965-any man] For instance , [the man Billali]970-the man billali was [the father of this " household , "[970-the man billali] which consisted of about [seven thousand individuals all told]972-seven thousand individuals all told , and [no other man]973-no other man was ever called by that name]971-the father of this " household , " which consisted of about seven thousand individuals all told , and no other man was ever called by that name . When [a woman]284-a woman took a fancy to [a man]352-a man [she]284-a woman signified [her]284-a woman preference by advancing and embracing [him]352-a man publicly , in the same way that [this handsome and exceedingly prompt young lady]976-this handsome and exceedingly prompt young lady , who was called [Ustane]172-ustane , had embraced [Leo]108-leo . If [he]352-a man kissed [her]284-a woman back it was a token that [he]352-a man accepted [her]284-a woman , and the arrangement continued until one of [them]977-them wearied of it . [I]0-i am bound , however , to say that the change of [husbands]978-husbands was not nearly so frequently as might have been expected . Nor did quarrels arise out of it , at least among [the men]532-the men , who , when [[their]532-the men wives]980-their wives deserted [them]532-the men in favour of [a rival]981-a rival , accepted the whole thing much as [we]982-we accept the income - tax or [our]982-we marriage laws , as something not to be disputed , and as tending to the good of [the community]983-the community , however disagreeable [they]977-them may in particular instances prove to [the individual]984-the individual .

It is very curious to observe how the customs of [mankind]985-mankind on this matter vary in [different countries]986-different countries , making morality an affair of latitude , and what is right and proper in [one place]987-one place wrong and improper in another . It must , however , be understood that , since [all civilised nations]988-all civilised nations appear to accept it as an axiom that ceremony is the touchstone of morality , there is , even according to [our]982-we canons , nothing immoral about this Amahagger custom , seeing that the interchange of the embrace answers to [our]982-we ceremony of marriage , which , as [we]982-we know , justifies most things .

[VII

USTANE]172-ustane SINGS

When the kissing operation was finished - by the way , [none of [the young ladies]990-the young ladies]989-none of the young ladies offered to pet [me]0-i in this fashion , though [I]0-i saw one hovering round [Job]137-job , to [that respectable individual]991-that respectable individual 's evident alarm - [the old man]910-the old man [Billali]137-job advanced , and graciously waved [us]982-we into [the cave]936-the cave , whither [we]982-we went , followed by [Ustane]172-ustane , who did not seem inclined to take the hints [I]0-i gave [her]172-ustane that [we]982-we liked privacy .

Before [we]982-we had gone five paces it struck [me]0-i that [the cave that [we]982-we were entering]994-the cave that we were entering was none of [Nature]173-nature 's handiwork , but , on the contrary , had been hollowed by the hand of [man]3189-man . So far as [we]982-we could judge [it]994-the cave that we were entering appeared to be about one hundred feet in length by fifty wide , and very lofty , resembling a cathedral aisle more than anything else . From [this main aisle]996-this main aisle opened passages at a distance of every twelve or fifteen feet , leading , [I]0-i supposed , to [smaller chambers]997-smaller chambers . About fifty feet from the entrance of [the cave]936-the cave , just where the light began to get dim , a fire was burning , which threw huge shadows upon the gloomy walls around . Here [Billali]137-job halted , and asked [us]982-we to be seated , saying that [the people]3344-the people would bring [us]982-we food , and accordingly [we]982-we squatted [ourselves]982-we down upon the rugs of skins which were spread for [us]982-we , and waited . Presently the food , consisting of goat 's flesh boiled , fresh milk in an earthenware pot , and boiled cobs of Indian corn , was brought by [young girls]1000-young girls . [We]982-we were almost starving , and [I]0-i do not think that [I]0-i ever in [my]0-i life before ate with such satisfaction . Indeed , before [we]982-we had finished [we]982-we literally ate up everything that was set before [us]982-we .

When [we]982-we had done , [[our]982-we somewhat saturnine host]1001-our somewhat saturnine host , [Billali]137-job , who had been watching [us]982-we in perfect silence , rose and addressed [us]982-we . [He]137-job said that it was a wonderful thing that had happened . [No man]3309-no man had ever known or heard of [white strangers]1003-white strangers arriving in [the country of [the People of [the Rocks]55-the rocks]913-the people of the rocks]1004-the country of the people of the rocks . Sometimes , though rarely , [black men]1006-black men had come [here]3102-here , and from [them]1006-black men [they]1006-black men had heard of the existence of [men much whiter than [themselves]1006-black men , who sailed on [the sea]593-the sea]1008-men much whiter than themselves , who sailed on the sea in [ships]1010-ships , but for the arrival of such there was no precedent . [We]982-we had , however , been seen dragging [the boat]3322-the boat up [the canal]842-the canal , and [he]137-job told [us]982-we frankly that [he]137-job had at once given orders for [our]982-we destruction , seeing that it was unlawful for [any stranger]334-any stranger to enter here , when a message had come from " [She]3414-she - who - must - be - obeyed , "[137-job] saying that [our]982-we lives were to be spared , and that [we]982-we were to be brought hither .

" Pardon [me]0-i , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father , "[0-i] [I]0-i interrupted at this point ; " but if , as [I]0-i understand , ' [She]3414-she - who - must - be - obeyed ' lives yet farther off , how could [she]3414-she have known of [our]982-we approach ? "[0-i]

[Billali]137-job turned , and seeing that [we]982-we were alone - for [the young lady]1014-the young lady , [Ustane]172-ustane , had withdrawn when [he]137-job had begun to speak - said , with a curious little laugh -

" Are there none in [[your]137-job land]3416-your land who can see without eyes and hear without ears ? Ask no questions ; [She]3414-she knew . "[1014-the young lady]

[I]0-i shrugged [my]0-i shoulders at this , and [he]137-job proceeded to say that no further instructions had been received on the subject of [our]982-we disposal , and this being so [he]137-job was about to start to interview " [She]3414-she - who - must - be - obeyed , "[137-job] generally spoken of , for the sake of brevity , as " [Hiya]174-hiya "[1015-she] or [She]1015-she simply , who [he]137-job gave [us]982-we to understand was [the Queen of [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger]1016-the queen of the amahagger , and learn [her]1015-she wishes .

[I]0-i asked [him]137-job how long [he]137-job proposed to be away , and [he]137-job said that by travelling hard [he]137-job might be back on the fifth day , but there were many miles of marsh to cross before [he]137-job came to where [She]1015-she was . [He]137-job then said that every arrangement would be made for [our]982-we comfort during [his]137-job absence , and that , as [he]137-job personally had taken a fancy to [us]982-we , [he]137-job sincerely trusted that the answer [he]137-job should bring from [She]1015-she would be one favourable to the continuation of [our]982-we existence , but at the same time [he]137-job did not wish to conceal from [us]982-we that [he]137-job thought this doubtful , as [every stranger who had ever come into [the country]3308-the country during [[his]137-job grandmother]1019-his grandmother 's life , [[his]137-job mother]3040-his mother 's life , and [his]137-job own life]1017-every stranger who had ever come into the country during his grandmother 's life , his mother 's life , and his own life , had been put to death without mercy , and in a way [he]137-job would not harrow [our]982-we feelings by describing ; and this had been done by the order of [She]1015-she [herself]1015-she , at least [he]137-job supposed that it was by [her]1015-she order . At any rate , [she]1015-she never interfered to save [them]1021-them .

" Why , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " but how can that be ? [You]137-job are [an old man]907-an old man , and the time [you]137-job talk of must reach back [three men]3418-three men 's lives . How therefore could [She]1015-she have ordered the death of [anybody]3032-anybody at the beginning of the life of [[your]137-job grandmother]3420-your grandmother , seeing that [herself]1015-she [she]1015-she would not have been born ? "[0-i]

Again [he]137-job smiled - that same faint , peculiar smile , and with a deep bow departed , without making any answer ; nor did [we]982-we see [him]137-job again for five days .

When [he]137-job had gone [we]982-we discussed the situation , which filled [me]0-i with alarm . [I]0-i did not at all like the accounts of [this mysterious Queen]1022-this mysterious queen , " [She]1022-this mysterious queen - who - must - be - obeyed , "[1022-this mysterious queen] or more shortly [She]1022-this mysterious queen , who apparently ordered the execution of [any unfortunate stranger]1023-any unfortunate stranger in a fashion so unmerciful . [Leo]108-leo , too , was depressed about it , but consoled [himself]137-job by triumphantly pointing out that this [She]1022-this mysterious queen was undoubtedly [the person referred to in the writing on the potsherd]1024-the person referred to in the writing on the potsherd and in [[his]137-job father]3053-his father 's letter , in proof of which [he]137-job advanced [Billali]137-job 's allusions to [her]1022-this mysterious queen age and power . [I]0-i was by this time too overwhelmed with the whole course of events that [I]0-i had not even the heart left to dispute a proposition so absurd , so [I]0-i suggested that [we]982-we should try to go out and get a bath , of which [we]982-we all stood sadly in need .

Accordingly , having indicated [our]982-we wish to [a middle - aged individual of an unusually saturnine cast of countenance]1026-a middle - aged individual of an unusually saturnine cast of countenance , even among [this saturnine people]1027-this saturnine people , who appeared to be deputed to look after [us]982-we now that [the Father of the hamlet]1028-the father of the hamlet had departed , [we]982-we started in a body - having first lit [our]982-we pipes . Outside [the cave]936-the cave [we]982-we found quite [a crowd of [people]454-people]1030-a crowd of people evidently watching for [our]982-we appearance , but when [they]1030-a crowd of people saw [us]982-we come out smoking [they]1030-a crowd of people vanished this way and that , calling out that [we]982-we were [great magicians]1032-great magicians . Indeed , nothing about [us]982-we created so great a sensation as [our]982-we tobacco smoke - not even [our]982-we firearms . After this [we]982-we succeeded in reaching a stream that had its source in a strong ground spring , and taking [our]982-we bath in peace , though [some of [the women]1034-the women]1033-some of the women , not excepting [Ustane]172-ustane , showed a decided inclination to follow [us]982-we even [there]3168-there .

[We]982-we found tobacco growing in [this country]302-this country as it does in [every other part of [Africa]9-africa]1037-every other part of africa , and , although [they]1030-a crowd of people were so absolutely ignorant of its other blessed qualities , [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger use it habitually in the form of snuff and also for medicinal purposes . - L. H. H.

By the time that [we]982-we had finished this most refreshing bath the sun was setting ; indeed , when [we]982-we got back to [the big cave]1038-the big cave it had already set . [The cave]936-the cave [itself]936-the cave was full of [people]454-people gathered round fires - for several more had now been lighted - and eating [their]454-people evening meal by [their]454-people lurid light , and by that of various lamps which were set about or hung upon the walls . These lamps were of a rude manufacture of baked earthenware , and of all shapes , some of them graceful enough . The larger ones were formed of big red earthenware pots , filled with clarified melted fat , and having a reed wick stuck through a wooden disk which filled the top of the pot . This sort of lamp required the most constant attention to prevent its going out whenever the wick burnt down , as there were no means of turning it up . The smaller hand lamps , however , which were also made of baked clay , were fitted with wicks manufactured from [the pith of a palm - tree]1041-the pith of a palm - tree , or sometimes from the stem of a very handsome variety of fern . This kind of wick was passed through a round hole at the end of the lamp , to which a sharp piece of hard wood was attached wherewith to pierce and draw it up whenever it showed signs of burning low .

For a while [we]982-we sat down and watched [this grim people]1042-this grim people eating [their]1042-this grim people evening meal in silence as grim as [themselves]1042-this grim people , till at length , getting tired of contemplating [them]1042-this grim people and the huge moving shadows on the rocky walls , [I]0-i suggested to [[our]982-we new keeper]1043-our new keeper that [we]982-we should like to go to bed .

Without a word [he]1043-our new keeper rose , and , taking [me]0-i politely by the hand , advanced with a lamp to one of [the small passages that [I]0-i had noticed opening out of [the central cave]1045-the central cave]1044-the small passages that i had noticed opening out of the central cave . This [we]982-we followed for about five paces , when [it]1046-it suddenly widened out into [a small chamber , about eight feet square , and hewn out of [the living rock]1048-the living rock]1047-a small chamber , about eight feet square , and hewn out of the living rock . On one side of [this chamber]1049-this chamber was a stone slab , about three feet from the ground , and running [its]1050-its entire length like a bunk in [a cabin]1051-a cabin , and on [this slab]1052-this slab [he]1043-our new keeper intimated that [I]0-i was to sleep . There was no window or air - hole to [the chamber]1053-the chamber , and no furniture ; and , on looking at [it]1047-a small chamber , about eight feet square , and hewn out of the living rock more closely , [I]0-i came to the disturbing conclusion in which , as [I]0-i afterwards discovered , [I]0-i was quite right that [it]1047-a small chamber , about eight feet square , and hewn out of the living rock had originally served for a sepulchre for [the dead]1054-the dead rather than a sleeping - place for [the living]1055-the living , the slab being designed to receive the corpse of the departed . The thought made [me]0-i shudder in spite of [myself]0-i ; but , seeing that [I]0-i must sleep somewhere , [I]0-i got over the feeling as best [I]0-i might , and returned to [the cavern]1056-the cavern to get [my]0-i blanket , which had been brought up from [the boat]3322-the boat with the other things . There [I]0-i met [Job]137-job , who , having been inducted to [a similar apartment]1058-a similar apartment , had flatly declined to stop in [it]1058-a similar apartment , saying that the look of [the place]1059-the place gave [him]137-job the horrors , and that [he]137-job might as well be dead and buried in [[[his]137-job grandfather]3057-his grandfather 's brick grave]1061-his grandfather 's brick grave at once , and expressed [his]137-job determination of sleeping with [me]0-i if [I]0-i would allow [him]137-job . This , of course , [I]0-i was only too glad to do .

The night passed very comfortably on the whole . [I]0-i say on the whole , for personally [I]0-i went through a most horrible nightmare of being buried alive , induced , no doubt , by the sepulchral nature of [my]0-i surroundings . At dawn [we]1062-we were aroused by a loud trumpeting sound , produced , as [we]1062-we afterwards discovered , by [a young Amahagger]1063-a young amahagger blowing through a hole bored in its side into a hollowed elephant tusk , which was kept for the purpose .

Taking the hint , [we]1062-we got up and went down to [the stream]826-the stream to wash , after which the morning meal was served . At breakfast one of [the women , no longer quite young]1065-the women , no longer quite young , advanced and publicly kissed [Job]137-job . [I]0-i think it was in its way the most delightful thing putting its impropriety aside for a moment that [I]0-i ever saw . Never shall [I]0-i forget [the respectable Job]137-job 's abject terror and disgust . [Job]137-job , like [myself]0-i , is a bit of [a misogynist]1066-a misogynist - [I]0-i fancy chiefly owing to the fact of [his]137-job having been [one of [a family of seventeen]1068-a family of seventeen]1067-one of a family of seventeen - and the feelings expressed upon [his]137-job countenance when [he]137-job realised that [he]137-job was not only being embraced publicly , and without authorisation on [his]137-job own part , but also in the presence of [[his]137-job masters]1069-his masters , were too mixed and painful to admit of accurate description . [He]137-job sprang to [his]137-job feet , and pushed [the woman]3243-the woman , [a buxom person of about thirty]1071-a buxom person of about thirty , from [him]137-job .

" Well , [I]137-job never ! "[137-job] [he]137-job gasped , whereupon probably thinking that [he]137-job was only coy , [she]3243-the woman embraced [him]137-job again .

" Be off with [you]1072-the lady ! Get away , [[you]1072-the lady minx]3421-you minx ! "[137-job] [he]137-job shouted , waving the wooden spoon , with which [he]137-job was eating [his]137-job breakfast , up and down before [the lady]1072-the lady 's face . " Beg [your]1072-the lady pardon , [gentlemen]3294-gentlemen , [I]137-job am sure [I]137-job have n't encouraged [her]3243-the woman . Oh , [Lord]3376-lord ! [she]3243-the woman 's coming for [me]137-job again . Hold [her]3243-the woman , [Mr. Holly]109-holly ! please hold [her]3243-the woman ! [I]137-job ca n't stand it ; [I]137-job ca n't , indeed . This has never happened to [me]137-job before , [gentlemen]3294-gentlemen , never . There 's nothing against [my]137-job character , "[137-job] and here [he]137-job broke off , and ran as hard as [he]137-job could go down [the cave]936-the cave , and for once [I]0-i saw [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger laugh . As for [the woman]3243-the woman , however , [she]3243-the woman did not laugh . On the contrary , [she]3243-the woman seemed to bristle with fury , which the mockery of [the other women]1075-the other women about only served to intensify . [She]3243-the woman stood there literally snarling and shaking with indignation , and , seeing [her]3243-the woman , [I]0-i wished [Job]137-job 's scruples had been at [Jericho]175-jericho , forming a shrewd guess that [his]137-job admirable behaviour had endangered [our]1076-our throats . Nor , as the sequel shows , was [I]0-i wrong .

[The lady]1072-the lady having retreated , [Job]137-job returned in a great state of nervousness , and keeping [his]137-job weather eye fixed upon [every woman who came near [him]137-job]1078-every woman who came near him . [I]0-i took an opportunity to explain to [[our]1076-our hosts]1079-our hosts that [Job]137-job was [a married man]1080-a married man , and had had very unhappy experiences in [his]137-job domestic relations , which accounted for [his]137-job presence [here]3102-here and [his]137-job terror at the sight of [women]327-women , but [my]0-i remarks were received in grim silence , it being evident that [[our]1076-our retainer]677-our retainer 's behaviour was considered as a slight to the " household "[1034-the women] at large , although [the women]1034-the women , after the manner of [some of [[their]1034-the women most civilised sisters]1086-their most civilised sisters]1085-some of their most civilised sisters , made merry at the rebuff of [[their]1034-the women companion]1087-their companion .

After breakfast [we]1076-our took a walk and inspected [the Amahagger herds]1088-the amahagger herds , and also [[their]1088-the amahagger herds cultivated lands]1089-their cultivated lands . [They]1088-the amahagger herds have two breeds of cattle , [one large and angular , with no horns , but yielding beautiful milk]1090-one large and angular , with no horns , but yielding beautiful milk ; and the other , a red breed , very small and fat , excellent for meat , but of no value for milking purposes . [This last breed]1091-this last breed closely resembles [the Norfolk red - pole strain]1092-the norfolk red - pole strain , only it has horns which generally curve forward over the head , sometimes to such an extent that they have to be cut to prevent them from growing into the bones of the skull . The goats are long - haired , and are used for eating only , at least [I]0-i never saw [them]1088-the amahagger herds milked . As for the Amahagger cultivation , it is primitive in the extreme , being all done by means of a spade made of iron , for [these people]902-these people smelt and work iron . This spade is shaped more like a big spear - head than anything else , and has no shoulder to it on which the foot can be set . As a consequence , the labour of digging is very great . It is , however , all done by [the men]532-the men , [the women]1034-the women , contrary to the habits of most savage races , being entirely exempt from manual toil . But then , as [I]0-i think [I]0-i have said elsewhere , among [the Amahagger]1096-the amahagger [the weaker sex]1097-the weaker sex has established its rights .

At first [we]1076-our were much puzzled as to the origin and constitution of [this extraordinary race]1098-this extraordinary race , points upon which [they]1088-the amahagger herds were singularly uncommunicative . As the time went on - for the next four days passed without any striking event - [we]1076-our learnt something from [[Leo]108-leo 's lady friend]1099-leo 's lady friend Ustane , who , by the way , stuck to [that young gentleman]1100-that young gentleman like [his]1100-that young gentleman own shadow . As to origin , [they]1088-the amahagger herds had none , at least , so far as [she]1099-leo 's lady friend was aware . There were , however , [she]1099-leo 's lady friend informed [us]1076-our , mounds of masonry and many pillars , near the place where [She]1099-leo 's lady friend lived , which was called [K"r]56-k"r , and which [the wise]3425-the wise said had once been houses wherein [men]516-men lived , and it was suggested that [they]1088-the amahagger herds were descended from [these men]3427-these men . [No one]3428-no one , however , dared go near [these great ruins]3429-these great ruins , because [they]3429-these great ruins were haunted : [they]3428-no one only looked on [them]3429-these great ruins from a distance . [Other similar ruins]3430-other similar ruins were to be seen , [she]1099-leo 's lady friend had heard , in [various parts of [the country]3308-the country]3431-various parts of the country , that is , wherever one of [the mountains]3433-the mountains rose above [the level of [the swamp]729-the swamp]3434-the level of the swamp . Also [the caves in which [they]1088-the amahagger herds lived]3436-the caves in which they lived had been hollowed out of the rocks by [men]516-men , perhaps [the same who built [the cities]3439-the cities]3438-the same who built the cities . [They]1088-the amahagger herds themselves had no written laws , only custom , which was , however , quite as binding as law . If [any man]965-any man offended against the custom , [he]965-any man was put to death by order of [the Father of the "[1099-leo 's lady friend] Household]3441-the father of the " household . " [I]1099-leo 's lady friend asked how [he]965-any man was put to death , and [she]1102-a queen only smiled and said that [I]1099-leo 's lady friend might see one day soon .[1099-leo 's lady friend]

[They]1101-they had [a Queen]1102-a queen , however . [She]1102-a queen was [[their]1101-they Queen]1103-their queen , but [she]1102-a queen was very rarely seen , perhaps once in two or three years , when [she]1102-a queen came forth to pass sentence on [some offenders]1104-some offenders , and when seen was muffled up in a big cloak , so that [nobody]488-nobody could look upon [her]1102-a queen face . [Those who waited upon [her]1102-a queen]1106-those who waited upon her were deaf and dumb , and therefore could tell no tales , but it was reported that [she]1102-a queen was lovely as [no other woman]1107-no other woman was lovely , or ever had been . It was rumoured also that [she]1102-a queen was immortal , and had power over all things , but [she]1102-a queen , [Ustane]172-ustane , could say nothing of all that . What [she]1102-a queen believed was that [the Queen]1108-the queen chose [a husband]1109-a husband from time to time , and as soon as [a female child]1110-a female child was born , [this husband]1111-this husband , who was never again seen , was put to death . Then [the female child]1112-the female child grew up and took the place of [the Queen]1108-the queen when [its mother]1114-its mother died , and had been buried in [the great caves]1115-the great caves . But of these matters none could speak with certainty . Only [She]1102-a queen was obeyed throughout the length and breadth of [the land]670-the land , and to question [her]1102-a queen command was instant death . [She]1102-a queen kept [a guard]1117-a guard , but had no regular army , and to disobey [her]1102-a queen was to die .

[I]0-i asked what size [the land]670-the land was , and how many [people]454-people lived in [it]670-the land . [She]1102-a queen answered that there were ten " Households , "[1102-a queen] like this that [she]1102-a queen knew of , including the big " Household , "[1102-a queen] where [the Queen]1108-the queen was , that all the " Households "[1102-a queen] lived in caves , in places resembling [this stretch of raised country]1121-this stretch of raised country , dotted about in [a vast extent of swamp , which was only to be threaded by secret paths]1122-a vast extent of swamp , which was only to be threaded by secret paths . Often the " Households "[1102-a queen] made war on each other until [She]1102-a queen sent word that it was to stop , and then [they]1123-they instantly ceased . That and the fever which [they]1123-they caught in crossing [the swamps]3176-the swamps prevented [their]1123-they numbers from increasing too much . [They]1123-they had no connection with [any other race]1125-any other race , indeed [none]1126-none lived near [them]1123-they , or were able to thread [the vast swamps]1127-the vast swamps . Once an army from [the direction of [the great river]3239-the great river]1128-the direction of the great river presumably [the Zambesi]73-the zambesi had attempted to attack [them]1123-they , but [they]1123-they got lost in [the marshes]1130-the marshes , and at night , seeing the great balls of fire that move about there , tried to come to [them]1123-they , thinking that [they]1123-they marked [the enemy camp]1131-the enemy camp , and half of [them]1123-they were drowned . As for [the rest]1132-the rest , [they]1132-the rest soon died of fever and starvation , not a blow being struck at [them]1132-the rest . [The marshes]1130-the marshes , [she]1134-she told [us]1135-we , were absolutely impassable except to those who knew [the paths]1136-the paths , adding , what [I]0-i could well believe , that [we]1135-we should never have reached [this place where [we]1135-we then were]1137-this place where we then were had [we]1135-we not been brought thither .

These and many other things [we]1135-we learnt from [Ustane]172-ustane during the four days ' pause before [our]1135-we real adventures began , and , as may be imagined , they gave [us]1135-we considerable cause for thought . The whole thing was exceedingly remarkable , almost incredibly so , indeed , and the oddest part of it was that so far it did more or less correspond to the ancient writing on the sherd . And now it appeared that there was [a mysterious Queen clothed by rumour with dread and wonderful attributes]1138-a mysterious queen clothed by rumour with dread and wonderful attributes , and commonly known by the impersonal , but , to [my]0-i mind , rather awesome title of [She]1134-she . Altogether , [I]0-i could not make it out , nor could [Leo]108-leo , though of course [he]108-leo was exceedingly triumphant over [me]0-i because [I]0-i had persistently mocked at the whole thing . As for [Job]137-job , [he]108-leo had long since abandoned any attempt to call [his]108-leo reason [his]108-leo own , and left it to drift upon the sea of circumstance . [Mahomed]158-mahomed , [the Arab]734-the arab , who was , by the way , treated civilly indeed , but with chilling contempt , by [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger , was , [I]0-i discovered , in a great fright , though [I]0-i could not quite make out what [he]108-leo was frightened about . [He]108-leo would sit crouched up in a corner of [the cave]936-the cave all day long , calling upon [Allah]159-allah and [the Prophet]1141-the prophet to protect [him]108-leo . When [I]0-i pressed [him]108-leo about it , [he]108-leo said that [he]108-leo was afraid because [these people]902-these people were not [men]516-men or [women]327-women at all , but devils , and that this was [an enchanted land]1145-an enchanted land ; and , upon [my]0-i word , once or twice since then [I]0-i have been inclined to agree with [him]108-leo . And so the time went on , till the night of the fourth day after [Billali]137-job had left , when something happened .

[We]1146-we three and [Ustane]172-ustane were sitting round a fire in [the cave]936-the cave just before bedtime , when suddenly [the woman , who had been brooding in silence]1148-the woman , who had been brooding in silence , rose , and laid [her]1148-the woman , who had been brooding in silence hand upon [Leo]108-leo 's golden curls , and addressed [him]108-leo . Even now , when [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes , [I]0-i can see [her]1148-the woman , who had been brooding in silence proud , imperial form , clothed alternately in dense shadow and the red flickering of the fire , as [she]1148-the woman , who had been brooding in silence stood , the wild centre of as weird a scene as [I]0-i ever witnessed , and delivered [herself]1148-the woman , who had been brooding in silence of the burden of [her]1148-the woman , who had been brooding in silence thoughts and forebodings in a kind of rhythmical speech that ran something as follows : -

[Thou]1149-thee art [my]0-i chosen - [I]0-i have waited for [thee]1149-thee from the beginning ! [Thou]1149-thee art very beautiful . Who hath hair like unto [thee]1149-thee , or skin so white ? Who hath so strong an arm , who is so much [a man]352-a man ? Thine eyes are the sky , and the light in them is the stars . [Thou]1149-thee art perfect and of a happy face , and [my]0-i heart turned itself towards [thee]1149-thee .
