Ay , when [mine]0-i eyes fell upon [thee]1149-thee [I]0-i did desire [thee]1149-thee , - Then did [I]0-i take [thee]1149-thee to [me]0-i - oh , [thou]1149-thee Beloved , And hold [thee]1149-thee fast , lest harm should come unto [thee]1149-thee . Ay , [I]0-i did cover thine head with [mine]0-i hair , lest the sun should strike it ; And altogether was [I]0-i thine , and [thou]1149-thee wast altogether mine . And so it went for a little space , till Time was in labour with an evil Day ; And then what befell on that day ? Alas ! [[my]0-i Beloved]1151-my beloved , [I]0-i know not ! But [I]0-i , [I]0-i saw [thee]1149-thee no more - [I]0-i , [I]0-i was lost in the blackness . And [she]1149-thee who is stronger did take [thee]1149-thee ; ay , [she]1149-thee who is fairer than [Ustane]172-ustane . Yet didst [thou]1149-thee turn and call upon [me]0-i , and let thine eyes wander in the darkness . But , nevertheless , [she]1149-thee prevailed by Beauty , and led [thee]1149-thee down [horrible places]1152-horrible places , And then , ah ! then [[my]0-i Beloved]1151-my beloved - -

Here [this extraordinary woman]1154-this extraordinary woman broke off [her]1154-this extraordinary woman speech , or chant , which was so much musical gibberish to [us]1155-us , for all that [we]1155-us understood of what [she]1154-this extraordinary woman was talking about , and seemed to fix [her]1154-this extraordinary woman flashing eyes upon the deep shadow before [her]1154-this extraordinary woman . Then in a moment [they]1156-they acquired a vacant , terrified stare , as though [they]1156-they were striving to realise some half - seen horror . [She]1154-this extraordinary woman lifted [her]1154-this extraordinary woman hand from [Leo]108-leo 's head , and pointed into the darkness . [We]1155-us all looked , and could see nothing ; but [she]1154-this extraordinary woman saw something , or thought [she]1154-this extraordinary woman did , and something evidently that affected even [her]1154-this extraordinary woman iron nerves , for , without another sound , down [she]1154-this extraordinary woman fell senseless between [us]1155-us .

[Leo]108-leo , who was growing really attached to [this remarkable young person]1157-this remarkable young person , was in a great state of alarm and distress , and [I]0-i , to be perfectly candid , was in a condition not far removed from superstitious fear . The whole scene was an uncanny one .

Presently , however , [she]1154-this extraordinary woman recovered , and sat up with an extraordinary convulsive shudder .

" What didst [thou]1154-this extraordinary woman mean , [Ustane]1157-this remarkable young person ? "[108-leo] asked [Leo]108-leo , who , thanks to years of tuition , spoke [Arabic]142-arabic very prettily .

" Nay , [[my]1154-this extraordinary woman chosen]3442-my chosen , "[1154-this extraordinary woman] [she]1154-this extraordinary woman answered , with a little forced laugh . " [I]1154-this extraordinary woman did but sing unto [thee]1154-this extraordinary woman after the fashion of [[my]1154-this extraordinary woman people]3406-my people . Surely , [I]1154-this extraordinary woman meant nothing . How could [I]1154-this extraordinary woman speak of that which is not yet ? "[1154-this extraordinary woman]

" And what didst [thou]1154-this extraordinary woman see , [Ustane]172-ustane ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , looking [her]1154-this extraordinary woman sharply in the face .

" Nay , "[1154-this extraordinary woman] [she]1154-this extraordinary woman answered again , " [I]1154-this extraordinary woman saw naught . Ask [me]1154-this extraordinary woman not what [I]1154-this extraordinary woman saw . Why should [I]1154-this extraordinary woman fright [ye]1154-this extraordinary woman ? "[1154-this extraordinary woman] And then , turning to [Leo]108-leo with a look of the most utter tenderness that [I]0-i ever saw upon the face of [a woman , civilised or savage]1158-a woman , civilised or savage , [she]1154-this extraordinary woman took [his]108-leo head between [her]1154-this extraordinary woman hands , and kissed [him]108-leo on the forehead as [a mother]1159-a mother might .

" When [I]1154-this extraordinary woman am gone from [thee]108-leo , [[my]1154-this extraordinary woman chosen]3442-my chosen , "[1154-this extraordinary woman] [she]1154-this extraordinary woman said ; " when at night [thou]108-leo stretchest out thine hand and canst not find [me]1154-this extraordinary woman , then shouldst [thou]108-leo think at times of [me]1154-this extraordinary woman , for of a truth [I]1154-this extraordinary woman love [thee]108-leo well , though [I]1154-this extraordinary woman be not fit to wash [thy]108-leo feet . And now let [us]1161-us love and take that which is given [us]1161-us , and be happy ; for in the grave there is no love and no warmth , nor any touching of the lips . Nothing perchance , or perchance but bitter memories of what might have been . To - night the hours are [our]1161-us own , how know [we]1161-us to whom they shall belong to - morrow ? "[1154-this extraordinary woman]

VIII

THE FEAST , AND AFTER !

On the day following this remarkable scene - a scene calculated to make a deep impression upon [anybody who beheld it , more because of what it suggested and seemed to foreshadow than of what it]1160-anybody who beheld it , more because of what it suggested and seemed to foreshadow than of what it revealed - it was announced to [us]1161-us that a feast would be held that evening in [our]1161-us honour . [I]0-i did [my]0-i best to get out of it , saying that [we]1161-us were [modest people]1162-modest people , and cared little for feasts , but [my]0-i remarks being received with the silence of displeasure , [I]0-i thought it wisest to hold [my]0-i tongue .

Accordingly , just before sundown , [I]0-i was informed that everything was ready , and , accompanied by [Job]137-job , went into [the cave]936-the cave , where [I]0-i met [Leo]108-leo , who was , as usual , followed by [Ustane]172-ustane . [These two]1164-these two had been out walking somewhere , and knew nothing of the projected festivity till that moment . When [Ustane]172-ustane heard of it [I]0-i saw an expression of horror spring up upon [her]172-ustane handsome features . Turning [she]172-ustane caught [a man who was passing up [the cave]936-the cave]1165-a man who was passing up the cave by the arm , and asked [him]1165-a man who was passing up the cave something in an imperious tone . [His]1165-a man who was passing up the cave answer seemed to reassure [her]172-ustane a little , for [she]172-ustane looked relieved , though far from satisfied . Next [she]172-ustane appeared to attempt some remonstrance with [the man]271-the man , who was [a person in authority]1168-a person in authority , but [he]1165-a man who was passing up the cave spoke angrily to [her]172-ustane , and shook [her]172-ustane off , and then , changing [his]1165-a man who was passing up the cave mind , led [her]172-ustane by the arm , and sat [her]172-ustane down between [himself]1165-a man who was passing up the cave and [another man in the circle round the fire]1169-another man in the circle round the fire , and [I]0-i perceived that for some reason of [her]172-ustane own [she]172-ustane thought it best to submit .

The fire in [the cave]936-the cave was an unusually big one that night , and in a large circle round [it]1171-it were gathered about [thirty - five men]1172-thirty - five men and [two women]1173-two women , [Ustane]172-ustane and [the woman to avoid whom [Job]137-job had played the r"le of another Scriptural character]3445-the woman to avoid whom job had played the r"le of another scriptural character . [The men]532-the men were sitting in perfect silence , as was [their]532-the men custom , each with [his]1165-a man who was passing up the cave great spear stuck upright behind [him]1165-a man who was passing up the cave , in a socket cut in the rock for that purpose . Only [one or two]3447-one or two wore the yellowish linen garment of which [I]3445-the woman to avoid whom job had played the r"le of another scriptural character have spoken , the rest had nothing on except the leopard 's skin about the middle .[3445-the woman to avoid whom job had played the r"le of another scriptural character]

" What 's up now , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] said [Job]137-job , doubtfully . " Bless [us]3449-us and save [us]3449-us , there 's [that woman]3450-that woman again . Now , surely , [she]3450-that woman ca n't be after [me]137-job , seeing that [I]137-job have given [her]3450-that woman no encouragement . [They]532-the men give [me]137-job the creeps , [the whole lot of [them]532-the men]3451-the whole lot of them , and that 's a fact . Why look , [they]532-the men have asked [Mahomed]158-mahomed to dine , too . There , [that lady of mine]3452-that lady of mine is talking to [him]158-mahomed in as nice and civil a way as possible . Well , [I]137-job 'm glad it is n't [me]137-job , that 's all . "[137-job]

[We]1174-we looked up , and sure enough [the woman in question]1175-the woman in question had risen , and was escorting [the wretched Mahomed]1176-the wretched mahomed from [his]1176-the wretched mahomed corner , where , overcome by some acute prescience of horror , [he]1176-the wretched mahomed had been seated , shivering , and calling on [Allah]159-allah . [He]1176-the wretched mahomed appeared unwilling enough to come , if for no other reason perhaps because it was an unaccustomed honour , for hitherto [his]1176-the wretched mahomed food had been given to [him]1176-the wretched mahomed apart . Anyway [I]0-i could see that [he]1176-the wretched mahomed was in a state of great terror , for [his]1176-the wretched mahomed tottering legs would scarcely support [his]1176-the wretched mahomed stout , bulky form , and [I]0-i think it was rather owing to the resources of barbarism behind [him]1176-the wretched mahomed , in the shape of [a huge Amahagger with a proportionately huge spear]1177-a huge amahagger with a proportionately huge spear , than to the seductions of [the lady who led [him]1176-the wretched mahomed by the hand , that [he]1176-the wretched mahomed consented to come at all]1178-the lady who led him by the hand , that he consented to come at all .

" Well , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [the others]847-the others , " [I]0-i do n't at all like the look of things , but [I]0-i suppose [we]3453-we must face it out . Have [you]847-the others [fellows]3454-fellows got [your]847-the others revolvers on ? because , if so , [you]847-the others had better see that they are loaded . "[0-i]

" [I]137-job have , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] said [Job]137-job , tapping [his]137-job Colt , " but [Mr. Leo]108-leo has only got [his]108-leo hunting knife , though that is big enough , surely . "[137-job]

Feeling that it would not do to wait while the missing weapon was fetched , [we]1180-we advanced boldly , and seated [ourselves]1180-we in a line , with [our]1180-we backs against the side of [the cave]936-the cave .

As soon as [we]1180-we were seated , an earthenware jar was passed round containing a fermented fluid , of by no means unpleasant taste , though apt to turn upon the stomach , made from crushed grain - not Indian corn , but a small brown grain that grows upon its stem in clusters , not unlike that which in [the southern part of [Africa]9-africa]1182-the southern part of africa is known by the name of [Kafir corn]177-kafir corn . The vase which contained this liquor was very curious , and as it more or less resembled many hundreds of others in use among the Amahagger [I]0-i may as well describe it . These vases are of a very ancient manufacture , and of all sizes . None such can have been made in [the country]3308-the country for hundreds , or rather thousands , of years . They are found in the rock tombs , of which [I]0-i shall give a description in [their]1184-they proper place , and [my]0-i own belief is that , after the fashion of [the Egyptians , with whom [the former inhabitants of [this country]302-this country]1186-the former inhabitants of this country may have had some connection]1185-the egyptians , with whom the former inhabitants of this country may have had some connection , [they]1184-they were used to receive the viscera of [the dead]1054-the dead . [Leo]108-leo , however , is of opinion that , as in the case of Etruscan amphoræ , they were placed [there]3168-there for the spiritual use of [the deceased]1190-the deceased . [They]1184-they are mostly two - handled , and of all sizes , some being nearly three feet in height , and running from that down to as many inches . In shape they vary , but all are exceedingly beautiful and graceful , being made of a very fine black ware , not lustrous , but slightly rough . On this groundwork are inlaid figures much more graceful and lifelike than any others that [I]0-i have seen on antique vases . Some of these inlaid pictures represent love - scenes with a childlike simplicity and freedom of manner which would not commend itself to the taste of the present day . Others again give pictures of [maidens]1191-maidens dancing , and yet others of hunting - scenes . For instance , the very vase from which [we]1180-we were then drinking had on one side a most spirited drawing of [men , apparently white in colour]1192-men , apparently white in colour , attacking [a bull - elephant with spears]1193-a bull - elephant with spears , while on the reverse was a picture , not quite so well done , of [a hunter]1194-a hunter shooting an arrow at a running antelope , [I]0-i should say from the look of it either an eland or a koodoo .

This is a digression at a critical moment , but it is not too long for the occasion , for the occasion itself was very long . With the exception of the periodical passing of the vase , and the movement necessary to throw fuel on to the fire , nothing happened for the best part of a whole hour . [Nobody]488-nobody spoke a word . There [we]1180-we all sat in perfect silence , staring at the glare and glow of the large fire , and at the shadows thrown by the flickering earthenware lamps which , by the way , were not ancient . On the open space between [us]1180-we and the fire lay a large wooden tray , with four short handles to it , exactly like [a butcher]1196-a butcher 's tray , only not hollowed out . By the side of the tray was a great pair of long - handled iron pincers , and on the other side of the fire was a similar pair . Somehow [I]0-i did not at all like the appearance of this tray and the accompanying pincers . There [I]0-i sat and stared at [them]1184-they and at the silent circle of the fierce moody faces of [the men]532-the men , and reflected that it was all very awful , and that [we]1180-we were absolutely in the power of [this alarming people , who , to [me]0-i at any rate , were all the more formidable because [their]1184-they true character was still very much of a mystery to [us]1180-we]1198-this alarming people , who , to me at any rate , were all the more formidable because their true character was still very much of a mystery to us . [They]1184-they might be better than [I]0-i thought [them]1184-they , or [they]1184-they might be worse . [I]0-i feared that [they]1184-they were worse , and [I]0-i was not wrong . It was a curious sort of a feast , [I]0-i reflected , in appearance indeed , an entertainment of the Barmecide stamp , for there was absolutely nothing to eat .

At last , just as [I]0-i was beginning to feel as though [I]0-i were being mesmerised , a move was made . Without the slightest warning , [a man from the other side of the circle]1199-a man from the other side of the circle called out in a loud voice -

" Where is the flesh that [we]1180-we shall eat ? "[1199-a man from the other side of the circle]

Thereon [everybody in the circle]1200-everybody in the circle answered in a deep measured tone , and stretching out the right arm towards the fire as [he]1199-a man from the other side of the circle spoke -

" The flesh will come . "[1199-a man from the other side of the circle]

" Is it a goat ? "[1201-the same man] said [the same man]1201-the same man .

" [It]3456-it is [a goat without horns , and more than a goat]3457-a goat without horns , and more than a goat , and [we]1180-we shall slay it , "[1202-they] [they]1202-they answered with one voice , and turning half round [they]1202-they one and all grasped the handles of [their]1202-they spears with the right hand , and then simultaneously let [them]1184-they go .

" Is it an ox ? "[271-the man] said [the man]271-the man again .

" It is [an ox without horns , and more than an ox]3458-an ox without horns , and more than an ox , and [we]1180-we shall slay it , "[271-the man] was the answer , and again the spears were grasped , and again let go .

Then came a pause , and [I]0-i noticed , with horror and a rising of the hair , that [the woman next to [Mahomed]158-mahomed]1204-the woman next to mahomed began to fondle [him]158-mahomed , patting [his]158-mahomed cheeks and calling [him]158-mahomed by names of endearment while [her]1204-the woman next to mahomed fierce eyes played up and down [his]158-mahomed trembling form . [I]0-i do not know why the sight frightened [me]0-i so , but it did frighten [us]1205-we all dreadfully , especially [Leo]108-leo . The caressing was so snake - like , and so evidently a part of some ghastly formula that had to be gone through . [I]0-i saw [Mahomed]158-mahomed turn white under [his]158-mahomed brown skin , sickly white with fear .

[We]1205-we afterwards learnt that its object was to pretend to [the victim]1206-the victim that [he]158-mahomed was the object of love and admiration , and so to sooth [his]158-mahomed injured feelings , and cause [him]158-mahomed to expire in a happy and contented frame of mind . - L. H. H.

" Is the meat ready to be cooked ? "[1207-the voice] asked [the voice]1207-the voice , more rapidly .

" It is ready ; it is ready . "[1207-the voice]

" Is the pot hot to cook it ? "[1207-the voice] it continued , in a sort of scream that echoed painfully down the great recesses of [the cave]936-the cave .

" It is hot ; it is hot . "[1207-the voice]

" Great heavens ! "[108-leo] roared [Leo]108-leo , " remember the writing , ' [The people who place pots upon the heads of [strangers]3229-strangers]3228-the people who place pots upon the heads of strangers . ' "[108-leo]

As [he]108-leo said the words , before [we]1205-we could stir , or even take the matter in , [two great ruffians]1209-two great ruffians jumped up , and , seizing the long pincers , thrust them into the heart of the fire , and [the woman who had been caressing [Mahomed]158-mahomed]1210-the woman who had been caressing mahomed suddenly produced a fibre noose from under [her]1210-the woman who had been caressing mahomed girdle or moocha , and , slipping it over [his]158-mahomed shoulders , ran it tight , while [the men next to [him]158-mahomed]1211-the men next to him seized [him]158-mahomed by the legs . [The two men with the pincers]1212-the two men with the pincers gave a heave , and , scattering the fire this way and that upon the rocky floor , lifted from it a large earthenware pot , heated to a white heat . In an instant , almost with a single movement , [they]1212-the two men with the pincers had reached the spot where [Mahomed]158-mahomed was struggling . [He]158-mahomed fought like [a fiend]1213-a fiend , shrieking in the abandonment of [his]158-mahomed despair , and notwithstanding the noose round [him]158-mahomed , and the efforts of [the men who held [his]158-mahomed legs]1214-the men who held his legs , [the advancing wretches]1215-the advancing wretches were for the moment unable to accomplish [their]1215-the advancing wretches purpose , which , horrible and incredible as it seems , was to put the red - hot pot upon [his]158-mahomed head .

[I]0-i sprang to [my]0-i feet with a yell of horror , and drawing [my]0-i revolver fired it by a sort of instinct straight at [the diabolical woman who had been caressing [Mahomed]158-mahomed]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed , and was now gripping [him]158-mahomed in [her]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed arms . The bullet struck [her]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed in the back and killed [her]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed , and to this day [I]0-i am glad that it did , for , as it afterwards transpired , [she]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed had availed [herself]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed of the anthropophagous customs of [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger to organise the whole thing in revenge of the slight put upon [her]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed by [Job]137-job . [She]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed sank down dead , and as [she]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed did so , to [my]0-i terror and dismay , [Mahomed]158-mahomed , by a superhuman effort , burst from [[his]158-mahomed tormenters]1217-his tormenters , and , springing high into the air , fell dying upon [her]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed corpse . The heavy bullet from [my]0-i pistol had driven through the bodies of both , at once striking down [the murderess]1218-the murderess , and saving [[her]1216-the diabolical woman who had been caressing mahomed victim]1219-her victim from a death a hundred times more horrible . It was an awful and yet a most merciful accident .

For a moment there was a silence of astonishment . [The Amahagger]171-the amahagger had never heard the report of a firearm before , and its effects dismayed [them]171-the amahagger . But the next [a man close to [us]1221-us]1220-a man close to us recovered [himself]1220-a man close to us , and seized [his]1220-a man close to us spear preparatory to making a lunge with it at [Leo]108-leo , who was the nearest to [him]1220-a man close to us .

" Run for it ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted , setting the example by starting up [the cave]936-the cave as hard as [my]0-i legs would carry [me]0-i . [I]0-i would have made for the open air if it had been possible , but there were [men in the way]1223-men in the way , and , besides , [I]0-i had caught sight of the forms of [a crowd of people standing out clear against the skyline]1224-a crowd of people standing out clear against the skyline beyond the entrance to [the cave]936-the cave . Up [the cave]936-the cave [I]0-i went , and after [me]0-i came [the others]847-the others , and after [them]847-the others thundered [the whole crowd of cannibals]1228-the whole crowd of cannibals , mad with fury at the death of [the woman]3243-the woman . With a bound [I]0-i cleared the prostrate form of [Mahomed]158-mahomed . As [I]0-i flew over [him]158-mahomed [I]0-i felt the heat from the red - hot pot , which was lying close by , strike upon [my]0-i legs , and by its glow saw [his]158-mahomed hands - for [he]158-mahomed was not quite dead - still feebly moving . At [the top of [the cave]936-the cave]1230-the top of the cave was a little platform of rock three feet or so high by about eight deep , on which two large lamps were placed at night . Whether [this platform]934-this platform had been left as a seat , or as a raised point afterwards to be cut away when [it]934-this platform had served [its]934-this platform purpose as a standing place from which to carry on the excavations , [I]0-i do not know - at least , [I]0-i did not then . At any rate , [we]1233-us all three reached [it]934-this platform , and , jumping on [it]934-this platform , prepared to sell [our]1233-us lives as dearly as [we]1233-us could . For a few seconds [the crowd that was pressing on [our]1233-us heels]1234-the crowd that was pressing on our heels hung back when [they]1234-the crowd that was pressing on our heels saw [us]1233-us face round upon [them]1234-the crowd that was pressing on our heels . [Job]137-job was on one side of [the rock]550-the rock to the left , [Leo]108-leo in the centre , and [I]0-i to the right . Behind [us]1233-us were the lamps . [Leo]108-leo bent forward , and looked down [the long lane of shadows]1236-the long lane of shadows , terminating in the fire and lighted lamps , through which the quiet forms of [[our]1233-us would - be murderers]1237-our would - be murderers flitted to and fro with the faint light glinting on [their]1234-the crowd that was pressing on our heels spears , for even [their]1234-the crowd that was pressing on our heels fury was silent as a bulldog 's . The only other thing visible was the red - hot pot still glowing angrily in the gloom . There was a curious light in [Leo]108-leo 's eyes , and [his]108-leo handsome face was set like a stone . In [his]108-leo right hand was [his]108-leo heavy hunting - knife . [He]108-leo shifted its thong a little up [his]108-leo wrist and then put [his]108-leo arm round [me]0-i and gave [me]0-i a good hug .

" Good - bye , [old fellow]3147-old fellow , "[108-leo] [he]108-leo said , " [[my]108-leo dear friend]3462-my dear friend - [[my]108-leo more than [father]331-father]3463-my more than father . [We]1233-us have no chance against [those scoundrels]3465-those scoundrels ; [they]3465-those scoundrels will finish [us]1233-us in a few minutes , and eat [us]1233-us afterwards , [I]108-leo suppose . Good - bye . [I]108-leo led [you]0-i into this . [I]108-leo hope [you]0-i will forgive [me]108-leo . Good - bye , [Job]137-job . "[108-leo]

" [God]134-god 's will be done , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , setting [my]0-i teeth , as [I]0-i prepared for the end . At that moment , with an exclamation , [Job]137-job lifted [his]137-job revolver and fired , and hit [a man]352-a man - not [the man [he]137-job had aimed at]1239-the man he had aimed at , by the way : anything that [Job]137-job shot at was perfectly safe .

On [they]1240-they came with a rush , and [I]0-i fired too as fast as [I]0-i could , and checked [them]1240-they - between [us]1241-we , [Job]137-job and [I]0-i , besides [the woman]3243-the woman , killed or mortally wounded five men with [our]1241-we pistols before [they]1240-they were emptied . But [we]1241-we had no time to reload , and [they]1240-they still came on in a way that was almost splendid in its recklessness , seeing that [they]1240-they did not know but that [we]1241-we could go on firing for ever .

[A great fellow]1243-a great fellow bounded up upon the platform , and [Leo]108-leo struck [him]1243-a great fellow dead with one blow of [his]108-leo powerful arm , sending the knife right through [him]1243-a great fellow . [I]0-i did the same by another , but [Job]137-job missed [his]137-job stroke , and [I]0-i saw a brawny [Amahagger]171-the amahagger grip [him]1243-a great fellow by the middle and whirl [him]1243-a great fellow off the rock . The knife not being secured by a thong fell from [Job]137-job 's hand as [he]137-job did so , and , by a most happy accident for [him]137-job , lit upon its handle on [the rock]550-the rock , just as the body of [the Amahagger , who was undermost , struck upon its point and was transfixed upon it]1245-the amahagger , who was undermost , struck upon its point and was transfixed upon it . What happened to [Job]137-job after that [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do not know , but [my]0-i own impression is that [he]137-job lay still upon the corpse of [[his]137-job deceased assailant]1246-his deceased assailant , " playing ' possum "[1247-the americans] as [the Americans]1247-the americans say . As for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i was soon involved in a desperate encounter with [two ruffians , who , luckily for [me]0-i , had left [their]1248-two ruffians , who , luckily for me , had left their spears behind them spears behind [them]1248-two ruffians , who , luckily for me , had left their spears behind them]1248-two ruffians , who , luckily for me , had left their spears behind them ; and for the first time in [my]0-i life the great physical power with which Nature has endowed [me]0-i stood [me]0-i in good stead . [I]0-i had hacked at the head of [one man]1249-one man with [my]0-i hunting - knife , which was almost as big and heavy as a short sword , with such vigour , that the sharp steel had split [his]1249-one man skull down to the eyes , and was held so fast by it that as [he]1249-one man suddenly fell sideways the knife was twisted right out of [my]0-i hand .

Then it was that [the two others]1250-the two others sprang upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i saw [them]1250-the two others coming , and got an arm round the waist of each , and down [we]1251-we all fell upon the floor of [the cave]936-the cave together , rolling over and over . [They]1250-the two others were [strong men]1253-strong men , but [I]0-i was mad with rage , and that awful lust for slaughter which will creep into the hearts of [the most civilised of [us]1251-we]1254-the most civilised of us when blows are flying , and life and death tremble on the turn . [My]0-i arms were round the two swarthy demons , and [I]0-i hugged [them]1250-the two others till [I]0-i heard [their]1250-the two others ribs crack and crunch up beneath [my]0-i grip . [They]1250-the two others twisted and writhed like snakes , and clawed and battered at [me]0-i with [their]1250-the two others fists , but [I]0-i held on . Lying on [my]0-i back there , so that [their]1250-the two others bodies might protect [me]0-i from spear thrusts from above , [I]0-i slowly crushed the life out of [them]1250-the two others , and as [I]0-i did so , strange as it may seem , [I]0-i thought of what [the amiable Head of [my]0-i College at [Cambridge]2-cambridge who is a member of [the Peace Society]1256-the peace society and [[my]0-i brother]1257-my brother Fellows]1255-the amiable head of my college at cambridge who is a member of the peace society and my brother fellows would say if by clairvoyance [they]1250-the two others could see [me]0-i , of [all men]1258-all men , playing such a bloody game . Soon [[my]0-i assailants]1259-my assailants grew faint , and almost ceased to struggle , [their]1259-my assailants breath had failed [them]1259-my assailants , and [they]1259-my assailants were dying , but still [I]0-i dared not leave [them]1259-my assailants , for [they]1259-my assailants died very slowly . [I]0-i knew that if [I]0-i relaxed [my]0-i grip [they]1259-my assailants would revive . [The other ruffians]1260-the other ruffians probably thought - for [we]1261-we were [all three lying in the shadow of the ledge]1262-all three lying in the shadow of the ledge - that [we]1261-we were all dead together , at any rate [they]1259-my assailants did not interfere with [our]1261-we little tragedy .

[I]0-i turned [my]0-i head , and as [I]0-i lay gasping in the throes of that awful struggle [I]0-i could see that [Leo]108-leo was off [the rock]550-the rock now , for the lamplight fell full upon [him]108-leo . [He]108-leo was still on [his]108-leo feet , but in the centre of [a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull [him]108-leo down as wolves pull down a stag]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag . Up above [them]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag towered [his]108-leo beautiful pale face crowned with its bright curls for [Leo]108-leo is six feet two high , and [I]0-i saw that [he]108-leo was fighting with a desperate abandonment and energy that was at once splendid and hideous to behold . [He]108-leo drove [his]108-leo knife through [one man]1249-one man - [they]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag were so close to and mixed up with [him]108-leo that [they]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag could not get at [him]108-leo to kill [him]108-leo with [their]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag big spears , and [they]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag had no knives or sticks . [The man]271-the man fell , and then somehow the knife was wrenched from [his]271-the man hand , leaving [him]271-the man defenceless , and [I]0-i thought the end had come . But no ; with a desperate effort [he]108-leo broke loose from [them]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag , seized the body of [the man [he]108-leo had just slain]1267-the man he had just slain , and lifting it high in the air hurled it right at [the mob of [[his]108-leo assailants]1269-his assailants]1268-the mob of his assailants , so that the shock and weight of it swept some five or six of [them]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag to [the earth]659-the earth . But in a minute [they]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag were all up again , except one , whose skull was smashed , and had once more fastened upon [him]108-leo . And then slowly , and with infinite labour and struggling , [the wolves]1271-the wolves bore [the lion]799-the lion down . Once even then [he]108-leo recovered [himself]108-leo , and felled [an Amahagger]171-the amahagger with [his]108-leo fist , but it was more than [man]3189-man could do to hold [his]108-leo own for long against so many , and at last [he]108-leo came crashing down upon the rock floor , falling as an oak falls , and bearing with [him]108-leo to [the earth]659-the earth [all those who clung about [him]108-leo]1275-all those who clung about him . [They]1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag gripped [him]108-leo by [his]108-leo arms and legs , and then cleared off [his]108-leo body .

" A spear , "[1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag] cried a voice - " a spear to cut [his]108-leo throat , and a vessel to catch [his]108-leo blood . "[1264-a surging mass of struggling men , who were striving to pull him down as wolves pull down a stag]

[I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes , for [I]0-i saw [the man]271-the man coming with a spear , and [myself]0-i , [I]0-i could not stir to [Leo]108-leo 's help , for [I]0-i was growing weak , and [the two men on [me]0-i]1277-the two men on me were not yet dead , and a deadly sickness overcame [me]0-i .

Then suddenly there was a disturbance , and involuntarily [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes again , and looked towards the scene of murder . [The girl Ustane]1278-the girl ustane had thrown [herself]1278-the girl ustane on [Leo]108-leo 's prostrate form , covering [his]108-leo body with [her]1278-the girl ustane body , and fastening [her]1278-the girl ustane arms about [his]108-leo neck . [They]1277-the two men on me tried to drag [her]1278-the girl ustane from [him]108-leo , but [she]1278-the girl ustane twisted [her]1278-the girl ustane legs round [his]108-leo , and hung on like a bulldog , or rather like a creeper to a tree , and [they]1277-the two men on me could not . Then [they]1277-the two men on me tried to stab [him]108-leo in the side without hurting [her]1278-the girl ustane , but somehow [she]1278-the girl ustane shielded [him]108-leo , and [he]108-leo was only wounded .

At last [they]1277-the two men on me lost patience .

" Drive the spear through [the man]271-the man and [the woman]3243-the woman together , "[1277-the two men on me] said a voice , the same voice that had asked the questions at that ghastly feast , ' so of a verity shall [they]1277-the two men on me be [we]1277-the two men on me d. "[1277-the two men on me]

Then [I]0-i saw [the man with the weapon]1279-the man with the weapon straighten [himself]1279-the man with the weapon for the effort . [I]0-i saw the cold steel gleam on high , and once more [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes .

As [I]0-i did so [I]0-i heard the voice of [a man]352-a man thunder out in tones that rang and echoed down [the rocky ways]1281-the rocky ways -

" Cease ! "[352-a man]

Then [I]0-i fainted , and as [I]0-i did so it flashed through [my]0-i darkening mind that [I]0-i was passing down into the last oblivion of death .

[IX

A LITTLE FOOT]178-ix a little foot

When [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes again [I]0-i found [myself]0-i lying on a skin mat not far from the fire round which [we]1277-the two men on me had been gathered for that dreadful feast . Near [me]0-i lay [Leo]108-leo , still apparently in a swoon , and over [him]108-leo was bending [the tall form of [the girl Ustane , who was washing a deep spear wound in [his]108-leo side with cold water preparatory to binding it up with linen . Leaning against the wall of the cave behind [her]1283-the girl ustane , who was washing a deep spear wound in his side with cold water preparatory to binding it up with linen . leaning against the wall of the cave behind her]1283-the girl ustane , who was washing a deep spear wound in his side with cold water preparatory to binding it up with linen . leaning against the wall of the cave behind her was [Job]137-job , apparently uninjured , but bruised and trembling . On the other side of the fire , tossed about this way and that , as though [they]1284-them had thrown [themselves]1284-them down to sleep in some moment of absolute exhaustion , were the bodies of [those whom [we]1277-the two men on me had killed in [our]1277-the two men on me frightful struggle for life]1285-those whom we had killed in our frightful struggle for life]1282-the tall form of the girl ustane , who was washing a deep spear wound in his side with cold water preparatory to binding it up with linen . leaning against the wall of the cave behind her was job , apparently uninjured , but bruised and trembling . on the other side of the fire , tossed about this way and that , as though they had thrown themselves down to sleep in some moment of absolute exhaustion , were the bodies of those whom we had killed in our frightful struggle for life . [I]0-i counted [them]1284-them : there were twelve besides [the woman]3243-the woman , and the corpse of [poor Mahomed , who had died by [my]0-i hand , which , the fire - stained pot at its side , was placed at the end of the irregular line]1287-poor mahomed , who had died by my hand , which , the fire - stained pot at its side , was placed at the end of the irregular line . To the left a body of [men]516-men were engaged in binding the arms of [the survivors of [the cannibals]1290-the cannibals behind [them]1284-them]1289-the survivors of the cannibals behind them , and then fastening [them]1284-them two and two . [The villains]1291-the villains were submitting with a look of sulky indifference upon [their]1291-the villains faces which accorded ill with the baffled fury that gleamed in [their]1291-the villains sombre eyes . In front of [these men , directing the operations]1292-these men , directing the operations , stood no other than [[our]1277-the two men on me friend]1293-our friend [Billali]137-job , looking rather tired , but particularly patriarchal with [his]137-job flowing beard , and as cool and unconcerned as though [he]137-job were superintending the cutting up of an ox .

Presently [he]137-job turned , and perceiving that [I]0-i was sitting up advanced to [me]0-i , and with the utmost courtesy said that [he]137-job trusted that [I]0-i felt better . [I]0-i answered that at present [I]0-i scarcely knew how [I]0-i felt , except that [I]0-i ached all over .

Then [he]137-job bent down and examined [Leo]108-leo 's wound .

" It is an evil cut , "[137-job] [he]137-job said , " but the spear has not pierced the entrails . [He]108-leo will recover . "[137-job]

" Thanks to [thy]108-leo arrival , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " In another minute [we]3469-we should all have been beyond the reach of recovery , for [those devils of thine]3470-those devils of thine would have slain [us]3469-we as [they]3470-those devils of thine would have slain [[our]3469-we servant]3471-our servant , "[0-i] and [I]0-i pointed towards [Mahomed]158-mahomed .

[The old man]910-the old man ground [his]910-the old man teeth , and [I]0-i saw an extraordinary expression of malignity light up [his]910-the old man eyes .

" Fear not , [[my]910-the old man son]3150-my son , "[910-the old man] [he]910-the old man answered . " Vengeance shall be taken on [them]3470-those devils of thine such as would make the flesh twist upon the bones merely to hear of it . To [She]3473-her shall [they]3470-those devils of thine go , and [her]3473-her vengeance shall be worthy of [her]3473-her greatness . [That man]3474-that man , "[910-the old man] pointing to [Mahomed]158-mahomed , " [I]910-the old man tell [thee]158-mahomed that [man]3189-man would have died a merciful death to the death [these hyæna - men]3476-these hyæna - men shall die . Tell [me]910-the old man , [I]910-the old man pray of [thee]158-mahomed , how it came about . "[910-the old man]

In a few words [I]0-i sketched what had happened .

" Ah , so , "[910-the old man] [he]910-the old man answered . " [Thou]158-mahomed seest , [[my]910-the old man son]3150-my son , here there is a custom that if [a stranger]3108-a stranger comes into [this country]302-this country [he]3108-a stranger may be slain by ' the pot , ' and eaten . "[910-the old man]

" It is hospitality turned upside down , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered feebly . " In [[our]3480-ye country]3481-our country [we]3480-ye entertain [a stranger]3108-a stranger , and give [him]3108-a stranger food to eat . Here [ye]3480-ye eat [him]3108-a stranger , and are entertained . "[0-i]

" It is a custom , "[910-the old man] [he]910-the old man answered , with a shrug . " [Myself]910-the old man [I]910-the old man think it an evil one ; but then , "[910-the old man] [he]910-the old man added by an afterthought , " [I]910-the old man do not like the taste of [strangers]3229-strangers , especially after [they]3229-strangers have wandered through [the swamps]3176-the swamps and lived on wild - fowl . When [She]3485-she - who - must - be - obeyed sent orders that [ye]3480-ye were to be saved alive [she]3485-she said naught of [the black man]3486-the black man , therefore , being hyænas , [these men]3427-these men lusted after [his]3486-the black man flesh , and [the woman it]3488-the woman it was , whom [thou]3489-thou didst rightly slay , who put it into [their]3427-these men evil hearts to hot - pot [him]3486-the black man . Well , [they]3427-these men will have [their]3427-these men reward . Better for [them]3427-these men would it be if [they]3427-these men had never seen the light than that [they]3427-these men should stand before [She]3485-she in [her]3485-she terrible anger . Happy are [those of [them]3427-these men who died by [your]3480-ye hands]3490-those of them who died by your hands . "[910-the old man]

" Ah , "[1295-he] [he]1295-he went on , " it was a gallant fight that [ye]3480-ye fought . Knowest [thou]3489-thou that , long - armed old baboon that [thou]3489-thou art , [thou]3489-thou hast crushed in the ribs of [those two who are laid out there as though [they]3491-those two who are laid out there as though they were but as the shell on an egg were but as the shell on an egg]3491-those two who are laid out there as though they were but as the shell on an egg ? And [the young one]3492-the young one , the lion , it was a beautiful stand that [he]1295-he made - one against so many - three did [he]1295-he slay outright , and [that one there]3493-that one there "[1295-he] - and [he]1295-he pointed to a body that was still moving a little - " will die anon , for [his]1295-he head is cracked across , and others of [those who are bound]3494-those who are bound are hurt . It was a gallant fight , and [thou]3489-thou and [he]1295-he have made [a friend of [me]1295-he]3495-a friend of me by it , for [I]1295-he love to see a well - fought fray . But tell [me]1295-he , [[my]1295-he son]3150-my son , [the baboon]3497-the baboon - and now [I]1295-he think of it [thy]3150-my son face , too , is hairy , and altogether like a baboon 's - how was it that [ye]3150-my son slew those with a hole in [them]3498-them ? - [Ye]3150-my son made a noise , [they]3498-them say , and slew [them]3498-them - [they]3498-them fell down on the faces at the noise ? "[1295-he]

[I]0-i explained to [him]1296-he as well as [I]0-i could , but very shortly - for [I]0-i was terribly wearied , and only persuaded to talk at all through fear of offending one so powerful if [I]0-i refused to do so - what were the properties of gunpowder , and [he]1296-he instantly suggested that [I]0-i should illustrate what [I]0-i said by operating on the person of [one of [the prisoners]1298-the prisoners]1297-one of the prisoners . One , [he]1296-he said , never would be counted , and it would not only be very interesting to [him]1296-he , but would give [me]0-i the opportunity of an instalment of revenge . [He]1296-he was greatly astounded when [I]0-i told [him]1296-he that it was not [our]1299-we custom to avenge [ourselves]1299-we in cold blood , and that [we]1299-we left vengeance to the law and a higher power , of which [he]1296-he knew nothing . [I]0-i added , however , that when [I]0-i recovered [I]0-i would take [him]1296-he out shooting with [us]1299-we , and [he]1296-he should kill an animal for [himself]1296-he , and at this [he]1296-he was as pleased as [a child]411-a child at the promise of a new toy .

Just then [Leo]108-leo opened [his]108-leo eyes beneath the stimulus of some brandy of which [we]1299-we still had a little that [Job]137-job had poured down [his]108-leo throat , and [our]1299-we conversation came to an end .

After this [we]1299-we managed to get [Leo]108-leo , who was in a very poor way indeed , and only half conscious , safely off to bed , supported by [Job]137-job and [that brave girl [Ustane]172-ustane]1301-that brave girl ustane , to whom , had [I]0-i not been afraid that [she]172-ustane might resent it , [I]0-i would certainly have given a kiss for [her]172-ustane splendid behaviour in saving [[my]0-i boy]3095-my boy 's life at the risk of [her]172-ustane own . But [Ustane]172-ustane was not [the sort of young person with whom one would care to take liberties]1303-the sort of young person with whom one would care to take liberties unless [one were perfectly certain that they would not be misunderstood]1304-one were perfectly certain that they would not be misunderstood , so [I]0-i repressed [my]0-i inclinations . Then , bruised and battered , but with a sense of safety in [my]0-i breast to which [I]0-i had for some days been [a stranger]3108-a stranger , [I]0-i crept off to [[my]0-i own little sepulchre]1306-my own little sepulchre , not forgetting before [I]0-i laid down in it to thank [Providence]179-providence from the bottom of [my]0-i heart that it was not a sepulchre indeed , as , save for a merciful combination of events that [I]0-i can only attribute to its protection , it would certainly have been for [me]0-i that night . [Few men]806-few men have been nearer [their]806-few men end and yet escaped it than [we]1308-we were on that dreadful day .

[I]0-i am [a bad sleeper]1309-a bad sleeper at the best of times , and [my]0-i dreams that night when at last [I]0-i got to rest were not of the pleasantest . The awful vision of [poor Mahomed]158-mahomed struggling to escape the red - hot pot would haunt [them]1310-them , and then in the background , as it were , a veiled form was always hovering , which , from time to time , seemed to draw the coverings from its body , revealing now the perfect shape of [a lovely blooming woman , and now again the white bones of a grinning skeleton , and which , as it veiled and unveiled]1311-a lovely blooming woman , and now again the white bones of a grinning skeleton , and which , as it veiled and unveiled , uttered the mysterious and apparently meaningless sentence : -

" [That which is alive and hath known death]3499-that which is alive and hath known death , and that which is dead yet can never die , for in the Circle of the Spirit life is naught and death is naught . Yea , all things live for ever , though at times they sleep and are forgotten . "[1311-a lovely blooming woman , and now again the white bones of a grinning skeleton , and which , as it veiled and unveiled]

The morning came at last , but when it came [I]0-i found that [I]0-i was too stiff and sore to rise . About seven [Job]137-job arrived , limping terribly , and with [his]137-job face the colour of a rotten apple , and told [me]0-i that [Leo]108-leo had slept fairly , but was very weak . Two hours afterwards [Billali Job]137-job called [him]108-leo " [Billy]126-billy - goat , "[137-job] to which , indeed , [his]137-job white beard gave [him]137-job some resemblance , or more familiarly , " [Billy]126-billy "[137-job] came too , bearing a lamp in [his]137-job hand , [his]137-job towering form reaching nearly to the roof of [the little chamber]1312-the little chamber . [I]0-i pretended to be asleep , and through the cracks of [my]0-i eyelids watched [his]137-job sardonic but handsome old face . [He]137-job fixed [his]137-job hawk - like eyes upon [me]0-i , and stroked [his]137-job glorious white beard , which , by the way , would have been worthy a hundred a year to any [London]19-london barber as an advertisement .

" Ah ! "[137-job] [I]0-i heard [him]137-job mutter [Billali]137-job had a habit of muttering to [himself]137-job , " [he]137-job is ugly - ugly as the other is beautiful - a very Baboon , it was a good name . But [I]137-job like [the man]271-the man . Strange now , at [my]137-job age , that [I]137-job should like [a man]352-a man . What says the proverb - ' Mistrust [all men]1258-all men , and slay [him]137-job whom [thou]3503-thou mistrustest overmuch ; and as for [women]327-women , flee from [them]327-women , for [they]327-women are evil , and in the end will destroy [thee]3503-thou . ' It is a good proverb , especially the last part of it : [I]137-job think that it must have come down from [the ancients]458-the ancients . Nevertheless [I]137-job like [this Baboon]180-the baboon , and [I]137-job wonder where [they]458-the ancients taught [him]180-the baboon [his]180-the baboon tricks , and [I]137-job trust that [She]3506-she will not bewitch [him]180-the baboon . [Poor Baboon]180-the baboon ! [he]180-the baboon must be wearied after that fight . [I]137-job will go lest [I]137-job should awake [him]180-the baboon . "[137-job]

[I]0-i waited till [he]1313-he had turned and was nearly through the entrance , walking softly on tiptoe , and then [I]0-i called after [him]1313-he .

" [[My]0-i father]3091-my father , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " is it [thou]3508-thou ? "[0-i]

" Yes , [[my]0-i son]3150-my son , it is [I]0-i ; but let [me]0-i not disturb [thee]3150-my son . [I]0-i did but come to see how [thou]3508-thou didst fare , and to tell [thee]3150-my son that those who would have slain [thee]3150-my son , [[my]0-i Baboon]3510-my baboon , are by now far on [[their]3510-my baboon road]3511-their road to [She]3512-she . [She]3512-she said that [ye]3150-my son also were to come at once , but [I]0-i fear [ye]3150-my son can not yet . "[0-i]

" Nay , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " not till [we]3513-we have recovered a little ; but have [me]0-i borne out into the daylight , [I]0-i pray [thee]1314-i , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father . [I]0-i love not [this place]3339-this place . "[0-i]

" Ah , no , "[1314-i] [he]1314-i answered , " it hath a sad air . [I]1314-i remember when [I]1314-i was [a boy]3516-a boy [I]1314-i found the body of [a fair woman]3517-a fair woman lying where [thou]3518-thou liest now , yes , on that very bench . [She]3517-a fair woman was so beautiful that [I]1314-i was wo nt to creep in hither with a lamp and gaze upon [her]3517-a fair woman . Had it not been for [her]3517-a fair woman cold hands , almost could [I]1314-i think that [she]3517-a fair woman slept and would one day awake , so fair and peaceful was [she]3517-a fair woman in [her]3517-a fair woman robes of white . White was [she]3517-a fair woman , too , and [her]3517-a fair woman hair was yellow and lay down [her]3517-a fair woman almost to the feet . There are many such still in the tombs at [the place where [She]3517-a fair woman is]3519-the place where she is , for those who set [them]3520-them there had a way [I]1314-i know naught of , whereby to keep [[their]3520-them beloved]3521-their beloved out of the crumbling hand of [Decay]181-decay , even when [Death]182-death had slain [them]3520-them . Ay , day by day [I]1314-i came hither , and gazed on [her]3517-a fair woman till at last - laugh not at [me]1314-i , [stranger]3387-stranger , for [I]1314-i was but [a silly lad]3523-a silly lad - [I]1314-i learned to love that dead form , that shell which once had held a life that no more is . [I]1314-i would creep up to [her]3517-a fair woman and kiss [her]3517-a fair woman cold face , and wonder how many [men]516-men had lived and died since [she]3517-a fair woman was , and who had loved [her]3517-a fair woman and embraced [her]3517-a fair woman in the days that long had passed away . And , [[my]1314-i Baboon]3510-my baboon , [I]1314-i think [I]1314-i learned wisdom from [that dead one]3526-that dead one , for of a truth it taught [me]1314-i of the littleness of life , and the length of Death , and how all things that are under the sun go down one path , and are for ever forgotten . And so [I]1314-i mused , and it seemed to [me]1314-i that wisdom flowed into [me]1314-i from the dead , till one day [[my]1314-i mother]3527-my mother , [a watchful woman]3528-a watchful woman , but hasty - minded , seeing [I]1314-i was changed , followed [me]1314-i , and saw [the beautiful white one]3529-the beautiful white one , and feared that [I]1314-i was bewitched , as , indeed , [I]1314-i was . So half in dread , and half in anger , [she]3527-my mother took up the lamp , and standing [the dead woman]3530-the dead woman up against the wall even there , set fire to [her]3530-the dead woman hair , and [she]3530-the dead woman burnt fiercely , even down to the feet , for [those who are thus kept burn]3531-those who are thus kept burn excellently well .[1314-i]

" See , [[my]0-i son]3150-my son , there on the roof is yet the smoke of [her]3530-the dead woman burning . "[0-i]

[I]0-i looked up doubtfully , and there , sure enough , on the roof of the sepulchre , was a peculiarly unctuous and sooty mark , three feet or more across . Doubtless it had in the course of years been rubbed off the sides of the little cave , but on the roof it remained , and there was no mistaking [its]1315-its appearance .

" [She]3530-the dead woman burnt , "[1316-he] [he]1316-he went on in a meditative way , " even to the feet , but the feet [I]1316-he came back and saved , cutting the burnt bone from them , and hid them under the stone bench there , wrapped up in a piece of linen . Surely , [I]1316-he remember it as though it were but yesterday . Perchance they are there , if [none]1126-none have found [them]3531-those who are thus kept burn , even to this hour . Of a truth [I]1316-he have not entered [this chamber]1049-this chamber from that time to this very day . Stay , [I]1316-he will look , "[1316-he] and , kneeling down , [he]1316-he groped about with [his]1316-he long arm in the recess under the stone bench . Presently [his]1316-he face brightened , and with an exclamation [he]1316-he pulled something forth which was caked in dust ; which [he]1316-he shook on to the floor . It was covered with the remains of a rotting rag , which [he]1316-he undid , and revealed to [my]0-i astonished gaze a beautifully shaped and almost white woman 's foot , looking as fresh and firm as though it had but now been placed there .

" [Thou]3535-thou seest , [[my]1316-he son]3150-my son , [the Baboon]3497-the baboon , "[1316-he] [he]1316-he said , in a sad voice , " [I]1316-he spake the truth to [thee]3150-my son , for here is yet one foot remaining . Take it , [[my]1316-he son]3150-my son , and gaze upon it . "[1316-he]

[I]0-i took this cold fragment of mortality in [my]0-i hand and looked at it in the light of the lamp with feelings which [I]0-i can not describe , so mixed up were they between astonishment , fear , and fascination . It was light , much lighter [I]0-i should say than it had been in the living state , and the flesh to all appearance was still flesh , though about it there clung a faintly aromatic odour . For the rest it was not shrunk or shrivelled , or even black and unsightly , like the flesh of Egyptian mummies , but plump and fair , and , except where it had been slightly burnt , perfect as on the day of death - a very triumph of embalming .

Poor little foot ! [I]0-i set [it]1317-it down upon the stone bench where it had lain for so many thousand years , and wondered whose was the beauty that it had upborne through the pomp and pageantry of a forgotten civilisation - first as [a merry child]1318-a merry child 's , then as [a blushing maid]1319-a blushing maid 's , and lastly as [a perfect woman]1320-a perfect woman 's . Through what halls of Life had its soft step echoed , and in the end , with what courage had it trodden down [the dusty ways of Death]1321-the dusty ways of death ! To whose side had it stolen in the hush of night when [the black slave slept upon the marble floor]1322-the black slave slept upon the marble floor , and who had listened for its stealing ? Shapely little foot ! Well might it have been set upon the proud neck of [a conqueror bent at last to woman]1323-a conqueror bent at last to woman 's beauty , and well might the lips of [nobles]1324-nobles and of [kings]1325-kings have been pressed upon its jewelled whiteness .

[I]0-i wrapped up this relic of the past in the remnants of the old linen rag which had evidently formed a portion of [its owner]1326-its owner 's grave - clothes , for it was partially burnt , and put it away in [my]0-i Gladstone bag - a strange combination , [I]0-i thought . Then with [Billali]137-job 's help [I]0-i staggered off to see [Leo]108-leo . [I]0-i found [him]108-leo dreadfully bruised , worse even than [myself]0-i , perhaps owing to the excessive whiteness of [his]108-leo skin , and faint and weak with the loss of blood from the flesh wound in [his]108-leo side , but for all that cheerful as a cricket , and asking for some breakfast . [Job]137-job and [Ustane]172-ustane got [him]108-leo on to the bottom , or rather the sacking of a litter , which was removed from [its]1327-its pole for that purpose , and with the aid of [old Billali]137-job carried [him]108-leo out into the shade at [the mouth of [the cave]936-the cave]1328-the mouth of the cave , from which , by the way , every trace of the slaughter of the previous night had now been removed , and there [we]1330-we all breakfasted , and indeed spent that day , and most of the two following ones .

On the third morning [Job]137-job and [myself]0-i were practically recovered . [Leo]108-leo also was so much better that [I]0-i yielded to [Billali]137-job 's often expressed entreaty , and agreed to start at once upon [our]1330-we journey to [K"r]56-k"r , which [we]1330-we were told was the name of [the place where [the mysterious She]3540-the mysterious she lived]3539-the place where the mysterious she lived , though [I]137-job still feared for its effect upon [Leo]108-leo , and especially lest the motion should cause [his]108-leo wound , which was scarcely skinned over , to break open again . Indeed , had it not been for [Billali]137-job 's evident anxiety to get off , which led [us]1330-we to suspect that some difficulty or danger might threaten [us]1330-we if [we]1330-we did not comply with it , [I]137-job would not have consented to go .[137-job]

X

SPECULATIONS

Within an hour of [our]1330-we finally deciding to start five litters were brought up to the door of [the cave]936-the cave , each accompanied by [four regular bearers]1332-four regular bearers and [two spare hands]1333-two spare hands , also [a band of about fifty armed Amahagger , who were to form [the escort and carry the baggage]1335-the escort and carry the baggage]1334-a band of about fifty armed amahagger , who were to form the escort and carry the baggage . Three of these litters , of course , were for [us]1330-we , and one for [Billali]137-job , who , [I]0-i was immensely relieved to hear , was to be [[our]1330-we companion]1336-our companion , while the fifth [I]0-i presumed was for the use of [Ustane]172-ustane .

" Does [the lady]1072-the lady go with [us]1330-we , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked of [Billali]137-job , as [he]137-job stood superintending things in general .

[He]137-job shrugged [his]137-job shoulders as [he]137-job answered -

" If [she]1072-the lady wills . In [this country]302-this country [the women]1034-the women do what [they]1034-the women please . [We]1330-we worship [them]1034-the women , and give [them]1034-the women [their]1034-the women way , because without [them]1034-the women [the world]252-the world could not go on ; [they]1034-the women are the source of life . "[137-job]

" Ah , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , the matter never having struck [me]0-i quite in that light before .

" [We]1330-we worship [them]1034-the women , "[137-job] [he]137-job went on , " up to a point , till at last [they]1034-the women get unbearable , which , "[137-job] [he]137-job added , " [they]1034-the women do about every second generation . "[137-job]

" And then what do [you]137-job do ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , with curiosity .

" Then , "[137-job] [he]137-job answered , with a faint smile , " [we]1330-we rise , and kill [the old ones]3546-the old ones as an example to [the young ones]3547-the young ones , and to show [them]3547-the young ones that [we]1330-we are the strongest . [[My]137-job poor wife]3548-my poor wife was killed in that way three years ago . It was very sad , but to tell [thee]0-i the truth , [[my]137-job son]3150-my son , life has been happier since , for [my]137-job age protects [me]137-job from [the young ones]3547-the young ones . "[137-job]

" In short , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , quoting the saying of [a great man whose wisdom has not yet lightened the darkness of [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger]1337-a great man whose wisdom has not yet lightened the darkness of the amahagger , " [thou]3551-thou hast found [thy]3551-thou position one of greater freedom and less responsibility . "[171-the amahagger]

This phrase puzzled [him]137-job a little at first from its vagueness , though [I]0-i think [my]0-i translation hit off its sense very well , but at last [he]137-job saw it , and appreciated it .

" Yes , yes , [[my]137-job Baboon]3510-my baboon , "[137-job] [he]137-job said , " [I]137-job see it now , but [all the ' responsibilities]3553-all the ' responsibilities ' are killed , at least some of [them]3553-all the ' responsibilities are , and that is why there are [so few old women about just now]3554-so few old women about just now . Well , [they]3554-so few old women about just now brought it on [themselves]3554-so few old women about just now . As for [this girl]3555-this girl , "[137-job] [he]137-job went on , in a graver tone , " [I]137-job know not what to say . [She]3555-this girl is [a brave girl]3556-a brave girl , and [she]3555-this girl loves [the Lion Leo]183-leo ; [thou]3557-thou sawest how [she]3555-this girl clung to [him]183-leo , and saved [his]183-leo life . Also , [she]3555-this girl is , according to [our]3558-our custom , [we]3558-our d to [him]183-leo , and has a right to go where [he]183-leo goes , unless , "[137-job] [he]137-job added significantly , " [She]3555-this girl would say [her]3555-this girl no , for [her]3555-this girl word overrides all rights . "[137-job]

" And if [She]3555-this girl bade [her]3555-this girl leave [him]183-leo , and [the girl]3559-the girl refused ? What then ? "[137-job]

" If , "[137-job] [he]137-job said , with a shrug , " the hurricane bids the tree to bend , and it will not ; what happens ? "[137-job]

And then , without waiting for an answer , [he]137-job turned and walked to [his]137-job litter , and in ten minutes from that time [we]1338-we were all well under way .

It took [us]1338-we an hour and more to cross [the cup of [the volcanic plain]1340-the volcanic plain]1339-the cup of the volcanic plain , and another half - hour or so to climb the edge on [the farther side]1341-the farther side . Once there , however , the view was a very fine one . Before [us]1338-we was [a long steep slope of grassy plain]1342-a long steep slope of grassy plain , broken here and there by clumps of trees mostly of [the thorn tribe]1343-the thorn tribe . At the bottom of this gentle slope , some nine or ten miles away , [we]1338-we could make out [a dim sea of marsh]1344-a dim sea of marsh , over which the foul vapours hung like smoke about [a city]722-a city . It was easy going for [the bearers]890-the bearers down [the slopes]1347-the slopes , and by midday [we]1338-we had reached [the borders of [the dismal swamp]1349-the dismal swamp]1348-the borders of the dismal swamp . Here [we]1338-we halted to eat [our]1338-we midday meal , and then , following [a winding and devious path]1350-a winding and devious path , plunged into [the morass]1351-the morass . Presently [the path]1352-the path , at any rate to [our]1338-we unaccustomed eyes , grew so faint as to be almost indistinguishable from those made by the aquatic beasts and birds , and it is to this day a mystery to [me]0-i how [[our]1338-we bearers]1353-our bearers found [their]1353-our bearers way across [the marshes]1130-the marshes . Ahead of [the cavalcade]1355-the cavalcade marched [two men]1356-two men with long poles , which [they]1356-two men now and again plunged into the ground before [them]1356-two men , the reason of this being that the nature of [the soil]1357-the soil frequently changed from causes with which [I]0-i am not acquainted , so that [places which might be safe enough to cross one month]1358-places which might be safe enough to cross one month would certainly swallow [the wayfarer]1359-the wayfarer the next . Never did [I]0-i see a more dreary and depressing scene . Miles on miles of quagmire , varied only by [bright green strips of comparatively solid ground]1360-bright green strips of comparatively solid ground , and by [deep and sullen pools fringed with tall rushes]1361-deep and sullen pools fringed with tall rushes , in which the bitterns boomed and the frogs croaked incessantly : miles on miles of [it]1362-it without a break , unless the fever fog can be called a break . The only life in [this great morass]1363-this great morass was that of the aquatic birds , and the animals that fed on [them]1364-them , of both of which there were vast numbers . Geese , cranes , ducks , teal , coot , snipe , and plover swarmed all around [us]1338-we , many being of varieties that were quite new to [me]0-i , and all so tame that [one]328-one could almost have knocked them over with a stick . Among these birds [I]0-i especially noticed a very beautiful variety of painted snipe , almost the size of a woodcock , and with a flight more resembling that bird 's than an English snipe 's . In [the pools]1366-the pools , too , was a species of small alligator or enormous iguana , [I]0-i do not know which , that fed , [Billali]137-job told [me]0-i , upon the waterfowl , also large quantities of a hideous black water - snake , of which the bite is very dangerous , though not , [I]0-i gathered , so deadly as [a cobra 's or a puff adder 's]1367-a cobra 's or a puff adder 's . The bull - frogs were also very large , and with voices proportionate to [their]1368-their size ; and as for the mosquitoes - the " musqueteers , "[137-job] as [Job]137-job called [them]1369-they - [they]1369-they were , if possible , even worse than [they]1369-they had been on [the river]621-the river , and tormented [us]1338-we greatly . Undoubtedly , however , the worst feature of [the swamp]729-the swamp was the awful smell of rotting vegetation that hung about it , which was at times positively overpowering , and the malarious exhalations that accompanied it , which [we]1338-we were of course obliged to breathe .

On [we]1338-we went through it all , till at last the sun sank in sullen splendour just as [we]1338-we reached a spot of rising ground about two acres in extent - [a little oasis of dry in the midst of [the miry wilderness]1373-the miry wilderness]1372-a little oasis of dry in the midst of the miry wilderness - where [Billali]137-job announced that [we]1338-we were to camp . The camping , however , turned out to be a very simple process , and consisted , in fact , in sitting down on the ground round a scanty fire made of dry reeds and some wood that had been brought with [us]1338-we . However , [we]1338-we made the best [we]1338-we could of it , and smoked and ate with such appetite as the smell of damp , stifling heat would allow , for it was very hot on [this low land]1374-this low land , and yet , oddly enough , chilly at times . But , however hot it was , [we]1338-we were glad enough to keep near the fire , because [we]1338-we found that the mosquitoes did not like the smoke . Presently [we]1338-we rolled [ourselves]1338-we up in [our]1338-we blankets and tried to go to sleep , but so far as [I]0-i was concerned the bull - frogs , and the extraordinary roaring and alarming sound produced by hundreds of snipe hovering high in the air , made sleep an impossibility , to say nothing of [our]1338-we other discomforts . [I]0-i turned and looked at [Leo]183-leo , who was next [me]0-i ; [he]183-leo was dozing , but [his]183-leo face had a flushed appearance that [I]0-i did not like , and by the flickering fire - light [I]0-i saw [Ustane]172-ustane , who was lying on the other side of [him]183-leo , raise [herself]172-ustane from time to time upon [her]172-ustane elbow , and look at [him]183-leo anxiously enough .

However , [I]0-i could do nothing for [him]183-leo , for [we]1338-we had all already taken a good dose of quinine , which was the only preventive [we]1338-we had ; so [I]0-i lay and watched the stars come out by thousands , till all the immense arch of heaven was strewn with glittering points , and every point [a world]1375-a world ! Here was a glorious sight by which [man]3189-man might well measure [his]3189-man own insignificance ! Soon [I]0-i gave up thinking about it , for the mind wearies easily when it strives to grapple with the Infinite , and to trace the footsteps of [the Almighty]1377-the almighty as [he]1377-the almighty strides from sphere to sphere , or deduce [His]1377-the almighty purpose from [His]1377-the almighty works . Such things are not for [us]1338-we to know . Knowledge is to the strong , and [we]1338-we are weak . Too much wisdom would perchance blind [our]1338-we imperfect sight , and too much strength would make [us]1338-we drunk , and over - weight [our]1338-we feeble reason till it fell and [we]1338-we were drowned in the depths of [our]1338-we own vanity . For what is the first result of [man]3189-man 's increased knowledge interpreted from [Nature]173-nature 's book by the persistent effort of [his]3189-man purblind observation ? It is not but too often to make [him]3189-man question the existence of [[his]3189-man Maker]1379-his maker , or indeed of any intelligent purpose beyond [his]3189-man own ? The truth is veiled , because [we]1338-we could no more look upon [her]1380-her glory than [we]1338-we can upon the sun . It would destroy [us]1338-we . Full knowledge is not for [man]3189-man as [man]3189-man is here , for [his]3189-man capacities , which [he]3189-man is apt to think so great , are indeed but small . The vessel is soon filled , and , were one - thousandth part of the unutterable and silent wisdom that directs the rolling of those shining spheres , and the Force which makes them roll , pressed into it , it would be shattered into fragments . Perhaps in some other place and time it may be otherwise , who can tell ? Here the lot of [man born of the flesh]1383-man born of the flesh is but to endure midst toil and tribulation , to catch at the bubbles blown by Fate , which [he]3189-man calls pleasure , thankful if before they burst [they]1384-they rest a moment in [his]3189-man hand , and when the tragedy is played out , and [his]3189-man hour comes to perish , to pass humbly whither [he]3189-man knows not .

Above [me]0-i , as [I]0-i lay , shone the eternal stars , and there at [my]0-i feet the impish marsh - born balls of fire rolled this way and that , vapour - tossed and earth - desiring , and methought that in the two [I]0-i saw a type and image of what [man]3189-man is , and what perchance [man]3189-man may one day be , if [the living Force who ordained [him]3189-man and [them]3189-man]1387-the living force who ordained him and them should so ordain this also . Oh , that it might be [ours]1338-we to rest year by year upon that high level of the heart to which at times [we]1338-we momentarily attain ! Oh , that [we]1338-we could shake loose the prisoned pinions of the soul and soar to that superior point , whence , like to [some traveller looking out through space from [[Darien]57-darien 's giddiest peak]1389-darien 's giddiest peak]1388-some traveller looking out through space from darien 's giddiest peak , [we]1338-we might gaze with spiritual eyes deep into Infinity !

What would it be to cast off this earthy robe , to have done for ever with these earthy thoughts and miserable desires ; no longer , like those corpse candles , to be tossed this way and that , by forces beyond [our]1338-we control ; or which , if [we]1338-we can theoretically control them , [we]1338-we are at times driven by the exigencies of [our]1338-we nature to obey ! Yes , to cast them off , to have done with [the foul and thorny places of [the world]252-the world]1390-the foul and thorny places of the world ; and , like to those glittering points above [me]0-i , to rest on high wrapped for ever in the brightness of [our]1338-we better selves , that even now shines in [us]1338-we as fire faintly shines within those lurid balls , and lay down [our]1338-we littleness in that wide glory of [our]1338-we dreams , that invisible but surrounding Good , from which all truth and beauty comes !

These and many such thoughts passed through [my]0-i mind that night . They come to torment [us]1338-we all at times . [I]0-i say to torment , for , alas ! thinking can only serve to measure out the helplessness of thought . What is the purpose of [our]1338-we feeble crying in the awful silences of space ? Can [our]1338-we dim intelligence read the secrets of that star - strewn sky ? Does any answer come out of it ? Never any at all , nothing but echoes and fantastic visions ! And yet [we]1338-we believe that there is an answer , and that upon a time a new Dawn will come blushing down the ways of [our]1338-we enduring night . [We]1338-we believe it , for its reflected beauty even now shines up continually in [our]1338-we hearts from beneath the horizon of the grave , and [we]1338-we call it Hope . Without Hope [we]1338-we should suffer moral death , and by the help of [Hope]184-hope [we]1338-we yet may climb to Heaven , or at the worst , if [she]184-hope also prove but a kindly mockery given to hold [us]1338-we from despair , be gently lowered into the abysses of eternal sleep .

Then [I]0-i fell to reflecting upon the undertaking on which [we]1338-we were bent , and what a wild one it was , and yet how strangely the story seemed to fit in with what had been written centuries ago upon the sherd . Who was [this extraordinary woman , Queen over [a people apparently as extraordinary as [herself]1392-this extraordinary woman , queen over a people apparently as extraordinary as herself , and reigning amidst the vestiges of a lost civilisation , and reigning amidst the vestiges of a lost civilisation]1393-a people apparently as extraordinary as herself , and reigning amidst the vestiges of a lost civilisation]1392-this extraordinary woman , queen over a people apparently as extraordinary as herself , and reigning amidst the vestiges of a lost civilisation ? And what was the meaning of this story of the Fire that gave unending life ? Could it be possible that any fluid or essence should exist which might so fortify these fleshy walls that they should from age to age resist the mines and batterings of decay ? It was possible , though not probable . The infinite continuation of life would not , as [poor Vincey]108-leo said , be so marvellous a thing as the production of life and its temporary endurance . And if it were true , what then ? [The person who found it]1394-the person who found it could no doubt rule [the world]252-the world . [He]1394-the person who found it could accumulate all the wealth in [the world]252-the world , and all the power , and all the wisdom that is power . [He]1394-the person who found it might give a lifetime to the study of each art or science . Well , if that were so , and this [She]1392-this extraordinary woman , queen over a people apparently as extraordinary as herself , and reigning amidst the vestiges of a lost civilisation were practically immortal , which [I]0-i did not for one moment believe , how was it that , with all these things at [her]1392-this extraordinary woman , queen over a people apparently as extraordinary as herself , and reigning amidst the vestiges of a lost civilisation feet , [she]1392-this extraordinary woman , queen over a people apparently as extraordinary as herself , and reigning amidst the vestiges of a lost civilisation preferred to remain in a cave amongst [a society of [cannibals]1398-cannibals]1397-a society of cannibals ? This surely settled the question . The whole story was monstrous , and only worthy of the superstitious days in which it was written . At any rate [I]0-i was very sure that [I]0-i would not attempt to attain unending life . [I]0-i had had far too many worries and disappointments and secret bitternesses during [my]0-i forty odd years of existence to wish that this state of affairs should be continued indefinitely . And yet [I]0-i suppose that [my]0-i life has been , comparatively speaking , a happy one .

And then , reflecting that at the present moment there was far more likelihood of [our]1399-our earthly careers being cut exceedingly short than of [their]1400-their being unduly prolonged , [I]0-i at last managed to get to sleep , a fact for which [anybody who reads this narrative]1401-anybody who reads this narrative , if [anybody]3032-anybody ever does , may very probably be thankful .

When [I]0-i woke again it was just dawning , and [the guard and bearers]1403-the guard and bearers were moving about like ghosts through the dense morning mists , getting ready for [our]1399-our start . The fire had died quite down , and [I]0-i rose and stretched [myself]0-i , shivering in every limb from the damp cold of the dawn . Then [I]0-i looked at [Leo]108-leo . [He]108-leo was sitting up , holding [his]108-leo hands to [his]108-leo head , and [I]0-i saw that [his]108-leo face was flushed and [his]108-leo eye bright , and yet yellow round the pupil .

" Well , [Leo]108-leo , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " how do [you]108-leo feel ? "[0-i]
