"[1725-she]

" [The Jews]3734-the jews are broken and gone , and the fragments of [[their]3734-the jews people]3735-their people strew [the world]252-the world , and [Jerusalem]67-jerusalem is no more . As for [the temple that [Herod]120-herod built]3737-the temple that herod built - - "[0-i]

" [Herod]120-herod ! "[1726-i] [she]1726-i said . " [I]1726-i know not [Herod]120-herod . But go on . "[1726-i]

" [The Romans]3722-the romans burnt [it]3737-the temple that herod built , and the Roman eagles flew across [its]3737-the temple that herod built ruins , and now [Judæa]68-judæa is [a desert]3739-a desert . "[0-i]

" So , so ! [They]3722-the romans were [a great people]3740-a great people , [those Romans]3741-those romans , and went straight to [their]3722-the romans end - ay , [they]3722-the romans sped to it like Fate , or like [their]3722-the romans own eagles on [their]3722-the romans prey ! - and left peace behind [them]3722-the romans . "[1726-i]

" Solitudinem faciunt , pacem appellant , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

" Ah , [thou]3742-thou canst speak the Latin tongue , too ! "[1726-i] [she]1726-i said , in surprise . " It hath a strange ring in [my]1726-i ears after all these days , and it seems to [me]1726-i that [thy]3742-thou accent does not fall as [the Romans]3722-the romans put it . Who was it wrote that ? [I]1726-i know not the saying , but it is [a true one of that great people]3744-a true one of that great people . It seems that [I]1726-i have found [a learned man]3745-a learned man - one whose hands have held the water of [the world]252-the world 's knowledge . Knowest [thou]3742-thou Greek also ? "[1726-i]

" Yes , oh Queen , and something of Hebrew , but not to speak them well . [They]3747-they are all dead languages now . "[1726-i]

[She]1726-i clapped [her]1726-i hands in childish glee . " Of a truth , ugly tree that [thou]3742-thou art , [thou]3742-thou growest the fruits of wisdom , oh [Holly]109-holly , "[1726-i] [she]1726-i said ; " but of [those Jews whom [I]1726-i hated]3748-those jews whom i hated , for [they]3748-those jews whom i hated called [me]1726-i ' heathen ' when [I]1726-i would have taught [them]3748-those jews whom i hated [my]1726-i philosophy - did [[their]3748-those jews whom i hated [Messiah]204-messiah]3732-their messiah come , and doth [He]204-messiah rule [the world]252-the world ? "[1726-i]

" [[Their]3748-those jews whom i hated [Messiah]204-messiah]3732-their messiah came , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered with reverence ; " but [He]204-messiah came poor and lowly , and [they]3748-those jews whom i hated would have none of [Him]204-messiah . "[0-i]

" Ah , [the fierce - hearted wolves]3755-the fierce - hearted wolves , "[1727-i] [she]1727-i said , " [the followers of [Sense]205-sense]3756-the followers of sense and [many gods]3757-many gods - greedy of gain and faction - torn . [I]1727-i can see [their]3755-the fierce - hearted wolves dark faces yet . So [they]3748-those jews whom i hated crucified [[their]3748-those jews whom i hated Messiah]3732-their messiah ? Well can [I]1727-i believe it . That [He]204-messiah was [a Son of the Living Spirit]3759-a son of the living spirit would be naught to [them]3748-those jews whom i hated , if indeed [He]204-messiah was so , and of that [we]3760-we will talk afterwards . [They]3748-those jews whom i hated would care naught for [any God]3761-any god if [He]204-messiah came not with pomp and power . [They]3748-those jews whom i hated , [a chosen people]3762-a chosen people , a vessel of [Him]204-messiah [they]3748-those jews whom i hated call [Jehovah]206-jehovah , ay , and [a vessel of [Baal]207-baal]3763-a vessel of baal , and [a vessel of [Astoreth]208-astoreth]3764-a vessel of astoreth , and [a vessel of [the gods of [the Egyptians]3767-the egyptians]3766-the gods of the egyptians]3765-a vessel of the gods of the egyptians - [a high - stomached people , greedy of aught that brought [them]3768-a high - stomached people , greedy of aught that brought them wealth and power wealth and power]3768-a high - stomached people , greedy of aught that brought them wealth and power . So [they]3748-those jews whom i hated crucified [[their]3748-those jews whom i hated Messiah]3732-their messiah because [He]3732-their messiah came in lowly guise - and now are [they]3748-those jews whom i hated scattered about [the earth]659-the earth ? Why , if [I]1727-i remember , so said one of [[their]3748-those jews whom i hated prophets]3771-their prophets that it should be . Well , let [them]3748-those jews whom i hated go - [they]3748-those jews whom i hated broke [my]1727-i heart , [those Jews]3772-those jews , and made [me]1727-i look with evil eyes across [the world]252-the world , ay , and drove [me]1727-i to [this wilderness]3774-this wilderness , [this place of [a people that was before [them]3748-those jews whom i hated]3776-a people that was before them]3775-this place of a people that was before them . When [I]1727-i would have taught [them]3748-those jews whom i hated wisdom in [Jerusalem]67-jerusalem [they]3748-those jews whom i hated stoned [me]1727-i , ay , at the Gate of [the Temple]3777-the temple [those]3772-those jews white - bearded hypocrites and [Rabbis]3778-rabbis hounded [the people]3344-the people on to stone [me]1727-i ! See , here is the mark of it to this day ! "[1727-i] and with a sudden move [she]1728-she pulled up the gauzy wrapping on [her]1728-she rounded arm , and pointed to a little scar that showed red against its milky beauty .

[I]0-i shrank back , horrified .

" Pardon [me]0-i , [oh Queen]3645-oh queen , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " but [I]0-i am bewildered . Nigh upon two thousand years have rolled across [the earth]659-the earth since [the Jewish Messiah]3782-the jewish messiah hung upon [His]3782-the jewish messiah cross at [Golgotha]70-golgotha . How then canst [thou]3783-thou have taught [thy]3783-thou philosophy to [the Jews]3734-the jews before [He]3782-the jewish messiah was ? [Thou]3783-thou art [a woman]284-a woman and [no spirit]3786-no spirit . How can [a woman]284-a woman live two thousand years ? Why dost [thou]3783-thou befool [me]0-i , [oh Queen]3645-oh queen ? "[0-i]

[She]1729-i leaned back upon the couch , and once more [I]0-i felt the hidden eyes playing upon [me]0-i and searching out [my]0-i heart .

" [Oh man]3789-oh man ! "[1729-i] [she]1729-i said at last , speaking very slowly and deliberately , " it seems that there are still things upon [the earth]659-the earth of which [thou]3783-thou knowest naught . Dost [thou]3783-thou still believe that all things die , even as [those very Jews]3791-those very jews believed ? [I]1729-i tell [thee]3783-thou that naught dies . There is no such thing as Death , though there be a thing called Change . See , "[1729-i] and [she]1729-i pointed to some sculptures on the rocky wall . " Three times two thousand years have passed since the last of [the great race that hewed those pictures]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures fell before the breath of the pestilence which destroyed [them]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures , yet are [they]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures not dead . E'en now [they]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures live ; perchance [their]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures spirits are drawn towards [us]3793-us at this very hour , "[1729-i] and [she]1729-i glanced round . " Of a surety it sometimes seems to [me]1729-i that [my]1729-i eyes can see them . "[1729-i]

" Yes , but to [the world]252-the world [they]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures are dead . "[1729-i]

" Ay , for a time ; but even to [the world]252-the world are [they]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures born again and again . [I]1729-i , yes [I]1729-i , [Ayesha]114-ayesha - for that , [stranger]3387-stranger , is [my]1729-i name - [I]1729-i say to [thee]3797-thou that [I]1729-i wait now for one [I]1729-i loved to be born again , and here [I]1729-i tarry till [he]3798-he finds [me]1729-i , knowing of a surety that hither [he]3798-he will come , and that here , and here only , shall [he]3798-he greet [me]1729-i . Why , dost [thou]3797-thou believe that [I]1729-i , who am all - powerful , [I]1729-i , whose loveliness is more than the loveliness of the Grecian Helen , of whom [they]3792-the great race that hewed those pictures used to sing , and whose wisdom is wider , ay , far more wide and deep than the wisdom of [Solomon the Wise]209-solomon the wise - [I]1729-i , who know the secrets of [the earth]659-the earth and its riches , and can turn all things to [my]1729-i uses - [I]1729-i , who have even for a while overcome Change , that [ye]3797-thou call Death - why , [I]1729-i say , oh [stranger]3387-stranger , dost [thou]3797-thou think that [I]1729-i herd here with barbarians lower than the beasts ? "[1729-i]

Pronounced Assha . - L. H. H.

" [I]0-i know not , "[0-i] [I]0-i said humbly .

" Because [I]1729-i wait for [him]3798-he [I]1729-i love . [My]1729-i life has perchance been evil , [I]1729-i know not - for who can say what is evil and what good ? - so [I]1729-i fear to die even if [I]1729-i could die , which [I]1729-i can not until [mine]1729-i hour comes , to go and seek [him]3798-he where [he]3798-he is ; for between [us]3801-us there might rise a wall [I]1729-i could not climb , at least , [I]1729-i dread it . Surely easy would it be also to lose the way in seeking in [those great spaces wherein the planets wander on]3802-those great spaces wherein the planets wander on for ever . But the day will come , it may be when five thousand more years have passed , and are lost and melted into the vault of Time , even as the little clouds melt into the gloom of night , or it may be to - morrow , when [he]3798-he , [my]1729-i love , shall be born again , and then , following a law that is stronger than any human plan , [he]3798-he shall find [me]1729-i here , where once [he]3798-he knew [me]1729-i , and of a surety [his]3798-he heart will soften towards [me]1729-i , though [I]1729-i sinned against [him]3798-he ; ay , even though [he]3798-he knew [me]1729-i not again , yet will [he]3798-he love [me]1729-i , if only for [my]1729-i beauty 's sake . "[1729-i]

For a moment [I]0-i was dumbfounded , and could not answer . The matter was too overpowering for [my]0-i intellect to grasp .

" But even so , oh [Queen]189-queen , "[0-i] [I]0-i said at last , " even if [we]3803-we [men]516-men be born again and again , that is not so with [thee]189-queen , if [thou]189-queen speakest truly . "[0-i] Here [she]1730-i looked up sharply , and once more [I]0-i caught the flash of those hidden eyes ; " [thou]189-queen , "[1730-i] [I]0-i went on hurriedly , " who hast never died ? "[0-i]

" That is so , "[1730-i] [she]1730-i said ; " and it is so because [I]1730-i have , half by chance and half by learning , solved one of the great secrets of [the world]252-the world . Tell [me]1730-i , [stranger]3387-stranger : life is - why therefore should not life be lengthened for a while ? What are ten or twenty or fifty thousand years in the history of life ? Why in ten thousand years scarce will the rain and storms lessen a mountain top by a span in thickness ? In two thousand years [these caves]3807-these caves have not changed , nothing has changed but the beasts , and [man]3189-man , who is as the beasts . There is naught that is wonderful about the matter , couldst [thou]189-queen but understand . Life is wonderful , ay , but that it should be a little lengthened is not wonderful . [Nature]173-nature hath [her]173-nature animating spirit as well as [man]3189-man , who is [[Nature]173-nature 's child]3810-nature 's child , and [he]3189-man who can find that spirit , and let it breathe upon [him]3189-man , shall live with [her]173-nature life . [He]3189-man shall not live eternally , for Nature is not eternal , and [she]173-nature [herself]173-nature must die , even as the nature of the moon hath died . [She]173-nature [herself]173-nature must die , [I]1730-i say , or rather change and sleep till it be time for [her]173-nature to live again . But when shall [she]173-nature die ? Not yet , [I]1730-i ween , and while [she]173-nature lives , so shall [he]3189-man who hath all [her]173-nature secret live with [her]173-nature . All [I]1730-i have it not , yet have [I]1730-i some , more perchance than [any who were before [me]1730-i]3811-any who were before me . Now , to [thee]3812-thee [I]1730-i doubt not that this thing is a great mystery , therefore [I]1730-i will not overcome [thee]3812-thee with it now . Another time [I]1730-i will tell [thee]3812-thee more if the mood be on [me]1730-i , though perchance [I]1730-i shall never speak thereof again . Dost [thou]3812-thee wonder how [I]1730-i knew that [ye]3812-thee were coming to [this land]3394-this land , and so saved [your]3812-thee heads from the hot - pot ? "[1730-i]

" Ay , oh Queen , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered feebly .

" Then gaze upon that water , "[1731-i] and [she]1731-i pointed to the font - like vessel , and then , bending forward , held [her]1731-i hand over it .

[I]0-i rose and gazed , and instantly the water darkened . Then it cleared , and [I]0-i saw as distinctly as [I]0-i ever saw anything in [my]0-i life - [I]0-i saw , [I]0-i say , [[our]1732-our boat]558-our boat upon [that horrible canal]1734-that horrible canal . There was [Leo]183-leo lying at the bottom asleep in it , with a coat thrown over [him]183-leo to keep off the mosquitoes , in such a fashion as to hide [his]183-leo face , and [myself]0-i , [Job]137-job , and Mahomed towing on [the bank]710-the bank .

[I]0-i started back , aghast , and cried out that it was magic , for [I]0-i recognised the whole scene - it was one which had actually occurred .

" Nay , nay ; oh [Holly]109-holly , "[1731-i] [she]1731-i answered , " it is no magic , that is a fiction of ignorance . There is no such thing as magic , though there is such a thing as a knowledge of the secrets of Nature . That water is [my]1731-i glass ; in it [I]1731-i see what passes if [I]1731-i will to summon up the pictures , which is not often . Therein [I]1731-i can show [thee]3814-thou what [thou]3814-thou wilt of the past , if it be anything that hath to do with [this country]302-this country and with what [I]1731-i have known , or anything that [thou]3814-thou , [the gazer]3816-the gazer , hast known . Think of a face if [thou]3814-thou wilt , and it shall be reflected from [thy]3814-thou mind upon [the water]538-the water . [I]1731-i know not all the secret yet - [I]1731-i can read nothing in the future . But it is an old secret ; [I]1731-i did not find it . In [Arabia]71-arabia and in [Egypt]8-egypt [the sorcerers]3818-the sorcerers knew it centuries gone . So one day [I]1731-i chanced to bethink [me]1731-i of [that old canal]3819-that old canal - some twenty ages since [I]1731-i sailed upon [it]3819-that old canal , and [I]1731-i was minded to look thereon again . So [I]1731-i looked , and there [I]1731-i saw [the boat]3322-the boat and [three men]3418-three men walking , and one , whose face [I]1731-i could not see , but [a youth of noble form]3822-a youth of noble form , sleeping in [the boat]3322-the boat , and so [I]1731-i sent and saved [ye]3824-thou . And now farewell . But stay , tell [me]1731-i of [this youth]3825-this youth - the Lion , as [the old man]910-the old man calls [him]3825-this youth . [I]1731-i would look upon [him]3825-this youth , but [he]3825-this youth is sick , [thou]3824-thou sayest - sick with the fever , and also wounded in the fray . "[1731-i]

" [He]3825-this youth is very sick , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered sadly ; " canst [thou]3824-thou do nothing for [him]3825-this youth , [oh Queen]3645-oh queen ! who knowest so much ? "[0-i]

" Of a surety [I]1731-i can . [I]1731-i can cure [him]3825-this youth ; but why speakest [thou]3824-thou so sadly ? Dost [thou]3824-thou love [the youth]3828-the youth ? Is [he]3825-this youth perchance [[thy]3824-thou son]3829-thy son ? "[1731-i]

" [He]3825-this youth is [[my]0-i adopted son]3017-my adopted son , [oh Queen]3645-oh queen ! Shall [he]3825-this youth be brought in before [thee]3824-thou ? "[0-i]

" Nay . How long hath the fever taken [him]3825-this youth ? "[1731-i]

" This is the third day . "[0-i]

" Good ; then let [him]3825-this youth lie another day . Then will [he]3825-this youth perchance throw it off by [his]3825-this youth own strength , and that is better than that [I]1731-i should cure [him]3825-this youth , for [my]1731-i medicine is of a sort to shake the life in its very citadel . If , however , by to - morrow night , at that hour when the fever first took [him]3825-this youth , [he]3825-this youth doth not begin to mend , then will [I]1731-i come to [him]3825-this youth and cure [him]3825-this youth . Stay , who nurses [him]3825-this youth ? "[1731-i]

" [[Our]3824-thou white servant]3832-our white servant , [him]3832-our white servant whom [Billali]137-job names [the Pig]3682-the pig ; also , "[0-i] and here [I]0-i spoke with some little hesitation , " [a woman named [Ustane]172-ustane]3834-a woman named ustane , [a very handsome woman of [this country]302-this country , who came and embraced [him]3825-this youth when [she]172-ustane first saw [him]3825-this youth]3835-a very handsome woman of this country , who came and embraced him when she first saw him , and hath stayed by [him]3825-this youth ever since , as [I]0-i understand is the fashion of [[thy]3824-thou people]3837-thy people , oh Queen . "[0-i]

" [[My]1736-i people]3406-my people ! speak not to [me]1736-i of [[my]1736-i people]3406-my people , "[1736-i] [she]1736-i answered hastily ; " [these slaves]3840-these slaves are [no people of [mine]1736-i]3841-no people of mine , [they]3840-these slaves are but dogs to do [my]1736-i bidding till the day of [my]1736-i deliverance comes ; and , as for [their]3840-these slaves customs , naught have [I]1736-i to do with [them]3840-these slaves . Also , call [me]1736-i not [Queen]189-queen - [I]1736-i am weary of flattery and titles - call [me]1736-i [Ayesha]114-ayesha , the name hath a sweet sound in [mine]1736-i ears , it is an echo from the past . As for [this Ustane]3842-this ustane , [I]1736-i know not . [I]1736-i wonder if it be [she]3842-this ustane against whom [I]1736-i was warned , and whom [I]1736-i in turn did warn ? " See , "[1737-she] [she]1737-she said quietly , " is that [the woman]3243-the woman ? "[1737-she]

[I]0-i looked into [the water]538-the water , and there , mirrored upon [its]538-the water placid surface , was the silhouette of [Ustane]172-ustane 's stately face . [She]1737-she was bending forward , with a look of infinite tenderness upon [her]1737-she features , watching something beneath [her]1737-she , and with [her]1737-she chestnut locks falling on to [her]1737-she right shoulder .

" It is [she]1737-she , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , in a low voice , for once more [I]0-i felt much disturbed at this most uncommon sight . " [She]1737-she watches [Leo]183-leo asleep . "[0-i]

" [Leo]183-leo ! "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , in an absent voice ; " why , that is ' lion ' in the Latin tongue . [The old man]910-the old man hath named happily for once . It is very strange , "[1737-she] [she]1737-she went on , speaking to [herself]1737-she , " very . So like - but it is not possible ! "[1737-she] With an impatient gesture [she]1737-she passed [her]1737-she hand over [the water]538-the water once more . It darkened , and the image vanished silently and mysteriously as it had risen , and once more the lamplight , and the lamplight only , shone on the placid surface of that limpid , living mirror .

" Hast [thou]3845-thou aught to ask [me]1737-she before [thou]3845-thou goest , oh [Holly]109-holly ? "[1737-she] [she]1737-she said , after a few moments ' reflection . " It is but a rude life that [thou]3845-thou must live [here]3102-here , for [these people]902-these people are [savages]3343-savages , and know not the ways of [cultivated man]3849-cultivated man . Not that [I]1737-she am troubled thereby , for behold [my]1737-she food , "[1737-she] and [she]1737-she pointed to the fruit upon the little table . " Naught but fruit doth ever pass [my]1737-she lips - fruit and cakes of flour , and a little water . [I]1737-she have bidden [[my]1737-she girls]3850-my girls to wait upon [thee]3845-thou . [They]3850-my girls are [mutes]3851-mutes , [thou]3845-thou knowest , deaf are [they]3850-my girls and dumb , and therefore the safest of [servants]3852-servants , save to those who can read [their]3850-my girls faces and [their]3850-my girls signs . [I]1737-she bred [them]3850-my girls so - it hath taken many centuries and much trouble ; but at last [I]1737-she have triumphed . Once [I]1737-she succeeded before , but the race was too ugly , so [I]1737-she let it die away ; but now , as [thou]3845-thou seest , [they]3850-my girls are otherwise . Once , too , [I]1737-she reared [a race of giants]3853-a race of giants , but after a while [Nature]173-nature would no more of it , and it died away . Hast [thou]3845-thou aught to ask of [me]1737-she ? "[1737-she]

" Ay , one thing , oh [Ayesha]114-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i said boldly ; but feeling by no means as bold as [I]0-i trust [I]0-i looked . " [I]0-i would gaze upon [thy]1740-i face . "[0-i]

[She]1740-i laughed out in [her]1740-i bell - like notes . " Bethink [thee]0-i , [Holly]109-holly , "[1740-i] [she]1740-i answered ; " bethink [thee]0-i . It seems that [thou]3845-thou knowest the old myths of [the gods of [Greece]18-greece]3854-the gods of greece . Was there not one Actæon who perished miserably because [he]3855-he looked on too much beauty ? If [I]1740-i show [thee]1740-i [my]1740-i face , perchance [thou]3845-thou wouldst perish miserably also ; perchance [thou]3845-thou wouldst eat out [thy]3845-thou heart in impotent desire ; for know [I]1740-i am not for [thee]3845-thou - [I]1740-i am for [no man]3309-no man , save [one , who hath been , but is not yet]3857-one , who hath been , but is not yet . "[1740-i]

" As [thou]3845-thou wilt , [Ayesha]114-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]0-i fear not [thy]3845-thou beauty . [I]0-i have put [my]0-i heart away from such vanity as [woman]3858-woman 's loveliness , that passeth like a flower . "[0-i]

" Nay , [thou]3845-thou errest , "[1741-i] [she]1741-i said ; " that does not pass . [My]1741-i beauty endures even as [I]1741-i endure ; still , if [thou]3845-thou wilt , [oh rash man]3859-oh rash man , have [thy]3845-thou will ; but blame not [me]1741-i if passion mount [thy]3845-thou reason , as [the Egyptian breakers used to mount a colt]3860-the egyptian breakers used to mount a colt , and guide it whither [thou]3845-thou wilt not . Never may [the man to whom [my]1741-i beauty has been unveiled]3861-the man to whom my beauty has been unveiled put it from [his]3861-the man to whom my beauty has been unveiled mind , and therefore even with [these savages]3862-these savages do [I]1741-i go veiled , lest [they]3862-these savages vex [me]1741-i , and [I]1741-i should slay [them]3862-these savages . Say , wilt [thou]3845-thou see ? "[1741-i]

" [I]0-i will , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , [my]0-i curiosity overpowering [me]0-i .

[She]1742-her lifted [her]1742-her white and rounded arms - never had [I]0-i seen such arms before - and slowly , very slowly , withdrew some fastening beneath [her]1742-her hair . Then all of a sudden the long , corpse - like wrappings fell from [her]1742-her to the ground , and [my]0-i eyes travelled up [her]1742-her form , now only robed in a garb of clinging white that did but serve to show its perfect and imperial shape , instinct with a life that was more than life , and with a certain serpent - like grace that was more than human . On [her]1742-her little feet were sandals , fastened with studs of gold . Then came ankles more perfect than ever sculptor dreamed of . About the waist [her]1742-her white kirtle was fastened by a double - headed snake of solid gold , above which [her]1742-her gracious form swelled up in lines as pure as they were lovely , till the kirtle ended on the snowy argent of [her]1742-her breast , whereon [her]1742-her arms were folded . [I]0-i gazed above [them]1743-them at [her]1742-her face , and - [I]0-i do not exaggerate - shrank back blinded and amazed . [I]0-i have heard of the beauty of [celestial beings]1744-celestial beings , now [I]0-i saw it ; only this beauty , with all its awful loveliness and purity , was evil - at least , at the time , it struck [me]0-i as evil . How am [I]0-i to describe it ? [I]0-i can not - simply [I]0-i can not ! [The man]271-the man does not live whose pen could convey a sense of what [I]0-i saw . [I]0-i might talk of the great changing eyes of deepest , softest black , of the tinted face , of the broad and noble brow , on which the hair grew low , and delicate , straight features . But , beautiful , surpassingly beautiful as they all were , [her]1742-her loveliness did not lie in them . It lay rather , if it can be said to have had any fixed abiding place , in a visible majesty , in an imperial grace , in a godlike stamp of softened power , which shone upon that radiant countenance like a living halo . Never before had [I]0-i guessed what beauty made sublime could be - and yet , the sublimity was a dark one - the glory was not all of heaven - though none the less was it glorious . Though the face before [me]0-i was that of [a young woman of certainly not more than thirty years , in perfect health , and the first flush of ripened beauty]1746-a young woman of certainly not more than thirty years , in perfect health , and the first flush of ripened beauty , yet it had stamped upon [it]1747-it a look of unutterable experience , and of deep acquaintance with grief and passion . Not even the lovely smile that crept about the dimples of [her]1742-her mouth could hide this shadow of sin and sorrow . It shone even in the light of the glorious eyes , it was present in the air of majesty , and it seemed to say : " Behold [me]1742-her , lovely as [no woman]386-no woman was or is , undying and half - divine ; memory haunts [me]1742-her from age to age , and passion leads [me]1742-her by the hand - evil have [I]1742-her done , and from age to age evil [I]1742-her shall do , and sorrow shall [I]1742-her know till [my]1742-her redemption comes . "[1742-her]

Drawn by some magnetic force which [I]0-i could not resist , [I]0-i let [my]0-i eyes rest upon [her]1742-her shining orbs , and felt a current pass from them to [me]0-i that bewildered and half - blinded [me]0-i .

[She]1742-her laughed - ah , how musically ! and nodded [her]1742-her little head at [me]0-i with an air of sublimated coquetry that would have done credit to [a Venus Victrix]1748-a venus victrix .

" [Rash man]3864-rash man ! "[1742-her] [she]1742-her said ; " like Actæon , [thou]3865-thou hast had [thy]3865-thou will ; be careful lest , like [Actæon]210-actæon , [thou]3865-thou too dost perish miserably , torn to pieces by the ban - hounds of thine own passions . [I]1742-her too , oh [Holly]109-holly , am [a virgin goddess]3866-a virgin goddess , not to be moved of [any man]965-any man , save one , and it is not [thou]3865-thou . Say , hast [thou]3865-thou seen enough ! "[1742-her]

" [I]0-i have looked on beauty , and [I]0-i am blinded , "[0-i] [I]0-i said hoarsely , lifting [my]0-i hand to cover up [my]0-i eyes .

" So ! what did [I]1742-her tell [thee]1742-her ? Beauty is like the lightning ; it is lovely , but it destroys - especially trees , oh [Holly]109-holly ! "[1742-her] and again [she]1742-her nodded and laughed .

Suddenly [she]1742-her paused , and through [my]0-i fingers [I]0-i saw an awful change come over [her]1742-her countenance . [Her]1742-her great eyes suddenly fixed themselves into an expression in which horror seemed to struggle with some tremendous hope arising through the depths of [her]1742-her dark soul . The lovely face grew rigid , and the gracious willowy form seemed to erect itself .

" [Man]3189-man , "[1742-her] [she]1742-her half whispered , half hissed , throwing back [her]1742-her head like a snake about to strike - " [Man]3189-man , whence hadst [thou]1742-her that scarab on [thy]1742-her hand ? Speak , or by the Spirit of Life [I]1742-her will blast [thee]1742-her where [thou]1742-her standest ! "[1742-her] and [she]1742-her took one light step towards [me]0-i , and from [her]1742-her eyes there shone such an awful light - to [me]0-i it seemed almost like a flame - that [I]0-i fell , then and there , on the ground before [her]1742-her , babbling confusedly in [my]0-i terror .

" Peace , "[1742-her] [she]1742-her said , with a sudden change of manner , and speaking in [her]1742-her former soft voice . " [I]1742-her did affright [thee]1742-her ! Forgive [me]1742-her ! But at times , oh [Holly]109-holly , the almost infinite mind grows impatient of the slowness of the very finite , and am [I]1742-her tempted to use [my]1742-her power out of vexation - very nearly wast [thou]1742-her dead , but [I]1742-her remembered - - . But the scarab - about the scarabæus ! "[1742-her]

" [I]0-i picked it up , "[0-i] [I]0-i gurgled feebly , as [I]0-i got on to [my]0-i feet again , and it is a solemn fact that [my]0-i mind was so disturbed that at the moment [I]0-i could remember nothing else about the ring except that [I]0-i had picked it up in [[Leo]183-leo 's cave]1749-leo 's cave .

" It is very strange , "[1742-her] [she]1742-her said with a sudden access of womanlike trembling and agitation which seemed out of place in [this awful woman]1750-this awful woman - " but once [I]1742-her knew a scarab like to that . It - hung round the neck - of one [I]1742-her loved , "[1742-her] and [she]1742-her gave a little sob , and [I]0-i saw that after all [she]1742-her was only [a woman]284-a woman , although [she]1742-her might be [a very old one]1752-a very old one .

" There , "[1742-her] [she]1742-her went on , " it must be one like to it , and yet never did [I]1742-her see one like to it , for thereto hung a history , and [he]3870-he who wore it prized it much . But the scarab that [I]1742-her knew was not set thus in the bezel of a ring . Go now , [Holly]109-holly , go , and , if [thou]3871-thou canst , try to forget that [thou]3871-thou hast of [thy]3871-thou folly looked upon [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's beauty , "[1742-her] and , turning from [me]0-i , [she]1742-her flung [herself]1742-her on [her]1742-her couch , and buried [her]1742-her face in the cushions .

[I]0-i am informed by [a renowned and learned Egyptologist]1753-a renowned and learned egyptologist , to whom [I]0-i have submitted this very interesting and beautifully finished scarab , " [Suten se Ra]140-ra , "[1753-a renowned and learned egyptologist] that [he]1753-a renowned and learned egyptologist has never seen one resembling it . Although it bears a title frequently given to [Egyptian royalty]473-egyptian royalty , [he]1753-a renowned and learned egyptologist is of opinion that it is not necessarily the cartouche of [a Pharaoh]1755-a pharaoh , on which either the throne or personal name of [the monarch]1756-the monarch is generally inscribed . What the history of this particular scarab may have been [we]1757-we can now , unfortunately , never know , but [I]0-i have little doubt but that it played some part in the tragic story of [the Princess [Amenartas]118-kallikrates]1758-the princess amenartas and [[her]1758-the princess amenartas lover]316-her lover [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , [the forsworn priest of [Isis]211-isis]1760-the forsworn priest of isis . - [Editor]164-editor .

As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i stumbled from [her]1758-the princess amenartas presence , and [I]0-i do not remember how [I]0-i reached [[my]0-i own cave]1761-my own cave .

XIV

A SOUL IN [HELL]72-hell

It was nearly ten o'clock at night when [I]0-i cast [myself]0-i down upon [my]0-i bed , and began to gather [my]0-i scattered wits , and reflect upon what [I]0-i had seen and heard . But the more [I]0-i reflected the less [I]0-i could make of it . Was [I]0-i mad , or drunk , or dreaming , or was [I]0-i merely [the victim of a gigantic and most elaborate hoax]1762-the victim of a gigantic and most elaborate hoax ? How was it possible that [I]0-i , [a rational man]1763-a rational man , not unacquainted with the leading scientific facts of [our]1764-our history , and hitherto an absolute and utter disbeliever in all the hocus - pocus which in [Europe]16-europe goes by the name of the supernatural , could believe that [I]0-i had within the last few minutes been engaged in conversation with [a woman two thousand and odd years old]1765-a woman two thousand and odd years old ? The thing was contrary to the experience of human nature , and absolutely and utterly impossible . It must be a hoax , and yet , if it were a hoax , what was [I]0-i to make of it ? What , too , was to be said of [the figures on the water]1766-the figures on the water , of [the woman]3243-the woman 's extraordinary acquaintance with the remote past , and [her]3243-the woman ignorance , or apparent ignorance , of any subsequent history ? What , too , of [her]3243-the woman wonderful and awful loveliness ? This , at any rate , was a patent fact , and beyond the experience of [the world]252-the world . [No merely mortal woman]1769-no merely mortal woman could shine with such a supernatural radiance . About that [she]3243-the woman had , at any rate , been in the right - it was not safe for [any man]965-any man to look upon such beauty . [I]0-i was [a hardened vessel in such matters]1771-a hardened vessel in such matters , having , with the exception of one painful experience of [my]0-i green and tender youth , put the softer sex [I]0-i sometimes think that this is a misnomer almost entirely out of [my]0-i thoughts . But now , to [my]0-i intense horror , [I]0-i knew that [I]0-i could never put away the vision of those glorious eyes ; and alas ! the very diablerie of [the woman]3243-the woman , whilst it horrified and repelled , attracted in even a greater degree . [A person with the experience of two thousand years at [her]3243-the woman back , with the command of such tremendous powers , and the knowledge of a mystery that could hold off death]1773-a person with the experience of two thousand years at her back , with the command of such tremendous powers , and the knowledge of a mystery that could hold off death , was certainly worth falling in love with , if ever [woman]3858-woman was . But , alas ! it was not a question of whether or no [she]3243-the woman was worth it , for so far as [I]0-i could judge , not being versed in such matters , [I]0-i , [a fellow of [my]0-i college]1775-a fellow of my college , noted for what [[my]0-i acquaintances]1776-my acquaintances are pleased to call [my]0-i misogyny , and [a respectable man now well on in middle life]1777-a respectable man now well on in middle life , had fallen absolutely and hopelessly in love with [this white sorceress]1778-this white sorceress . Nonsense ; it must be nonsense ! [She]3243-the woman had warned [me]0-i fairly , and [I]0-i had refused to take the warning . Curses on the fatal curiosity that is ever prompting [man]3189-man to draw the veil from [woman]3858-woman , and curses on the natural impulse that begets it ! It is the cause of half - ay , and more than half - of [our]1781-our misfortunes . Why can not [man]3189-man be content to live alone and be happy , and let [the women]1034-the women live alone and be happy too ? But perhaps [they]1034-the women would not be happy , and [I]0-i am not sure that [we]1781-our should either . Here is a nice state of affairs . [I]0-i , at [my]0-i age , to fall [a victim to this modern Circe]1784-a victim to this modern circe ! But then [she]3243-the woman was not modern , at least [she]3243-the woman said not . [She]3243-the woman was almost as ancient as [the original Circe]1785-the original circe .

[I]0-i tore [my]0-i hair , and jumped up from [my]0-i couch , feeling that if [I]0-i did not do something [I]0-i should go off [my]0-i head . What did [she]3243-the woman mean about the scarabæus too ? It was [Leo]183-leo 's scarabæus , and had come out of the old coffer that [Vincey]108-leo had left in [[my]0-i rooms]363-my rooms nearly one - and - twenty years before . Could it be , after all , that the whole story was true , and the writing on the sherd was not a forgery , or the invention of [some crack - brained , long - forgotten individual]1787-some crack - brained , long - forgotten individual ? And if so , could it be that [Leo]108-leo was [the man that [She]3243-the woman was waiting for]1788-the man that she was waiting for - [the dead man who was to be born again]1789-the dead man who was to be born again ! Impossible ! The whole thing was gibberish ! Who ever heard of [a man being born again]1790-a man being born again ?

But if it were possible that [a woman]284-a woman could exist for two thousand years , this might be possible also - anything might be possible . [I]0-i [myself]0-i might , for aught [I]0-i knew , be [a reincarnation of some other forgotten self]1792-a reincarnation of some other forgotten self , or perhaps the last of a long line of [ancestral selves]1793-ancestral selves . Well , vive la guerre ! why not ? Only , unfortunately , [I]0-i had no recollection of these previous conditions . The idea was so absurd to [me]0-i that [I]0-i burst out laughing , and , addressing the sculptured picture of [a grim - looking warrior on the cave wall]1794-a grim - looking warrior on the cave wall , called out to [him]1794-a grim - looking warrior on the cave wall aloud , " Who knows , [old fellow]3147-old fellow ? - perhaps [I]0-i was [[your]1794-a grim - looking warrior on the cave wall contemporary]3873-your contemporary . By Jove ! perhaps [I]0-i was [you]1794-a grim - looking warrior on the cave wall and [you]1794-a grim - looking warrior on the cave wall are [I]0-i , "[0-i] and then [I]0-i laughed again at [my]0-i own folly , and the sound of [my]0-i laughter rang dismally along the vaulted roof , as though the ghost of [the warrior]1795-the warrior had echoed the ghost of a laugh .

Next [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i that [I]0-i had not been to see how [Leo]108-leo was , so , taking up one of the lamps which was burning at [my]0-i bedside , [I]0-i slipped off [my]0-i shoes and crept down [the passage]1645-the passage to the entrance of [[his]108-leo sleeping cave]1797-his sleeping cave . The draught of the night air was lifting [his]108-leo curtain to and fro gently , as though spirit hands were drawing and redrawing it . [I]0-i slid into [the vault - like apartment]1798-the vault - like apartment , and looked round . There was a light by which [I]0-i could see that [Leo]108-leo was lying on the couch , tossing restlessly in [his]108-leo fever , but asleep . At [his]108-leo side , half - lying on the floor , half - leaning against the stone couch , was [Ustane]172-ustane . [She]172-ustane held [his]108-leo hand in one of [hers]172-ustane , but [she]172-ustane too was dozing , and [the two]1799-the two made a pretty , or rather a pathetic , picture . [Poor Leo]108-leo ! [his]108-leo cheek was burning red , there were dark shadows beneath [his]108-leo eyes , and [his]108-leo breath came heavily . [He]108-leo was very , very ill ; and again the horrible fear seized [me]0-i that [he]108-leo might die , and [I]0-i be left alone in [the world]252-the world . And yet if [he]108-leo lived [he]108-leo would perhaps be [[my]0-i rival]1801-my rival with [Ayesha]114-ayesha ; even if [he]108-leo were not [the man]271-the man , what chance should [I]0-i , middle - aged and hideous , have against [his]108-leo bright youth and beauty ? Well , thank Heaven ! [my]0-i sense of right was not dead . [She]114-ayesha had not killed that yet ; and , as [I]0-i stood there , [I]0-i prayed to [Heaven]212-heaven in [my]0-i heart that [[my]0-i boy]3095-my boy , [[my]0-i more than [son]1805-son]1804-my more than son , might live - ay , even if [he]108-leo proved to be [the man]271-the man .

Then [I]0-i went back as softly as [I]0-i had come , but still [I]0-i could not sleep ; the sight and thought of [dear Leo]108-leo lying there so ill had but added fuel to the fire of [my]0-i unrest . [My]0-i wearied body and overstrained mind awakened all [my]0-i imagination into preternatural activity . Ideas , visions , almost inspirations , floated before it with startling vividness . Most of them were grotesque enough , some were ghastly , some recalled thoughts and sensations that had for years been buried in the débris of [my]0-i past life . But , behind and above [them]1807-them all , hovered the shape of [that awful woman]1808-that awful woman , and through them gleamed the memory of [her]1808-that awful woman entrancing loveliness . Up and down [the cave]936-the cave [I]0-i strode - up and down .

Suddenly [I]0-i observed , what [I]0-i had not noticed before , that there was a narrow aperture in the rocky wall . [I]0-i took up the lamp and examined it ; the aperture led to [a passage]1810-a passage . Now , [I]0-i was still sufficiently sensible to remember that it is not pleasant , in such a situation as [ours]1811-ours was , to have passages running into [[one]328-one 's bed - chamber]1813-one 's bed - chamber from [no one]3428-no one knows where . If there are passages , [people]454-people can come up them ; [they]454-people can come up when [one]328-one is asleep . Partly to see where it went to , and partly from a restless desire to be doing something , [I]0-i followed [the passage]1645-the passage . It led to a stone stair , which [I]0-i descended ; the stair ended in [another passage]1818-another passage , or rather tunnel , also hewn out of the bed - rock , and running , so far as [I]0-i could judge , exactly beneath the gallery that led to the entrance of [[our]1811-ours rooms]1819-our rooms , and across [the great central cave]1820-the great central cave . [I]0-i went on down [it]1645-the passage : it was as silent as the grave , but still , drawn by some sensation or attraction that [I]0-i can not define , [I]0-i followed on , [my]0-i stockinged feet falling without noise on the smooth and rocky floor . When [I]0-i had traversed some fifty yards of space , [I]0-i came to [another passage]1818-another passage running at right angles , and here an awful thing happened to [me]0-i : the sharp draught caught [my]0-i lamp and extinguished it , leaving [me]0-i in utter darkness in the bowels of [that mysterious place]1822-that mysterious place . [I]0-i took a couple of strides forward so as to clear [the bisecting tunnel]1823-the bisecting tunnel , being terribly afraid lest [I]0-i should turn up [it]1823-the bisecting tunnel in the dark if once [I]0-i got confused as to the direction , and then paused to think . What was [I]0-i to do ? [I]0-i had no match ; it seemed awful to attempt that long journey back through the utter gloom , and yet [I]0-i could not stand there all night , and , if [I]0-i did , probably it would not help [me]0-i much , for in [the bowels of [the rock]550-the rock]1824-the bowels of the rock it would be as dark at midday as at midnight . [I]0-i looked back over [my]0-i shoulder - not a sight or a sound . [I]0-i peered forward into the darkness : surely , far away , [I]0-i saw something like the faint glow of fire . Perhaps it was a cave where [I]0-i could get a light - at any rate , it was worth investigating . Slowly and painfully [I]0-i crept along [the tunnel]1826-the tunnel , keeping [my]0-i hand against [its]1826-the tunnel wall , and feeling at every step with [my]0-i foot before [I]0-i put it down , fearing lest [I]0-i should fall into some pit . Thirty paces - there was a light , a broad light that came and went , shining through curtains ! Fifty paces - it was close at hand ! Sixty - oh , great heaven !

[I]0-i was at the curtains , and they did not hang close , so [I]0-i could see clearly into [the little cavern beyond [them]1828-them]1827-the little cavern beyond them . [It]1827-the little cavern beyond them had all the appearance of being [a tomb]1829-a tomb , and was lit up by a fire that burnt in [its]1827-the little cavern beyond them centre with a whitish flame and without smoke . Indeed , there , to the left , was a stone shelf with a little ledge to it three inches or so high , and on the shelf lay what [I]0-i took to be a corpse ; at any rate , it looked like one , with something white thrown over it . To the right was a similar shelf , on which lay some broidered coverings . Over the fire bent the figure of [a woman]284-a woman ; [she]284-a woman was sideways to [me]0-i and facing the corpse , wrapped in a dark mantle that hid [her]284-a woman like [a nun]1831-a nun 's cloak . [She]284-a woman seemed to be staring at the flickering flame . Suddenly , as [I]0-i was trying to make up [my]0-i mind what to do , with a convulsive movement that somehow gave an impression of despairing energy , [the woman]3243-the woman rose to [her]3243-the woman feet and cast the dark cloak from [her]3243-the woman .

It was [She]3243-the woman [herself]3243-the woman !

[She]3243-the woman was clothed , as [I]0-i had seen [her]3243-the woman when [she]3243-the woman unveiled , in the kirtle of clinging white , cut low upon [her]3243-the woman bosom , and bound in at the waist with the barbaric double - headed snake , and , as before , [her]3243-the woman rippling black hair fell in heavy masses down [her]3243-the woman back . But [her]3243-the woman face was what caught [my]0-i eye , and held [me]0-i as in a vice , not this time by the force of its beauty , but by the power of fascinated terror . The beauty was still there , indeed , but the agony , the blind passion , and the awful vindictiveness displayed upon those quivering features , and in the tortured look of the upturned eyes , were such as surpass [my]0-i powers of description .

For a moment [she]3243-the woman stood still , [her]3243-the woman hands raised high above [her]3243-the woman head , and as [she]3243-the woman did so the white robe slipped from [her]3243-the woman down to [her]3243-the woman golden girdle , baring the blinding loveliness of [her]3243-the woman form . [She]3243-the woman stood there , [her]3243-the woman fingers clenched , and the awful look of malevolence gathered and deepened on [her]3243-the woman face .

Suddenly [I]0-i thought of what would happen if [she]3243-the woman discovered [me]0-i , and the reflection made [me]0-i turn sick and faint . But , even if [I]0-i had known that [I]0-i must die if [I]0-i stopped , [I]0-i do not believe that [I]0-i could have moved , for [I]0-i was absolutely fascinated . But still [I]0-i knew [my]0-i danger . Supposing [she]3243-the woman should hear [me]0-i , or see [me]0-i through the curtain , supposing [I]0-i even sneezed , or that [her]3243-the woman magic told [her]3243-the woman that [she]3243-the woman was being watched - swift indeed would be [my]0-i doom .

Down came the clenched hands to [her]3243-the woman sides , then up again above [her]3243-the woman head , and , as [I]0-i am [a living and honourable man]1833-a living and honourable man , the white flame of the fire leapt up after [them]1834-them , almost to the roof , throwing a fierce and ghastly glare upon [She]3243-the woman [herself]3243-the woman , upon [the white figure beneath the covering , and every scroll and detail of the rockwork]1835-the white figure beneath the covering , and every scroll and detail of the rockwork .

Down came the ivory arms again , and as [they]1834-them did so [she]3243-the woman spoke , or rather hissed , in Arabic , in a note that curdled [my]0-i blood , and for a second stopped [my]0-i heart .

" Curse [her]3243-the woman , may [she]3243-the woman be everlastingly accursed . "[3243-the woman]

The arms fell and the flame sank . Up they went again , and the broad tongue of fire shot up after them ; and then again they fell .

" Curse [her]3243-the woman memory - accursed be the memory of [the Egyptian]118-kallikrates . "[3243-the woman]

Up again , and again down .

" Curse [her]3243-the woman , [the daughter of the Nile]3874-the daughter of the nile , because of [her]3243-the woman beauty .[3243-the woman]

" Curse [her]3243-the woman , because [her]3243-the woman magic hath prevailed against [me]3243-the woman .[3243-the woman]

" Curse [her]3243-the woman , because [she]3243-the woman held [[my]3243-the woman beloved]1151-my beloved from [me]3243-the woman . "[3243-the woman]

And again the flame dwindled and shrank .

[She]3243-the woman put [her]3243-the woman hands before [her]3243-the woman eyes , and abandoning the hissing tone , cried aloud : -

" What is the use of cursing ? - [she]3243-the woman prevailed , and [she]3243-the woman is gone . "[3243-the woman]

Then [she]3243-the woman recommenced with an even more frightful energy : -

" Curse [her]3243-the woman where [she]3243-the woman is . Let [my]3243-the woman curses reach [her]3243-the woman where [she]3243-the woman is and disturb [her]3243-the woman rest .[3243-the woman]

" Curse [her]3243-the woman through [the starry spaces]3876-the starry spaces . Let [her]3243-the woman shadow be accursed .[3243-the woman]

" Let [my]3243-the woman power find [her]3243-the woman even there .[3243-the woman]

" Let [her]3243-the woman hear [me]3243-the woman even there . Let [her]3243-the woman hide [herself]3243-the woman in the blackness .[3243-the woman]

" Let [her]3243-the woman go down into the pit of despair , because [I]3243-the woman shall one day find [her]3243-the woman . "[3243-the woman]

Again the flame fell , and again [she]3243-the woman covered [her]3243-the woman eyes with [her]3243-the woman hands .

" It is of no use - no use , "[3243-the woman] [she]3243-the woman wailed ; " who can reach [those who sleep]3877-those who sleep ? Not even [I]3243-the woman can reach [them]3877-those who sleep . "[3243-the woman]

Then once more [she]3243-the woman began [her]3243-the woman unholy rites .

" Curse [her]3243-the woman when [she]3243-the woman shall be born again . Let [her]3243-the woman be born accursed .[3243-the woman]

" Let [her]3243-the woman be utterly accused from the hour of [her]3243-the woman birth until sleep finds [her]3243-the woman .[3243-the woman]

" Yea , then , let [her]3243-the woman be accursed ; for then shall [I]3243-the woman overtake [her]3243-the woman with [my]3243-the woman vengeance , and utterly destroy [her]3243-the woman . "[3243-the woman]

And so on . The flame rose and fell , reflecting itself in [her]3243-the woman agonised eyes ; the hissing sound of [her]3243-the woman terrible maledictions , and no words of mine can convey how terrible they were , ran round the walls and died away in little echoes , and the fierce light and deep gloom alternated themselves on the white and dreadful form stretched upon that bier of stone .

But at length [she]3243-the woman seemed to wear [herself]3243-the woman out and cease . [She]3243-the woman sat [herself]3243-the woman down upon the rocky floor , shook the dense cloud of [her]3243-the woman beautiful hair over [her]3243-the woman face and breast , and began to sob terribly in the torture of a heartrending despair .

" Two thousand years , "[3243-the woman] [she]3243-the woman moaned - " two thousand years have [I]3243-the woman wanted and endured ; but though century doth still creep on to century , and time give place to time , the sting of memory hath not lessened , the light of hope doth not shine more bright . Oh ! to have lived two thousand years , with all [my]3243-the woman passion eating out [my]3243-the woman heart , and with [my]3243-the woman sin ever before [me]3243-the woman . Oh , that for [me]3243-the woman life can not bring forgetfulness ! Oh , for the weary years that have been and are yet to come , and evermore to come , endless and without end ![3243-the woman]

" [My]1836-i love ! [my]1836-i love ! [my]1836-i love ! Why did [that stranger]3878-that stranger bring [thee]3243-the woman back to [me]1836-i after this sort ? For five hundred years [I]1836-i have not suffered thus . Oh , if [I]1836-i sinned against [thee]3243-the woman , have [I]1836-i not wiped away the sin ? When wilt [thou]3243-the woman come back to [me]1836-i who have all , and yet without [thee]3243-the woman have naught ? What is there that [I]1836-i can do ? What ? What ? What ? And perchance [she]1836-i - perchance that [Egyptian]118-kallikrates doth abide with [thee]3243-the woman where [thou]3243-the woman art , and mock [my]1836-i memory . Oh , why could [I]1836-i not die with [thee]3243-the woman , [I]1836-i who slew [thee]3243-the woman ? Alas , that [I]1836-i can not die ! Alas ! Alas ! "[1836-i] and [she]1836-i flung [herself]1836-i prone upon the ground , and sobbed and wept till [I]0-i thought [her]1836-i heart must burst .

Suddenly [she]1836-i ceased , raised [herself]1836-i to [her]1836-i feet , rearranged [her]1836-i robe , and , tossing back [her]1836-i long locks impatiently , swept across to where [the figure lay upon the stone]1837-the figure lay upon the stone .

" Oh [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , "[1836-i] [she]1836-i cried , and [I]0-i trembled at the name , " [I]0-i must look upon [thy]3243-the woman face again , though it be agony . It is a generation since [I]0-i looked upon [thee]3243-the woman whom [I]0-i slew - slew with [mine]0-i own hand , "[0-i] and with trembling fingers [she]1836-i seized the corner of the sheet - like wrapping that covered the form upon the stone bier , and then paused . When [she]1836-i spoke again , it was in a kind of awed whisper , as though [her]1836-i idea were terrible even to [herself]1836-i .

" Shall [I]1836-i raise [thee]1838-the corpse , "[1836-i] [she]1836-i said , apparently addressing [the corpse]1838-the corpse , ' so that [thou]1838-the corpse standest there before [me]0-i , as of old ? [I]0-i can do it , " and [she]1836-i held out [her]1836-i hands over the sheeted dead , while [her]1836-i whole frame became rigid and terrible to see , and [her]1836-i eyes grew fixed and dull . [I]1836-i shrank in horror behind the curtain , [my]1836-i hair stood up upon [my]1836-i head , and , whether it was [my]1836-i imagination or a fact [I]1836-i am unable to say , but [I]1836-i thought that the quiet form beneath the covering began to quiver , and the winding sheet to lift as though it lay on the breast of one who slept . Suddenly [she]1836-i withdrew [her]1836-i hands , and the motion of the corpse seemed to [me]1836-i to cease .[1836-i]

" To what purpose ? "[1836-i] [she]1836-i said gloomily . " Of what good is it to recall the semblance of life when [I]1836-i can not recall the spirit ? Even if [thou]1838-the corpse stoodest before [me]1836-i [thou]1838-the corpse wouldst not know [me]1836-i , and couldst but do what [I]1836-i bid [thee]1838-the corpse . The life in [thee]1838-the corpse would be [my]1836-i life , and not [thy]1838-the corpse life , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . "[1836-i]

For a moment [she]1836-i stood there brooding , and then cast [herself]1836-i down on [her]1836-i knees beside the form , and began to press [her]1836-i lips against the sheet , and weep . There was something so horrible about the sight of [this awe - inspiring woman]1839-this awe - inspiring woman letting loose [her]1836-i passion on the dead - so much more horrible even than anything that had gone before - that [I]0-i could no longer bear to look at it , and , turning , began to creep , shaking as [I]0-i was in every limb , slowly along [the pitch - dark passage]1840-the pitch - dark passage , feeling in [my]0-i trembling heart that [I]0-i had seen a vision of a Soul in [Hell]72-hell .

On [I]0-i stumbled , [I]0-i scarcely know how . Twice [I]0-i fell , once [I]0-i turned up [the bisecting passage]1841-the bisecting passage , but fortunately found out [my]0-i mistake in time . For twenty minutes or more [I]0-i crept along , till at last it occurred to [me]0-i that [I]0-i must have passed the little stair by which [I]0-i had descended . So , utterly exhausted , and nearly frightened to death , [I]0-i sank down at length there on the stone flooring , and sank into oblivion .

When [I]0-i came to [I]0-i noticed a faint ray of light in [the passage]1645-the passage just behind [me]0-i . [I]0-i crept to [it]1843-it , and found it was the little stair down which the weak dawn was stealing . Passing up [it]1843-it , [I]0-i gained [[my]0-i chamber]1844-my chamber in safety , and , flinging [myself]0-i on the couch , was soon lost in slumber or rather stupor .

XV

[AYESHA GIVES JUDGMENT]114-ayesha

The next thing that [I]0-i remember was opening [my]0-i eyes and perceiving the form of [Job]137-job , who had now practically recovered from [his]137-job attack of fever . [He]137-job was standing in the ray of light that pierced into [the cave]936-the cave from the outer air , shaking out [my]0-i clothes as a makeshift for brushing them , which [he]137-job could not do because there was no brush , and then folding them up neatly and laying them on the foot of the stone couch . This done , [he]137-job got [my]0-i travelling dressing - case out of the Gladstone bag , and opened it ready for [my]0-i use . First [he]137-job stood it on the foot of the couch also , then , being afraid , [I]0-i suppose , that [I]0-i should kick it off , [he]137-job placed it on a leopard skin on the floor , and stood back a step or two to observe the effect . It was not satisfactory , so [he]137-job shut up the bag , turned it on end , and , having rested it against the foot of the couch , placed the dressing - case on it . Next [he]137-job looked at the pots full of water , which constituted [our]1846-our washing apparatus . " Ah ! "[137-job] [I]0-i heard [him]137-job murmur , " no hot water in [this beastly place]3879-this beastly place . [I]137-job suppose [these poor creatures]3880-these poor creatures only use it to boil each other in , "[137-job] and [he]137-job sighed deeply .

" What is the matter , [Job]137-job ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Beg pardon , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] [he]137-job said , touching [his]137-job hair . " [I]137-job thought [you]3126-sir were asleep , [sir]3126-sir ; and [I]137-job am sure [you]3126-sir seem as though [you]3126-sir want it . [One]328-one might think from the look of [you]3126-sir that [you]3126-sir had been having a night of it . "[137-job]

[I]0-i only groaned by way of answer . [I]0-i had , indeed , been having a night of it , such as [I]0-i hope never to have again .

" How is [Mr. Leo]108-leo , [Job]137-job ? "[137-job]

" Much the same , [sir]3126-sir . If [he]108-leo do n't soon mend , [he]108-leo 'll end , [sir]3126-sir ; and that 's all about it ; though [I]137-job must say that that there savage , [Ustane]172-ustane , do do [her]172-ustane best for [him]108-leo , almost like [a baptised Christian]3886-a baptised christian . [She]172-ustane is always hanging round and looking after [him]108-leo , and if [I]137-job ventures to interfere it 's awful to see [her]172-ustane ; [her]172-ustane hair seems to stand on end , and [she]172-ustane curses and swears away in [her]172-ustane heathen talk - at least [I]137-job fancy [she]172-ustane must be cursing , from the look of [her]172-ustane . "[137-job]

" And what do [you]137-job do then ? "[137-job]

" [I]137-job make [her]172-ustane a perlite bow , and [I]137-job say , ' [Young woman]3887-young woman , [your]3887-young woman position is one that [I]137-job do n't quite understand , and ca n't recognise . Let [me]137-job tell [you]3887-young woman that [I]137-job has a duty to perform to [[my]137-job master]3888-my master as is incapacitated by illness , and that [I]137-job am going to perform it until [I]137-job am incapacitated too , ' but [she]172-ustane do n't take no heed , not [she]172-ustane - only curses and swears away worse than ever . Last night [she]172-ustane put [her]172-ustane hand under that sort of night - shirt [she]172-ustane wears and whips out a knife with a kind of a curl in the blade , so [I]137-job whips out [my]137-job revolver , and [we]3889-we walks round and round [each other]417-each other till at last [she]172-ustane bursts out laughing . It is n't nice treatment for [a Christian man]3891-a christian man to have to put up with from [a savage]3892-a savage , however handsome [she]172-ustane may be , but it is what [people]454-people must expect as is [fools]3701-fools enough "[137-job] [Job]137-job laid great emphasis on [the " fools "[137-job] "]3895-the " fools " " to come to such a place to look for things [no man]3309-no man is meant to find . It 's a judgment on [us]3889-we , [sir]3126-sir - that 's [my]137-job view ; and [I]137-job , for one , is of opinion that the judgment is n't half done yet , and when it is done [we]3889-we shall be done too , and just stop in [these beastly caves]3898-these beastly caves with the ghosts and the corpseses for once and all . And now , [sir]3126-sir , [I]137-job must be seeing about [[Mr. Leo]108-leo 's broth]3900-mr. leo 's broth , if that wild cat will let [me]137-job ; and , perhaps , [you]3126-sir would like to get up , [sir]3126-sir , because it 's past nine o'clock . "[137-job]

[Job]137-job 's remarks were not of an exactly cheering order to [a man who had passed such a night as [I]0-i had]1847-a man who had passed such a night as i had ; and , what is more , they had the weight of truth . Taking one thing with another , it appeared to [me]0-i to be an utter impossibility that [we]1848-we should escape from [the place [we]1848-we were]1849-the place we were . Supposing that [Leo]108-leo recovered , and supposing that [She]1850-she would let [us]1848-we go , which was exceedingly doubtful , and that [she]1850-she did not " blast "[1850-she] [us]1848-we in some moment of vexation , and that [we]1848-we were not hot - potted by [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger , it would be quite impossible for [us]1848-we to find [our]1848-we way across [the network of marshes]1851-the network of marshes which , stretching for scores and scores of miles , formed a stronger and more impassable fortification round [the various Amahagger households]1852-the various amahagger households than any that could be built or designed by [man]3189-man . No , there was but one thing to do - face it out ; and , speaking for [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i was so intensely interested in the whole weird story that , so far as [I]0-i was concerned , notwithstanding the shattered state of [my]0-i nerves , [I]0-i asked nothing better , even if [my]0-i life paid forfeit to [my]0-i curiosity . What man for whom physiology has charms could forbear to study [such a character as that of this Ayesha]1854-such a character as that of this ayesha when the opportunity of doing so presented itself ? The very terror of the pursuit added to its fascination , and besides , as [I]0-i was forced to own to [myself]0-i even now in the sober light of day , [she]1850-she [herself]1850-she had attractions that [I]0-i could not forget . Not even the dreadful sight which [I]0-i had witnessed during the night could drive that folly from [my]0-i mind ; and alas ! that [I]0-i should have to admit it , it has not been driven thence to this hour .

After [I]0-i had dressed [myself]0-i [I]0-i passed into the eating , or rather [embalming chamber]1855-embalming chamber , and had some food , which was as before brought to [me]0-i by [the girl mutes]1856-the girl mutes . When [I]0-i had finished [I]0-i went and saw poor [Leo]108-leo , who was quite off [his]108-leo head , and did not even know [me]0-i . [I]0-i asked [Ustane]172-ustane how [she]172-ustane thought [he]108-leo was ; but [she]172-ustane only shook [her]172-ustane head and began to cry a little . Evidently [her]172-ustane hopes were small ; and [I]0-i then and there made up [my]0-i mind that , if it were in any way possible , [I]0-i would get [She]172-ustane to come and see [him]108-leo . Surely [she]172-ustane would cure [him]108-leo if [she]172-ustane chose - at any rate [she]172-ustane said [she]172-ustane could . While [I]0-i was in [the room]449-the room , [Billali]137-job entered , and also shook [his]137-job head .

" [He]108-leo will die at night , "[137-job] [he]137-job said .

" God forbid , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , and turned away with a heavy heart .

" [She]172-ustane - who - must - be - obeyed commands [thy]0-i presence , [[my]910-the old man Baboon]3510-my baboon , "[910-the old man] said [the old man]910-the old man as soon as [we]1859-we got to the curtain ; " but , oh [[my]910-the old man dear son]3904-my dear son , be more careful . Yesterday [I]910-the old man made sure in [my]910-the old man heart that [She]172-ustane would blast [thee]3904-my dear son when [thou]3904-my dear son didst not crawl upon [thy]3904-my dear son stomach before [her]172-ustane . [She]172-ustane is sitting in [the great hall]3697-the great hall even now to do justice upon [those who would have smitten [thee]3904-my dear son and [the Lion]183-leo]3906-those who would have smitten thee and the lion . Come on , [[my]910-the old man son]3150-my son ; come swiftly . "[910-the old man]

[I]0-i turned , and followed [him]910-the old man down [the passage]1645-the passage , and when [we]1859-we reached [the great central cave]1820-the great central cave saw that many [Amahagger]171-the amahagger , some robed , and [some merely clad in the sweet simplicity of a leopard skin]1862-some merely clad in the sweet simplicity of a leopard skin , were hurrying along [it]1820-the great central cave . [We]1859-we mingled with [the throng]1863-the throng , and walked up the enormous and , indeed , almost interminable cave . All the way [its]1820-the great central cave walls were elaborately sculptured , and every twenty paces or so passages opened out of [it]1820-the great central cave at right angles , leading , [Billali]137-job told [me]0-i , to [tombs]1864-tombs , hollowed in the rock by " [the people who were before]3908-the people who were before . "[488-nobody] [Nobody]488-nobody visited [those tombs]1866-those tombs now , [he]137-job said ; and [I]0-i must say that [my]0-i heart rejoiced when [I]0-i thought of the opportunities of antiquarian research which opened out before [me]0-i .

At last [we]1859-we came to the head of [the cave]936-the cave , where there was a rock daïs almost exactly similar to [the one on which [we]1859-we had been so furiously attacked]1868-the one on which we had been so furiously attacked , a fact that proved to [me]0-i that [these daïs]1869-these daïs must have been used as altars , probably for the celebration of religious ceremonies , and more especially of rites connected with the interment of [the dead]1054-the dead . On either side of [this daïs]1871-this daïs were passages leading , [Billali]137-job informed [me]0-i , to [other caves full of dead bodies]1872-other caves full of dead bodies . " Indeed , "[137-job] [he]137-job added , " [the whole mountain]3909-the whole mountain is full of dead , and nearly all of [them]1054-the dead are perfect . "[137-job]

In front of [the daïs]1873-the daïs were gathered [a great number of [people of both sexes]1875-people of both sexes , who stood staring about in [their]1874-a great number of people of both sexes , who stood staring about in their peculiar gloomy fashion , which would have reduced mark tapley himself to misery in about five minutes peculiar gloomy fashion , which would have reduced [Mark Tapley]213-mark tapley [himself]213-mark tapley to misery in about five minutes]1874-a great number of people of both sexes , who stood staring about in their peculiar gloomy fashion , which would have reduced mark tapley himself to misery in about five minutes . On [the daïs]1873-the daïs was a rude chair of black wood inlaid with ivory , having a seat made of grass fibre , and a footstool formed of a wooden slab attached to the framework of the chair .

Suddenly there was a cry of " Hiya ! [Hiya]174-hiya ! "[1879-a long string of guards] " [She]3910-she ! [She]3910-she ! "[1879-a long string of guards] , and thereupon [the entire crowd of spectators]1877-the entire crowd of spectators instantly precipitated itself upon the ground , and lay still as though it were individually and collectively stricken dead , leaving [me]0-i standing there like [some solitary survivor of a massacre]1878-some solitary survivor of a massacre . As it did so [a long string of [guards]1559-guards]1879-a long string of guards began to defile from [a passage to the left]1881-a passage to the left , and ranged [themselves]1879-a long string of guards on either side of [the daïs]1873-the daïs . Then followed about a score of [male mutes]1883-male mutes , then as many [women mutes bearing lamps]1884-women mutes bearing lamps , and then [a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot , in whom [I]0-i recognised [She]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot [herself]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot . [She]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot mounted the daïs and sat down upon the chair , and spoke to [me]0-i in Greek , [I]0-i suppose because [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot did not wish [those present]1886-those present to understand what [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot said .

" Come hither , oh [Holly]109-holly , "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot] [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot said , " and sit [thou]109-holly at [my]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot feet , and see [me]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot do justice on [those who would have slain [thee]109-holly]3911-those who would have slain thee . Forgive [me]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot if [my]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot Greek doth halt like [a lame man]3912-a lame man ; it is so long since [I]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot have heard the sound of it that [my]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot tongue is stiff , and will not bend rightly to the words . "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]

[I]0-i bowed , and , mounting the daïs , sat down at [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot feet .

" How hast [thou]109-holly slept , [[my]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly ? "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot] [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot asked .

" [I]0-i slept not well , oh [Ayesha]114-ayesha ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered with perfect truth , and with an inward fear that perhaps [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot knew how [I]0-i had passed the heart of the night .

" So , "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot] [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot said , with a little laugh ; " [I]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot , too , have not slept well . Last night [I]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot had dreams , and methinks that [thou]109-holly didst call them to [me]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot , oh [Holly]109-holly . "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]

" Of what didst [thou]109-holly dream , [Ayesha]114-ayesha ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked indifferently .

" [I]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot dreamed , "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot] [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot answered quickly , " of one [I]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot hate and one [I]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot love , "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot] and then , as though to turn the conversation , [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot addressed [the captain of [[her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot guard]1888-her guard in Arabic]1887-the captain of her guard in arabic : " Let [the men]532-the men be brought before [me]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot . "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]

[The captain]3300-the captain bowed low , for [the guard]1890-the guard and [[her]1890-the guard attendants]1891-her attendants did not prostrate [themselves]1892-themselves , but had remained standing , and departed with [[his]3300-the captain underlings]1893-his underlings down a passage to the right .

Then came a silence . [She]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot leaned [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot swathed head upon [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot hand and appeared to be lost in thought , while [the multitude before [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]1894-the multitude before her continued to grovel upon [their]1894-the multitude before her stomachs , only screwing [their]1894-the multitude before her heads round a little so as to get a view of [us]1895-us with one eye . It seemed that [[their]1894-the multitude before her Queen]1103-their queen so rarely appeared in public that [they]1894-the multitude before her were willing to undergo this inconvenience , and even graver risks , to have the opportunity of looking on [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot , or rather on [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot garments , for [no living man]1897-no living man there except [myself]0-i had ever seen [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot face . At last [we]1895-us caught sight of the waving of lights , and heard the tramp of [men]516-men coming along [the passage]1645-the passage , and in filed [the guard]1890-the guard , and with [them]1890-the guard [the survivors of [[our]1895-us would - be murderers]1237-our would - be murderers]1901-the survivors of our would - be murderers , to the number of [twenty or more , on whose countenances a natural expression of sullenness]1903-twenty or more , on whose countenances a natural expression of sullenness struggled with the terror that evidently filled [their]1894-the multitude before her savage hearts . [They]1894-the multitude before her were ranged in front of [the daïs]1873-the daïs , and would have cast [themselves]1894-the multitude before her down on the floor of [the cave]936-the cave like [the spectators]1906-the spectators , but [She]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot stopped [them]1894-the multitude before her .

" Nay , "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot] [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot said in [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot softest voice , ' stand ; [I]0-i pray [you]1907-you stand . Perchance the time will soon be when [ye]1907-you shall grow weary of being stretched out , " and [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot laughed melodiously .[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]

[I]0-i saw a cringe of terror run along the rank of the doomed wretches , and , wicked villains as [they]1894-the multitude before her were , [I]0-i felt sorry for [them]1894-the multitude before her . Some minutes , perhaps two or three , passed before anything fresh occurred , during which [She]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot appeared from the movement of [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot head - for , of course , [we]1908-we could not see [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot eyes - to be slowly and carefully examining [each delinquent]1909-each delinquent . At last [she]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot spoke , addressing [herself]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot to [me]0-i in a quiet and deliberate tone .

" Dost [thou]3915-thou , oh [[my]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot guest]3916-my guest , recognise [these men]3427-these men ? "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]

" Ay , oh Queen , nearly all of [them]3427-these men , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and [I]0-i saw [them]1894-the multitude before her glower at [me]0-i as [I]0-i said it .

" Then tell to [me]1894-the multitude before her , and this great company , the tale whereof [I]1894-the multitude before her have heard . "[1894-the multitude before her]

Thus adjured , [I]0-i , in as few words as [I]0-i could , related the history of the cannibal feast , and of the attempted torture of [[our]1908-we poor servant]1910-our poor servant . The narrative was received in perfect silence , both by [the accused]1911-the accused and by [the audience]1912-the audience , and also by [She]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot [herself]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot . When [I]0-i had done , [Ayesha]114-ayesha called upon [Billali]137-job by name , and , lifting [his]137-job head from the ground , but without rising , [the old man]910-the old man confirmed [my]0-i story . No further evidence was taken .

" [Ye]0-i have heard , "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot] said [She]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot at length , in a cold , clear voice , very different from [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot usual tones - indeed , it was one of the most remarkable things about [this extraordinary creature]1914-this extraordinary creature that [her]1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot voice had the power of suiting itself in a wonderful manner to the mood of the moment . " What have [ye]0-i to say , [[ye]0-i rebellious children]3918-ye rebellious children , why vengeance should not be done upon [you]0-i ? "[1885-a tall white figure , swathed from head to foot]

For some time there was no answer , but at last [one of [the men]532-the men]1426-one of the men , [a fine , broad - chested fellow , well on in middle - life , with deep - graven features and an eye like a hawk 's]1917-a fine , broad - chested fellow , well on in middle - life , with deep - graven features and an eye like a hawk 's , spoke , and said that the orders that [they]532-the men had received were not to harm [the white men]1918-the white men ; nothing was said of [[their]532-the men black servant]1919-their black servant , so , egged on thereto by [a woman who was now dead , [they]532-the men proceeded to try to hot - pot [him]910-the old man after the ancient and honourable custom of [[their]532-the men country]1921-their country]1920-a woman who was now dead , they proceeded to try to hot - pot him after the ancient and honourable custom of their country , with a view of eating [him]910-the old man in due course . As for [their]532-the men sudden attack upon [ourselves]1922-ourselves , it was made in an access of sudden fury , and [they]532-the men deeply regretted it . [He]910-the old man ended by humbly praying that [they]532-the men might be banished into [the swamps]3176-the swamps , to live and die as it might chance ; but [I]0-i saw it written on [his]910-the old man face that [he]910-the old man had but little hope of mercy .
