Then came a pause , and the most intense silence reigned over the whole scene , which , illuminated as it was by the flicker of the lamps striking out broad patterns of light and shadow upon the rocky walls , was as strange as any [I]0-i ever saw , even in [that unholy land]1924-that unholy land . Upon the ground before the daïs were stretched scores of the corpselike forms of [the spectators]1906-the spectators , till at last the long lines of [them]1906-the spectators were lost in the gloomy background . Before [this outstretched audience]1926-this outstretched audience were the knots of [evil - doers]1927-evil - doers , trying to cover up [their]1906-the spectators natural terrors with a brave appearance of unconcern . On the right and left stood [the silent guards , robed in white and armed with great spears and daggers]1928-the silent guards , robed in white and armed with great spears and daggers , and [men]516-men and [women mutes watching with hard curious eyes]1930-women mutes watching with hard curious eyes . Then , seated in [her]1931-my barbaric chair above [them]532-the men all , with [myself]0-i at [her]1931-my feet , was [the veiled white woman , whose loveliness and awesome power seemed to visibly shine about [her]1931-my like a halo , or rather like the glow from some unseen light]1932-the veiled white woman , whose loveliness and awesome power seemed to visibly shine about her like a halo , or rather like the glow from some unseen light . Never have [I]0-i seen [her]1931-my veiled shape look more terrible than it did in that space , while [she]1931-my gathered [herself]1931-my up for vengeance .

At last it came .

" Dogs and serpents , "[1931-my] [She]1931-my began in a low voice that gradually gathered power as [she]1931-my went on , till [the place]1059-the place rang with it . " [Eaters of human flesh]3919-eaters of human flesh , two things have [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh done . First , [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh have attacked [these strangers]3920-these strangers , being [white men]3372-white men , and would have slain [[their]3920-these strangers servant]3689-their servant , and for that alone death is [your]3919-eaters of human flesh reward . But that is not all . [Ye]3919-eaters of human flesh have dared to disobey [me]1931-my . Did [I]1931-my not send [my]1931-my word unto [you]3919-eaters of human flesh by [Billali]137-job , [[my]1931-my servant]3923-my servant , and [the father of [[your]3919-eaters of human flesh household]3925-your household]3924-the father of your household ? Did [I]1931-my not bid [you]3919-eaters of human flesh to hospitably entertain [these strangers]3920-these strangers , whom now [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh have striven to slay , and whom , had not [they]3920-these strangers been brave and strong beyond the strength of [men]516-men , [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh would cruelly have murdered ? Hath it not been taught to [you]3919-eaters of human flesh from childhood that the law of [She]3928-she is an ever fixed law , and that [he]3929-he [who breaketh it by so much as one jot or tittle]3930-who breaketh it by so much as one jot or tittle shall perish ? And is not [my]1931-my lightest word a law ? Have not [[your]3919-eaters of human flesh fathers]3931-your fathers taught [you]3919-eaters of human flesh this , [I]1931-my say , whilst as yet [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh were but [children]395-children ? Do [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh not know that as well might [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh bid these great caves to fall upon [you]3919-eaters of human flesh , or the sun to cease its journeying , as to hope to turn [me]1931-my from [my]1931-my courses , or make [my]1931-my word light or heavy , according to [your]3919-eaters of human flesh minds ? Well do [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh know it , [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh [Wicked Ones]3933-wicked ones . But [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh are all evil - evil to the core - the wickedness bubbles up in [you]3919-eaters of human flesh like a fountain in the spring - time . Were it not for [me]1931-my , generations since had [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh ceased to be , for of [your]3919-eaters of human flesh own evil way had [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh destroyed each other . And now , because [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh have done this thing , because [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh have striven to put [these men]3427-these men , [[my]1931-my guests]3669-my guests , to death , and yet more because [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh have dared to disobey [my]1931-my word , this is the doom that [I]1931-my doom [you]3919-eaters of human flesh to . That [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh be taken to [the cave of torture]3936-the cave of torture , and given over to [the tormentors]3937-the tormentors , and that on the going down of to - morrow 's sun [those of [you]3919-eaters of human flesh who yet remain alive be slain , even as [ye]3919-eaters of human flesh would have slain the servant of [this [my]1931-my guest]3939-this my guest]3938-those of you who yet remain alive be slain , even as ye would have slain the servant of this my guest . "[1931-my]

" The cave of torture . "[0-i] [I]0-i afterwards saw [this dreadful place]1934-this dreadful place , also a legacy from [the prehistoric people who lived in [K"r]56-k"r]3940-the prehistoric people who lived in k"r . The only objects in [the cave]936-the cave [itself]936-the cave were slabs of rock arranged in various positions to facilitate the operations of [the torturers]3942-the torturers . Many of these slabs , which were of a porous stone , were stained quite dark with the blood of [ancient victims that had soaked into them]3943-ancient victims that had soaked into them . Also in the centre of [the room]449-the room was a place for a furnace , with a cavity wherein to heat the historic pot . But the most dreadful thing about [the cave]936-the cave was that over each slab was a sculptured illustration of the appropriate torture being applied . These sculptures were so awful that [I]1935-i will not harrow [the reader]298-the reader by attempting a description of them . - L. H. H.[1935-i]

[She]1935-i ceased , and a faint murmur of horror ran round [the cave]936-the cave . As for [the victims]1937-the victims , as soon as [they]1937-the victims realised the full hideousness of [their]1937-the victims doom , [their]1937-the victims stoicism forsook [them]1937-the victims , and [they]1937-the victims flung [themselves]1937-the victims down upon the ground , and wept and implored for mercy in a way that was dreadful to behold . [I]0-i , too , turned to [Ayesha]114-ayesha , and begged [her]114-ayesha to spare [them]1937-the victims , or at least to mete out [their]1937-the victims fate in some less awful way . But [she]114-ayesha was hard as adamant about it .

" [[My]114-ayesha [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , again speaking in Greek , which , to tell the truth , although [I]0-i have always been considered [a better scholar of the language]1938-a better scholar of the language than [most men]3036-most men , [I]0-i found it rather difficult to follow , chiefly because of the change in the fall of the accent . [Ayesha]114-ayesha , of course , talked with the accent of [[her]114-ayesha contemporaries]1940-her contemporaries , whereas [we]1941-we have only tradition and the modern accent to guide [us]1941-we as to the exact pronunciation . " [[My]114-ayesha [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , it can not be . Were [I]114-ayesha to show mercy to those wolves , [your]109-holly lives would not be safe among [this people]1554-this people for a day . [Thou]3950-thou knowest [them]1554-this people not . [They]1554-this people are tigers to lap blood , and even now [they]1554-this people hunger for [your]109-holly lives . How thinkest [thou]3950-thou that [I]114-ayesha rule [this people]1554-this people ? [I]114-ayesha have but [a regiment of [guards]1559-guards]3952-a regiment of guards to do [my]114-ayesha bidding , therefore it is not by force . It is by terror . [[My]114-ayesha empire]3954-my empire is of the imagination . Once in [a generation]3955-a generation mayhap [I]114-ayesha do as [I]114-ayesha have done but now , and slay a score by torture . Believe not that [I]114-ayesha would be cruel , or take vengeance on anything so low . What can it profit [me]114-ayesha to be avenged on such as these ? [Those who live long]3956-those who live long , [[my]114-ayesha Holly]3913-my holly , have no passions , save where [they]3956-those who live long have interests . Though [I]114-ayesha may seem to slay in wrath , or because [my]114-ayesha mood is crossed , it is not so . [Thou]3958-thou hast seen how in the heavens the little clouds blow this way and that without a cause , yet behind them is the great wind sweeping on its path whither it listeth . So it is with [me]114-ayesha , oh [Holly]109-holly . [My]114-ayesha moods and changes are the little clouds , and fitfully these seem to turn ; but behind them ever blows the great wind of [my]114-ayesha purpose . Nay , [the men]532-the men must die ; and die as [I]114-ayesha have said . "[114-ayesha] Then , suddenly turning to [the captain of the guard]1942-the captain of the guard : -

" As [my]114-ayesha word is , so be it ! "[114-ayesha]

XVI

THE TOMBS OF [K"R]111-k"r[114-ayesha]

After [the prisoners]1298-the prisoners had been removed [Ayesha]114-ayesha waved [her]114-ayesha hand , and [the spectators]1906-the spectators turned round , and began to crawl off down [the cave]936-the cave like a scattered flock of sheep . When [they]1906-the spectators were a fair distance from [the daïs]1873-the daïs , however , [they]1906-the spectators rose and walked away , leaving [the Queen]1108-the queen and [myself]0-i alone , with the exception of [the mutes]1948-the mutes and [the few remaining guards]1949-the few remaining guards , most of whom had departed with [the doomed men]1950-the doomed men . Thinking this a good opportunity , [I]0-i asked [She]114-ayesha to come and see [Leo]183-leo , telling [her]114-ayesha of [his]183-leo serious condition ; but [she]114-ayesha would not , saying that [he]183-leo certainly would not die before the night , as [people]454-people never died of that sort of fever except at nightfall or dawn . Also [she]114-ayesha said that it would be better to let the sickness spend its course as much as possible before [she]114-ayesha cured it . Accordingly , [I]0-i was rising to leave , when [she]114-ayesha bade [me]0-i follow [her]114-ayesha , as [she]114-ayesha would talk with [me]0-i , and show [me]0-i the wonders of [the caves]3307-the caves .

[I]0-i was too much involved in the web of [her]114-ayesha fatal fascinations to say [her]114-ayesha no , even if [I]0-i had wished , which [I]0-i did not . [She]114-ayesha rose from [her]114-ayesha chair , and , making some signs to [the mutes]1948-the mutes , descended from [the daïs]1873-the daïs . Thereon [four of [the girls]1956-the girls]1955-four of the girls took lamps , and ranged [themselves]1955-four of the girls two in front and two behind [us]1957-us , but [the others]847-the others went away , as also did [the guards]1647-the guards .

" Now , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , " wouldst [thou]3960-thou see some of the wonders of [this place]3339-this place , oh [Holly]109-holly ? Look upon [this great cave]3962-this great cave . Sawest [thou]3960-thou ever the like ? Yet was [it]3962-this great cave , and many more like [it]3962-this great cave , hollowed by the hands of [the dead race that once lived here in [the city]3964-the city on [the plain]1452-the plain]3963-the dead race that once lived here in the city on the plain . [A great and wonderful people]3966-a great and wonderful people must [they]214-the egyptians have been , [those men of [K"r]56-k"r]3967-those men of k"r[114-ayesha] , but , like [the Egyptians]214-the egyptians , [they]214-the egyptians thought more of [the dead]1054-the dead than of [the living]1055-the living . How many [men]516-men , thinkest [thou]1963-thou , working for how many years , did it need to the hollowing out [this cave]1964-this cave and all the galleries thereof ? "[516-men]

" Tens of thousands , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" So , oh [Holly]109-holly . [This people]1554-this people was [an old people]3969-an old people before [the Egyptians]214-the egyptians were . A little can [I]1965-i read of [their]1554-this people inscriptions , having found the key thereto - and see [thou]1963-thou here , this was one of the last of [the caves that [they]1554-this people hollowed]3970-the caves that they hollowed , "[1965-i] and , turning to the rock behind [her]1965-i , [she]1965-i motioned [the mutes]1948-the mutes to hold up the lamps . [Carven]215-carven over [the daïs]1873-the daïs was the figure of [an old man]907-an old man seated in a chair , with an ivory rod in [his]907-an old man hand . It struck [me]0-i at once that [his]907-an old man features were exceedingly like those of [the man who was represented as being embalmed in the chamber where [we]1970-we took [our]1970-we meals]1969-the man who was represented as being embalmed in the chamber where we took our meals . Beneath the chair , which , by the way , was shaped exactly like the one in which [Ayesha]114-ayesha had sat to give judgment , was a short inscription in the extraordinary characters of which [I]0-i have already spoke , but which [I]0-i do not remember sufficient of to illustrate . It looked more like Chinese writing than any other that [I]0-i am acquainted with . This inscription [Ayesha]114-ayesha proceeded , with some difficulty and hesitation , to read aloud and translate . It ran as follows : -

" In the year four thousand two hundred and fifty - nine from the founding of [the City of imperial K"r]3971-the city of imperial k"r[1972-she] was [this cave or burial place completed by [Tisno]216-tisno]1971-this cave or burial place completed by tisno , [King of [K"r]56-k"r]3972-king of k"r , [the people thereof and [[their]3973-the people thereof and their slaves having laboured thereat for three generations slaves]3974-their slaves having laboured thereat for three generations]3973-the people thereof and their slaves having laboured thereat for three generations , to be a tomb for [[their]3973-the people thereof and their slaves having laboured thereat for three generations citizens of rank]3975-their citizens of rank who shall come after . May the blessings of the heaven above the heaven rest upon [their]3973-the people thereof and their slaves having laboured thereat for three generations work , and make the sleep of [Tisno]216-tisno , [the mighty monarch , the likeness of whose features is graven above , a sound and happy sleep till the day of awakening]3976-the mighty monarch , the likeness of whose features is graven above , a sound and happy sleep till the day of awakening , and also the sleep of [[his]3972-king of k"r servants]3977-his servants , and of [those of [his]3972-king of k"r race]3978-those of his race who , rising up after [him]3972-king of k"r , shall yet lay [their]3978-those of his race heads as low . "[1972-she]

This phrase is remarkable , as seeming to indicate a belief in a future state . - [Editor]164-editor .

" [Thou]1972-she seest , oh [Holly]109-holly , "[1972-she] [she]1972-she said , " [this people]1554-this people founded [the city]3964-the city , of which the ruins yet cumber [the plain yonder]3981-the plain yonder , four thousand years before [this cave]1964-this cave was finished . Yet , when first [mine]1972-she eyes beheld it two thousand years ago , was it even as it is now . Judge , therefore , how old must [that city]3983-that city have been ! And now , follow [thou]1972-she [me]1972-she , and [I]1972-she will show [thee]1972-she after what fashion [this great people]3984-this great people fell when the time was come for it to fall , "[1972-she] and [she]1972-she led the way down to [the centre of [the cave]936-the cave]1973-the centre of the cave , stopping at a spot where a round rock had been let into a kind of large manhole in the flooring , accurately filling [it]1975-it just as the iron plates fill the spaces in the London pavements down which the coals are thrown . " [Thou]1972-she seest , "[1972-she] [she]1972-she said . " Tell [me]1972-she , what is it ? "[1972-she]

" Nay , [I]0-i know not , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; whereon [she]1972-she crossed to the left - hand side of [the cave]936-the cave looking towards the entrance and signed to [the mutes]1948-the mutes to hold up the lamps . On the wall was something painted with a red pigment in similar characters to those hewn beneath the sculpture of [Tisno]216-tisno , [King of [K"r]56-k"r]3972-king of k"r . This inscription [she]1972-she proceeded to translate to [me]1972-she , the pigment still being fresh enough to show the form of the letters . It ran thus :[1972-she]

" [I]1972-she , [Junis]217-junis , [a priest of [the Great Temple of K"r]3987-the great temple of k"r]3986-a priest of the great temple of k"r[1972-she] , write this upon the rock of the burying - place in the year four thousand eight hundred and three from [the founding of [K"r]56-k"r]3988-the founding of k"r . [K"r]56-k"r[1972-she] is fallen ! No more shall the mighty feast in [[her]1972-she halls]1978-her halls , no more shall [she]1972-she rule [the world]252-the world , and [her]1972-she navies go out to commerce with [the world]252-the world . [K"r]56-k"r is fallen ! and [her]1972-she mighty works and all [the cities of [K"r]56-k"r]3989-the cities of k"r[1972-she] , and [all the harbours that [she]1972-she built]1981-all the harbours that she built and [the canals that [she]1972-she made]1982-the canals that she made , are for the wolf and the owl and the wild swan , and [the barbarian who comes after]1983-the barbarian who comes after . Twenty and five moons ago did a cloud settle upon [K"r]56-k"r , and [the hundred cities of [K"r]56-k"r]3990-the hundred cities of k"r[1972-she] , and out of the cloud came a pestilence that slew [[her]1972-she people]1984-her people , [old and young]1985-old and young , [one with another]1986-one with another , and spared not . [One with another]1986-one with another [they]1984-her people turned black and died - [the young]1988-the young and [the old]1989-the old , the rich and the poor , [the man]271-the man and [the woman]3243-the woman , [the prince]1992-the prince and [the slave]1993-the slave . The pestilence slew and slew , and ceased not by day or by night , and [those who escaped from the pestilence]1994-those who escaped from the pestilence were slain of the famine . No longer could the bodies of [the children of [K"r]56-k"r]3991-the children of k"r be preserved according to the ancient rites , because of the number of the dead , therefore were [they]3991-the children of k"r hurled into the great pit beneath [the cave]936-the cave , through [the hole in the floor of [the cave]936-the cave]3993-the hole in the floor of the cave . Then , at last , [a remnant of this [the great people]3996-the great people , the light of [the whole world]3997-the whole world]3995-a remnant of this the great people , the light of the whole world , went down to [the coast]819-the coast and took [ship]3359-ship and sailed northwards ; and now am [I]1995-the imperial , [the Priest Junis]4000-the priest junis , who write this , [the last man left alive of [this great city of [men]516-men]4002-this great city of men]4001-the last man left alive of this great city of men , but whether there be any yet left in [the other cities]4004-the other cities [I]1995-the imperial know not . This do [I]1995-the imperial write in misery of heart before [I]1995-the imperial die , because [K"r]56-k"r[1995-the imperial] [the Imperial]1995-the imperial is no more , and because there are none to worship in [[her]1995-the imperial temple]1996-her temple , and all [[her]1995-the imperial palaces]1997-her palaces are empty , and [[her]1995-the imperial princes]1998-her princes and [[her]1995-the imperial captains]1999-her captains and [[her]1995-the imperial traders]2000-her traders and [[her]1995-the imperial fair women]2001-her fair women have passed off the face of [the earth]659-the earth . "[0-i]

[I]0-i gave a sigh of astonishment - the utter desolation depicted in this rude scrawl was so overpowering . It was terrible to think of [this solitary survivor of [a mighty people recording its fate]2004-a mighty people recording its fate before [he]2003-this solitary survivor of a mighty people recording its fate before he too went down into darkness too went down into darkness]2003-this solitary survivor of a mighty people recording its fate before he too went down into darkness . What must [the old man]910-the old man have felt as , in ghastly terrifying solitude , by the light of one lamp feebly illuminating a little space of gloom , [he]910-the old man in a few brief lines daubed the history of [[his]910-the old man nation]2006-his nation 's death upon the cavern wall ? What a subject for [the moralist]2007-the moralist , or [the painter]2008-the painter , or indeed for [any one who can think]2009-any one who can think !

" Doth it not occur to [thee]0-i , oh [Holly]109-holly , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , laying [her]114-ayesha hand upon [my]0-i shoulder , " that [those men who sailed North]4005-those men who sailed north may have been [the fathers of the first Egyptians]4006-the fathers of the first egyptians ? "[114-ayesha]

" Nay , [I]0-i know not , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " it seems that [the world]252-the world is very old . "[0-i]

" Old ? Yes , it is old indeed . Time after time have [nations]4008-nations , ay , and [rich and strong nations]4009-rich and strong nations , learned in the arts , been and passed away and been forgotten , so that no memory of [them]902-these people remains . This is but one of several ; for Time eats up the works of [man]3189-man , unless , indeed , [he]3189-man digs in caves like [the people of [K"r]56-k"r]4011-the people of k"r[114-ayesha] , and then mayhap [the sea]593-the sea swallows them , or the earthquake shakes [them]2011-them in . Who knows what hath been on [the earth]659-the earth , or what shall be ? There is no new thing under the sun , as [the wise Hebrew]2013-the wise hebrew wrote long ago . Yet were not [these people]902-these people utterly destroyed , as [I]0-i think . [Some few]2015-some few remained in [the other cities]4004-the other cities , for [[their]2015-some few cities]2017-their cities were many . But [the barbarians from [the south]2019-the south]2018-the barbarians from the south , or perchance [[my]0-i people]3406-my people , [the Arabs]2021-the arabs , came down upon [them]2018-the barbarians from the south , and took [[their]2018-the barbarians from the south women]2022-their women to [wife]2023-wife , and the race of [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger that is now is [a bastard brood of [the mighty sons of [K"r]56-k"r]4013-the mighty sons of k"r]4012-a bastard brood of the mighty sons of k"r , and behold it dwelleth in [the tombs]1514-the tombs with [its fathers]4015-its fathers ' bones . But [I]218-ama - hagger know not : who can know ? [My]218-ama - hagger arts can not pierce so far into the blackness of Time 's night . [A great people]3740-a great people were [they]3740-a great people . [They]3740-a great people conquered till [none]1126-none were left to conquer , and then [they]3740-a great people dwelt at ease within [[their]3740-a great people rocky mountain walls]4018-their rocky mountain walls , with [[their]3740-a great people man servants]4019-their man servants and [[their]3740-a great people maid servants]4020-their maid servants , [[their]3740-a great people minstrels]4021-their minstrels , [[their]3740-a great people sculptors]4022-their sculptors , and [[their]3740-a great people concubines]4023-their concubines , and traded and quarrelled , and ate and hunted and slept and made merry till [their]3740-a great people time came . But come , [I]218-ama - hagger will show [thee]4024-thee the great pit beneath [the cave]936-the cave whereof the writing speaks . Never shall thine eyes witness such another sight . "[218-ama - hagger]

The name of the race [Ama - hagger]218-ama - hagger would seem to indicate a curious mingling of races such as might easily have occurred in [the neighbourhood of [the Zambesi]73-the zambesi]2024-the neighbourhood of the zambesi . The prefix " Ama "[218-ama - hagger] is common to [the Zulu and kindred races]2025-the zulu and kindred races , and signifies " [people]454-people , "[218-ama - hagger] while " [hagger]4027-hagger "[218-ama - hagger] is an Arabic word meaning a stone . - Editor .

Accordingly [I]0-i followed [her]2026-she to [a side passage opening out of [the main cave]2028-the main cave]2027-a side passage opening out of the main cave , then down [a great number of steps]2029-a great number of steps , and along an underground shaft which can not have been less than sixty feet beneath [the surface of the rock]2030-the surface of the rock , and was ventilated by curious borings that ran upward , [I]0-i know not where . Suddenly [the passage]1645-the passage ended , and [she]2026-she halted and bade [the mutes]1948-the mutes hold up the lamps , and , as [she]2026-she had prophesied , [I]0-i saw a scene such as [I]0-i was not likely to see again . [We]2033-we were standing in [an enormous pit , or rather on the brink of [it]2034-an enormous pit , or rather on the brink of it]2034-an enormous pit , or rather on the brink of it , for [it]2034-an enormous pit , or rather on the brink of it went down deeper - [I]0-i do not know how much - than the level on which [we]2033-we stood , and was edged in with [a low wall of rock]2035-a low wall of rock . So far as [I]0-i could judge , [this pit]2036-this pit was about the size of [the space beneath [the dome of [St. Paul]74-st. paul 's in [London]19-london]2038-the dome of st. paul 's in london]2037-the space beneath the dome of st. paul 's in london , and when the lamps were held up [I]0-i saw that [it]2036-this pit was nothing but [one vast charnel - house]2039-one vast charnel - house , being literally full of thousands of human skeletons , which lay piled up in an enormous gleaming pyramid , formed by the slipping down of the bodies at the apex as fresh ones were dropped in from above . Anything more appalling than this jumbled mass of the remains of [a departed race]2040-a departed race [I]0-i can not imagine , and what made it even more dreadful was that in this dry air a considerable number of the bodies had simply become desiccated with the skin still on [them]2041-them , and now , fixed in every conceivable position , stared at [us]2033-we out of the mountain of white bones , grotesquely horrible caricatures of humanity . In [my]0-i astonishment [I]0-i uttered an ejaculation , and the echoes of [my]0-i voice , ringing in [the vaulted space]2042-the vaulted space , disturbed a skull that had been accurately balanced for many thousands of years near the apex of the pile . Down it came with a run , bounding along merrily towards [us]2033-we , and of course bringing an avalanche of other bones after it , till at last the whole pit rattled with their movement , even as though the skeletons were getting up to greet [us]2033-we .

" Come , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i have seen enough . These are the bodies of [those who died of the great sickness]4028-those who died of the great sickness , is it not so ? "[0-i] [I]0-i added , as [we]2033-we turned away .

" Yea . [The people of [K"r]56-k"r]4011-the people of k"r[2043-their] ever embalmed [their]2043-their dead , as did [the Egyptians]3767-the egyptians , but [their]2043-their art was greater than the art of [the Egyptians]3767-the egyptians , for , whereas [the Egyptians]3767-the egyptians disembowelled and drew the brain , [the people of [K"r]56-k"r]4011-the people of k"r injected fluid into the veins , and thus reached every part . But stay , [thou]4031-thou shalt see , "[2047-she] and [she]2047-she halted at haphazard at one of the little doorways opening out of the passage along which [we]2033-we were walking , and motioned to [the mutes]1948-the mutes to light [us]2033-we in . [We]2033-we entered into [a small chamber similar to [the one in which [I]0-i had slept at [our]2033-we first stopping - place]2050-the one in which i had slept at our first stopping - place]2049-a small chamber similar to the one in which i had slept at our first stopping - place , only instead of one there were two stone benches or beds in [it]2049-a small chamber similar to the one in which i had slept at our first stopping - place . On the benches lay figures covered with yellow linen , on which a fine and impalpable dust had gathered in the course of ages , but nothing like to the extent that one would have anticipated , for in these deep - hewn caves there is no material to turn to dust . About the bodies on the stone shelves and floor of [the tomb]2051-the tomb were many painted vases , but [I]0-i saw very few ornaments or weapons in any of [the vaults]2052-the vaults .

All the linen that [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger wore was taken from [the tombs]1514-the tombs , which accounted for its yellow hue . It was well washed , however , and properly rebleached , it acquired its former snowy whiteness , and was the softest and best linen [I]0-i ever saw . - L. H. H.

" Uplift the cloths , oh [Holly]109-holly , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , but when [I]0-i put out [my]0-i hand to do so [I]0-i drew it back again . It seemed like sacrilege , and , to speak the truth , [I]0-i was awed by the dread solemnity of [the place]1059-the place , and of the presences before [us]2033-we . Then , with a little laugh at [my]0-i fears , [she]114-ayesha drew them [herself]114-ayesha , only to discover other and yet finer cloths lying over the forms upon the stone bench . These also [she]114-ayesha withdrew , and then for the first time for thousands upon thousands of years did living eyes look upon the face of that chilly dead . It was [a woman]284-a woman ; [she]284-a woman might have been thirty - five years of age , or perhaps a little less , and had certainly been beautiful . Even now [her]284-a woman calm clear - cut features , marked out with delicate eyebrows and long eyelashes which threw little lines of the shadow of the lamplight upon the ivory face , were wonderfully beautiful . There , robed in white , down which [her]284-a woman blue - black hair was streaming , [she]284-a woman slept [her]284-a woman last long sleep , and on [her]284-a woman arm , its face pressed against [her]284-a woman breast , there lay [a little babe]2056-a little babe . So sweet was the sight , although so awful , that - [I]0-i confess it without shame - [I]0-i could scarcely withhold [my]0-i tears . It took [me]0-i back across the dim gulf of ages to [some happy home in [dead Imperial K"r]4033-dead imperial k"r]4032-some happy home in dead imperial k"r , where [this winsome lady girt about with beauty]4034-this winsome lady girt about with beauty had lived and died , and dying taken [her]114-ayesha last - born with [her]114-ayesha to [the tomb]2051-the tomb . There [they]4036-they were before [us]4037-us , [mother]332-mother and [babe]4039-babe , the white memories of a forgotten human history speaking more eloquently to the heart than could any written record of [their]4036-they lives . Reverently [I]2057-we replaced the grave - cloths , and , with a sigh that flowers so fair should , in the purpose of the Everlasting , have only bloomed to be gathered to the grave , [I]2057-we turned to the body on the opposite shelf , and gently unveiled it . It was that of [a man in advanced life , with a long grizzled beard , and also robed in white]4040-a man in advanced life , with a long grizzled beard , and also robed in white , probably [the husband of [the lady]1072-the lady , who , after surviving [her]1072-the lady many years , came at [the last to sleep once more for good and all]4043-the last to sleep once more for good and all beside [her]1072-the lady]4041-the husband of the lady , who , after surviving her many years , came at the last to sleep once more for good and all beside her .[2057-we]

[We]2057-we left [the place]1059-the place and entered [others]309-others . It would be too long to describe the many things [I]0-i saw in [them]309-others . [Each one]2060-each one had [its occupants]2061-its occupants , for the five hundred and odd years that had elapsed between the completion of [the cave]936-the cave and the destruction of the race had evidently sufficed to fill [these catacombs]2063-these catacombs , numberless as they were , and all appeared to have been undisturbed since the day when [they]309-others were placed [there]3168-there . [I]0-i could fill a book with the description of [them]309-others , but to do so would only be to repeat what [I]0-i have said , with variations .

Nearly all the bodies , so masterfully was the art with which [they]309-others had been treated , were as perfect as on the day of death thousands of years before . Nothing came to injure [them]309-others in the deep silence of the living rock : [they]309-others were beyond the reach of heat and cold and damp , and the aromatic drugs with which [they]309-others had been saturated were evidently practically everlasting in their effect . Here and there , however , [we]2057-we saw an exception , and in these cases , although the flesh looked sound enough externally , if one touched it it fell in , and revealed the fact that [the figure]2065-the figure was but a pile of dust . This arose , [Ayesha]114-ayesha told [me]0-i , from these particular bodies having , either owing to haste in the burial or other causes , been soaked in the preservative , instead of its being injected into the substance of the flesh .

[Ayesha]114-ayesha afterwards showed [me]0-i the tree from the leaves of which this ancient preservative was manufactured . It is a low bush - like tree , that to this day grows in wonderful plenty upon [the sides of [the mountains]3433-the mountains]2066-the sides of the mountains , or rather upon the slopes leading up to the rocky walls . The leaves are long and narrow , a vivid green in colour , but turning a bright red in the autumn , and not unlike those of a laurel in general appearance . They have little smell when green , but if boiled the aromatic odour from them is so strong that one can hardly bear it . The best mixture , however , was made from the roots , and among [the people of [K"r]56-k"r]4011-the people of k"r there was a law , which [Ayesha]114-ayesha showed [me]4011-the people of k"r alluded to on some of the inscriptions , to the effect that on pain of heavy penalties [no one under a certain rank]4045-no one under a certain rank was to be embalmed with the drugs prepared from the roots . The object and effect of this was , of course , to preserve the trees from extermination . The sale of the leaves and roots was a Government monopoly , and from it [the Kings of [K"r]56-k"r]4046-the kings of k"r[4011-the people of k"r] derived a large proportion of [their]2068-their private revenue . - L. H. H.

About [the last tomb [we]2057-we visited]2069-the last tomb we visited [I]0-i must , however , say one word , for [its]2069-the last tomb we visited contents spoke even more eloquently to the human sympathies than those of the first . [It]2069-the last tomb we visited had but [two occupants]2070-two occupants , and [they]2070-two occupants lay together on a single shelf . [I]0-i withdrew the grave - cloths and there , clasped heart to heart , were [a young man]2071-a young man and [a blooming girl]2072-a blooming girl . [Her]2072-a blooming girl head rested on [his]2071-a young man arm , and [his]2071-a young man lips were pressed against [her]2072-a blooming girl brow . [I]0-i opened [the man]271-the man 's linen robe , and there over [his]271-the man heart was a dagger - wound , and beneath [the woman]3243-the woman 's fair breast was a like cruel stab , through which [her]3243-the woman life had ebbed away . On the rock above was an inscription in three words . [Ayesha]114-ayesha translated it . It was " Wedded in Death . "[114-ayesha]

What was the life - story of these two , who , of a truth , were beautiful in [their]2070-two occupants lives , and in [their]2070-two occupants death were not divided ?

[I]0-i closed [my]0-i eyelids , and imagination , taking up the thread of thought , shot its swift shuttle back across the ages , weaving a picture on [their]2070-two occupants blackness so real and vivid in its details that [I]0-i could almost for a moment think that [I]0-i had triumphed o'er [the Past]75-the past , and that [my]0-i spirit 's eyes had pierced the mystery of Time .

[I]0-i seemed to see [this fair girl]2075-this fair girl form - the yellow hair streaming down [her]2075-this fair girl , glittering against [her]2075-this fair girl garments snowy white , and the bosom that was whiter than the robes , even dimming with its lustre [her]2075-this fair girl ornaments of burnished gold . [I]0-i seemed to see [the great cave filled with [warriors]2077-warriors , bearded and clad in mail , and , on the lighted daïs where [Ayesha]114-ayesha had given judgment]2076-the great cave filled with warriors , bearded and clad in mail , and , on the lighted daïs where ayesha had given judgment , [a man standing , robed , and surrounded by the symbols of [[his]2078-a man standing , robed , and surrounded by the symbols of his priestly office priestly office]2079-his priestly office]2078-a man standing , robed , and surrounded by the symbols of his priestly office . And up [the cave]936-the cave there came one clad in purple , and before [him]2078-a man standing , robed , and surrounded by the symbols of his priestly office and behind [him]2078-a man standing , robed , and surrounded by the symbols of his priestly office came [minstrels]2081-minstrels and [fair maidens , chanting a wedding song]2082-fair maidens , chanting a wedding song . [White]219-white stood [the maid]2083-the maid against the altar , fairer than the fairest there - purer than a lily , and more cold than the dew that glistens in its heart . But as [the man]271-the man drew near [she]2083-the maid shuddered . Then out of the press and throng there sprang [a dark - haired youth]2085-a dark - haired youth , and put [his]2085-a dark - haired youth arms about [this long - forgotten maid]2086-this long - forgotten maid , and kissed [her]2083-the maid pale face in which the blood shot up like lights of the red dawn across the silent sky . And next there was turmoil and uproar , and a flashing of swords , and [they]2087-they tore [the youth]3828-the youth from [her]2083-the maid arms , and stabbed [him]3828-the youth , but with a cry [she]2083-the maid snatched the dagger from [his]3828-the youth belt , and drove it into [her]2083-the maid snowy breast , home to the heart , and down [she]2083-the maid fell , and then , with cries and wailing , and every sound of lamentation , the pageant rolled away from the arena of [my]0-i vision , and once more the past shut to its book .

Let [him]271-the man who reads forgive the intrusion of a dream into a history of fact . But it came so home to [me]0-i - [I]0-i saw it all so clear in a moment , as it were ; and , besides , who shall say what proportion of fact , past , present , or to come , may lie in the imagination ? What is imagination ? Perhaps it is the shadow of the intangible truth , perhaps it is the soul 's thought .

In an instant the whole thing had passed through [my]0-i brain , and [She]2083-the maid was addressing [me]0-i .

" Behold [the lot of [man]3189-man]4047-the lot of man , "[2083-the maid] said [the veiled Ayesha]2089-the veiled ayesha , as [she]2083-the maid drew the winding sheets back over [the dead lovers]2090-the dead lovers , speaking in a solemn , thrilling voice , which accorded well with the dream that [I]0-i had dreamed : " to [the tomb]2051-the tomb , and to the forgetfulness that hides [the tomb]2051-the tomb , must [we]4051-we all come at last ! Ay , even [I]2083-the maid who live so long . Even for [me]2083-the maid , oh [Holly]109-holly , thousands upon thousands of years hence ; thousands of years after [you]109-holly hast gone through the gate and been lost in the mists , a day will dawn whereon [I]2083-the maid shall die , and be even as [thou]4052-thou art and these are . And then what will it avail that [I]2083-the maid have lived a little longer , holding off death by the knowledge that [I]2083-the maid have wrung from Nature , since at last [I]2083-the maid too must die ? What is a span of ten thousand years , or ten times ten thousand years , in the history of time ? It is as naught - it is as the mists that roll up in the sunlight ; it fleeth away like an hour of sleep or a breath of the Eternal Spirit . Behold [the lot of [man]3189-man]4047-the lot of man ! Certainly it shall overtake [us]4051-we , and [we]4051-we shall sleep . Certainly , too , [we]4051-we shall awake and live again , and again shall sleep , and so on and on , through periods , spaces , and times , from æon unto æon , till [the world]252-the world is dead , and [the worlds beyond [the world]252-the world]4056-the worlds beyond the world are dead , and naught liveth but the Spirit that is Life . But for [us]4051-we twain and for [these dead ones]4058-these dead ones shall the end of ends be Life , or shall it be Death ? As yet Death is but Life 's Night , but out of the night is the Morrow born again , and doth again beget the Night . Only when Day and Night , and Life and Death , are ended and swallowed up in that from which [they]4051-we came , what shall be [our]4051-we fate , oh [Holly]109-holly ? Who can see so far ? Not even [I]2083-the maid ! "[2083-the maid]

And then , with a sudden change of tone and manner -

" Hast [thou]4052-thou seen enough , [[my]2083-the maid stranger guest]4059-my stranger guest , or shall [I]2083-the maid show [thee]4052-thou more of the wonders of [these tombs that are [[my]2083-the maid palace halls]4061-my palace halls]4060-these tombs that are my palace halls ? If [thou]4052-thou wilt , [I]2083-the maid can lead [thee]4052-thou to where [Tisno]216-tisno , [the mightiest and most valorous King of [K"r]56-k"r]4062-the mightiest and most valorous king of k"r[2083-the maid] , in whose day [these caves]3807-these caves were ended , lies in a pomp that seems to mock at nothingness , and bid the empty shadows of the past do homage to [his]2092-his sculptured vanity ! "[2083-the maid]

" [I]0-i have seen enough , [oh Queen]3645-oh queen , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [My]0-i heart is overwhelmed by the power of the present Death . Mortality is weak , and easily broken down by a sense of the companionship that waits upon its end . Take [me]0-i hence , oh Ayesha ! "[0-i]

XVII

THE BALANCE TURNS

In a few minutes , following the lamps of [the mutes]1948-the mutes , which , held out from the body as [a bearer]2094-a bearer holds water in a vessel , had the appearance of floating down the darkness by [themselves]1948-the mutes , [we]2095-we came to a stair which led [us]2095-we to [[She]2096-i 's ante - room]2097-she 's ante - room , the same that [Billali]137-job had crept up upon on all fours on the previous day . Here [I]0-i would have bid [the Queen]1108-the queen adieu , but [she]2096-i would not .

" Nay , "[2096-i] [she]2096-i said , " enter with [me]2096-i , oh [Holly]109-holly , for of a truth [thy]2096-i conversation pleaseth [me]2096-i . Think , oh [Holly]109-holly : for two thousand years have [I]2096-i had none to converse with save [slaves]4064-slaves and [my]2096-i own thoughts , and though of all this thinking hath much wisdom come , and many secrets been made plain , yet am [I]2096-i weary of [my]2096-i thoughts , and have come to loathe [[mine]2096-i own society]4065-mine own society , for surely the food that memory gives to eat is bitter to the taste , and it is only with the teeth of hope that [we]2095-we can bear to bite it . Now , though [thy]2096-i thoughts are green and tender , as becometh one so young , yet are they those of a thinking brain , and in truth [thou]2096-i dost bring back to [my]2096-i mind certain of [those old philosophers with whom in days bygone [I]2096-i have disputed at [Athens]11-athens , and at [Becca]76-becca in [Arabia]71-arabia]4066-those old philosophers with whom in days bygone i have disputed at athens , and at becca in arabia , for [thou]2096-i hast the same crabbed air and dusty look , as though [thou]2096-i hadst passed [thy]2096-i days in reading ill - writ Greek , and been stained dark with the grime of manuscripts . So draw the curtain , and sit here by [my]2096-i side , and [we]2095-we will eat fruit , and talk of pleasant things . See , [I]2096-i will again unveil to [thee]2096-i . [Thou]2096-i hast brought it on [thyself]2096-i , oh [Holly]109-holly ; fairly have [I]2096-i warned [thee]2096-i - and [thou]2096-i shalt call [me]2096-i beautiful as [even those old philosophers]4067-even those old philosophers were wo nt to do . Fie upon [them]4067-even those old philosophers , forgetting [their]4067-even those old philosophers philosophy ! "[2096-i]

And without more ado [she]2099-her stood up and shook the white wrappings from [her]2099-her , and came forth shining and splendid like some glittering snake when [she]2099-her has cast [her]2099-her slough ; ay , and fixed [her]2099-her wonderful eyes upon [me]0-i - more deadly than any Basilisk 's - and pierced [me]0-i through and through with their beauty , and sent [her]2099-her light laugh ringing through the air like chimes of silver bells .

A new mood was on [her]2099-her , and the very colour of [her]2099-her mind seemed to change beneath it . It was no longer torture - torn and hateful , as [I]0-i had seen it when [she]2099-her was cursing [her]2099-her dead rival by the leaping flames , no longer icily terrible as in [the judgment - hall]2100-the judgment - hall , no longer rich , and sombre , and splendid , like a Tyrian cloth , as in the dwellings of the dead . No , [her]2099-her mood now was that of [Aphrodité]220-aphrodité triumphing . Life - radiant , ecstatic , wonderful - seemed to flow from [her]2099-her and around [her]2099-her . Softly [she]2099-her laughed and sighed , and swift [her]2099-her glances flew . [She]2099-her shook [her]2099-her heavy tresses , and their perfume filled [the place]1059-the place ; [she]2099-her struck [her]2099-her little sandalled foot upon the floor , and hummed a snatch of some old Greek epithalamium . All the majesty was gone , or did but lurk and faintly flicker through [her]2099-her laughing eyes , like lightning seen through sunlight . [She]2099-her had cast off the terror of the leaping flame , the cold power of judgment that was even now being done , and the wise sadness of [the tombs]1514-the tombs - cast them off and put them behind [her]2099-her , like the white shroud [she]2099-her wore , and now stood out the incarnation of lovely tempting womanhood , made more perfect - and in a way more spiritual - than [ever woman]2103-ever woman was before .

" So , [[my]0-i [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , sit there where [thou]4069-thou canst see [me]0-i . It is by [thine]4069-thou own wish , remember - again [I]0-i say , blame [me]0-i not if [thou]4069-thou dost wear away [thy]4069-thou little span with such a sick pain at the heart that [thou]4069-thou wouldst fain have died before ever [thy]4069-thou curious eyes were set upon [me]0-i . There , sit so , and tell [me]0-i , for in truth [I]0-i am inclined for praises - tell [me]0-i , am [I]0-i not beautiful ? Nay , speak not so hastily ; consider well the point ; take [me]0-i feature by feature , forgetting not [my]0-i form , and [my]0-i hands and feet , and [my]0-i hair , and the whiteness of [my]0-i skin , and then tell [me]0-i truly , hast [thou]4069-thou ever known [a woman who in aught , ay , in one little portion of [her]4070-a woman who in aught , ay , in one little portion of her beauty , in the curve of an eyelash even , or the modelling of a shell - like ear , is justified to hold a light before my loveliness beauty , in the curve of an eyelash even , or the modelling of a shell - like ear , is justified to hold a light before [my]0-i loveliness]4070-a woman who in aught , ay , in one little portion of her beauty , in the curve of an eyelash even , or the modelling of a shell - like ear , is justified to hold a light before my loveliness ? Now , [my]0-i waist ! Perchance [thou]4069-thou thinkest it too large , but of a truth it is not so ; it is this golden snake that is too large , and doth not bind it as it should . It is a wide snake , and knoweth that it is ill to tie in the waist . But see , give [me]0-i [thy]4069-thou hands - so - now press them round [me]0-i , and there , with but a little force , [thy]4069-thou fingers touch , oh [Holly]109-holly . "[0-i]

[I]0-i could bear it no longer . [I]0-i am but [a man]352-a man , and [she]2105-she was more than [a woman]284-a woman . [Heaven]212-heaven knows what [she]2105-she was - [I]0-i do not ! But then and there [I]0-i fell upon [my]0-i knees before [her]2105-she , and told [her]2105-she in a sad mixture of languages - for such moments confuse the thoughts - that [I]0-i worshipped [her]2105-she as [never woman]2107-never woman was worshipped , and that [I]0-i would give [my]0-i immortal soul to marry [her]2105-she , which at that time [I]0-i certainly would have done , and so , indeed , would [any other man]2108-any other man , or all the race of [men]516-men rolled into one . For a moment [she]2105-she looked surprised , and then [she]2105-she began to laugh , and clap [her]2105-she hands in glee .

" Oh , so soon , oh [Holly]109-holly ! "[2105-she] [she]2105-she said . " [I]2105-she wondered how many minutes it would need to bring [thee]109-holly to [thy]109-holly knees . [I]2105-she have not seen [a man]352-a man kneel before [me]2105-she for so many days , and , believe [me]2105-she , to [a woman]284-a woman 's heart the sight is sweet , ay , wisdom and length of days take not from that dear pleasure which is [our]4073-our sex 's only right .[2105-she]

" What wouldst [thou]109-holly ? - what wouldst [thou]109-holly ? [Thou]109-holly dost not know what [thou]109-holly doest . Have [I]2110-i not told [thee]2105-she that [I]2110-i am not for [thee]2105-she ? [I]2110-i love but [one]328-one , and [thou]109-holly art not [the man]271-the man . Ah [Holly]109-holly , for all [thy]2105-she wisdom - and in a way [thou]109-holly art wise - [thou]109-holly art but [a fool running after folly]4076-a fool running after folly . [Thou]109-holly wouldst look into [mine]109-holly eyes - [thou]109-holly wouldst kiss [me]2110-i ! Well , if it pleaseth [thee]0-i , look , "[2110-i] and [she]2110-i bent [herself]2110-i towards [me]0-i , and fixed [her]2110-i dark and thrilling orbs upon [my]0-i own ; " ay , and kiss too , if [thou]109-holly wilt , for , thanks be given to the scheme of things , kisses leave no marks , except upon the heart . But if [thou]109-holly dost kiss , [I]2110-i tell [thee]109-holly of a surety wilt [thou]109-holly eat out [thy]109-holly breast with love of [me]2110-i , and die ! "[2110-i] and [she]2110-i bent yet further towards [me]0-i till [her]2110-i soft hair brushed [my]0-i brow , and [her]2110-i fragrant breath played upon [my]0-i face , and made [me]0-i faint and weak . Then of a sudden , even as [I]0-i stretched out [my]0-i hands to clasp , [she]2110-i straightened [herself]2110-i , and a quick change passed over [her]2110-i . Reaching out [her]2110-i hand , [she]2110-i held it over [my]0-i head , and it seemed to [me]0-i that something flowed from it that chilled [me]0-i back to common sense , and a knowledge of propriety and the domestic virtues .

" Enough of this wanton folly , "[2110-i] [she]2110-i said with a touch of sternness . " Listen , [Holly]109-holly . [Thou]0-i art [a good and honest man]4077-a good and honest man , and [I]2110-i fain would spare [thee]2110-i ; but , oh ! it is so hard for [woman]3858-woman to be merciful . [I]2110-i have said [I]2110-i am not for [thee]2110-i , therefore let [thy]2110-i thoughts pass by [me]2110-i like an idle wind , and the dust of [thy]2110-i imagination sink again into the depths - well , of despair , if [thou]2110-i wilt . [Thou]2110-i dost not know [me]2110-i , [Holly]109-holly . Hadst [thou]2110-i seen [me]2110-i but ten hours past when [my]2110-i passion seized [me]2110-i , [thou]2110-i hadst shrunk from [me]2110-i in fear and trembling . [I]2110-i am of many moods , and , like the water in [that vessel]4079-that vessel , [I]2110-i reflect many things ; but they pass , [my]2110-i [Holly]109-holly ; they pass , and are forgotten . Only the water is the water still , and [I]2110-i still am [I]2110-i , and that which maketh the water maketh it , and that which maketh [me]2110-i maketh [me]2110-i , nor can [my]2110-i quality be altered . Therefore , pay no heed to what [I]2110-i seem , seeing that [thou]2110-i canst not know what [I]2110-i am . If [thou]2110-i troublest [me]2110-i again [I]2110-i will veil [myself]2110-i , and [thou]2110-i shalt behold [my]2110-i face no more . "[2110-i]

[I]0-i rose , and sank on the cushioned couch beside [her]2111-her , yet quivering with emotion , though for a moment [my]0-i mad passion had left [me]0-i , as the leaves of a tree quiver still , although the gust be gone that stirred them . [I]0-i did not dare to tell [her]2111-her that [I]0-i had seen [her]2111-her in that deep and hellish mood , muttering incantations to the fire in [the tomb]2051-the tomb .

" So , "[2111-her] [she]2111-her went on , " now eat some fruit ; believe [me]2111-her , it is the only true food for [man]3189-man . Oh , tell [me]2111-her of the philosophy of [that Hebrew Messiah , who came after [me]2111-her , and who [thou]2110-i sayest doth now rule [Rome]12-rome , and [Greece]18-greece]204-messiah , and [Egypt]8-egypt , and [the barbarians beyond]4081-the barbarians beyond . It must have been a strange philosophy that [He]204-messiah taught , for in [my]2111-her day [the peoples]4082-the peoples would have naught of [our]2114-our philosophies . Revel and lust and drink , blood and cold steel , and the shock of [men gathered in the battle]4083-men gathered in the battle - these were the canons of [their]4083-men gathered in the battle creeds . "[2111-her]

[I]0-i had recovered [myself]0-i a little by now , and , feeling bitterly ashamed of the weakness into which [I]0-i had been betrayed , [I]0-i did [my]0-i best to expound to [her]2113-her the doctrines of Christianity , to which , however , with the single exception of [our]2114-our conception of Heaven and Hell , [I]0-i found that [she]2113-her paid but scant attention , [her]2113-her interest being all directed towards [the Man who taught [them]2116-them]2115-the man who taught them . Also [I]0-i told [her]2113-her that among [[her]2113-her own people]2117-her own people , [the Arabs]2021-the arabs , [another prophet]2119-another prophet , [one Mohammed]2120-one mohammed , had arisen and preached a new faith , to which [many millions of [mankind]985-mankind]2121-many millions of mankind now adhered .

" Ah ! "[2113-her] [she]2113-her said ; " [I]2113-her see - two new religions ! [I]2113-her have known so many , and doubtless there have been many more since [I]2113-her knew aught beyond [these caves of [K"r]56-k"r]4084-these caves of k"r[2113-her] . [Mankind]985-mankind asks ever of the skies to vision out what lies behind [them]2124-them . It is terror for the end , and but a subtler form of selfishness - this it is that breeds religions . [Mark]213-mark tapley , [[my]0-i Holly]3913-my holly , each religion claims the future for [its followers]2126-its followers ; or , at least , the good thereof . The evil is for [those benighted ones who will have none of it]2127-those benighted ones who will have none of it ; seeing the light [the true believers]2128-the true believers worship , as the fishes see the stars , but dimly . The religions come and the religions pass , and the civilisations come and pass , and naught endures but [the world]252-the world and human nature . Ah ! if [man]3189-man would but see that hope is from within and not from without - that [he]3189-man [himself]3189-man must work out [his]3189-man own salvation ! [He]3189-man is there , and within [him]3189-man is the breath of life and a knowledge of good and evil as good and evil is to [him]3189-man . Thereon let [him]3189-man build and stand erect , and not cast [himself]3189-man before the image of [some unknown God]2131-some unknown god , modelled like [his]3189-man poor self , but with a bigger brain to think the evil thing , and a longer arm to do it . "[0-i]

[I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , which shows how old such reasoning is , being , indeed , one of the recurring qualities of theological discussion , that [her]3913-my holly argument sounded very like some that [I]0-i have heard in the nineteenth century , and in other places than [the caves of [K"r]56-k"r]4085-the caves of k"r , and with which , by the way , [I]2132-i totally disagree , but [I]2132-i did not care to try and discuss the question with [her]3913-my holly . To begin with , [my]2132-i mind was too weary with all the emotions through which [I]2132-i had passed , and , in the second place , [I]2132-i knew that [I]2132-i should get the worst of it . It is weary work enough to argue with [an ordinary materialist]4086-an ordinary materialist , who hurls statistics and whole strata of geological facts at [your]4087-your head , whilst [you]4087-your can only buffet [him]3189-man with deductions and instincts and the snowflakes of faith , that are , alas ! so apt to melt in the hot embers of [our]4088-our troubles . How little chance , then , should [I]2132-i have against [one whose brain was supernaturally sharpened]4089-one whose brain was supernaturally sharpened , and who had two thousand years of experience , besides all manner of knowledge of the secrets of Nature at [her]3913-my holly command ! Feeling that [she]3913-my holly would be more likely to convert [me]2132-i than [I]2132-i should to convert [her]3913-my holly , [I]2132-i thought it best to leave the matter alone , and so sat silent . Many a time since then have [I]2132-i bitterly regretted that [I]2132-i did so , for thereby [I]2132-i lost the only opportunity [I]2132-i can remember having had of ascertaining what [Ayesha]114-ayesha really believed , and what [her]114-ayesha "[2132-i] philosophy " was .[3913-my holly]

" Well , [[my]2132-i [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , "[2132-i] [she]2132-i continued , " and so [those people of [mine]2132-i]4091-those people of mine have found [a prophet]4092-a prophet , [a false prophet]4093-a false prophet [thou]4094-thou sayest , for [he]4092-a prophet is not thine own , and , indeed , [I]2132-i doubt it not . Yet in [my]2132-i day was it otherwise , for then [we]4095-we Arabs had many gods . Allât there was , and [Saba]221-saba , [the Host of [Heaven]212-heaven]77-the host of heaven , [Al Uzza]79-al uzza , and [Manah the stony one , for whom the blood of victims]4096-manah the stony one , for whom the blood of victims flowed , and [Wadd and Sawâ]222-wadd and sawâ , and Yagh - th the Lion of [the dwellers in [Yaman]62-yaman]4097-the dwellers in yaman , and [Yä]223-yä - k [the Horse of [Morad]81-morad]80-the horse of morad , and [Nasr the Eagle of [Hamyar]63-hamyar]82-nasr the eagle of hamyar ; ay , and many more . Oh , the folly of it all , the shame and the pitiful folly ! Yet when [I]2132-i rose in wisdom and spoke thereof , surely [they]4098-they would have slain [me]2132-i in the name of [[their]4098-they outraged gods]4099-their outraged gods . Well , so hath it ever been ; - but , [[my]2132-i [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , art [thou]4101-thou weary of [me]2132-i already , that [thou]4101-thou dost sit so silent ? Or dost [thou]4101-thou fear lest [I]2132-i should teach [thee]4101-thou [my]2132-i philosophy ? - for know [I]2132-i have a philosophy . What would [a teacher]4102-a teacher be without [her]4102-a teacher own philosophy ? and if [thou]4101-thou dost vex [me]2132-i overmuch beware ! for [I]2132-i will have [thee]4101-thou learn it , and [thou]4101-thou shalt be [[my]2132-i disciple]4103-my disciple , and [we]4104-we twain will found a faith that shall swallow up all others . [Faithless man]4105-faithless man ! And but half an hour since [thou]4101-thou wast upon [thy]4101-thou knees - the posture does not suit [thee]4101-thou , [Holly]109-holly - swearing that [thou]4101-thou didst love [me]2132-i . What shall [we]4104-we do ? - Nay , [I]2132-i have it . [I]2132-i will come and see [this youth]3825-this youth , the Lion , as [the old man Billali]4107-the old man billali calls [him]3825-this youth , who came with [thee]4101-thou , and who is so sick . The fever must have run its course by now , and if [he]3825-this youth is about to die [I]2132-i will recover [him]3825-this youth . Fear not , [[my]2132-i [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , [I]2132-i shall use no magic . Have [I]2132-i not told [thee]109-holly that there is no such thing as magic , though there is such a thing as understanding and applying the forces which are in Nature ? Go now , and presently , when [I]2132-i have made the drug ready , [I]2132-i will follow [thee]109-holly . "[2132-i]

[Ayesha]114-ayesha was [a great chemist]2133-a great chemist , indeed chemistry appears to have been [her]114-ayesha only amusement and occupation . [She]114-ayesha had [one of [the caves]3307-the caves]2134-one of the caves fitted up as [a laboratory]2136-a laboratory , and , although [her]114-ayesha appliances were necessarily rude , the results that [she]114-ayesha attained were , as will become clear in the course of this narrative , sufficiently surprising . - L. H. H.

Accordingly [I]0-i went , only to find [Job]137-job and [Ustane]172-ustane in a great state of grief , declaring that [Leo]183-leo was in the throes of death , and that [they]2137-they had been searching for [me]0-i everywhere . [I]0-i rushed to the couch , and glanced at [him]183-leo : clearly [he]183-leo was dying . [He]183-leo was senseless , and breathing heavily , but [his]183-leo lips were quivering , and every now and again a little shudder ran down [his]183-leo frame . [I]0-i knew enough of doctoring to see that in another hour [he]183-leo would be beyond the reach of earthly help - perhaps in another five minutes . How [I]0-i cursed [my]0-i selfishness and the folly that had kept [me]0-i lingering by [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's side while [[my]0-i dear boy]2138-my dear boy lay dying ! Alas and alas ! how easily the best of [us]2139-us are lighted down to evil by the gleam of [a woman]284-a woman 's eyes ! What [a wicked wretch]2141-a wicked wretch was [I]0-i ! Actually , for the last half - hour [I]0-i had scarcely thought of [Leo]183-leo , and this , be it remembered , of [the man who for twenty years had been [my]0-i dearest companion]2142-the man who for twenty years had been my dearest companion , and the chief interest of [my]0-i existence . And now , perhaps , it was too late !

[I]0-i wrung [my]0-i hands , and glanced round . [Ustane]172-ustane was sitting by the couch , and in [her]172-ustane eyes burnt the dull light of despair . [Job]137-job was blubbering - [I]0-i am sorry [I]0-i can not name [his]137-job distress by any more delicate word - audibly in the corner . Seeing [my]0-i eye fixed upon [him]137-job , [he]137-job went [outside]2143-outside to give way to [his]137-job grief in [the passage]1645-the passage . Obviously the only hope lay in [Ayesha]114-ayesha . [She]114-ayesha , and [she]114-ayesha alone - unless , indeed , [she]114-ayesha was [an imposter]2145-an imposter , which [I]0-i could not believe - could save [him]137-job . [I]0-i would go and implore [her]114-ayesha to come . As [I]0-i started to do so , however , [Job]137-job came flying into [the room]449-the room , [his]137-job hair literally standing on end with terror .

" Oh , [God]134-god help [us]4109-us , [sir]3126-sir ! "[137-job] [he]137-job ejaculated in a frightened whisper , " here 's a corpse a - coming sliding down [the passage]1645-the passage ! "[137-job]

For a moment [I]0-i was puzzled , but presently , of course , it struck [me]0-i that [he]137-job must have seen [Ayesha]114-ayesha , wrapped in [her]114-ayesha grave - like garment , and been deceived by the extraordinary undulating smoothness of [her]114-ayesha walk into a belief that [she]114-ayesha was a white ghost gliding towards [him]137-job . Indeed , at that very moment the question was settled , for [Ayesha]114-ayesha [herself]114-ayesha was in [the apartment]1614-the apartment , or rather cave . [Job]137-job turned , and saw [her]114-ayesha sheeted form , and then , with a convulsive howl of " Here it comes ! "[137-job] sprang into a corner , and jammed [his]137-job face against the wall , and [Ustane]172-ustane , guessing whose the dread presence must be , prostrated [herself]172-ustane upon [her]172-ustane face .

" [Thou]4112-thou comest in a good time , [Ayesha]114-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " for [[my]0-i boy]3095-my boy lies at the point of death . "[0-i]

" So , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said softly ; " provided [he]3095-my boy be not dead , it is no matter , for [I]114-ayesha can bring [him]3095-my boy back to life , [[my]114-ayesha Holly]3913-my holly . Is [that man]3474-that man there [[thy]114-ayesha servant]3677-thy servant , and is that the method wherewith [[thy]114-ayesha servants]4117-thy servants greet [strangers]3229-strangers in [[thy]114-ayesha country]4119-thy country ? "[114-ayesha]

" [He]3095-my boy is frightened of [thy]114-ayesha garb - it hath a death - like air , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

[She]114-ayesha laughed .

" And [the girl]3559-the girl ? Ah , [I]114-ayesha see now . It is [she]3559-the girl of whom [thou]4121-thou didst speak to [me]114-ayesha . Well , bid [them]4122-them both to leave [us]4123-us , and [we]4123-us will see to [this sick Lion of thine]4124-this sick lion of thine . [I]114-ayesha love not that [underlings]4125-underlings should perceive [my]114-ayesha wisdom . "[114-ayesha]

Thereon [I]0-i told [Ustane]172-ustane in [Arabic]142-arabic and [Job]137-job in English both to leave [the room]449-the room ; an order which [the latter]2149-the latter obeyed readily enough , and was glad to obey , for [he]2149-the latter could not in any way subdue [his]2149-the latter fear . But it was otherwise with [Ustane]172-ustane .

" What does [She]2150-she want ? "[2150-she] [she]2150-she whispered , divided between [her]2150-she fear of [the terrible Queen]2151-the terrible queen and [her]2150-she anxiety to remain near [Leo]183-leo . " It is surely the right of [a wife]4126-a wife to be near [[her]4126-a wife husband]3271-her husband when [he]3271-her husband dieth . Nay , [I]2150-she will not go , [[my]2150-she lord]4128-my lord [the Baboon]3497-the baboon . "[2150-she]

" Why doth not [that woman]3450-that woman leave [us]4131-us , [[my]114-ayesha Holly]3913-my holly ? "[114-ayesha] asked [Ayesha]114-ayesha from the other end of [the cave]936-the cave , where [she]114-ayesha was engaged in carelessly examining some of the sculptures on the wall .

" [She]3450-that woman is not willing to leave [Leo]183-leo , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , not knowing what to say . [Ayesha]114-ayesha wheeled round , and , pointing to [the girl Ustane]1278-the girl ustane , said one word , and one only , but it was quite enough , for the tone in which it was said meant volumes .

" Go ! "[114-ayesha]

And then [Ustane]172-ustane crept past [her]114-ayesha on [her]172-ustane hands and knees , and went .

" [Thou]4133-thou seest , [[my]114-ayesha [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , with a little laugh , " it was needful that [I]114-ayesha should give [these people]902-these people a lesson in obedience . [That girl]4136-that girl went nigh to disobeying [me]114-ayesha , but then [she]4136-that girl did not learn this morn how [I]114-ayesha treat [the disobedient]4137-the disobedient . Well , [she]114-ayesha has gone ; and now let [me]114-ayesha see [the youth]3828-the youth , "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha glided towards the couch on which [Leo]183-leo lay , with [his]183-leo face in the shadow and turned towards the wall .

" [He]183-leo hath a noble shape , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , as [she]114-ayesha bent over [him]183-leo to look upon [his]183-leo face .

Next second [her]114-ayesha tall and willowy form was staggering back across [the room]449-the room , as though [she]114-ayesha had been shot or stabbed , staggering back till at last [she]114-ayesha struck [the cavern wall]2155-the cavern wall , and then there burst from [her]114-ayesha lips the most awful and unearthly scream that [I]0-i ever heard in all [my]0-i life .

" What is it , [Ayesha]114-ayesha ? "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " Is [he]183-leo dead ? "[0-i]

[She]114-ayesha turned , and sprang towards [me]0-i like a tigress .

" [Thou]0-i dog ! "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , in [her]114-ayesha terrible whisper , which sounded like the hiss of a snake , " why didst [thou]0-i hide this from [me]114-ayesha ? "[114-ayesha] And [she]114-ayesha stretched out [her]114-ayesha arm , and [I]0-i thought that [she]114-ayesha was about to slay [me]0-i .

" What ? "[0-i] [I]0-i ejaculated , in the most lively terror ; " what ? "[0-i]

" Ah ! "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , " perchance [thou]0-i didst not know . Learn , [[my]114-ayesha Holly]3913-my holly , learn : there lies - there lies [my]114-ayesha lost [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , who has come back to [me]114-ayesha at last , as [I]114-ayesha knew [he]118-kallikrates would , as [I]114-ayesha knew [he]118-kallikrates would ; "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha began to sob and to laugh , and generally to conduct [herself]114-ayesha like [any other lady who is a little upset , murmuring " [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates]4140-any other lady who is a little upset , murmuring " kallikrates , kallikrates ! "[114-ayesha]

" Nonsense , "[0-i] thought [I]0-i to [myself]0-i , but [I]0-i did not like to say it ; and , indeed , at that moment [I]0-i was thinking of [Leo]183-leo 's life , having forgotten everything else in that terrible anxiety . What [I]0-i feared now was that [he]183-leo should die while [she]114-ayesha was " carrying on . "[114-ayesha]

" Unless [thou]4141-thou art able to help [him]183-leo , [Ayesha]114-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i put in , by way of a reminder , " [[thy]4141-thou [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates]4142-thy kallikrates will soon be far beyond [thy]4141-thou calling . Surely [he]183-leo dieth even now . "[0-i]

" True , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , with a start . " Oh , why did [I]114-ayesha not come before ! [I]114-ayesha am unnerved - [my]114-ayesha hand trembles , even [mine]114-ayesha - and yet it is very easy . Here , [thou]4141-thou [Holly]109-holly , take this phial , "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha produced a tiny jar of pottery from the folds of [her]114-ayesha garment , " and pour the liquid in it down [his]183-leo throat . It will cure [him]183-leo if [he]183-leo be not dead . Swift , now ! Swift ! [The man]271-the man dies ! "[114-ayesha]

[I]0-i glanced towards [him]2156-him ; it was true enough , [Leo]183-leo was in [his]183-leo death - struggle . [I]0-i saw [his]183-leo poor face turning ashen , and heard the breath begin to rattle in [his]183-leo throat . The phial was stoppered with a little piece of wood . [I]0-i drew it with [my]0-i teeth , and a drop of the fluid within flew out upon [my]0-i tongue . It had a sweet flavour , and for a second made [my]0-i head swim , and a mist gather before [my]0-i eyes , but happily the effect passed away as swiftly as it had arisen .

When [I]0-i reached [Leo]183-leo 's side [he]183-leo was plainly expiring - [his]183-leo golden head was slowly turning from side to side , and [his]183-leo mouth was slightly open . [I]0-i called to [Ayesha]114-ayesha to hold [his]183-leo head , and this [she]114-ayesha managed to do , though [the woman]3243-the woman was quivering from head to foot , like an aspen - leaf or a startled horse . Then , forcing the jaw a little more open , [I]0-i poured the contents of the phial into [his]183-leo mouth . Instantly a little vapour arose from it , as happens when one disturbs nitric acid , and this sight did not increase [my]0-i hopes , already faint enough , of the efficacy of the treatment .

One thing , however , was certain , the death throes ceased - at first [I]0-i thought because [he]183-leo had got beyond them , and crossed [the awful river]2158-the awful river . [His]183-leo face turned to a livid pallor , and [his]183-leo heart - beats , which had been feeble enough before , seemed to die away altogether - only the eyelid still twitched a little . In [my]0-i doubt [I]0-i looked up at [Ayesha]114-ayesha , whose head - wrapping had slipped back in [her]114-ayesha excitement when [she]114-ayesha went reeling across [the room]449-the room . [She]114-ayesha was still holding [Leo]183-leo 's head , and , with a face as pale as [his]183-leo own , watching [his]183-leo countenance with such an expression of agonised anxiety as [I]0-i had never seen before . Clearly [she]114-ayesha did not know if [he]183-leo would live or die . Five minutes slowly passed and [I]0-i saw that [she]114-ayesha was abandoning hope ; [her]114-ayesha lovely oval face seemed to fall in and grow visibly thinner beneath the pressure of a mental agony whose pencil drew black lines about the hollows of [her]114-ayesha eyes . The coral faded even from [her]114-ayesha lips , till they were as white as [Leo]183-leo 's face , and quivered pitifully . It was shocking to see [her]114-ayesha : even in [my]0-i own grief [I]0-i felt for [hers]114-ayesha .

" Is it too late ? "[0-i] [I]0-i gasped .

[She]114-ayesha hid [her]114-ayesha face in [her]114-ayesha hands , and made no answer , and [I]0-i too turned away . But as [I]0-i did so [I]0-i heard a deep - drawn breath , and looking down perceived a line of colour creeping up [Leo]183-leo 's face , then another and another , and then , wonder of wonders , [the man [we]2161-we had thought dead]2160-the man we had thought dead turned over on [his]183-leo side .

" [Thou]4144-thou seest , "[0-i] [I]0-i said in a whisper .

" [I]114-ayesha see , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha answered hoarsely . " [He]183-leo is saved . [I]114-ayesha thought [we]2161-we were too late - another moment - one little moment more - and [he]183-leo had been gone ! "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha burst into an awful flood of tears , sobbing as though [her]114-ayesha heart would break , and yet looking lovelier than ever as [she]114-ayesha did it . As last [she]114-ayesha ceased .

" Forgive [me]114-ayesha , [[my]114-ayesha Holly]3913-my holly - forgive [me]114-ayesha for [my]114-ayesha weakness , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said . " [Thou]4144-thou seest after all [I]114-ayesha am [a very woman]4146-a very woman . Think - now think of it ! This morning didst [thou]4144-thou speak of the place of torment appointed by [this new religion of thine]4147-this new religion of thine . Hell or Hades [thou]4144-thou didst call [it]4148-it - a place where the vital essence lives and retains an individual memory , and where all the errors and faults of judgment , and unsatisfied passions and the unsubstantial terrors of the mind wherewith it hath at any time had to do , come to mock and haunt and gibe and wring the heart for ever and for ever with the vision of its own hopelessness . Thus , even thus , have [I]114-ayesha lived for full two thousand years - for some six and sixty generations , as [ye]4149-ye reckon time - in [a Hell]4150-a hell , as [thou]4144-thou callest it - tormented by the memory of a crime , tortured day and night with an unfulfilled desire - without companionship , without comfort , without death , and led on only down [[my]114-ayesha dreary road]4151-my dreary road by the marsh lights of Hope , which , though they flickered here and there , and now glowed strong , and now were not , yet , as [my]114-ayesha skill told [me]114-ayesha , would one day lead unto [[my]114-ayesha deliverer]4152-my deliverer .[114-ayesha]

" And then - think of it still , oh [Holly]109-holly , for never shalt [thou]4144-thou hear such another tale , or see such another scene , nay , not even if [I]2162-i give [thee]4144-thou ten thousand years of life - and [thou]4144-thou shalt have it in payment if [thou]4144-thou wilt - think : at last [[my]2162-i deliverer]4152-my deliverer came - [he]4152-my deliverer for whom [I]2162-i had watched and waited through the generations - at the appointed time [he]4152-my deliverer came to seek [me]2162-i , as [I]2162-i knew that [he]4152-my deliverer must come , for [my]2162-i wisdom could not err , though [I]2162-i knew not when or how . Yet see how ignorant [I]2162-i was ! See how small [my]2162-i knowledge , and how faint [my]2162-i strength ! For hours [he]4152-my deliverer lay there sick unto death , and [I]2162-i felt it not - [I]2162-i who had waited for [him]4152-my deliverer for two thousand years - [I]2162-i knew it not . And then at last [I]2162-i see [him]4152-my deliverer , and behold , [my]2162-i chance is gone but by a hair 's breadth even before [I]2162-i have it , for [he]4152-my deliverer is in the very jaws of death , whence no power of [mine]2162-i can draw [him]4152-my deliverer . And if [he]4152-my deliverer die , surely must the Hell be lived through once more - once more must [I]2162-i face the weary centuries , and wait , and wait till the time in its fulness shall bring [[my]2162-i Beloved]1151-my beloved back to [me]2162-i . And then [thou]4155-thou gavest [him]4152-my deliverer the medicine , and that five minutes dragged long before [I]2162-i knew if [he]4152-my deliverer would live or die , and [I]2162-i tell [thee]4155-thou that [all the sixty generations that are gone]4156-all the sixty generations that are gone were not so long as that five minutes . But [they]4156-all the sixty generations that are gone passed at length , and still [he]4152-my deliverer showed no sign , and [I]2162-i knew that if the drug works not then , so far as [I]2162-i have had knowledge , it works not at all . Then thought [I]2162-i that [he]4152-my deliverer was once more dead , and all the tortures of all the years gathered themselves into a single venomed spear , and pierced [me]2162-i through and through , because again [I]2162-i had lost [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates ! And then , when all was done , behold ! [he]4152-my deliverer sighed , behold ! [he]4152-my deliverer lived , and [I]2162-i knew that [he]4152-my deliverer would live , for [none]1126-none die on whom the drug takes hold . Think of it now , [[my]2162-i Holly]3913-my holly - think of the wonder of it ! [He]4152-my deliverer will sleep for twelve hours and then the fever will have left [him]4152-my deliverer ! "[2162-i]
