"[114-ayesha] and with a sudden motion [she]114-ayesha shook [her]114-ayesha gauzy covering from [her]114-ayesha , and stood forth in [her]114-ayesha low kirtle and [her]114-ayesha snaky zone , in [her]114-ayesha glorious radiant beauty and [her]114-ayesha imperial grace , rising from [her]114-ayesha wrappings , as it were , like Venus from the wave , or Galatea from [her]114-ayesha marble , or a beatified spirit from [the tomb]2051-the tomb . [She]114-ayesha stood forth , and fixed [her]114-ayesha deep and glowing eyes upon [Leo]108-leo 's eyes , and [I]0-i saw [his]108-leo clenched fists unclasp , and [his]108-leo set and quivering features relax beneath [her]114-ayesha gaze . [I]0-i saw [his]108-leo wonder and astonishment grow into admiration , and then into fascination , and the more [he]108-leo struggled the more [I]0-i saw the power of [her]114-ayesha dread beauty fasten on [him]108-leo and take possession of [his]108-leo senses , drugging them , and drawing the heart out of [him]108-leo . Did [I]0-i not know the process ? Had not [I]0-i , who was twice [his]108-leo age , gone through it [myself]0-i ? Was [I]0-i not going through it afresh even then , although [her]114-ayesha sweet and passionate gaze was not for [me]0-i ? Yes , alas , [I]0-i was ! Alas , that [I]0-i should have to confess that at that very moment [I]0-i was rent by mad and furious jealousy . [I]0-i could have flown at [him]108-leo , shame upon [me]0-i ! [The woman]3243-the woman had confounded and almost destroyed [my]0-i moral sense , as [she]3243-the woman was bound to confound all who looked upon [her]3243-the woman superhuman loveliness . But - [I]0-i do not quite know how - [I]0-i got the better of [myself]0-i , and once more turned to see the climax of the tragedy .

" Oh , great Heaven ! "[108-leo] gasped [Leo]108-leo , " art [thou]4362-thou [a woman]284-a woman ? "[108-leo]

" [A woman in truth]4364-a woman in truth - in very truth - and [[thine]3243-the woman own spouse]4365-thine own spouse , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates ! "[3243-the woman] [she]3243-the woman answered , stretching out [her]3243-the woman rounded ivory arms towards [him]108-leo , and smiling , ah , so sweetly !

[He]108-leo looked and looked , and slowly [I]0-i perceived that [he]108-leo was drawing nearer to [her]3243-the woman . Suddenly [his]108-leo eye fell upon the corpse of [poor Ustane]172-ustane , and [he]108-leo shuddered and stopped .

" How can [I]108-leo ? "[108-leo] [he]108-leo said hoarsely . " [Thou]3243-the woman art [a murderess]4366-a murderess ; [she]3243-the woman loved [me]108-leo . "[108-leo]

[Observe]230-observe , [he]108-leo was already forgetting that [he]108-leo had loved [her]3243-the woman .

" It is naught , "[3243-the woman] [she]3243-the woman murmured , and [her]3243-the woman voice sounded sweet as the night - wind passing through the trees . " It is naught at all . If [I]3243-the woman have sinned , let [my]3243-the woman beauty answer for [my]3243-the woman sin . If [I]3243-the woman have sinned , it is for love of [thee]3243-the woman : let [my]3243-the woman sin , therefore , be put away and forgotten ; "[3243-the woman] and once more [she]3243-the woman stretched out [her]3243-the woman arms and whispered " Come , "[3243-the woman] and then in another few seconds it was all over .

[I]0-i saw [him]108-leo struggle - [I]0-i saw [him]108-leo even turn to fly ; but [her]3243-the woman eyes drew [him]108-leo more strongly than iron bonds , and the magic of [her]3243-the woman beauty and concentrated will and passion entered into [him]108-leo and overpowered [him]108-leo - ay , even there , in the presence of the body of [the woman who had loved [him]108-leo well enough to die for [him]108-leo]2350-the woman who had loved him well enough to die for him . It sounds horrible and wicked enough , but [he]108-leo should not be too greatly blamed , and be sure [his]108-leo sin will find [him]108-leo out . The temptress who drew [him]108-leo into evil was more than human , and [her]3243-the woman beauty was greater than the loveliness of [the daughters of [men]516-men]2351-the daughters of men .

[I]0-i looked up again and now [her]3243-the woman perfect form lay in [his]108-leo arms , and [her]3243-the woman lips were pressed against [his]108-leo own ; and thus , with the corpse of [his]108-leo dead love for an altar , did [Leo Vincey]108-leo plight [his]108-leo troth to [her]3243-the woman red - handed murderess - plight it for ever and a day . For those who sell [themselves]2353-their into a like dominion , paying down the price of [their]2353-their own honour , and throwing [their]2353-their soul into the balance to sink the scale to the level of [their]2353-their lusts , can hope for no deliverance here or hereafter . As [they]2353-their have sown , so shall [they]2353-their reap and reap , even when the poppy flowers of passion have withered in [their]2353-their hands , and [their]2353-their harvest is but bitter tares , garnered in satiety .

Suddenly , with a snake - like motion , [she]3243-the woman seemed to slip from [his]108-leo embrace , and then again broke out into [her]3243-the woman low laugh of triumphant mockery .

" Did [I]3243-the woman not tell [thee]3243-the woman that within a little space [thou]3243-the woman wouldst creep to [my]3243-the woman knee , oh [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates ? And surely the space has not been a great one ! "[3243-the woman]

[Leo]108-leo groaned in shame and misery ; for though [he]108-leo was overcome and stricken down , [he]108-leo was not so lost as to be unaware of the depth of the degradation to which [he]108-leo had sunk . On the contrary , [his]108-leo better nature rose up in arms against [his]108-leo fallen self , as [I]0-i saw clearly enough later on .

[Ayesha]114-ayesha laughed again , and then quickly veiled [herself]114-ayesha , and made a sign to [the girl mute , who had been watching the whole scene with curious startled eyes]2354-the girl mute , who had been watching the whole scene with curious startled eyes . [The girl]3559-the girl left , and presently returned , followed by [two male mutes , to whom [the Queen]1108-the queen]2356-two male mutes , to whom the queen made another sign . Thereon [they]2358-they all three seized the body of [poor Ustane]172-ustane by the arms , and dragged it heavily down [the cavern]1056-the cavern and away through the curtains at the end . [Leo]108-leo watched [it]2360-it for a little while , and then covered [his]108-leo eyes with [his]108-leo hand , and it too , to [my]0-i excited fancy , seemed to watch [us]2361-us as it went .

" There passes the dead past , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , solemnly , as the curtains shook and fell back into their places , when the ghastly procession had vanished behind [them]2358-they . And then , with one of those extraordinary transitions of which [I]0-i have already spoken , [she]114-ayesha again threw off [her]114-ayesha veil , and broke out , after the ancient and poetic fashion of [the dwellers in [Arabia]71-arabia]2362-the dwellers in arabia , into a pæan of triumph or epithalamium , which , wild and beautiful as it was , is exceedingly difficult to render into English , and ought by rights to be sung to the music of a cantata , rather than written and read . It was divided into two parts - one descriptive or definitive , and the other personal ; and , as nearly as [I]0-i can remember , ran as follows : -

Love is like a flower in [the desert]2363-the desert .

It is like the aloe of [Arabia]71-arabia that blooms but once and dies ; it blooms in the salt emptiness of Life , and the brightness of its beauty is set upon the waste as a star is set upon a storm .

It hath the sun above that is the Spirit , and above it blows the air of its divinity .

At the echoing of a step , [Love]231-love blooms , [I]0-i say ; [I]0-i say [Love]231-love blooms , and bends [her]114-ayesha beauty down to [him]2364-he who passeth by .

[He]2364-he plucketh it , yea , [he]2364-he plucketh the red cup that is full of honey , and beareth it away ; away across [the desert]2363-the desert , away till the flower be withered , away till [the desert]2363-the desert be done .

There is only one perfect flower in [the wilderness of Life]2367-the wilderness of life .

That flower is Love !

There is only one fixed star in the midsts of [our]2368-our wandering .

That star is Love !

There is only one hope in [our]2368-our despairing night .

That hope is Love !

All else is false . All else is shadow moving upon water . All else is wind and vanity .

Who shall say what is the weight or the measure of Love ?

It is born of the flesh , it dwelleth in the spirit . From each doth [it]231-love draw its comfort .

For beauty it is as a star .

Many are its shapes , but all are beautiful , and [none]1126-none know where the star rose , or the horizon where it shall set .

Among [the ancient Arabians]2370-the ancient arabians the power of poetic declamation , either in verse or prose , was held in the highest honour and esteem , and [he]2371-he who excelled in it was known as " [Khâteb , "[2371-he] or Orator]4367-khâteb , " or orator . Every year a general assembly was held at which [the rival poets]2372-the rival poets repeated [their]2372-the rival poets compositions , when those poems which were judged to be the best were , so soon as the knowledge and the art of writing became general , inscribed on silk in letters of gold , and publicly exhibited , being known as " Al Modhahabât , "[109-holly] or golden verses . In the poem given above by [Mr. Holly]109-holly , [Ayesha]114-ayesha evidently followed the traditional poetic manner of [[her]114-ayesha people]1984-her people , which was to embody [their]1984-her people thoughts in a series of somewhat disconnected sentences , each remarkable for its beauty and the grace of its expression . - [Editor]164-editor .

Then , turning to [Leo]108-leo , and laying [her]114-ayesha hand upon [his]108-leo shoulder , [she]114-ayesha went on in a fuller and more triumphant tone , speaking in balanced sentences that gradually grew and swelled from idealised prose into pure and majestic verse : -

Long have [I]0-i loved [thee]114-ayesha , oh , [my]0-i love ; yet has [my]0-i love not lessened .

Long have [I]0-i waited for [thee]114-ayesha , and behold [my]0-i reward is at hand - is here !

Far away [I]0-i saw [thee]114-ayesha once , and [thou]114-ayesha wast taken from [me]0-i .

Then in a grave sowed [I]0-i the seed of patience , and shone upon it with the sun of hope , and watered it with tears of repentance , and breathed on it with the breath of [my]0-i knowledge . And now , lo ! it hath sprung up , and borne fruit . Lo ! out of [the grave]366-the grave hath it sprung . Yea , from among the dry bones and ashes of the dead .

[I]0-i have waited and [my]0-i reward is with [me]0-i .

[I]0-i have overcome [Death]182-death , and [Death]182-death brought back to [me]0-i [him]182-death that was dead .

Therefore do [I]0-i rejoice , for fair is the future .

Green are the paths that [we]2375-we shall tread across [the everlasting meadows]2376-the everlasting meadows .

The hour is at hand . Night hath fled away into [the valleys]2377-the valleys .

The dawn kisseth [the mountain tops]2378-the mountain tops .

Soft shall [we]2375-we live , [my]0-i love , and easy shall [we]2375-we go .

Crowned shall [we]2375-we be with the diadem of [Kings]1325-kings .

Worshipping and wonder struck [all peoples of [the world]252-the world]2380-all peoples of the world , [Blinded]232-blinded shall fall before [our]2375-we beauty and might .

From time unto times shall [our]2375-we greatness thunder on , Rolling like [a chariot]2382-a chariot through the dust of endless days .

Laughing shall [we]2375-we speed in [our]2375-we victory and pomp , Laughing like [the Daylight]2383-the daylight as [he]182-death leaps along [the hills]2384-the hills .

Onward , still triumphant to a triumph ever new !

Onward , in [our]2375-we power to a power unattained !

Onward , never weary , clad with splendour for a robe !

Till accomplished be [our]2375-we fate , and the night is rushing down .

[She]2385-me paused in [her]2385-me strange and most thrilling allegorical chant , of which [I]0-i am , unfortunately , only able to give the burden , and that feebly enough , and then said -

" Perchance [thou]4368-thou dost not believe [my]2385-me word , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates - perchance [thou]4368-thou thinkest that [I]2385-me do delude [thee]4368-thou , and that [I]2385-me have not lived these many years , and that [thou]4368-thou hast not been born again to [me]2385-me . Nay , look not so - put away that pale cast of doubt , for oh be sure herein can error find no foothold ! Sooner shall the suns forget their course and the swallow miss [her]2385-me nest , than [my]2385-me soul shall swear a lie and be led astray from [thee]4368-thou , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . Blind [me]2385-me , take away [mine]2385-me eyes , and let the darkness utterly fence [me]2385-me in , and still [mine]2385-me ears would catch the tone of [thy]4368-thou unforgotten voice , striking more loud against the portals of [my]2385-me sense than can the call of brazen - throated clarions : - stop up [mine]2385-me hearing also , and let a thousand touch [me]2385-me on the brow , and [I]2385-me would name [thee]4368-thou out of all : - yea , rob [me]2385-me of every sense , and see [me]2385-me stand deaf and blind , and dumb , and with nerves that can not weigh the value of a touch , yet would [my]2385-me spirit leap within [me]2385-me like [a quickening child]4369-a quickening child and cry unto [my]2385-me heart , behold [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates ! behold , [thou]4368-thou watcher , the watches of [thy]4368-thou night are ended ! behold [thou]4368-thou [who seekest in the night season]4370-who seekest in the night season , [thy]4368-thou morning Star ariseth . "[2385-me]

[She]2386-i paused awhile and then continued , " But stay , if [thy]4368-thou heart is yet hardened against the mighty truth and [thou]4368-thou dost require a further pledge of that which [thou]4368-thou dost find too deep to understand , even now shall it be given to [thee]4368-thou , and to [thee]4368-thou also , oh [[my]2386-i Holly]3913-my holly . Bear each one of [you]4368-thou a lamp , and follow after [me]2386-i whither [I]2386-i shall lead [you]4368-thou . "[2386-i]

Without stopping to think - indeed , speaking for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i had almost abandoned the function in circumstances under which to think seemed to be absolutely useless , since thought fell hourly helpless against a black wall of wonder - [we]2387-we took the lamps and followed [her]2386-i . Going to the end of [her]2386-i " boudoir , "[2386-i] [she]2386-i raised a curtain and revealed a little stair of the sort that is so common in [these dim caves of [K"r]56-k"r]4372-these dim caves of k"r . As [we]2387-we hurried down [the stair]4373-the stair [I]2386-i observed that the steps were worn in the centre to such an extent that some of them had been reduced from seven and a half inches , at which [I]2386-i guessed their original height , to about three and a half . Now , all the other steps that [I]2386-i had seen in [the caves]3307-the caves were practically unworn , as was to be expected , seeing that the only traffic which ever passed upon [them]4373-the stair was that of [those who bore a fresh burden to [the tomb]2051-the tomb]4375-those who bore a fresh burden to the tomb . Therefore this fact struck [my]2386-i notice with that curious force with which little things do strike [us]2387-we when [our]2387-we minds are absolutely overwhelmed by a sudden rush of powerful sensations ; beaten flat , as it were , like a sea beneath the first burst of a hurricane , so that [every little object on the surface starts into an unnatural prominence]4377-every little object on the surface starts into an unnatural prominence .[2386-i]

At the bottom of [the staircase]2388-the staircase [I]0-i stood and stared at the worn steps , and [Ayesha]114-ayesha , turning , saw [me]0-i .

" Wonderest [thou]4378-thou whose are the feet that have worn away the rock , [[my]114-ayesha [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly ? "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha asked . " They are [mine]114-ayesha - even [mine]114-ayesha own light feet ! [I]114-ayesha can remember when those stairs were fresh and level , but for two thousand years and more have [I]114-ayesha gone down hither day by day , and see , [my]114-ayesha sandals have worn out the solid rock ! "[114-ayesha]

[I]0-i made no answer , but [I]0-i do not think that anything that [I]0-i had heard or seen brought home to [my]0-i limited understanding so clear a sense of [this being]2389-this being 's overwhelming antiquity as that hard rock hollowed out by [her]2389-this being soft white feet . How many hundreds of thousands of times must [she]2389-this being have passed up and down that stair to bring about such a result ?

[The stair]4373-the stair led to [a tunnel]2391-a tunnel , and a few paces down [the tunnel]1826-the tunnel was one of the usual curtain - hung doorways , a glance at which told [me]0-i that it was the same where [I]0-i had been [a witness of that terrible scene by the leaping flame]2393-a witness of that terrible scene by the leaping flame . [I]0-i recognised the pattern of the curtain , and the sight of it brought the whole event vividly before [my]0-i eyes , and made [me]0-i tremble even at its memory . [Ayesha]114-ayesha entered [the tomb]2051-the tomb for [it]2051-the tomb was [a tomb]1829-a tomb , and [we]2396-we followed [her]114-ayesha - [I]0-i , for one , rejoicing that the mystery of [the place]1059-the place was about to be cleared up , and yet afraid to face [its]1059-the place solution .

XXI

[THE DEAD AND LIVING MEET]2398-the dead and living meet

" See now the place where [I]114-ayesha have slept for these two thousand years , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , taking the lamp from [Leo]108-leo 's hand and holding it above [her]114-ayesha head . Its rays fell upon a little hollow in the floor , where [I]0-i had seen the leaping flame , but the fire was out now . [They]2399-they fell upon the white form stretched there beneath its wrappings upon its bed of stone , upon the fretted carving of [the tomb]2051-the tomb , and upon another shelf of stone opposite the one on which the body lay , and separated from it by the breadth of [the cave]936-the cave .

" Here , "[114-ayesha] went on [Ayesha]114-ayesha , laying [her]114-ayesha hand upon the rock - " here have [I]114-ayesha slept night by night for all these generations , with but a cloak to cover [me]114-ayesha . It did not become [me]114-ayesha that [I]114-ayesha should lie soft when [my]114-ayesha spouse yonder , "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha pointed to the rigid form , " lay stiff in death . Here night by night have [I]114-ayesha slept in [[his]108-leo cold company]4380-his cold company - till , [thou]4381-thou seest , this thick slab , like the stairs down which [we]4382-we passed , has worn thin with the tossing of [my]114-ayesha form - so faithful have [I]114-ayesha been to [thee]4381-thou even in [thy]4381-thou space of sleep , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . And now , [mine]114-ayesha own , [thou]4381-thou shalt see a wonderful thing - living , [thou]4381-thou shalt behold [thyself]4381-thou dead - for well have [I]114-ayesha tended [thee]4381-thou during all these years , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . Art [thou]4381-thou prepared ? "[114-ayesha]

[We]2402-our made no answer , but gazed at [each other]417-each other with frightened eyes , the whole scene was so dreadful and so solemn . [Ayesha]114-ayesha advanced , and laid [her]114-ayesha hand upon the corner of the shroud , and once more spoke .

" Be not affrighted , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said ; " though the thing seem wonderful to [thee]4381-thou - all [we]2402-our who live have thus lived before ; nor is the very shape that holds [us]2402-our a stranger to the sun ! Only [we]2402-our know it not , because memory writes no record , and earth hath gathered in the earth [she]114-ayesha lent [us]2402-our , for none have saved [our]2402-our glory from the grave . But [I]114-ayesha , by [my]114-ayesha arts and by the arts of [those dead men of [K"r]56-k"r[114-ayesha] which [I]0-i have learned]4383-those dead men of k"r which i have learned , have held [thee]2404-thy back , oh [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , from the dust , that the waxen stamp of beauty on [thy]2404-thy face should ever rest before [mine]0-i eye . ' Twas a mask that memory might fill , serving to fashion out [thy]2404-thy presence from the past , and give it strength to wander in the habitations of [my]0-i thought , clad in a mummery of life that stayed [my]0-i appetite with visions of dead days .

" Behold now , let the Dead and Living meet ! Across [the gulf of Time]4384-the gulf of time they still are one . Time hath no power against [Identity]233-identity , though sleep the merciful hath blotted out the tablets of [our]2402-our mind , and with oblivion sealed the sorrows that else would hound [us]2402-our from life to life , stuffing the brain with gathered griefs till it burst in the madness of uttermost despair . Still are [they]4385-they one , for the wrappings of [our]2402-our sleep shall roll away as thunder - clouds before the wind ; the frozen voice of the past shall melt in music like mountain snows beneath the sun ; and the weeping and the laughter of the lost hours shall be heard once more most sweetly echoing up the cliffs of immeasurable time .[2405-she]

" Ay , the sleep shall roll away , and the voices shall be heard , when down the completed chain , whereof [our]2402-our each existence is a link , the lightning of [the Spirit]4386-the spirit hath passed to work out the purpose of [our]2402-our being ; quickening and fusing those separated days of life , and shaping them to a staff whereon [we]2402-our may safely lean as [we]2402-our wend to [our]2402-our appointed fate .[2405-she]

" Therefore , have no fear , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , when [thou]4387-thou - living , and but lately born - shalt look upon [thine]4387-thou own departed self , who breathed and died so long ago . [I]2405-she do but turn one page in [thy]2405-she Book of Being , and show [thee]2405-she what is writ thereon .[2405-she]

" Behold ! "[2405-she]

With a sudden motion [she]2405-she drew the shroud from the cold form , and let the lamplight play upon it . [I]0-i looked , and then shrank back terrified ; since , say what [she]2405-she might in explanation , the sight was an uncanny one - for [her]2405-she explanations were beyond the grasp of [our]2406-our finite minds , and when they were stripped from the mists of vague esoteric philosophy , and brought into conflict with the cold and horrifying fact , did not do much to break its force . For there , stretched upon the stone bier before [us]2406-our , robed in white and perfectly preserved , was what appeared to be the body of [Leo Vincey]108-leo . [I]0-i stared from [Leo]108-leo , standing there alive , to [Leo]108-leo lying there dead , and could see no difference ; except , perhaps , that the body on the bier looked older . Feature for feature they were the same , even down to the crop of little golden curls , which was [Leo]108-leo 's most uncommon beauty . It even seemed to [me]0-i , as [I]0-i looked , that the expression on [the dead man]1625-the dead man 's face resembled that which [I]0-i had sometimes seen upon [Leo]108-leo 's when [he]108-leo was plunged into profound sleep . [I]0-i can only sum up the closeness of the resemblance by saying that [I]0-i never saw [twins so exactly similar as that dead and living pair]2408-twins so exactly similar as that dead and living pair .

[I]0-i turned to see what effect was produced upon [Leo]108-leo by the sight of [his]108-leo dead self , and found it to be one of partial stupefaction . [He]108-leo stood for two or three minutes staring , and said nothing , and when at last [he]108-leo spoke it was only to ejaculate -

" Cover it up , and take [me]108-leo away . "[108-leo]

" Nay , wait , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , who , standing with the lamp raised above [her]114-ayesha head , flooding with its light [her]114-ayesha own rich beauty and the cold wonder of the death - clothed form upon the bier , resembled [an inspired Sibyl]2409-an inspired sibyl rather than [a woman]284-a woman , as [she]114-ayesha rolled out [her]114-ayesha majestic sentences with a grandeur and a freedom of utterance which [I]0-i am , alas ! quite unable to reproduce .

" Wait , [I]114-ayesha would show [thee]114-ayesha something , that no tittle of [my]114-ayesha crime may be hidden from [thee]114-ayesha . Do [thou]114-ayesha , oh [Holly]109-holly , open the garment on the breast of [the dead Kallikrates]4388-the dead kallikrates , for perchance [[my]114-ayesha lord]4128-my lord may fear to touch it [himself]4128-my lord . "[114-ayesha]

[I]0-i obeyed with trembling hands . It seemed a desecration and an unhallowed thing to touch that sleeping image of [the live man]2411-the live man by [my]0-i side . Presently [his]2411-the live man broad chest was bare , and there upon it , right over the heart , was a wound , evidently inflicted with a spear .

" [Thou]114-ayesha seest , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said . " Know then that it was [I]114-ayesha who slew [thee]114-ayesha : in [the Place of Life]4390-the place of life [I]114-ayesha gave [thee]114-ayesha death . [I]114-ayesha slew [thee]114-ayesha because of the Egyptian Amenartas , whom [thou]114-ayesha didst love , for by [her]114-ayesha wiles [she]114-ayesha held [thy]114-ayesha heart , and [her]114-ayesha [I]114-ayesha could not smite as but now [I]114-ayesha smote [that woman]3450-that woman , for [she]114-ayesha was too strong for [me]114-ayesha . In [my]114-ayesha haste and bitter anger [I]114-ayesha slew [thee]114-ayesha , and now for all these days have [I]114-ayesha lamented [thee]114-ayesha , and waited for [thy]114-ayesha coming . And [thou]114-ayesha hast come , and none can stand between [thee]114-ayesha and [me]114-ayesha , and of a truth now for death [I]114-ayesha will give [thee]114-ayesha life - not life eternal , for that none can give , but life and youth that shall endure for thousands upon thousands of years , and with it pomp , and power , and wealth , and all things that are good and beautiful , such as have been to [no man before [thee]114-ayesha]4392-no man before thee , nor shall be to [any man who comes after]4393-any man who comes after . And now one thing more , and [thou]114-ayesha shalt rest and make ready for the day of [thy]114-ayesha new birth . [Thou]114-ayesha seest this body , which was thine own . For all these centuries it hath been [my]114-ayesha cold comfort and [[my]114-ayesha companion]4394-my companion , but now [I]114-ayesha need it no more , for [I]114-ayesha have [thy]114-ayesha living presence , and it can but serve to stir up memories of that which [I]114-ayesha would fain forget . Let it therefore go back to the dust from which [I]114-ayesha held it .[114-ayesha]

" Behold ! [I]2412-she have prepared against this happy hour ! "[2412-she] And going to the other shelf or stone ledge , which [she]2412-she said had served [her]2412-she for a bed , [she]2412-she took from it a large vitrified double - handed vase , the mouth of which was tied up with a bladder . This [she]2412-she loosed , and then , having bent down and gently kissed the white forehead of [the dead man]1625-the dead man , [she]2412-she undid the vase , and sprinkled its contents carefully over the form , taking , [I]0-i observed , the greatest precautions against any drop of them touching [us]2414-we or [herself]2415-herself , and then poured out what remained of the liquid upon the chest and head . Instantly a dense vapour arose , and [the cave]936-the cave was filled with choking fumes that prevented [us]2414-we from seeing anything while the deadly acid for [I]0-i presume it was some tremendous preparation of that sort did its work . From the spot where the body lay came a fierce fizzing and cracking sound , which ceased , however , before the fumes had cleared away . At last [they]2417-they were all gone , except a little cloud that still hung over the corpse . In a couple of minutes more this too had vanished , and , wonderful as it may seem , it is a fact that on the stone bench that had supported the mortal remains of [the ancient Kallikrates]2418-the ancient kallikrates for so many centuries there was now nothing to be seen but a few handfuls of smoking white powder . The acid had utterly destroyed the body , and even in places eaten into the stone . [Ayesha]114-ayesha stooped down , and , taking a handful of this powder in [her]114-ayesha grasp , threw it into the air , saying at the same time , in a voice of calm solemnity -

" Dust to dust ! - the past to the past ! - the dead to the dead ! - [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates is dead , and is born again ! "[114-ayesha]

The ashes floated noiselessly to the rocky floor , and [we]2414-we stood in awed silence and watched them fall , too overcome for words .

" Now leave [me]2412-she , "[2412-she] [she]2412-she said , " and sleep if [ye]0-i may . [I]2412-she must watch and think , for to - morrow night [we]2414-we go hence , and the time is long since [I]2412-she trod the path that [we]2414-we must follow . "[2412-she]

[Accordingly]188-accordingly [we]2414-we bowed , and left [her]2412-she .

As [we]2414-we passed to [[our]2414-we own apartment]2419-our own apartment [I]0-i peeped into [[Job]137-job 's sleeping place]2420-job 's sleeping place , to see how [he]137-job fared , for [he]137-job had gone away just before [our]2414-we interview with [the murdered Ustane]2421-the murdered ustane , quite prostrated by the terrors of the Amahagger festivity . [He]137-job was sleeping soundly , [good honest fellow that [he]137-job was]2422-good honest fellow that he was , and [I]0-i rejoiced to think that [his]137-job nerves , which , like those of [most uneducated people]2423-most uneducated people , were far from strong , had been spared the closing scenes of this dreadful day . Then [we]2414-we entered [[our]2414-we own chamber]2424-our own chamber , and here at last [poor [Leo]108-leo , who , ever since [he]137-job had looked upon that frozen image of [his]137-job living self]2425-poor leo , who , ever since he had looked upon that frozen image of his living self , had been in a state not far removed from stupefaction , burst out into a torrent of grief . Now that [he]137-job was no longer in the presence of the dread [She]2421-the murdered ustane , [his]137-job sense of the awfulness of all that had happened , and more especially of the wicked murder of [Ustane]172-ustane , who was bound to [him]137-job by ties so close , broke upon [him]137-job like a storm , and lashed [him]137-job into an agony of remorse and terror which was painful to witness . [He]137-job cursed [himself]137-job - [he]137-job cursed the hour when [we]2414-we had first seen the writing on the sherd , which was being so mysteriously verified , and bitterly [he]137-job cursed [his]137-job own weakness . [Ayesha]114-ayesha [he]137-job dared not curse - who dared speak evil of [such a woman , whose consciousness , for aught [we]2414-we knew , was watching [us]2414-we at the very moment]2426-such a woman , whose consciousness , for aught we knew , was watching us at the very moment ?

" What am [I]137-job to do , [old fellow]3147-old fellow ? "[137-job] [he]137-job groaned , resting [his]137-job head against [my]0-i shoulder in the extremity of [his]137-job grief . " [I]137-job let [her]114-ayesha be killed - not that [I]137-job could help that , but within five minutes [I]137-job was kissing [her]114-ayesha murderess over [her]114-ayesha body . [I]137-job am [a degraded brute]4396-a degraded brute , but [I]137-job can not resist that "[137-job] and here [his]137-job voice sank - " [that awful sorceress]4397-that awful sorceress . [I]137-job know [I]137-job shall do it again to - morrow ; [I]137-job know that [I]137-job am in [her]114-ayesha power for always ; if [I]137-job never saw [her]114-ayesha again [I]137-job should never think of [anybody else]4398-anybody else during all [my]137-job life ; [I]137-job must follow [her]114-ayesha as a needle follows a magnet ; [I]137-job would not go away now if [I]137-job could ; [I]137-job could not leave [her]114-ayesha , [my]137-job legs would not carry [me]137-job , but [my]137-job mind is still clear enough , and in [my]137-job mind [I]137-job hate [her]114-ayesha - at least , [I]137-job think so . It is all so horrible ; and that - that body ! What can [I]137-job make of it ? [It]4399-it was [I]137-job ! [I]137-job am sold into bondage , [old fellow]3147-old fellow , and [she]114-ayesha will take [my]137-job soul as the price of [herself]114-ayesha ! "[137-job]

Then , for the first time , [I]0-i told [him]2427-he that [I]0-i was in a but very little better position ; and [I]0-i am bound to say that , notwithstanding [his]2427-he own infatuation , [he]2427-he had the decency to sympathise with [me]0-i . Perhaps [he]2427-he did not think it worth while being jealous , realising that [he]2427-he had no cause so far as [the lady]1072-the lady was concerned . [I]0-i went on to suggest that [we]2429-we should try to run away , but [we]2429-we soon rejected the project as futile , and , to be perfectly honest , [I]0-i do not believe that either of [us]2429-we would really have left [Ayesha]114-ayesha even if some superior power had suddenly offered to convey [us]2429-we from [these gloomy caves]2430-these gloomy caves and set [us]2429-we down in [Cambridge]2-cambridge . [We]2429-we could no more have left [her]114-ayesha than a moth can leave the light that destroys it . [We]2429-we were like [confirmed opium - eaters]2431-confirmed opium - eaters : in [our]2429-we moments of reason [we]2429-we well knew the deadly nature of [our]2429-we pursuit , but [we]2429-we certainly were not prepared to abandon its terrible delights .

[No man who once had seen [She]114-ayesha unveiled , and heard the music of [her]114-ayesha voice , and drunk in the bitter wisdom of [her]114-ayesha words]2432-no man who once had seen she unveiled , and heard the music of her voice , and drunk in the bitter wisdom of her words , would willingly give up the sight for a whole sea of placid joys . How much more , then , was this likely to be so when , as in [Leo]108-leo 's case , to put [myself]0-i out of the question , [this extraordinary creature]1914-this extraordinary creature declared [her]114-ayesha utter and absolute devotion , and gave what appeared to be proofs of its having lasted for some two thousand years ?

No doubt [she]114-ayesha was [a wicked person]2434-a wicked person , and no doubt [she]114-ayesha had murdered [Ustane]172-ustane when [she]114-ayesha stood in [her]114-ayesha path , but then [she]114-ayesha was very faithful , and by a law of nature [man]3189-man is apt to think but lightly of [a woman]284-a woman 's crimes , especially if [that woman]3450-that woman be beautiful , and the crime be committed for the love of [him]3189-man .

And then , for the rest , when had such a chance ever come to [a man]352-a man before as that which now lay in [Leo]108-leo 's hand ? True , in uniting [himself]108-leo to [this dread woman]2439-this dread woman , [he]108-leo would place [his]108-leo life under the influence of [a mysterious creature of evil tendencies]2440-a mysterious creature of evil tendencies , but then that would be likely enough to happen to [him]108-leo in any ordinary marriage . On the other hand , however , no ordinary marriage could bring [him]108-leo such awful beauty - for awful is the only word that can describe it - such divine devotion , such wisdom , and command over the secrets of nature , and the place and power that [they]2441-they must win , or , lastly , the royal crown of unending youth , if indeed [she]2439-this dread woman could give that . No , on the whole , it is not wonderful that , though [Leo]108-leo was plunged in bitter shame and grief , such as [any gentleman]2442-any gentleman would have felt under the circumstances , [he]108-leo was not ready to entertain the idea of running away from [his]108-leo extraordinary fortune .

After some months of consideration of this statement [I]0-i am bound to confess that [I]0-i am not quite satisfied of its truth . It is perfectly true that [Ayesha]114-ayesha committed a murder , but [I]0-i shrewdly suspect that , were [we]2443-we endowed with the same absolute power , and if [we]2443-we had the same tremendous interest at stake , [we]2443-we would be very apt to do likewise under parallel circumstances . Also , it must be remembered that [she]2439-this dread woman looked on it as an execution for disobedience under a system which made the slightest disobedience punishable by death . Putting aside this question of the murder , [her]2439-this dread woman evil - doing resolves itself into the expression of views and the acknowledgment of motives which are contrary to [our]2443-we preaching if not to [our]2443-we practice . Now at first sight this might be fairly taken as a proof of an evil nature , but when [we]2443-we come to consider the great antiquity of [the individual]984-the individual it becomes doubtful if it was anything more than the natural cynicism which arises from age and bitter experience , and the possession of extraordinary powers of observation . It is a well known fact that very often , putting the period of boyhood out of the question , the older [we]2443-we grow the more cynical and hardened [we]2443-we get ; indeed many of [us]2443-we are only saved by timely death from utter moral petrifaction if not moral corruption . [No one]3428-no one will deny that [a young man]2071-a young man is on the average better than [an old one]2447-an old one , for [he]2071-a young man is without that experience of the order of things that in certain thoughtful dispositions can hardly fail to produce cynicism , and that disregard of acknowledged methods and established custom which [we]2443-we call evil . Now [the oldest man upon]2448-the oldest man upon [the earth]659-the earth was but [a babe]2450-a babe compared to [Ayesha]114-ayesha , and [the wisest man upon]2451-the wisest man upon [the earth]659-the earth was not one - third as wise . And the fruit of [her]2439-this dread woman wisdom was this , that there was but one thing worth living for , and that was Love in its highest sense , and to gain that good thing [she]2439-this dread woman was not prepared to stop at trifles . This is really the sum of [her]2439-this dread woman evil doings , and it must be remembered , on the other hand , that , whatever may be thought of them , [she]2439-this dread woman had some virtues developed to a degree very uncommon in either sex - constancy , for instance . - L. H. H.

[My]0-i own opinion is that [he]2071-a young man would have been mad if [he]2071-a young man had done so . But then [I]0-i confess that [my]0-i statement on the matter must be accepted with qualifications . [I]0-i am in love with [Ayesha]114-ayesha [myself]0-i to this day , and [I]0-i would rather have been the object of [her]114-ayesha affection for one short week than that of [any other woman in [the world]252-the world]2453-any other woman in the world for a whole lifetime . And let [me]0-i add that , if anybody who doubts this statement , and thinks [me]0-i foolish for making it , could have seen [Ayesha]114-ayesha draw [her]114-ayesha veil and flash out in beauty on [his]2071-a young man gaze , [his]2071-a young man view would exactly coincide with [my]0-i own . Of course , [I]0-i am speaking of [any man]965-any man . [We]2456-we never had the advantage of [a lady]2457-a lady 's opinion of [Ayesha]114-ayesha , but [I]0-i think it quite possible that [she]2457-a lady would have regarded [the Queen]1108-the queen with dislike , would have expressed [her]2457-a lady disapproval in some more or less pointed manner , and ultimately have got [herself]2457-a lady blasted .

For two hours or more [Leo]108-leo and [I]0-i sat with shaken nerves and frightened eyes , and talked over the miraculous events through which [we]2456-we were passing . It seemed like a dream or a fairy tale , instead of the solemn , sober fact . Who would have believed that the writing on the potsherd was not only true , but that [we]2456-we should live to verify its truth , and that [we]2456-we two seekers should find [her]114-ayesha who was sought , patiently awaiting [our]2456-we coming in [the tombs of [K"r]111-k"r]4401-the tombs of k"r ? Who would have thought that in the person of [Leo]108-leo [this mysterious woman]2216-this mysterious woman should , as [she]2216-this mysterious woman believed , discover the being whom [she]2216-this mysterious woman awaited from century to century , and whose former earthly habitation [she]2216-this mysterious woman had till this very night preserved ? But so it was . In the face of all [we]2456-we had seen it was difficult for [us]2456-we as [ordinary reasoning men]4403-ordinary reasoning men any longer to doubt its truth , and therefore at last , with humble hearts and a deep sense of the impotence of human knowledge , and the insolence of its assumption that denies that to be possible which it has no experience of , [we]2456-we laid [ourselves]2456-we down to sleep , leaving [our]2456-we fates in the hands of that watching Providence which had thus chosen to allow [us]2456-we to draw the veil of human ignorance , and reveal to [us]2456-we for good or evil some glimpse of the possibilities of life .[2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened]

XXII

[JOB]137-job HAS A PRESENTIMENT

It was nine o'clock on the following morning when [Job , who still looked scared and frightened]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened , came in to call [me]0-i , and at the same time breathe [his]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened gratitude at finding [us]2456-we alive in [our]2456-we beds , which it appeared was more than [he]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened had expected . When [I]0-i told [him]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened of the awful end of [poor Ustane]172-ustane [he]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened was even more grateful at [our]2456-we survival , and much shocked , though [Ustane]172-ustane had been no favourite of [his]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened , or [he]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened of [hers]2460-her , for the matter of that . [She]2460-her called [him]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened " pig "[2460-her] in bastard Arabic , and [he]2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened called [her]2460-her " hussy "[2459-job , who still looked scared and frightened] in good English , but these amenities were forgotten in the face of the catastrophe that had overwhelmed [her]2460-her at the hands of [[her]2460-her Queen]2461-her queen .

" [I]137-job do n't want to say anything as may n't be agreeable , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] said [Job]137-job , when [he]137-job had finished exclaiming at [my]0-i tale , " but it 's [my]137-job opinion that that there [She]2460-her is [the old gentleman]909-the old gentleman [himself]909-the old gentleman , or perhaps [[his]909-the old gentleman wife]3066-his wife , if [he]909-the old gentleman has one , which [I]137-job suppose [he]909-the old gentleman has , for [he]909-the old gentleman could n't be so wicked all by [himself]909-the old gentleman . [The Witch of Endor]4407-the witch of endor was a fool to [her]4407-the witch of endor , [sir]3126-sir : bless [you]3126-sir , [she]4407-the witch of endor would make no more of raising [every gentleman in the Bible]4409-every gentleman in the bible out of these [here beastly tombs]4410-here beastly tombs than [I]137-job should of growing cress on an old flannel . [It]4411-it 's [a country of devils]4412-a country of devils , this is , [sir]3126-sir , and [she]4407-the witch of endor 's [the master one of the lot]4414-the master one of the lot ; and if ever [we]4415-we get out of it it will be more than [I]137-job expect to do . [I]137-job do n't see no way out of it . [That witch]4416-that witch is n't likely to let [a fine young man]4417-a fine young man like [Mr. Leo]108-leo go . "[137-job]

" Come , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " at any rate [she]4416-that witch saved [his]108-leo life . "[0-i]

" Yes , and [she]4416-that witch 'll take [his]108-leo soul to pay for it . [She]4416-that witch 'll make [him]108-leo [a witch]4418-a witch , like [herself]4416-that witch . [I]137-job say it 's wicked to have anything to do with [those sort of people]4419-those sort of people . Last night , [sir]3126-sir , [I]137-job lay awake and read in [my]137-job little Bible that [[my]137-job poor old mother]4421-my poor old mother gave [me]137-job about what is going to happen to [sorceresses]4422-sorceresses and [them]4422-sorceresses sort , till [my]137-job hair stood on end . [Lord]4423-lord , how [the old lady]4424-the old lady would stare if [she]4424-the old lady saw where [her]4424-the old lady Job had got to ! "[137-job]

" Yes , it 's [a queer country]4425-a queer country , and [a queer people]4426-a queer people too , [Job]137-job , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , with a sigh , for , though [I]0-i am not superstitious like [Job]137-job , [I]0-i admit to a natural shrinking which will not bear investigation from the things that are above Nature .

" [You]0-i are right , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] [he]137-job answered , " and if [you]3126-sir wo n't think [me]108-leo very foolish , [I]108-leo should like to say something to [you]3126-sir now that [Mr. Leo]108-leo is out of the way "[108-leo] - [Leo]108-leo had got up early and gone for a stroll - " and that is that [I]108-leo know it is [the last country as ever [I]108-leo shall see in [this world]350-this world]4428-the last country as ever i shall see in this world . [I]108-leo had a dream last night , and [I]108-leo dreamed that [I]108-leo saw [[my]108-leo old father]4430-my old father with a kind of night - shirt on [him]4430-my old father , something like [these folks]4431-these folks wear when [they]4431-these folks want to be in particular full - dress , and a bit of that feathery grass in [his]4430-my old father hand , which [he]4430-my old father may have gathered on the way , for [I]108-leo saw lots of it yesterday about three hundred yards from [the mouth of [this beastly cave]4433-this beastly cave]4432-the mouth of this beastly cave .[108-leo]

" ' Job , ' [he]4430-my old father said to [me]108-leo , solemn like , and yet with a kind of satisfaction shining through [him]4430-my old father , more like [a Methody parson]4434-a methody parson when [he]4430-my old father has sold [a neighbour]4435-a neighbour a marked horse for a sound one and cleared twenty pounds by the job than anything [I]108-leo can think on - ' Job , time 's up , [Job]137-job ; but [I]108-leo never did expect to have to come and hunt [you]137-job out in this ' ere place , [Job]137-job . ' "[108-leo]

" Regular cautions , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

"[137-job]

" Surely , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [you]3126-sir do n't think that [you]3126-sir are going to die because [you]3126-sir dreamed [you]3126-sir saw [[your]3126-sir old father]4445-your old father ; if [one]328-one dies because one dreams of [[one]328-one 's father]4448-one 's father , what happens to [a man who dreams of [[his]4449-a man who dreams of his mother - in - law mother - in - law]4450-his mother - in - law]4449-a man who dreams of his mother - in - law ? "[0-i]

" Ah , [sir]3126-sir , [you]3126-sir 're laughing at [me]137-job , "[137-job] said [Job]137-job ; " but , [you]3126-sir see , [you]3126-sir did n't know [[my]137-job old father]4430-my old father . No , [sir]3126-sir ; [I]137-job know that [he]3091-my father meant business . Well , [sir]3126-sir , [I]137-job ca n't help it ; [I]137-job suppose [every man]4169-every man must go some time or other , though it is a hard thing to die in a place like this , where Christian burial is n't to be had for its weight in gold . [I]137-job 've tried to be [a good man]4460-a good man , [sir]3126-sir , and do [my]137-job duty honest , and if it was n't for the supercilus kind of way in which [father]331-father carried on last night - a sort of sniffing at [me]137-job as it were , as though [he]331-father had n't no opinion of [my]137-job references and testimonials - [I]137-job should feel easy enough in [my]137-job mind . Any way , [sir]3126-sir , [I]137-job 've been [a good servant to [you]3126-sir]4464-a good servant to you and [Mr. Leo]108-leo , bless [him]3091-my father ! - why , it seems but the other day that [I]137-job used to lead [him]3091-my father about [the streets]4465-the streets with a penny whip ; - and if ever [you]3126-sir get out of [this place]3339-this place - which , as [father]331-father did n't allude to [you]3126-sir , perhaps [you]3126-sir may - [I]137-job hope [you]3126-sir will think kindly of [my]137-job whitened bones , and never have anything more to do with Greek writing on flower - pots , [sir]3126-sir , if [I]137-job may make so bold as to say so . "[137-job]

" Come , come , [Job]137-job , "[0-i] [I]0-i said seriously , " this is all nonsense , [you]137-job know . [You]137-job must n't be silly enough to go getting such ideas into [your]137-job head . [We]4469-we 've lived through some queer things , and [I]0-i hope that [we]4469-we may go on doing so . "[0-i]

" No , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] answered [Job]137-job , in a tone of conviction that jarred on [me]0-i unpleasantly , " it is n't nonsense . [I]137-job 'm [a doomed man]4471-a doomed man , and [I]137-job feel it , and a wonderful uncomfortable feeling it is , [sir]3126-sir , for one ca n't help wondering how it 's going to come about . If [you]3126-sir are eating [your]3126-sir dinner [you]3126-sir think of poison and it goes against [your]3126-sir stomach , and if [you]3126-sir are walking along these dark rabbit - burrows [you]3126-sir think of knives , and [Lord]4473-lord , do n't [you]3126-sir just shiver about the back ! " Nonsense , "[0-i] [I]0-i broke in angrily , " nonsense ! "[0-i]

" Very well , [sir]3126-sir , "[137-job] said [Job]137-job , " it is n't [my]137-job place to differ from [you]3126-sir , [sir]3126-sir , but if [you]3126-sir happen to be going anywhere , [sir]3126-sir , [I]137-job should be obliged if [you]3126-sir could manage to take [me]137-job with [you]3126-sir , seeing that [I]137-job shall be glad to have a friendly face to look at when the time comes , just to help one through , as it were . And now , [sir]3126-sir , [I]137-job 'll be getting the breakfast , "[137-job] and [he]137-job went , leaving [me]0-i in a very uncomfortable state of mind . [I]0-i was deeply attached to [old Job]137-job , who was [one of the best and honestest men [I]0-i have ever had to do with in any class of life , and really more of [a friend]257-a friend than [a servant]2464-a servant]2462-one of the best and honestest men i have ever had to do with in any class of life , and really more of a friend than a servant , and the mere idea of anything happening to [him]137-job brought a lump into [my]0-i throat . Beneath all [his]137-job ludicrous talk [I]0-i could see that [he]137-job [himself]137-job was quite convinced that something was going to happen , and though in most cases these convictions turn out to be utter moonshine - and this particular one especially was to be amply accounted for by the gloomy and unaccustomed surroundings in which [its victim]2465-its victim was placed - still it did more or less carry a chill to [my]0-i heart , as any dread that is obviously a genuine object of belief is apt to do , however absurd the belief may be . Presently the breakfast arrived , and with it [Leo]108-leo , who had been taking a walk outside [the cave]936-the cave - to clear [his]108-leo mind , [he]108-leo said - and very glad [I]0-i was to see both , for [they]2467-they gave [me]0-i a respite from [my]0-i gloomy thoughts . After breakfast [we]2468-we went for another walk , and watched some of [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger sowing [a plot of ground]2469-a plot of ground with the grain from which [they]2470-they make [their]2470-they beer . This [they]2470-they did in scriptural fashion - [a man with a bag made of goat 's hide fastened round [his]2471-a man with a bag made of goat 's hide fastened round his waist waist]2471-a man with a bag made of goat 's hide fastened round his waist walking up and down [the plot]2472-the plot and scattering the seed as [he]2471-a man with a bag made of goat 's hide fastened round his waist went . It was a positive relief to see [one of [these dreadful people]2474-these dreadful people]2473-one of these dreadful people do anything so homely and pleasant as sow a field , perhaps because it seemed to link [them]2470-they , as it were , with the rest of [humanity]646-humanity .

As [we]2468-we were returning [Billali]137-job met [us]2468-we , and informed [us]2468-we that it was [She]2476-her 's pleasure that [we]2468-we should wait upon [her]2476-her , and accordingly [we]2468-we entered [her]2476-her presence , not without trepidation , for [Ayesha]114-ayesha was certainly an exception to the rule . Familiarity with [her]2476-her might and did breed passion and wonder and horror , but it certainly did not breed contempt .

[We]2468-we were as usual shown in by [the mutes]1948-the mutes , and after these had retired [Ayesha]114-ayesha unveiled , and once more bade [Leo]108-leo embrace [her]114-ayesha , which , notwithstanding [his]108-leo heart - searchings of the previous night , [he]108-leo did with more alacrity and fervour than in strictness courtesy required .

[She]114-ayesha laid [her]114-ayesha white hand on [his]108-leo head , and looked [him]108-leo fondly in the eyes . " Dost [thou]4481-thou wonder , [[my]114-ayesha Kallikrates]4350-my kallikrates , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , " when [thou]4481-thou shalt call [me]114-ayesha all thine own , and when [we]2468-we shall of a truth be for [one another]4483-one another and to [one another]4483-one another ? [I]114-ayesha will tell [thee]108-leo . First , must [thou]4481-thou be even as [I]114-ayesha am , not immortal indeed , for that [I]114-ayesha am not , but so cased and hardened against the attacks of Time that [his]108-leo arrows shall glance from the armour of [thy]4481-thou vigorous life as the sunbeams glance from water . As yet [I]114-ayesha may not mate with [thee]4481-thou , for [thou]4481-thou and [I]114-ayesha are different , and the very brightness of [my]114-ayesha being would burn [thee]4481-thou up , and perchance destroy [thee]4481-thou . [Thou]2478-thou couldst not even endure to look upon [me]114-ayesha for too long a time lest thine eyes should ache , and [thy]4481-thou senses swim , and therefore "[114-ayesha] with a little nod ' shall [I]0-i presently veil [myself]0-i again . " This by the way [she]4481-thou did not do . "[114-ayesha] No : listen , [thou]2478-thou shalt not be tried beyond endurance , for this very evening , an hour before the sun goes down , shall [we]2479-we start hence , and by to - morrow 's dark , if all goes well , and [the road]2480-the road is not lost to [me]0-i , which [I]0-i pray it may not be , shall [we]2479-we stand in the place of Life , and [thou]2478-thou shalt bathe in the fire , and come forth glorified , as [no man]3309-no man ever was before [thee]2478-thou , and then , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , shalt [thou]2478-thou call [me]0-i [wife]2023-wife , and [I]0-i will call [thee]2478-thou [husband]3233-husband . "[0-i]

[Leo]108-leo muttered something in answer to this astonishing statement , [I]0-i do not know what , and [she]2023-wife laughed a little at [his]108-leo confusion , and went on .

" And [thou]2478-thou , too , oh [Holly]109-holly ; on [thee]2478-thou also will [I]2023-wife confer this boon , and then of a truth shalt [thou]2478-thou be evergreen , and this will [I]2023-wife do - well , because [thou]2478-thou hast pleased [me]2023-wife , [Holly]109-holly , for [thou]2478-thou art not altogether [a fool]4485-a fool , like most of [the sons of men]4486-the sons of men , and because , though [thou]2478-thou hast a school of philosophy as full of nonsense as those of the old days , yet hast [thou]2478-thou not forgotten how to turn a pretty phrase about [a lady]2457-a lady 's eyes . "[2023-wife]

" Hulloa , [old fellow]3147-old fellow ! "[108-leo] whispered [Leo]108-leo , with a return of [his]108-leo old cheerfulness , " have [you]3147-old fellow been paying compliments ? [I]108-leo should never have thought it of [you]3147-old fellow ! "[108-leo]

" [I]0-i thank [thee]3147-old fellow , [oh Ayesha]114-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , with as much dignity as [I]0-i could command , " but if there be such a place as [thou]2478-thou dost describe , and if in [this strange place]4489-this strange place there may be found a fiery virtue that can hold off Death when [he]108-leo comes to pluck [us]4490-our by the hand , yet would [I]0-i none of it . For [me]0-i , oh [Ayesha]114-ayesha , [the world]252-the world has not proved so soft a nest that [I]0-i would lie in it for ever . [A stony - hearted mother]4492-a stony - hearted mother is [our]4490-our earth , and stones are the bread [she]4492-a stony - hearted mother gives [[her]4492-a stony - hearted mother children]4493-her children for [their]4493-her children daily food . Stones to eat and bitter water for [their]4493-her children thirst , and stripes for tender nurture . Who would endure this for many lives ? Who would so load up [his]108-leo back with memories of lost hours and loves , and of [[his]108-leo neighbour]4494-his neighbour 's sorrows that [he]108-leo can not lessen , and wisdom that brings not consolation ? Hard is it to die , because [our]4490-our delicate flesh doth shrink back from the worm it will not feel , and from that unknown which the winding - sheet doth curtain from [our]4490-our view . But harder still , to [my]0-i fancy , would it be to live on , green in the leaf and fair , but dead and rotten at the core , and feel that other secret worm of recollection gnawing ever at the heart . "[0-i]

" Bethink [thee]0-i , [Holly]109-holly , "[2484-she] [she]2484-she said ; " yet doth long life and strength and beauty beyond measure mean power and all things that are dear to [man]3189-man . "[2484-she]

" And what , oh [Queen]189-queen , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " are those things that are dear to [man]3189-man ? Are they not bubbles ? Is not ambition but an endless ladder by which no height is ever climbed till the last unreachable rung is mounted ? For height leads on to height , and there is no resting - place upon them , and rung doth grow upon rung , and there is no limit to the number . Doth not wealth satiate , and become nauseous , and no longer serve to satisfy or pleasure , or to buy an hour 's peace of mind ? And is there any end to wisdom that [we]4490-our may hope to reach it ? Rather , the more [we]4490-our learn , shall [we]4490-our not thereby be able only to better compass out [our]4490-our ignorance ? Did [we]4490-our live ten thousand years could [we]4490-our hope to solve the secrets of the suns , and of [the space beyond the suns]4497-the space beyond the suns , and of the Hand that hung them in the heavens ? Would not [our]4490-our wisdom be but as a gnawing hunger calling [our]4490-our consciousness day by day to a knowledge of the empty craving of [our]4490-our souls ? Would it not be but as a light in one of [these great caverns]4498-these great caverns , that , though bright it burn , and brighter yet , doth but the more serve to show the depths of the gloom around it ? And what good thing is there beyond that [we]4490-our may gain by length of days ? "[0-i]

" Nay , [[my]2484-she [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , there is love - love which makes all things beautiful , and doth breathe divinity into the very dust [we]4490-our tread . With love shall life roll gloriously on from year to year , like the voice of some great music that hath power to hold [the hearer]4500-the hearer 's heart poised on eagles ' wings above the sordid shame and folly of [the earth]659-the earth . "[2484-she]

" It may be so , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " but if [the loved one]4502-the loved one prove a broken reed to pierce [us]4490-our , or if the love be loved in vain - what then ? Shall [a man]352-a man grave [his]352-a man sorrows upon a stone when [he]352-a man hath but need to write them on the water ? Nay , oh [She]3913-my holly , [I]0-i will live [my]0-i day , and grow old with [my]0-i generation , and die [my]0-i appointed death , and be forgotten . For [I]0-i do hope for an immortality to which the little span that perchance [thou]4504-thou canst confer will be but as a finger 's length laid against the measure of [the great world]4505-the great world ; and , mark this ! the immortality to which [I]0-i look , and which [my]0-i faith doth promise [me]0-i , shall be free from the bonds that here must tie [my]0-i spirit down . For , while the flesh endures , sorrow and evil and the scorpion whips of sin must endure also ; but when the flesh hath fallen from [us]4490-our , then shall the spirit shine forth clad in the brightness of eternal good , and for its common air shall breathe so rare an ether of most noble thoughts that the highest aspiration of [[our]4490-our manhood]4506-our manhood , or the purest incense of [a maiden]4507-a maiden 's prayer , would prove too earthly gross to float therein . "[0-i]

" [Thou]4504-thou lookest high , "[114-ayesha] answered [Ayesha]114-ayesha , with a little laugh , " and speakest clearly as a trumpet and with no uncertain sound . And yet methinks that but now didst [thou]4504-thou talk of ' that Unknown ' from which the winding - sheet doth curtain [us]4490-our . But perchance , [thou]4504-thou seest with the eye of Faith , gazing on that brightness , that is to be , through the painted - glass of [thy]4504-thou imagination . Strange are the pictures of the future that [mankind]985-mankind can thus draw with this brush of faith and this many - coloured pigment of imagination ! Strange , too , that no one of [them]4509-them doth agree with another ! [I]114-ayesha could tell [thee]4504-thou - but there , what is the use ? why rob [a fool]4485-a fool of [his]4485-a fool bauble ? Let it pass , and [I]114-ayesha pray , oh [Holly]109-holly , that when [thou]4504-thou dost feel old age creeping slowly toward [thyself]4511-thyself , and the confusion of senility making havoc in [thy]4504-thou brain , [thou]4504-thou mayest not bitterly regret that [thou]4504-thou didst cast away the imperial boon [I]114-ayesha would have given to [thee]4504-thou . But so it hath ever been ; [man]3189-man can never be content with that which [his]3189-man hand can pluck . If a lamp be in [his]3189-man reach to light [him]3189-man through the darkness , [he]3189-man must needs cast it down because it is no star . [Happiness]235-happiness danceth ever apace before [him]3189-man , like the marsh - fires in [the swamps]3176-the swamps , and [he]3189-man must catch the fire , and [he]3189-man must hold the star ! Beauty is naught to [him]3189-man , because there are lips more honey - sweet ; and wealth is naught , because [others]309-others can weigh [him]3189-man down with heavier shekels ; and fame is naught , because there have been [greater men]4515-greater men than [he]3189-man . [Thyself]4504-thou [thou]4504-thou saidst it , and [I]114-ayesha turn [thy]4504-thou words against [thee]4504-thou . Well , [thou]4504-thou dreamest that [thou]4504-thou shalt pluck the star . [I]114-ayesha believe it not , and [I]114-ayesha think [thee]4504-thou [a fool]4485-a fool , [[my]114-ayesha [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , to throw away the lamp . "[114-ayesha]

[I]0-i made no answer , for [I]0-i could not - especially before [Leo]108-leo - tell [her]2485-her that since [I]0-i had seen [her]2485-her face [I]0-i knew that it would always be before [my]0-i eyes , and that [I]0-i had no wish to prolong an existence which must always be haunted and tortured by [her]2485-her memory , and by the last bitterness of unsatisfied love . But so it was , and so , alas , is it to this hour !

" And now , "[2485-her] went on [She]2485-her , changing [her]2485-her tone and the subject together , " tell [me]2485-her , [[my]2485-her [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates]4350-my kallikrates , for as yet [I]2485-her know it not , how came [ye]108-leo to seek [me]2485-her [here]3102-here ? Yesternight [thou]108-leo didst say that [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates - [him]118-kallikrates whom [thou]108-leo sawest - was thine ancestor . How was it ? Tell [me]2485-her - [thou]108-leo dost not speak overmuch ! "[2485-her]

Thus adjured , [Leo]108-leo told [her]2485-her the wonderful story of the casket and of the potsherd that , written on by [[his]108-leo ancestress]2486-his ancestress , [the Egyptian Amenartas]2487-the egyptian amenartas , had been the means of guiding [us]2488-us to [her]2485-her . [Ayesha]114-ayesha listened intently , and , when [he]108-leo had finished , spoke to [me]0-i .

" Did [I]114-ayesha not tell [thee]2485-her one day , when [we]2488-us did talk of good and evil , oh [Holly]109-holly - it was when [[my]114-ayesha beloved]1151-my beloved lay so ill - that out of good came evil , and out of evil good - that [they]4521-they who sowed knew not what the crop should be , nor [he]108-leo who struck where the blow should fall ? See , now : [this Egyptian Amenartas]4522-this egyptian amenartas , [this royal child of the Nile who hated [me]114-ayesha]4523-this royal child of the nile who hated me , and whom even now [I]114-ayesha hate , for in a way [she]2485-her did prevail against [me]114-ayesha - see , now , [she]2485-her [herself]2485-her hath been the very means to bring [[her]2485-her lover]316-her lover to [mine]114-ayesha arms ! For [her]2485-her sake [I]114-ayesha slew [him]316-her lover , and now , behold , through [her]2485-her [he]316-her lover hath come back to [me]114-ayesha ! [She]2485-her would have done [me]114-ayesha evil , and sowed [her]2485-her seeds that [I]114-ayesha might reap tares , and behold [she]2485-her hath given [me]114-ayesha more than all [the world]252-the world can give , and there is a strange square for [thee]4526-thou to fit into [thy]4526-thou circle of good and evil , oh [Holly]109-holly ![114-ayesha]

" And so , "[2489-she] [she]2489-she went on , after a pause - " and so [she]2485-her bade [[her]2485-her son]4527-her son destroy [me]2490-her if [he]4527-her son might , because [I]2490-her slew [[his]4527-her son father]3053-his father . And [thou]4526-thou , [[my]2490-her [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates]4350-my kallikrates , art [the father]4530-the father , and in a sense [thou]4526-thou art likewise [the son]4531-the son ; and wouldst [thou]4526-thou avenge [thy]4526-thou wrong , and the wrong of [that far - off mother of thine]4532-that far - off mother of thine , upon [me]2490-her , oh [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates ? See , "[2490-her] and [she]2490-her slid to [her]2490-her knees , and drew the white corsage still farther down [her]2490-her ivory bosom - ' see , here beats [my]0-i heart , and there by [thy]2491-thou side is a knife , heavy , and long , and sharp , the very knife to slay [an erring woman]2492-an erring woman with . Take it now , and be avenged . Strike , and strike [home]648-home ! - so shalt [thou]2491-thou be satisfied , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , and go through life [a happy man]2494-a happy man , because [thou]2491-thou hast paid back the wrong , and obeyed the mandate of the past . "[2495-i]

[He]2495-i looked at [her]2490-her , and then stretched out [his]2495-i hand and lifted [her]2490-her to [her]2490-her feet .

" Rise , [Ayesha]114-ayesha , "[2495-i] [he]2495-i said sadly ; " well [thou]2491-thou knowest that [I]2495-i can not strike [thee]2490-her , no , not even for the sake of [her]2490-her whom [thou]2491-thou slewest but last night . [I]2495-i am in [thy]2491-thou power , and [a very slave to [thee]2490-her]4533-a very slave to thee . How can [I]2495-i kill [thee]2490-her ? - sooner should [I]2495-i slay [myself]2495-i . "[2495-i]

" Almost dost [thou]2491-thou begin to love [me]2490-her , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , "[2490-her] [she]2490-her answered , smiling . " And now tell [me]2490-her of [[thy]2491-thou country]4119-thy country - ' tis [a great people]3740-a great people , is it not ? with [an empire like that of [Rome]12-rome]4536-an empire like that of rome ! Surely [thou]2496-thou wouldst return thither , and it is well , for [I]2490-her mean not that [thou]2496-thou shouldst dwell in [these caves of [K"r]56-k"r]4084-these caves of k"r[2490-her] . Nay , when once [thou]2496-thou art even as [I]0-i am , [we]2497-we will go hence - fear not but that [I]0-i shall find a path - and then shall [we]2497-we journey to [this [England]15-england of thine]2498-this england of thine , and live as it becometh [us]2497-we to live . Two thousand years have [I]0-i waited for the day when [I]0-i should see the last of [these hateful caves]2499-these hateful caves and this gloomy - visaged folk , and now it is at hand , and [my]0-i heart bounds up to meet it like [a child]411-a child 's towards its holiday . For [thou]2496-thou shalt rule [this England]2501-this england - - "[2496-thou]

" But [we]2497-we have [a queen]1102-a queen already , "[108-leo] broke in [Leo]108-leo , hastily .

" It is naught , it is naught , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha ; ' [she]2502-she can be overthrown . "[114-ayesha]

At this [we]2497-we both broke out into an exclamation of dismay , and explained that [we]2497-we should as soon think of overthrowing [ourselves]2497-we .

" But here is a strange thing , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , in astonishment ; " [a queen whom [[her]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms people]1984-her people love]4539-a queen whom her people love ! Surely [the world]252-the world must have changed since [I]114-ayesha dwelt in [K"r]56-k"r[114-ayesha] . "[114-ayesha]

Again [we]2497-we explained that it was the character of [monarchs]2503-monarchs that had changed , and that [the one under whom [we]2497-we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in [[her]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms vast realms]2505-her vast realms]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms . Also , [we]2497-we told [her]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms that real power in [[our]2497-we country]3481-our country rested in the hands of [the people]3344-the people , and that [we]2497-we were in fact ruled by [the votes of [the lower and least educated classes of [the community]983-the community]2509-the lower and least educated classes of the community]2508-the votes of the lower and least educated classes of the community .

" Ah , "[2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms] [she]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms said , " a democracy - then surely there is [a tyrant]4542-a tyrant , for [I]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms have long since seen [that democracies , having no clear will of]4543-that democracies , having no clear will of [their]4543-that democracies , having no clear will of own , in the end set up [a tyrant]4542-a tyrant , and worship [him]4542-a tyrant . "[2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [we]2497-we have [[our]2497-we tyrants]4545-our tyrants . "[0-i]

" Well , "[2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms] [she]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms answered resignedly , " [we]2497-we can at any rate destroy [these tyrants]4546-these tyrants , and [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates shall rule [the land]670-the land . "[2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms]

[I]0-i instantly informed [Ayesha]114-ayesha that in [England]15-england " blasting "[2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms] was not an amusement that could be indulged in with impunity , and that any such attempt would meet with the consideration of the law and probably end upon a scaffold .

" The law , "[2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms] [she]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms laughed with scorn - " the law ! Canst [thou]4548-thou not understand , oh [Holly]109-holly , that [I]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms am above the law , and so shall [[my]2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates]4350-my kallikrates be also ? All human law will be to [us]2497-we as the north wind to [a mountain]4550-a mountain . Does the wind bend [the mountain]1457-the mountain , or [the mountain]1457-the mountain the wind ? "[2504-the one under whom we lived was venerated and beloved by all right - thinking people in her vast realms]

" And now leave [me]2511-i , [I]2511-i pray [thee]114-ayesha , and [thou]4548-thou too , [my]2511-i own [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , for [I]2511-i would get [me]2511-i ready against [our]2497-we journey , and so must [ye]114-ayesha both , and [[your]114-ayesha servant]4553-your servant also . But bring no great quantity of things with [thee]114-ayesha , for [I]2511-i trust that [we]2497-we shall be but three days gone . Then shall [we]2497-we return hither , and [I]2511-i will make a plan whereby [we]2497-we can bid farewell for ever to [these sepulchres of [K"r]56-k"r]4554-these sepulchres of k"r[2511-i] . [Yea]2511-i , surely [thou]2512-thou mayst kiss [my]0-i hand ! "[2512-thou]

So [we]2513-we went , [I]0-i , for one , meditating deeply on the awful nature of the problem that now opened out before [us]2513-we . The terrible [She]2514-her had evidently made up [her]2514-her mind to go to [England]15-england , and it made [me]0-i absolutely shudder to think what would be the result of [her]2514-her arrival [there]3168-there . What [her]2514-her powers were [I]0-i knew , and [I]0-i could not doubt but that [she]2514-her would exercise them to the full . It might be possible to control [her]2514-her for a while , but [her]2514-her proud , ambitious spirit would be certain to break loose and avenge itself for the long centuries of its solitude . [She]2514-her would , if necessary , and if the power of [her]2514-her beauty did not unaided prove equal to the occasion , blast [her]2514-her way to any end [she]2514-her set before [her]2514-her , and , as [she]2514-her could not die , and for aught [I]0-i knew could not even be killed , what was there to stop [her]2514-her ? In the end [she]2514-her would , [I]0-i had little doubt , assume absolute rule over [the British dominions]2516-the british dominions , and probably over [the whole earth]2517-the whole earth , and , though [I]0-i was sure that [she]2514-her would speedily make [ours]2518-we [the most glorious and prosperous empire that [the world]252-the world]2519-the most glorious and prosperous empire that the world has ever seen , it would be at the cost of a terrible sacrifice of life .

[I]0-i regret to say that [I]0-i was never able to ascertain if [She]2514-her was invulnerable against the ordinary accidents of life . Presumably this was so , else some misadventure would have been sure to put an end to [her]2514-her in the course of so many centuries . True , [she]2514-her offered to let [Leo]108-leo slay [her]2514-her , but very probably this was only an experiment to try [his]108-leo temper and mental attitude towards [her]2514-her . [Ayesha]114-ayesha never gave way to impulse without some valid object . - L. H. H.

The whole thing sounded like a dream or some extraordinary invention of a speculative brain , and yet it was a fact - a wonderful fact - of which [the whole world]3997-the whole world would soon be called on to take notice . What was the meaning of it all ? After much thinking [I]0-i could only conclude that this marvellous creature , whose passion had kept [her]2514-her for so many centuries chained as it were , and comparatively harmless , was now about to be used by [Providence]179-providence as a means to change the order of [the world]252-the world , and possibly , by the building up of a power that could no more be rebelled against or questioned than the decrees of [Fate]236-fate , to change it materially for the better .

XXIII

[THE TEMPLE OF TRUTH]2523-the temple of truth

[Our]2518-we preparations did not take [us]2518-we very long . [We]2518-we put a change of clothing apiece and some spare boots into [my]0-i Gladstone bag , also [we]2518-we took [our]2518-we revolvers and an express rifle each , together with a good supply of ammunition , a precaution to which , under [Providence]179-providence , [we]2518-we subsequently owed [our]2518-we lives over and over again . The rest of [our]2518-we gear , together with [our]2518-we heavy rifles , [we]2518-we left behind [us]2518-we .

A few minutes before the appointed time [we]2518-we once more attended in [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's boudoir , and found [her]114-ayesha also ready , [her]114-ayesha dark cloak thrown over [her]114-ayesha winding - sheetlike wrappings .

" Are [ye]0-i prepared for the great venture ? "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said .

" [We]2518-we are , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " though for [my]0-i part , [Ayesha]114-ayesha , [I]0-i have no faith in it . "[0-i]

" Ah , [[my]114-ayesha [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , " [thou]4556-thou art of a truth like [those old Jews]4557-those old jews - of whom the memory vexes [me]114-ayesha so sorely - unbelieving , and hard to accept that which [they]4557-those old jews have not known . But [thou]4556-thou shalt see ; for unless [my]114-ayesha mirror beyond lies , "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha pointed to the font of crystal water , " the path is yet open as it was of old time . And now let [us]2524-we start upon the new life which shall end - who knoweth where ? "[114-ayesha]

" Ah , "[0-i] [I]0-i echoed , " who knoweth where ? "[0-i] and [we]2524-we passed down into [the great central cave]1820-the great central cave , and out into the light of day .
