At [the mouth of [the cave]936-the cave]1328-the mouth of the cave [we]2524-we found a single litter with [six bearers]2528-six bearers , all of [them]2528-six bearers mutes , waiting , and with [them]2528-six bearers [I]0-i was relieved to see [[our]2524-we old friend]2529-our old friend [Billali]137-job , for whom [I]0-i had conceived a sort of affection . It appeared that , for reasons not necessary to explain at length , [Ayesha]114-ayesha had thought it best that , with the exception of [herself]114-ayesha , [we]2524-we should proceed on foot , and this [we]2524-we were nothing loth to do , after [our]2524-we long confinement in [these caves]3807-these caves , which , however suitable they might be for sarcophagi - a singularly inappropriate word , by the way , for [these particular tombs]2531-these particular tombs , which certainly did not consume the bodies given to [their]2531-these particular tombs keeping - were depressing habitations for [breathing mortals like [ourselves]2524-we]2532-breathing mortals like ourselves . Either by accident or by the orders of [She]114-ayesha , the space in front of [the cave where [we]2524-we had beheld that awful dance]2533-the cave where we had beheld that awful dance was perfectly clear of [spectators]2534-spectators . [Not a soul]2535-not a soul was to be seen , and consequently [I]0-i do not believe that [our]2524-we departure was known to [anybody]3032-anybody , except perhaps [the mutes who waited on [She]114-ayesha]2537-the mutes who waited on she , and [they]2537-the mutes who waited on she were , of course , in the habit of keeping what [they]2537-the mutes who waited on she saw to [themselves]2537-the mutes who waited on she .

In a few minutes ' time [we]2524-we were stepping out sharply across [the great cultivated plain]2538-the great cultivated plain or [lake bed]2539-lake bed , framed like a vast emerald in [its]2540-its setting of [frowning cliff]2541-frowning cliff , and had another opportunity of wondering at the extraordinary nature of the site chosen by [these old people of [K"r]56-k"r]4558-these old people of k"r for [[their]4558-these old people of k"r capital]4559-their capital , and at the marvellous amount of labour , ingenuity , and engineering skill that must have been brought into requisition by [the founders of [the city]3964-the city]4560-the founders of the city to drain so huge a sheet of water , and to keep it clear of subsequent accumulations . It is , indeed , so far as [my]4558-these old people of k"r experience goes , an unequalled instance of what [man]3189-man can do in the face of nature , for in [my]4558-these old people of k"r opinion such achievements as [the Suez Canal]4563-the suez canal or even [the Mont Cenis Tunnel]4564-the mont cenis tunnel do not approach this ancient undertaking in magnitude and grandeur of conception .[4558-these old people of k"r]

When [we]2524-we had been walking for about half an hour , enjoying [ourselves]2524-we exceedingly in the delightful cool which about this time of the day always appeared to descend upon [the great plain of [K"r]56-k"r]4565-the great plain of k"r , and which in some degree atoned for the want of any land or [sea breeze]4566-sea breeze - for all wind was kept off by [the rocky mountain wall]4567-the rocky mountain wall - [we]2524-we began to get a clear view of what [Billali]137-job had informed [us]2524-we were [the ruins of [the great city]4569-the great city]4568-the ruins of the great city . And even from that distance [we]2524-we could see how wonderful [those ruins]4570-those ruins were , a fact which with every step [we]2524-we took became more evident . [The town]4571-the town was not very large if compared to [Babylon]87-babylon or [Thebes]88-thebes , or [other cities of remote antiquity]4572-other cities of remote antiquity ; perhaps [its]4571-the town outer wall contained some twelve square miles of ground , or a little more . Nor had the walls , so far as [we]2524-we could judge when [we]2524-we reached [them]2543-they , been very high , probably not more than forty feet , which was about [their]2543-they present height where [they]2543-they had not through the sinking of the ground , or some such cause , fallen into ruin . The reason of this , no doubt , was that [the people of [K"r]56-k"r]4011-the people of k"r[4558-these old people of k"r] , being protected from any outside attack by far more tremendous ramparts than any that the hand of [man]3189-man could rear , only required [them]2543-they for show and to guard against civil discord . But on the other hand [they]2543-they were as broad as [they]2543-they were high , built entirely of dressed stone , hewn , no doubt , from [the vast caves]2544-the vast caves , and surrounded by a great moat about sixty feet in width , some reaches of which were still filled with water . About ten minutes before the sun finally sank [we]2545-we reached [this moat]2546-this moat , and passed down and through [it]2546-this moat , clambering across what evidently were the piled - up fragments of [a great bridge]2547-a great bridge in order to do so , and then with some little difficulty over the slope of the wall to [its]2546-this moat summit . [I]0-i wish that it lay within the power of [my]0-i pen to give some idea of the grandeur of the sight that then met [our]2545-we view . There , all bathed in the red glow of the sinking sun , were miles upon miles of ruins - columns , [temples]2548-temples , [shrines]2549-shrines , and [the palaces of [kings]1325-kings]2550-the palaces of kings , varied with patches of green bush . Of course , the roofs of [these buildings]2552-these buildings had long since fallen into decay and vanished , but owing to the extreme massiveness of the style of building , and to the hardness and durability of the rock employed , most of the party walls and great columns still remained standing .

In connection with the extraordinary state of preservation of [these ruins]2553-these ruins after so vast a lapse of time - at least six thousand years - it must be remembered that [K"r]56-k"r was not burnt or destroyed by [an enemy]4574-an enemy or an earthquake , but deserted , owing to the action of a terrible plague . Consequently [the houses]4575-the houses were left unharmed ; also the climate of [the plain]1452-the plain is remarkably fine and dry , and there is very little rain or wind ; as a result of which these relics have only to contend against the unaided action of time , that works but slowly upon such massive blocks of masonry . - L. H. H.[2545-we]

Straight before [us]2545-we stretched away what had evidently been [the main thoroughfare of [the city]3964-the city]2554-the main thoroughfare of the city , for [it]2556-it was very wide , wider than [the Thames Embankment]89-the thames embankment , and regular , being , as [we]2545-we afterwards discovered , paved , or rather built , throughout of blocks of dressed stone , such as were employed in the walls , it was but little overgrown even now with grass and shrubs that could get no depth of soil to live in . What had been [the parks and gardens]2557-the parks and gardens , on the contrary , were now dense jungle . Indeed , it was easy even from a distance to trace the course of [the various roads]2558-the various roads by the burnt - up appearance of the scanty grass that grew upon [them]2558-the various roads . On either side of [this great thoroughfare]2559-this great thoroughfare were vast blocks of ruins , each block , generally speaking , being separated from [its]2560-its neighbour by a space of what had once , [I]0-i suppose , been garden - ground , but was now dense and tangled bush . [They]2552-these buildings were all built of the same coloured stone , and most of [them]2552-these buildings had pillars , which was as much as [we]2545-we could make out in the fading light as [we]2545-we passed swiftly up [the main road]2561-the main road , that [I]0-i believe [I]0-i am right in saying [no living foot]2562-no living foot had pressed for thousands of years .

[Billali]137-job told [me]0-i that [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger believe that [the site of [the city]3964-the city]2563-the site of the city is haunted , and could not be persuaded to enter [it]2563-the site of the city upon any consideration . Indeed , [I]0-i could see that [he]137-job [himself]137-job did not at all like doing so , and was only consoled by the reflection that [he]137-job was under the direct protection of [She]237-she . It struck [Leo]108-leo and [myself]0-i as very curious that [a people which has no objection to living amongst the dead , with whom [their]2565-a people which has no objection to living amongst the dead , with whom their familiarity has perhaps bred contempt , and even using their bodies for purposes of fuel familiarity has perhaps bred contempt , and even using [their]2565-a people which has no objection to living amongst the dead , with whom their familiarity has perhaps bred contempt , and even using their bodies for purposes of fuel bodies for purposes of fuel]2565-a people which has no objection to living amongst the dead , with whom their familiarity has perhaps bred contempt , and even using their bodies for purposes of fuel , should be terrified at approaching the habitations that [these very departed]2566-these very departed had occupied when alive . After all , however , it is only a savage inconsistency . - L. H. H.

Presently [we]2567-we came to an enormous pile , which [we]2567-we rightly took to be [a temple covering at least eight acres of ground , and apparently arranged in a series of courts]2568-a temple covering at least eight acres of ground , and apparently arranged in a series of courts , each one enclosing another of smaller size , on the principle of a Chinese nest of boxes , the courts being separated one from the other by rows of huge columns . And , while [I]0-i think of it , [I]0-i may as well state a remarkable thing about the shape of these columns , which resembled none that [I]0-i have ever seen or heard of , being fashioned with a kind of waist at the centre , and swelling out above and below . At first [we]2567-we thought that this shape was meant to roughly symbolise or suggest the female form , as was a common habit amongst [the ancient religious architects of many creeds]2569-the ancient religious architects of many creeds . On the following day , however , as [we]2567-we went up [the slopes of [the mountain]1457-the mountain]3616-the slopes of the mountain , [we]2567-we discovered a large quantity of the most stately looking palms , of which the trucks grew exactly in this shape , and [I]0-i have now no doubt but that [the first designer of those columns]2572-the first designer of those columns drew [his]2572-the first designer of those columns inspiration from the graceful bends of those very palms , or rather of [[their]2565-a people which has no objection to living amongst the dead , with whom their familiarity has perhaps bred contempt , and even using their bodies for purposes of fuel ancestors]2573-their ancestors , which then , some eight or ten thousand years ago , as now , beautified [the slopes of [the mountain]1457-the mountain]3616-the slopes of the mountain that had once formed [the shores of [the volcanic lake]2577-the volcanic lake]2576-the shores of the volcanic lake .

At the façade of [this huge temple]2578-this huge temple , which , [I]0-i should imagine , is almost as large as that of [El - Karnac]90-el - karnac , at [Thebes]88-thebes , some of the largest columns , which [I]0-i measured , being between eighteen to twenty feet in diameter at the base , by about seventy feet in height , [our]2567-we little procession was halted , and [Ayesha]114-ayesha descended from [her]114-ayesha litter .

" There was a spot here , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said to [Leo]108-leo , who had run up to help [her]114-ayesha down , " where one might sleep . Two thousand years ago did [thou]4577-thou and [I]114-ayesha and [that Egyptian asp]4578-that egyptian asp rest therein , but since then have [I]114-ayesha not set foot here , nor [any man]965-any man , and perchance it has fallen , "[114-ayesha] and , followed by [the rest of [us]2567-we]2338-the rest of us , [she]114-ayesha passed up a vast flight of broken and ruined steps into [the outer court]2580-the outer court , and looked round into the gloom . Presently [she]114-ayesha seemed to recollect , and , walking a few paces along the wall to the left , halted .

" It is here , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , and at the same time beckoned to [the two mutes , who were loaded with provisions]2581-the two mutes , who were loaded with provisions and [our]2567-we little belongings , to advance . [One of [them]2581-the two mutes , who were loaded with provisions]2298-one of them came forward , and , producing a lamp , lit it from [his]2298-one of them brazier for [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger when on a journey nearly always carried with [them]2581-the two mutes , who were loaded with provisions a little lighted brazier , from which to provide fire . The tinder of this brazier was made of broken fragments of mummy carefully damped , and , if the admixture of moisture was properly managed , this unholy compound would smoulder away for hours . As soon as the lamp was lit [we]2567-we entered [the place before which [Ayesha]114-ayesha had halted]2583-the place before which ayesha had halted . [It]2583-the place before which ayesha had halted turned out to be [a chamber hollowed in the thickness of the wall]2584-a chamber hollowed in the thickness of the wall , and , from the fact of there still being a massive stone table in [it]2583-the place before which ayesha had halted , [I]0-i should think that [it]2583-the place before which ayesha had halted had probably served as [a living - room]2585-a living - room , perhaps for [one of [the door - keepers of [the great temple]2588-the great temple]2587-the door - keepers of the great temple]2586-one of the door - keepers of the great temple .

After all [we]2567-we are not much in advance of [the Amahagger]1096-the amahagger in these matters . " [Mummy]238-mummy , "[1096-the amahagger] that is pounded ancient Egyptian , is , [I]0-i believe , a pigment much used by [artists]2590-artists , and especially by [those of [them]2590-artists who direct [their]2591-those of them who direct their talents to the reproduction of the works of the old masters talents to the reproduction of the works of [the old masters]2592-the old masters]2591-those of them who direct their talents to the reproduction of the works of the old masters . - Editor .

Here [we]2567-we stopped , and after cleaning [the place]1059-the place out and making [it]1059-the place as comfortable as circumstances and the darkness would permit , [we]2567-we ate some cold meat , at least [Leo]108-leo , Job and [I]0-i did , for [Ayesha]114-ayesha , as [I]0-i think [I]0-i have said elsewhere , never touched anything except cakes of flour , fruit and water . While [we]2567-we were still eating , the moon , which was at [her]114-ayesha full , rose above the mountain - wall , and began to flood the place with silver .

" Wot [ye]4580-you why [I]114-ayesha have brought [you]4580-you [here]3102-here to - night , [[my]114-ayesha Holly]3913-my holly ? "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , leaning [her]114-ayesha head upon [her]114-ayesha hand and watching the great orb as [she]114-ayesha rose , like [some heavenly queen]2594-some heavenly queen , above the solemn pillars of [the temple]3777-the temple . " [I]114-ayesha brought [you]4580-you - nay , it is strange , but knowest [thou]4580-you , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , that [thou]4580-you liest at this moment upon the very spot where [thy]4580-you dead body lay when [I]114-ayesha bore [thee]4580-you back to [those caves of [K"r]56-k"r]4583-those caves of k"r[114-ayesha] so many years ago ? It all returns to [my]0-i mind now . [I]0-i can see it , and horrible is it to [my]0-i sight ! " and [she]114-ayesha shuddered .[0-i]

Here [Leo]108-leo jumped up and hastily changed [his]108-leo seat . However the reminiscence might affect [Ayesha]114-ayesha , it clearly had few charms for [him]108-leo .

" [I]114-ayesha brought [you]2596-you , "[114-ayesha] went on [Ayesha]114-ayesha presently , " that [ye]2596-you might look upon the most wonderful sight that ever the eye of [man]3189-man beheld - the full moon shining over ruined [K"r]56-k"r[114-ayesha] . When [ye]2596-you have done [your]2596-you eating - [I]0-i would that [I]0-i could teach [you]2596-you to eat naught but fruit , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , but that will come after [thou]2596-you hast laved in the fire . Once [I]0-i , too , ate flesh like a brute beast . When [ye]2596-you have done [we]2597-we will go out , and [I]0-i will show [you]2596-you [this great temple]2598-this great temple and [the God whom [men]516-men once worshipped therein]2599-the god whom men once worshipped therein . "[0-i]

Of course [we]2597-we got up at once , and started . And here again [my]0-i pen fails [me]0-i . To give a string of measurements and details of [the various courts of [the temple]3777-the temple]2601-the various courts of the temple would only be wearisome , supposing that [I]0-i had them , and yet [I]0-i know not how [I]0-i am to describe what [we]2597-we saw , magnificent as it was even in [its]3777-the temple ruin , almost beyond the power of realisation . [Court]91-court upon [dim court]2603-dim court , row upon row of mighty pillars - some of [them]2601-the various courts of the temple especially at the gateways sculptured from pedestal to capital - space upon space of [empty chambers]2604-empty chambers that spoke more eloquently to the imagination than [any crowded streets]2605-any crowded streets . And over all , the dead silence of the dead , the sense of utter loneliness , and the brooding spirit of the Past ! How beautiful it was , and yet how drear ! [We]2597-we did not dare to speak aloud . [Ayesha]114-ayesha [herself]114-ayesha was awed in the presence of an antiquity compared to which even [her]114-ayesha length of days was but a little thing ; [we]2597-we only whispered , and [our]2597-we whispers seemed to run from column to column , till they were lost in the quiet air . Bright fell the moonlight on pillar and [court]2606-court and shattered wall , hiding all [their]2607-their rents and imperfections in its silver garment , and clothing [their]2607-their hoar majesty with the peculiar glory of the night . It was a wonderful sight to see the full moon looking down on [the ruined fane of [K"r]56-k"r]4585-the ruined fane of k"r . It was a wonderful thing to think for how many thousands of years the dead orb above and [the dead city]4586-the dead city below had gazed thus upon each other , and in the utter solitude of space poured forth each to each the tale of [their]2607-their lost life and long - departed glory . The white light fell , and minute by minute the quiet shadows crept across [the grass - grown courts]4587-the grass - grown courts like the spirits of [old priests]4588-old priests haunting [the habitations of [their]4588-old priests worship]4589-the habitations of their worship - the white light fell , and the long shadows grew till the beauty and grandeur of each scene and the untamed majesty of its present Death seemed to sink into [our]2597-we very souls , and speak more loudly than the shouts of armies concerning the pomp and splendour that the grave had swallowed , and even memory had forgotten .[114-ayesha]

" Come , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , after [we]2597-we had gazed and gazed , [I]0-i know not for how long , " and [I]114-ayesha will show [you]2597-we the stony flower of Loveliness and Wonder 's very crown , if yet it stands to mock time with its beauty and fill the heart of [man]3189-man with longing for that which is behind the veil , "[114-ayesha] and , without waiting for an answer , [she]114-ayesha led [us]2597-we through [two more pillared courts]2608-two more pillared courts into [the inner shrine of [the old fane]2610-the old fane]2609-the inner shrine of the old fane .

And there , in the centre of [the inmost court]2611-the inmost court , that might have been some fifty yards square , or a little more , [we]2597-we stood face to face with what is perhaps the grandest allegorical work of Art that [the genius of [[her]114-ayesha children]4493-her children]2612-the genius of her children has ever given to [the world]252-the world . For in [the exact centre of [the court]2616-the court]2615-the exact centre of the court , placed upon a thick square slab of rock , was a huge round ball of dark stone , some twenty feet in diameter , and standing on the ball was a colossal winged figure of a beauty so entrancing and divine that when [I]0-i first gazed upon it , illuminated and shadowed as it was by the soft light of the moon , [my]0-i breath stood still , and for an instant [my]0-i heart ceased its beating .

The statue was hewn from marble so pure and white that even now , after all those ages , it shone as the moonbeams danced upon it , and its height was , [I]0-i should say , a trifle over twenty feet . It was the winged figure of [a woman of such marvellous loveliness and delicacy of form that the size seemed rather to add to than to detract from its so human and yet more spiritual beauty]2617-a woman of such marvellous loveliness and delicacy of form that the size seemed rather to add to than to detract from its so human and yet more spiritual beauty . [She]114-ayesha was bending forward and poising [herself]114-ayesha upon [her]114-ayesha half - spread wings as though to preserve [her]114-ayesha balance as [she]114-ayesha leant . [Her]114-ayesha arms were outstretched like those of [some woman about to embrace one [she]114-ayesha dearly loved]2618-some woman about to embrace one she dearly loved , while [her]114-ayesha whole attitude gave an impression of the tenderest beseeching . [Her]114-ayesha perfect and most gracious form was naked , save - and here came the extraordinary thing - the face , which was thinly veiled , so that [we]2619-we could only trace the marking of [her]114-ayesha features . A gauzy veil was thrown round and about the head , and of its two ends one fell down across [her]114-ayesha left breast , which was outlined beneath it , and one , now broken , streamed away upon the air behind [her]114-ayesha .

" Who is [she]114-ayesha ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , as soon as [I]0-i could take [my]0-i eyes off the statue .

" Canst [thou]4591-thou not guess , oh [Holly]109-holly ? "[114-ayesha] answered [Ayesha]114-ayesha . " Where then is [thy]4591-thou imagination ? It is Truth standing on [the World]252-the world , and calling to [its children]4593-its children to unveil [her]114-ayesha face . See what is writ upon the pedestal . Without doubt it is taken from the book of Scriptures of [these men of [K"r]56-k"r]4594-these men of k"r[114-ayesha] , " and [she]114-ayesha led the way to the foot of the statue , where an inscription of the usual Chinese - looking hieroglyphics was so deeply graven as to be still quite legible , at least to [Ayesha]114-ayesha . According to [her]114-ayesha translation it ran thus : -[114-ayesha]

" Is there [no man]3309-no man that will draw [my]114-ayesha veil and look upon [my]114-ayesha face , for it is very fair ? Unto [him]3309-no man who draws [my]114-ayesha veil shall [I]114-ayesha be , and peace will [I]114-ayesha give [him]3309-no man , and [sweet children of knowledge and good works]4596-sweet children of knowledge and good works . "[114-ayesha]

And a voice cried , " Though all those who seek after [thee]4591-thou desire [thee]4591-thou , behold ! [Virgin]239-virgin art [thou]4591-thou , and [Virgin]239-virgin shalt [thou]4591-thou go till Time be done . [No man]3309-no man is there born of woman who may draw [thy]4591-thou [veil and live , nor shall be]4598-veil and live , nor shall be . By Death only can [thy]4591-thou veil be drawn , oh Truth ! "[114-ayesha]

And [Truth]240-truth stretched out [her]240-truth arms and wept , because those who sought [her]240-truth might not find [her]240-truth , nor look upon [her]240-truth face to face .

" [Thou]4591-thou seest , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , when [she]114-ayesha had finished translating , " [Truth]240-truth was [the Goddess of [the people of old [K"r]56-k"r]4600-the people of old k"r]4599-the goddess of the people of old k"r[114-ayesha] , and to [her]240-truth [they]2620-they built [[their]2620-they shrines]2621-their shrines , and [her]240-truth [they]2620-they sought ; knowing that [they]2620-they should never find , still sought [they]2620-they . "[2620-they]

" And so , "[0-i] [I]0-i added sadly , " do [men]516-men seek to this very hour , but [they]516-men find out ; and , as this Scripture saith , nor shall [they]516-men ; for in Death only is [Truth]240-truth found . "[0-i]

Then with one more look at this veiled and spiritualised loveliness - which was so perfect and so pure that one might almost fancy that the light of a living spirit shone through [the marble prison]2622-the marble prison to lead [man]3189-man on to high and ethereal thoughts - [this poet]2624-this poet 's dream of beauty frozen into stone , which [I]0-i shall never forget while [I]0-i live , [we]2625-we turned and went back through [the vast moonlit courts]2626-the vast moonlit courts to the spot whence [we]2625-we had started . [I]0-i never saw the statue again , which [I]0-i the more regret , because on the great ball of stone representing [the World]252-the world whereon the figure stood , lines were drawn , that probably , had there been light enough , [we]2625-we should have discovered to be a map of [the Universe]92-the universe as it was known to [the people of [K"r]56-k"r]4011-the people of k"r . It is at any rate suggestive of some scientific knowledge that [these long - dead worshippers of Truth]4603-these long - dead worshippers of truth had recognised the fact that the globe is round .[1948-the mutes]

XXIV

WALKING THE PLANK

Next day [the mutes]1948-the mutes woke [us]2625-we before the dawn ; and by the time that [we]2625-we had got the sleep out of [our]2625-we eyes , and gone through a perfunctory wash at a spring which still welled up into the remains of a marble basin in the centre of [the North quadrangle of [the vast outer court]2630-the vast outer court]2629-the north quadrangle of the vast outer court , [we]2625-we found [She]2631-she standing by the litter ready to start , while [old Billali]137-job and [the two bearer mutes]2632-the two bearer mutes were busy collecting the baggage . As usual , [Ayesha]114-ayesha was veiled like the marble Truth by the way , [I]0-i wonder if [she]114-ayesha originally got the idea of covering up [her]114-ayesha beauty from that statue ? . [I]0-i noticed , however , that [she]114-ayesha seemed very depressed , and had none of that proud and buoyant bearing which would have betrayed [her]114-ayesha among [a thousand women of the same stature]2633-a thousand women of the same stature , even if [they]2633-a thousand women of the same stature had been veiled like [herself]114-ayesha . [She]114-ayesha looked up as [we]2625-we came - for [her]114-ayesha head was bowed - and greeted [us]2625-we . [Leo]108-leo asked [her]114-ayesha how [she]114-ayesha had slept .

" Ill , [[my]114-ayesha Kallikrates]4350-my kallikrates , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha answered , " ill . This night have strange and hideous dreams come creeping through [my]114-ayesha brain , and [I]114-ayesha know not what they may portend . Almost do [I]114-ayesha feel as though some evil overshadowed [me]114-ayesha ; and yet how can evil touch [me]114-ayesha ? [I]114-ayesha wonder , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha went on with a sudden outbreak of womanly tenderness , " [I]114-ayesha wonder if , should aught happen to [me]114-ayesha , so that [I]114-ayesha slept awhile and left [thee]4605-thou waking , [thou]4605-thou wouldst think gently of [me]114-ayesha ? [I]114-ayesha wonder , [[my]114-ayesha Kallikrates]4350-my kallikrates , if [thou]4605-thou wouldst tarry till [I]114-ayesha came again , as for so many centuries [I]114-ayesha have tarried for [thy]4605-thou coming ? "[114-ayesha]

Then , without waiting for an answer , [she]114-ayesha went on : " Come , let [us]2634-we be setting forth , for [we]2634-we have far to go , and before another day is born in yonder blue should [we]2634-we stand in the place of Life . "[114-ayesha]

In five minutes [we]2634-we were once more on [our]2634-we way through [the vast ruined city]2635-the vast ruined city , which loomed at [us]2634-we on either side in the grey dawning in a way that was at once grand and oppressive . Just as the first ray of the rising sun shot like a golden arrow athwart this storied desolation [we]2634-we gained the further gateway of the outer wall , and having given one more glance at the hoar and pillared majesty through which [we]2634-we had journeyed , and with the exception of [Job]137-job , for whom ruins had no charms breathed a sigh of regret that [we]2634-we had not had more time to explore [it]2635-the vast ruined city , passed through [the great moat]2636-the great moat , and on to [the plain beyond]2637-the plain beyond .

As the sun rose so did [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's spirits , till by breakfast - time [they]2638-their had regained [their]2638-their normal level , and [she]114-ayesha laughingly set down [her]114-ayesha previous depression to the associations of [the spot where [she]114-ayesha had slept]2639-the spot where she had slept .

" [These barbarians]4607-these barbarians swear that [K"r]111-k"r[114-ayesha] is haunted , " [she]114-ayesha said , "[114-ayesha] and of a truth [I]0-i do believe [their]2638-their saying , for never did [I]0-i know so ill a night save one . [I]0-i remember it now . It was on that very spot when [thou]2640-thou didst lie dead at [my]0-i feet , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . Never will [I]0-i visit [it]2641-it again ; it is [a place of evil omen]2642-a place of evil omen . "[0-i]

After a very brief halt for breakfast [we]2643-we pressed on with such good will that by two o'clock in the afternoon [we]2643-we were at the foot of [the vast wall of rock]2644-the vast wall of rock that formed [the lip of [the volcano]2646-the volcano]2645-the lip of the volcano , and which at this point towered up precipitously above [us]2643-we for fifteen hundred or two thousand feet . Here [we]2643-we halted , certainly not to [my]0-i astonishment , for [I]0-i did not see how it was possible that [we]2643-we should go any farther .

" Now , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha , as [she]114-ayesha descended from [her]114-ayesha litter , " doth [our]2643-we labour but commence , for here do [we]2643-we part with [these men]3427-these men , and henceforward must [we]2643-we bear [ourselves]2643-we ; "[114-ayesha] and then , addressing [Billali]137-job , " do [thou]4609-thou and [these slaves]3840-these slaves remain here , and abide [our]2643-we coming . By to - morrow at the midday shall [we]2643-we be with [thee]4609-thou - if not , wait . "[114-ayesha]

[Billali]137-job bowed humbly , and said that [her]114-ayesha august bidding should be obeyed if [they]2647-they stopped there till [they]2647-they grew old .

" And [this man]4214-this man , oh [Holly]109-holly , "[114-ayesha] said [She]114-ayesha , pointing to [Job]137-job ; " best is it that [he]4214-this man should tarry also , for if [his]4214-this man heart be not high and [his]4214-this man courage great , perchance some evil might overtake [him]4214-this man . Also , the secrets of [the place whither [we]4613-we go]4612-the place whither we go are not fit for common eyes . "[114-ayesha]

[I]0-i translated this to [Job]137-job , who instantly and earnestly entreated [me]0-i , almost with tears in [his]137-job eyes , not to leave [him]137-job behind . [He]137-job said [he]137-job was sure that [he]137-job could see nothing worse than [he]137-job had already seen , and that [he]137-job was terrified to death at the idea of being left alone with [those " dumb folk , "[137-job] who , [he]137-job thought , would probably take the opportunity to hot - pot [him]137-job]2648-those " dumb folk , " who , he thought , would probably take the opportunity to hot - pot him .

[I]0-i translated what [he]137-job said to [Ayesha]114-ayesha , who shrugged [her]114-ayesha shoulders , and answered , " Well , let [him]137-job come , it is naught to [me]114-ayesha ; on [his]137-job own head be it , and [he]137-job will serve to bear the lamp and this , "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha pointed to a narrow plank , some sixteen feet in length , which had been bound above the long bearing - pole of [her]114-ayesha hammock , as [I]0-i had thought to make curtains spread out better , but , as it now appeared , for some unknown purpose connected with [our]2649-we extraordinary undertaking .

Accordingly , the plank , which , though tough , was very light , was given to [Job]137-job to carry , and also one of the lamps . [I]0-i slung the other on to [my]0-i back , together with a spare jar of oil , while [Leo]108-leo loaded [himself]108-leo with the provisions and some water in [a kid]2650-a kid 's skin . When this was done [She]114-ayesha bade [Billali]137-job and [the six bearer mutes]2651-the six bearer mutes to retreat behind a grove of flowering magnolias about a hundred yards away , and remain there under pain of death till [we]2649-we had vanished . [They]2652-they bowed humbly , and went , and , as [he]108-leo departed , [old Billali]137-job gave [me]0-i a friendly shake of the hand , and whispered that [he]137-job had rather that it was [I]0-i than [he]137-job who was going on this wonderful expedition with " [She]114-ayesha - who - must - be - obeyed , "[137-job] and upon [my]0-i word [I]0-i felt inclined to agree with [him]137-job . In another minute [they]2652-they were gone , and then , having briefly asked [us]2649-we if [we]2649-we were ready , [Ayesha]114-ayesha turned , and gazed up [the towering cliff]2653-the towering cliff .

" Goodness [me]0-i , [Leo]108-leo , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , ' surely [we]2649-we are not going to climb that precipice ! "[0-i]

[Leo]108-leo shrugged [his]108-leo shoulders , being in a condition of half - fascinated , half - expectant mystification , and as [he]108-leo did so , [Ayesha]114-ayesha with a sudden move began to climb [the cliff]723-the cliff , and of course [we]2649-we had to follow [her]114-ayesha . It was perfectly marvellous to see the ease and grace with which [she]114-ayesha sprang from rock to rock , and swung [herself]114-ayesha along the ledges . The ascent was not , however , so difficult as it seemed , although there were one or two nasty places where it did not do to look behind [you]2655-you , the fact being that [the rock]550-the rock still sloped here , and was not absolutely precipitous as it was higher up . In this way [we]2649-we , with no great labour , mounted to the height of some fifty feet above [our]2649-we last standing - place , the only really troublesome thing to manage being [Job]137-job 's board , and in doing so drew some fifty or sixty paces to the left of [our]2649-we starting - point , for [we]2649-we went up like a crab , sideways . Presently [we]2649-we reached a ledge , narrow enough at first , but which widened as [we]2649-we followed [it]723-the cliff , and moreover sloped inwards like the petal of a flower , so that as [we]2649-we followed it [we]2649-we gradually got into a kind of rut or fold of rock , that grew deeper and deeper , till at last [it]723-the cliff resembled [a Devonshire lane in stone]2657-a devonshire lane in stone , and hid [us]2649-we perfectly from the gaze of [anybody on the slope below]2658-anybody on the slope below , if there had been [anybody to gaze]2659-anybody to gaze . [This lane which appeared to be a natural formation]2660-this lane which appeared to be a natural formation continued for some fifty or sixty paces , and then suddenly ended in a cave , also natural , running at right angles to [it]723-the cliff . [I]0-i am sure [it]723-the cliff was [a natural cave]2661-a natural cave , and not hollowed by the hand of [man]3189-man , because of [its]723-the cliff irregular and contorted shape and course , which gave [it]723-the cliff the appearance of having been blown bodily in [the mountain]1457-the mountain by some frightful eruption of gas following the line of the least resistance . [All the caves hollowed by [the ancients of [K"r]56-k"r]4615-the ancients of k"r]4614-all the caves hollowed by the ancients of k"r , on the contrary , were cut out with the most perfect regularity and symmetry . At [the mouth of [this cave]1964-this cave]4616-the mouth of this cave [Ayesha]114-ayesha halted , and bade [us]2665-we light the two lamps , which [I]3189-man did , giving one to [her]114-ayesha and keeping the other [myself]3189-man . Then , taking the lead , [she]114-ayesha advanced down [the cavern]1056-the cavern , picking [her]114-ayesha way with great care , as indeed it was necessary to do , for the floor was most irregular - strewn with boulders like the bed of [a stream]4619-a stream , and in some places pitted with deep holes , in which it would have been easy to break one 's leg .[3189-man]

[This cavern]2664-this cavern [we]2665-we pursued for twenty minutes or more , [it]2664-this cavern being , so far as [I]0-i could form a judgment - owing to [its]2664-this cavern numerous twists and turns no easy task - about a quarter of a mile long .

At last , however , [we]2665-we halted at [its]2664-this cavern farther end , and whilst [I]0-i was still trying to pierce the gloom a great gust of air came tearing down it , and extinguished both the lamps .

[Ayesha]114-ayesha called to [us]2665-we , and [we]2665-we crept up to [her]114-ayesha , for [she]114-ayesha was a little in front , and were rewarded with a view that was positively appalling in its gloom and grandeur . Before [us]2665-we was a mighty chasm in [the black rock]2666-the black rock , jagged and torn and splintered through [it]2664-this cavern in a far past age by some awful convulsion of Nature , as though it had been cleft by stroke upon stroke of the lightning . [This chasm]2667-this chasm , which was bounded by a precipice on the hither , and presumably , though [we]2665-we could not see [it]2667-this chasm , on the farther side also , may have measured any width across , but from [its]2667-this chasm darkness [I]0-i do not think it can have been very broad . It was impossible to make out much of [its]2667-this chasm outline , or how far it ran , for the simple reason that the point where [we]2665-we were standing was so far from [the upper surface of [the cliff]723-the cliff]2668-the upper surface of the cliff , at least fifteen hundred or two thousand feet , that only a very dim light struggled down to [us]2665-we from above . The mouth of [the cavern that [we]2665-we had been following]2670-the cavern that we had been following gave on to [a most curious and tremendous spur of rock]2671-a most curious and tremendous spur of rock , which jutted out in mid air into [the gulf]2672-the gulf before [us]2665-we , for a distance of some fifty yards , coming to a sharp point at [its]2671-a most curious and tremendous spur of rock termination , and resembling nothing that [I]0-i can think of so much as the spur upon the leg of a cock in shape . This huge spur was attached only to the parent precipice at its base , which was , of course , enormous , just as the cock 's spur is attached to [its]2671-a most curious and tremendous spur of rock leg . Otherwise it was utterly unsupported .

" Here must [we]2665-we pass , "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha . " Be careful lest giddiness overcome [you]4620-you , or the wind sweep [you]4620-you into [the gulf beneath]4621-the gulf beneath , for of a truth it hath no bottom ; "[114-ayesha] and , without giving [us]2665-we any further time to get scared , [she]114-ayesha started walking along [the spur]2673-the spur , leaving [us]2665-we to follow [her]114-ayesha as best [we]2665-we might . [I]0-i was next to [her]114-ayesha , then came [Job]137-job , painfully dragging [his]137-job plank , while [Leo]108-leo brought up the rear . It was a wonderful sight to see [this intrepid woman]2674-this intrepid woman gliding fearlessly along [that dreadful place]2675-that dreadful place . For [my]0-i part , when [I]0-i had gone but a very few yards , what between the pressure of the air and the awful sense of the consequences that a slip would entail , [I]0-i found it necessary to go down on [my]0-i hands and knees and crawl , and so did the other two .

But [Ayesha]114-ayesha never condescended to this . On [she]114-ayesha went , leaning [her]114-ayesha body against the gusts of wind , and never seeming to lose [her]114-ayesha head or [her]114-ayesha balance .

In a few minutes [we]2665-we had crossed some twenty paces of [this awful bridge]2676-this awful bridge , which got narrower at every step , and then all of a sudden a great gust came tearing along [the gorge]2677-the gorge . [I]0-i saw [Ayesha]114-ayesha lean [herself]114-ayesha against it , but the strong draught got under [her]114-ayesha dark cloak , and tore it from [her]114-ayesha , and away it went down the wind flapping like a wounded bird . It was dreadful to see it go , till it was lost in the blackness . [I]0-i clung to [the saddle of rock]2678-the saddle of rock , and looked round , while , like a living thing , the great spur vibrated with a humming sound beneath [us]2665-we . The sight was a truly awesome one . There [we]2665-we were poised in the gloom between [earth]308-earth and [heaven]2680-heaven . Beneath [us]2665-we were hundreds upon hundreds of feet of emptiness that gradually grew darker , till at last it was absolutely black , and at what depth it ended is more than [I]0-i can guess . Above was space upon space of giddy air , and far , far away a line of blue sky . And down [this vast gulf upon which [we]2665-we were pinnacled]2681-this vast gulf upon which we were pinnacled the great draught dashed and roared , driving clouds and misty wreaths of vapour before it , till [we]2665-we were nearly blinded , and utterly confused .

The whole position was so tremendous and so absolutely unearthly , that [I]0-i believe it actually lulled [our]2665-we sense of terror , but to this hour [I]0-i often see it in [my]0-i dreams , and at its mere phantasy wake up covered with cold sweat .

" On ! on ! "[114-ayesha] cried the white form before [us]2665-we , for now the cloak had gone , [She]114-ayesha was robed in white , and looked more like [a spirit riding down the gale]2682-a spirit riding down the gale than [a woman]284-a woman ; " On , or [ye]4622-ye will fall and be dashed to pieces . Keep [your]4622-ye eyes fixed upon the ground , and closely hug the rock . "[284-a woman]

[We]2665-we obeyed [her]114-ayesha , and crept painfully along the quivering path , against which the wind shrieked and wailed as it shook it , causing it to murmur like a vast tuning - fork . On [we]2665-we went , [I]0-i do not know for how long , only gazing round now and again , when it was absolutely necessary , until at last [we]2665-we saw that [we]2665-we were on the very tip of the spur , a slab of rock , little larger than an ordinary table , that throbbed and jumped like [any over - engined steamer]2684-any over - engined steamer . There [we]2665-we lay , clinging to the ground , and looked about [us]2665-we , while [Ayesha]114-ayesha stood leaning out against the wind , down which [her]114-ayesha long hair streamed , and , absolutely heedless of the hideous depth that yawned beneath , pointed before [her]114-ayesha . Then [we]2665-we saw why the narrow plank had been provided , which [Job]137-job and [I]0-i had painfully dragged along between [us]2665-we . Before [us]2665-we was an empty space , on the other side of which was something , as yet [we]2665-we could not see what , for here - either owing to the shadow of [the opposite cliff]2685-the opposite cliff , or from some other cause - the gloom was that of night .

" [We]2665-we must wait awhile , "[114-ayesha] called [Ayesha]114-ayesha ; ' soon there will be light . "[114-ayesha]

At the moment [I]0-i could not imagine what [she]114-ayesha meant . How could more light than there was ever come to [this dreadful spot]2686-this dreadful spot ? While [I]0-i was still wondering , suddenly , like a great sword of flame , a beam from the setting sun pierced the Stygian gloom , and smote upon the point of rock whereon [we]2665-we lay , illumining [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's lovely form with an unearthly splendour . [I]0-i only wish [I]0-i could describe the wild and marvellous beauty of that sword of fire , laid across the darkness and rushing mist - wreaths of [the gulf]2672-the gulf . How it got [there]3168-there [I]0-i do not to this moment know , but [I]0-i presume that there was some cleft or hole in [the opposing cliff]2689-the opposing cliff , through which [it]2690-it pierced when the setting orb was in a direct line therewith . All [I]0-i can say is , that the effect was the most wonderful that [I]0-i ever saw . Right through the heart of the darkness that flaming sword was stabbed , and where it lay there was the most surpassingly vivid light , so vivid that even at a distance [we]2665-we could see the grain of the rock , while , outside of it - yes , within a few inches of its keen edge - was naught but clustering shadows .

And now , by this ray of light , for which [She]114-ayesha had been waiting , and timed [our]2665-we arrival to meet , knowing that at this season for thousands of years it had always struck thus at sunset , [we]2665-we saw what was before [us]2665-we . Within eleven or twelve feet of the very tip of [the tongue - like rock whereon [we]2665-we stood there]2691-the tongue - like rock whereon we stood there arose , presumably from [the far bottom of [the gulf]2672-the gulf]2692-the far bottom of the gulf , a sugarloaf - shaped cone , of which the summit was exactly opposite to [us]2665-we . But had there been [a summit]2694-a summit only it would not have helped [us]2665-we much , for the nearest point of [its]2694-a summit circumference was some forty feet from where [we]2665-we were . On the lip of this summit , however , which was circular and hollow , rested a tremendous flat boulder , something like a glacier stone - perhaps it was one , for all [I]0-i know to the contrary - and the end of this boulder approached to within twelve feet or so of [us]2665-we . This huge rock was nothing more or less than a gigantic rocking - stone , accurately balanced upon the edge of the cone or miniature crater , like a half - crown on the rim of a wine - glass ; for , in the fierce light that played upon it and [us]2665-we , [we]2665-we could see it oscillating in the gusts of wind .

" Quick ! "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha ; " the plank - [we]2665-we must cross while the light endures ; presently it will be gone . "[114-ayesha]

" Oh , [Lord]3376-lord , [sir]3126-sir ! "[137-job] groaned [Job]137-job , ' surely [she]114-ayesha do n't mean [us]2665-we to walk across that there place on that there thing , " as in obedience to [my]114-ayesha direction [he]137-job pushed the long board towards [me]114-ayesha .[114-ayesha]

" That 's it , [Job]137-job , "[0-i] [I]0-i halloaed in ghastly merriment , though the idea of walking the plank was no pleasanter to [me]0-i than to [him]137-job .

[I]0-i pushed the board on to [Ayesha]114-ayesha , who deftly ran it across [the gulf]2672-the gulf so that one end of it rested on the rocking - stone , the other remaining on the extremity of the trembling spur . Then placing [her]114-ayesha foot upon it to prevent it from being blown away , [she]114-ayesha turned to [me]0-i .

" Since [I]114-ayesha was last here , oh [Holly]109-holly , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha called , " the support of the moving stone hath lessened somewhat , so that [I]114-ayesha am not certain if it will bear [our]4625-our weight or no . Therefore will [I]114-ayesha cross the first , because no harm will come unto [me]114-ayesha , "[114-ayesha] and , without further ado , [she]114-ayesha trod lightly but firmly across [the frail bridge]2696-the frail bridge , and in another second was standing safe upon the heaving stone .

" It is safe , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha called . " See , hold [thou]4626-thou the plank ! [I]114-ayesha will stand on the farther side of the stone so that it may not overbalance with [your]109-holly greater weights . Now , come , oh [Holly]109-holly , for presently the light will fail [us]4625-our . "[114-ayesha]

[I]0-i struggled to [my]0-i knees , and if ever [I]0-i felt terrified in [my]0-i life it was then , and [I]0-i am not ashamed to say that [I]0-i hesitated and hung back .

" Surely [thou]4626-thou art not afraid , "[2697-this strange creature] [this strange creature]2697-this strange creature called in a lull of the gale , from where [she]114-ayesha stood poised like a bird on the highest point of the rocking - stone . " Make way then for [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . "[114-ayesha]

This settled [me]0-i ; it is better to fall down a precipice and die than be laughed at by [such a woman]2698-such a woman ; so [I]0-i clenched [my]0-i teeth , and in another instant [I]0-i was on that horrible , narrow , bending plank , with bottomless space beneath and around [me]0-i . [I]0-i have always hated a great height , but never before did [I]0-i realise the full horrors of which such a position is capable . Oh , the sickening sensation of that yielding board resting on the two moving supports . [I]0-i grew dizzy , and thought that [I]0-i must fall ; [my]0-i spine crept ; it seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i was falling , and [my]0-i delight at finding [myself]0-i sprawling upon that stone , which rose and fell beneath [me]0-i like [a boat in a swell]2699-a boat in a swell , can not be expressed in words . All [I]0-i know is that briefly , but earnestly enough , [I]0-i thanked [Providence]179-providence for preserving [me]0-i so far .

Then came [Leo]108-leo 's turn , and though [he]108-leo looked rather queer , [he]108-leo came across like [a rope - dancer]2700-a rope - dancer . [Ayesha]114-ayesha stretched out [her]114-ayesha hand to clasp [his]108-leo own , and [I]0-i heard [her]114-ayesha say , " Bravely done , [my]114-ayesha love - bravely done ! The old Greek spirit lives in [thee]108-leo yet ! "[114-ayesha]

And now only poor [Job]137-job remained on [the farther side of [the gulf]2672-the gulf]2701-the farther side of the gulf . [He]108-leo crept up to the plank , and yelled out , " [I]108-leo ca n't do it , [sir]3126-sir . [I]108-leo shall fall into [that beastly place]4628-that beastly place . "[108-leo]

" [You]3126-sir must , "[0-i] [I]0-i remember saying with inappropriate facetiousness - " [you]3126-sir must , [Job]137-job , it 's as easy as catching flies . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose that [I]0-i must have said it to satisfy [my]0-i conscience , because although the expression conveys a wonderful idea of facility , as a matter of fact [I]0-i know no more difficult operation in [the whole world]3997-the whole world than catching flies - that is , in warm weather , unless , indeed , it is catching mosquitoes .

" [I]114-ayesha ca n't , [sir]3126-sir - [I]114-ayesha ca n't , indeed . "[114-ayesha]

" Let [the man]271-the man come , or let [him]271-the man stop and perish there . See , the light is dying ! In a moment it will be gone ! "[114-ayesha] said [Ayesha]114-ayesha .

[I]0-i looked . [She]114-ayesha was right . The sun was passing below the level of the hole or cleft in the precipice through which the ray reached [us]2704-us .

" If [you]2705-the miserable job stop there , [Job]137-job , [you]2705-the miserable job will die alone , "[0-i] [I]0-i called ; " the light is going . "[0-i]

" Come , be [a man]352-a man , [Job]137-job , "[108-leo] roared [Leo]108-leo ; " it 's quite easy . "[108-leo]

Thus adjured , [the miserable Job]2705-the miserable job , with a most awful yell , precipitated [himself]2705-the miserable job face downwards on the plank - [he]2705-the miserable job did not dare , small blame to [him]2705-the miserable job , to try to walk it , and commenced to draw [himself]2705-the miserable job across in little jerks , [his]2705-the miserable job poor legs hanging down on either side into the nothingness beneath .

[His]2705-the miserable job violent jerks at the frail board made the great stone , which was only balanced on a few inches of rock , oscillate in a most dreadful manner , and , to make matters worse , when [he]2705-the miserable job was half - way across the flying ray of lurid light suddenly went out , just as though a lamp had been extinguished in [a curtained room]2706-a curtained room , leaving the whole howling wilderness of air black with darkness .

" Come on , [Job]137-job , for [God]134-god 's sake ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted in an agony of fear , while the stone , gathering motion with every swing , rocked so violently that it was difficult to hang on to it . It was a truly awful position .

" [Lord]4632-lord have mercy on [me]137-job ! "[137-job] cried [poor Job]137-job from the darkness . " Oh , the plank 's slipping ! "[137-job] and [I]0-i heard a violent struggle , and thought that [he]2705-the miserable job was gone .

But at that moment [his]2705-the miserable job outstretched hand , clasping in agony at the air , met [my]0-i own , and [I]0-i hauled - ah , how [I]0-i did haul , putting out all the strength that it has pleased [Providence]179-providence to give [me]0-i in such abundance - and to [my]0-i joy in another minute [Job]137-job was gasping on the rock beside [me]0-i . But the plank ! [I]0-i felt it slip , and heard it knock against a projecting knob of rock , and it was gone .

" Great heavens ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " How are [we]4633-we going to get back ? "[0-i]

" [I]108-leo do n't know , "[108-leo] answered [Leo]108-leo , out of the gloom . " ' Sufficient to the day is the evil thereof , ' [I]108-leo am thankful enough to be [here]3102-here . "[108-leo]

But [Ayesha]114-ayesha merely called to [me]0-i to take [her]114-ayesha hand and creep after [her]114-ayesha .

XXV

THE SPIRIT OF LIFE

[I]0-i did as [I]0-i was bid , and in fear and trembling felt [myself]0-i guided over the edge of the stone . [I]0-i sprawled [my]0-i legs out , but could touch nothing .

" [I]0-i am going to fall ! "[0-i] [I]0-i gasped .

" Nay , let [thyself]4635-thyself go , and trust to [me]114-ayesha , "[114-ayesha] answered [Ayesha]114-ayesha .

Now , if the position is considered , it will be easily understood that this was a greater demand upon [my]0-i confidence than was justified by [my]0-i knowledge of [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's character . For all [I]0-i knew [she]114-ayesha might be in the very act of consigning [me]0-i to a horrible doom . But in life [we]2707-we sometimes have to lay [our]2707-we faith upon strange altars , and so it was now .

" Let [thyself]0-i go ! "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha cried , and , having no choice , [I]0-i did .

[I]0-i felt [myself]0-i slide a pace or two down the sloping surface of [the rock]550-the rock , and then pass into the air , and the thought flashed through [my]0-i brain that [I]0-i was lost . But no ! In another instant [my]0-i feet struck against a rocky floor , and [I]0-i felt that [I]0-i was standing upon something solid , and out of reach of the wind , which [I]0-i could hear singing away overhead . As [I]0-i stood there thanking Heaven for these small mercies , there was a slip and a scuffle , and down came [Leo]108-leo alongside of [me]0-i .

" [Hulloa]241-hulloa , [old fellow]3147-old fellow ! "[108-leo] [he]108-leo called out , " are [you]3147-old fellow there ? This is getting interesting , is it not ? "[108-leo]

Just then , with a terrific yell , [Job]137-job arrived right on the top of [us]2709-we , knocking [us]2709-we both down . By the time [we]2709-we had struggled to [our]2709-we feet again [Ayesha]114-ayesha was standing among [us]2709-we , and bidding [us]2709-we light the lamps , which fortunately remained uninjured , as also did the spare jar of oil .

[I]0-i got out [my]0-i box of wax matches , and they struck as merrily , there , in that awful place , as they could have done in [a London drawing - room]2710-a london drawing - room .

In a couple of minutes both the lamps were alight and revealed a curious scene . [We]2709-we were huddled together in [a rocky chamber]2711-a rocky chamber , some ten feet square , and scared enough [we]2709-we looked ; that is , except [Ayesha]114-ayesha , who was standing calmly with [her]114-ayesha arms folded , and waiting for the lamps to burn up . [The chamber]1053-the chamber appeared to be partly natural , and partly hollowed out of the top of the cone . The roof of [the natural part]2713-the natural part was formed of the swinging stone , and that of the back part of [the chamber]1053-the chamber , which sloped downwards , was hewn from [the live rock]2715-the live rock . For the rest , [the place]1059-the place was warm and dry - a perfect haven of rest compared to the giddy pinnacle above , and the quivering spur that shot out to meet it in mid - air .

" So ! "[114-ayesha] said [She]114-ayesha , ' safely have [we]2709-we come , though once [I]0-i feared that the rocking stone would fall with [you]2717-you , and precipitate [you]2717-you into [the bottomless depths beneath]2718-the bottomless depths beneath , for [I]0-i do believe that the cleft goeth down to [the very womb of [the world]252-the world]2719-the very womb of the world . The rock whereon the stone resteth hath crumbled beneath the swinging weight . And now that [he]2721-he , " nodding towards [Job]137-job , who was sitting on the floor , feebly wiping [his]137-job forehead with a red cotton pocket - handkerchief , "[2721-he] whom [they]2722-they rightly call the ' Pig , ' for as [a pig]2723-a pig is [he]2723-a pig stupid , [hath]2724-hath let fall the plank , it will not be easy to return across [the gulf]2672-the gulf , and to that end must [I]0-i make a plan . But now rest a while , and look upon [this place]3339-this place . What think [ye]2717-you that it is ? "[2717-you]

" [We]2709-we know not , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Wouldst [thou]2717-you believe , oh [Holly]109-holly , that once [a man]352-a man did choose [this airy nest]4638-this airy nest for a daily habitation , and did [here]3102-here endure for many years ; leaving it only but one day in every twelve to seek food and water and oil that [the people]3344-the people brought , more than [he]352-a man could carry , and laid as an offering in the mouth of [the tunnel through which [we]2727-we passed hither]4641-the tunnel through which we passed hither ? "[2728-she]

[We]2727-we looked up wonderingly , and [she]2728-she continued -

" Yet so it was . There was [a man]352-a man - [Noot]242-noot , [he]242-noot named [himself]242-noot - who , though [he]242-noot lived in the latter days , had of the wisdom of [the sons of [K"r]111-k"r]4643-the sons of k"r[2728-she] . [A hermit]2729-a hermit was [he]2729-a hermit , and [a philosopher]2730-a philosopher , and greatly skilled in the secrets of Nature , and [he]2729-a hermit it was who discovered the Fire that [I]0-i shall show [you]2731-you , which is Nature 's blood and life , and also that [he]2729-a hermit who bathed therein , and breathed thereof , should live while [Nature]173-nature lives . But like unto [thee]2731-you , oh [Holly]109-holly , [this man]4214-this man , [Noot]242-noot , would not turn [his]4214-this man knowledge to account . ' Ill , ' [he]4214-this man said , ' was it for [man]3189-man to live , for [man]3189-man was born to die . ' Therefore did [he]4214-this man tell [his]4214-this man secret to none , and therefore did [he]4214-this man come and live here , where [the seeker after Life]2735-the seeker after life must pass , and was revered of [the Amahagger of the day]2736-the amahagger of the day as holy , and [a hermit]2729-a hermit . And when first [I]0-i came to [this country]302-this country - knowest [thou]2739-thou how [I]0-i came , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates ? Another time [I]0-i will tell [thee]2739-thou , for it is a strange tale - [I]0-i heard of [this philosopher]2740-this philosopher , and waited for [him]2740-this philosopher when [he]2740-this philosopher came to fetch [his]2740-this philosopher food , and returned with [him]2740-this philosopher hither , though greatly did [I]0-i fear to tread [the gulf]2672-the gulf . Then did [I]0-i beguile [him]2740-this philosopher with [my]0-i beauty and [my]0-i wit , and flatter [him]2740-this philosopher with [my]0-i tongue , so that [he]2740-this philosopher led [me]0-i down and showed [me]0-i the Fire , and told [me]0-i the secrets of the Fire , but [he]2740-this philosopher would not suffer [me]0-i to step therein , and , fearing lest [he]2740-this philosopher should slay [me]0-i , [I]0-i refrained , knowing that [the man]271-the man was very old , and soon would die . And [I]0-i returned , having learned from [him]2740-this philosopher all that [he]2740-this philosopher knew of the wonderful Spirit of [the World]252-the world , and that was much , for [the man]271-the man was wise and very ancient , and by purity and abstinence , and the contemplations of [his]271-the man innocent mind , had worn thin the veil between that which [we]2745-we see and the great invisible truths , the whisper of whose wings at times [we]2745-we hear as they sweep through the gross air of [the world]252-the world . Then - it was but a very few days after , [I]0-i met [thee]2747-thee , [[my]0-i Kallikrates , who hadst wandered hither with [the beautiful Egyptian Amenartas]2748-the beautiful egyptian amenartas]118-kallikrates , and [I]0-i learned to love for the first and last time , once and for ever , so that it entered into [my]0-i mind to come hither with [thee]2747-thee , and receive the gift of Life for [thee]2747-thee and [me]0-i . Therefore came [we]2745-we , with [that Egyptian who would not be left behind]2749-that egyptian who would not be left behind , and , behold , [we]2745-we found [the old man Noot]2750-the old man noot lying but newly dead . There [he]2750-the old man noot lay , and [his]2750-the old man noot white beard covered [him]2750-the old man noot like a garment , " and [she]114-ayesha pointed to a spot near where [I]2750-the old man noot was sitting ; "[2750-the old man noot] but surely [he]2750-the old man noot hath long since crumbled into dust , and the wind hath borne [his]2750-the old man noot ashes hence . "[114-ayesha]

Here [I]0-i put out [my]0-i hand and felt in the dust , and presently [my]0-i fingers touched something . It was a human tooth , very yellow , but sound . [I]0-i held it up and showed it to [Ayesha]114-ayesha , who laughed .

" Yes , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , " it is [his]2750-the old man noot without a doubt . Behold what remaineth of [Noot]242-noot , and the wisdom of [Noot]242-noot - one little tooth ! And yet [that man]3474-that man had all life at [his]3474-that man command , and for [his]3474-that man conscience ' sake would have none of it . Well , [he]2750-the old man noot lay there newly dead , and [we]4645-we descended whither [I]114-ayesha shall lead [you]4646-thee , and then , gathering up all [my]114-ayesha courage , and courting death that [I]114-ayesha might perchance win so glorious a crown of life , [I]114-ayesha stepped into the flames , and behold ! life such as [ye]4646-thee can never know until [ye]4646-thee feel it also , flowed into [me]114-ayesha , and [I]114-ayesha came forth undying , and lovely beyond imagining . Then did [I]114-ayesha stretch out [mine]114-ayesha arms to [thee]4646-thee , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , and bid [thee]4646-thee take [[thine]4646-thee immortal bride]4647-thine immortal bride , and behold , as [I]114-ayesha spoke , [thou]4646-thee , blinded by [my]114-ayesha beauty , didst turn from [me]114-ayesha , and throw [thine]4646-thee arms about the neck of [Amenartas]118-kallikrates . And then a great fury filled [me]114-ayesha , and made [me]114-ayesha mad , and [I]114-ayesha seized the javelin that [thou]4646-thee didst bear , and stabbed [thee]4646-thee , so that there , at [my]114-ayesha very feet , in the place of Life , [thou]4646-thee didst groan and go down into death . [I]114-ayesha knew not then that [I]114-ayesha had strength to slay with [mine]114-ayesha eyes and by the power of [my]114-ayesha will , therefore in [my]114-ayesha madness slew [I]114-ayesha with the javelin .[114-ayesha]

It will be observed that [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's account of the death of [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates differs materially from that written on the potsherd by [Amenartas]118-kallikrates . The writing on the sherd says , " Then in [her]114-ayesha rage did [she]114-ayesha smite [him]118-kallikrates by [her]114-ayesha magic , and [he]118-kallikrates died . "[2751-we] [We]2751-we never ascertained which was the correct version , but it will be remembered that the body of [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates had a spear- wound in the breast , which seems conclusive , unless , indeed , it was inflicted after death . Another thing that [we]2751-we never ascertained was how [the two women]2752-the two women - [She]114-ayesha and [the Egyptian Amenartas]118-kallikrates - were able to bear the corpse of [the man [they]2752-the two women both loved across [the dread gulf]2754-the dread gulf and along [the shaking spur]2755-the shaking spur]2753-the man they both loved across the dread gulf and along the shaking spur . What a spectacle [the two distracted creatures]2756-the two distracted creatures must have presented in [their]2756-the two distracted creatures grief and loveliness as [they]2756-the two distracted creatures toiled along that awful place with [the dead man]1625-the dead man between [them]2756-the two distracted creatures ! Probably however the passage was easier then . - L. H. H.

" And when [thou]4648-thou wast dead , ah ! [I]2758-i wept , because [I]2758-i was undying and [thou]4648-thou wast dead . [I]2758-i wept there in [the place of Life]4390-the place of life so that had [I]2758-i been mortal any more [my]2758-i heart had surely broken . And [she]114-ayesha , [the swart Egyptian]4650-the swart egyptian - [she]114-ayesha cursed [me]2758-i by [[her]114-ayesha gods]4651-her gods . By [Osiris]243-osiris did [she]114-ayesha curse [me]2758-i and by [Isis]211-isis , by [Nephthys]244-nephthys and by Anubis , by [Sekhet]245-sekhet , the cat - headed , and by Set , calling down evil on [me]2758-i , evil and everlasting desolation . Ah ! [I]2758-i can see [her]114-ayesha dark face now lowering o'er [me]2758-i like a storm , but [she]114-ayesha could not hurt [me]2758-i , and [I]2758-i - [I]2758-i know not if [I]2758-i could hurt [her]114-ayesha . [I]2758-i did not try ; it was naught to [me]2758-i then ; so together [we]4652-we bore [thee]114-ayesha hence . And afterwards [I]2758-i sent [her]114-ayesha - [the Egyptian]4653-the egyptian - away through [the swamps]3176-the swamps , and it seems that [she]114-ayesha lived to bear [a son]3039-a son and to write the tale that should lead [thee]114-ayesha , [[her]114-ayesha husband]3271-her husband , back to [me]2758-i , [[her]114-ayesha rival]2190-her rival and [[thy]114-ayesha murderess]4658-thy murderess .[2758-i]

" Such is the tale , [[my]2758-i love]4659-my love , and now is the hour at hand that shall set a crown upon it . Like all things on [the earth]659-the earth , it is compounded of evil and of good - more of evil than of good , perchance ; and writ in letters of blood . It is the truth ; naught have [I]2758-i hidden from [thee]114-ayesha , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . And now one thing before the final moment of [thy]114-ayesha trial . [We]4661-we go down into the presence of Death , for Life and Death are very near together , and - who knoweth ? - that might happen which should separate [us]4661-we for another space of waiting . [I]2758-i am but [a woman]284-a woman , and [no prophetess]4663-no prophetess , and [I]2758-i can not read the future . But this [I]2758-i know - for [I]2758-i learned it from the lips of [the wise man Noot]4664-the wise man noot - that [my]2758-i life is but prolonged and made more bright . It can not live for aye . Therefore , before [we]4661-we go , tell [me]2758-i , oh [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , that of a truth [thou]114-ayesha dost forgive [me]2758-i , and dost love [me]2758-i from [thy]114-ayesha heart . See , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates : much evil have [I]2758-i done - perchance it was evil but two nights ago to strike [that girl who loved [thee]2758-i cold in death]4665-that girl who loved thee cold in death - but [she]4665-that girl who loved thee cold in death disobeyed [me]2758-i and angered [me]2758-i , prophesying misfortune to [me]2758-i , and [I]2758-i smote . Be careful when power comes to [thee]2758-i also , lest [thou]114-ayesha too shouldst smite in thine anger or [thy]114-ayesha jealousy , for unconquerable strength is a sore weapon in the hands of [erring man]4666-erring man . [Yea]4667-yea , [I]2758-i have sinned - out of the bitterness born of a great love have [I]2758-i sinned - but yet do [I]2758-i know the good from the evil , nor is [my]2758-i heart altogether hardened . [Thy]114-ayesha love , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , shall be the gate of [my]2758-i redemption , even as aforetime [my]2758-i passion was the path down which [I]2758-i ran to evil . For deep love unsatisfied is the hell of noble hearts and a portion of the accursed , but love that is mirrored back more perfect from the soul of [our]4668-us desired doth fashion wings to lift [us]4668-us above [ourselves]4668-us , and makes [us]4668-us what [we]4668-us might be . Therefore , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , take [me]2758-i by the hand , and lift [my]2758-i veil with no more fear than though [I]2758-i were [some peasant girl]4669-some peasant girl , and not [the wisest and most beauteous woman in [this wide world]4671-this wide world]4670-the wisest and most beauteous woman in this wide world , and look [me]2758-i in the eyes , and tell [me]2758-i that [thou]4672-thou dost forgive [me]2758-i with all thine heart , and that will all thine heart [thou]4672-thou dost worship [me]2758-i . "[2758-i]

[She]2758-i paused , and the strange tenderness in [her]2758-i voice seemed to hover round [us]2759-us like a memory . [I]0-i know that the sound of it moved [me]0-i more even than [her]2758-i words , it was so very human - so very womanly . [Leo]108-leo , too , was strangely touched . Hitherto [he]108-leo had been fascinated against [his]108-leo better judgment , something as a bird is fascinated by a snake , but now [I]0-i think that all this passed away , and [he]108-leo realised that [he]108-leo really loved this strange and glorious creature , as , alas ! [I]0-i loved [her]2758-i also . At any rate , [I]0-i saw [his]108-leo eyes fill with tears , and [he]108-leo stepped swiftly to [her]2758-i and undid the gauzy veil , and then took [her]2758-i by the hand , and , gazing into [her]2758-i deep eyes , said aloud -

" [Ayesha]114-ayesha , [I]108-leo love [thee]2758-i with all [my]108-leo heart , and so far as forgiveness is possible [I]108-leo forgive [thee]2758-i the death of [Ustane]4673-ustane . For the rest , it is between [thee]2758-i and [[thy]2758-i Maker]4674-thy maker ; [I]108-leo know naught of it . [I]108-leo only know that [I]108-leo love [thee]2758-i as [I]108-leo never loved before , and that [I]108-leo will cleave to [thee]2758-i to the end . "[108-leo]

" Now , "[114-ayesha] answered [Ayesha]114-ayesha , with proud humility - " now when [[my]114-ayesha lord]4128-my lord doth speak thus royally and give with so free a hand , it can not become [me]114-ayesha to lag behind in words , and be beggared of [my]114-ayesha generosity . Behold ! "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha took [his]2760-his hand and placed it upon [her]114-ayesha shapely head , and then bent [herself]114-ayesha slowly down till one knee for an instant touched the ground - " Behold ! in token of submission do [I]114-ayesha bow [me]114-ayesha to [[my]114-ayesha lord]4128-my lord ! Behold ! "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha kissed [him]2760-his on the lips , " in token of [my]114-ayesha wifely love do [I]114-ayesha kiss [[my]114-ayesha lord]4128-my lord . Behold ! "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha laid [her]114-ayesha hand upon [his]2760-his heart , " by the sin [I]114-ayesha sinned , by [my]114-ayesha lonely centuries of waiting wherewith it was wiped out , by the great love wherewith [I]114-ayesha love , and by the Spirit - the Eternal Thing that doth beget all life , from whom it ebbs , to whom it doth return again - [I]114-ayesha swear : -[114-ayesha]

" [I]114-ayesha swear , even in this most holy hour of completed Womanhood , that [I]114-ayesha will abandon Evil and cherish Good . [I]114-ayesha swear that [I]114-ayesha will be ever guided by [thy]4128-my lord voice in the straightest path of Duty . [I]114-ayesha swear that [I]114-ayesha will eschew Ambition , and through all [my]114-ayesha length of endless days set Wisdom over [me]114-ayesha as a guiding star to lead [me]114-ayesha unto Truth and a knowledge of the Right . [I]114-ayesha swear also that [I]114-ayesha will honour and will cherish [thee]4128-my lord , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , who hast been swept by the wave of time back into [my]114-ayesha arms , ay , till the very end , come it soon or late . [I]114-ayesha swear - nay , [I]114-ayesha will swear no more , for what are words ? Yet shalt [thou]4128-my lord learn that [Ayesha]114-ayesha hath no false tongue .[114-ayesha]

" So [I]114-ayesha have sworn , and [thou]4128-my lord , [[my]114-ayesha Holly]3913-my holly , art witness to [my]114-ayesha oath . Here , too , are [we]4679-we [we]4679-we d , [[my]114-ayesha husband]4225-my husband , with the gloom for bridal canopy - [we]4679-we d till the end of all things ; here do [we]4679-we write [our]4679-we marriage vows upon the rushing winds which shall bear them up to [heaven]2680-heaven , and round and continually round [this rolling world]4682-this rolling world .[114-ayesha]

" And for a bridal gift [I]114-ayesha crown [thee]4128-my lord with [my]114-ayesha beauty 's starry crown , and enduring life , and wisdom without measure , and wealth that none can count . Behold ! the great ones of [the earth]659-the earth shall creep about [thy]4128-my lord feet , and [its fair women]4684-its fair women shall cover up [their]4684-its fair women eyes because of the shining glory of [thy]4128-my lord countenance , and its wise ones shall be abased before [thee]4128-my lord . [Thou]4128-my lord shalt read the hearts of [men]516-men as an open writing , and hither and thither shalt [thou]4128-my lord lead [them]516-men as [thy]4128-my lord pleasure listeth . Like [that old Sphinx of [Egypt]8-egypt]4686-that old sphinx of egypt shalt [thou]4128-my lord sit aloft from age to age , and ever shall [they]516-men cry to [thee]4128-my lord to solve the riddle of [thy]4128-my lord greatness that doth not pass away , and ever shalt [thou]4128-my lord mock [them]516-men with [thy]4128-my lord silence ![114-ayesha]

" Behold ! once more [I]114-ayesha kiss [thee]4128-my lord , and by that kiss [I]114-ayesha give to [thee]4128-my lord dominion over [sea and earth]4687-sea and earth , over [the peasant]4688-the peasant in [his]4688-the peasant hovel , over [the monarch]1756-the monarch in [[his]4688-the peasant palace halls]4690-his palace halls , and cities crowned with towers , and [those who breathe therein]4691-those who breathe therein . Where'er the sun shakes out [his]4688-the peasant spears , and the lonesome waters mirror up the moon , where'er storms roll , and Heaven 's painted bows arch in the sky - from [the pure North]4692-the pure north clad in snows , across [the middle spaces of [the world]252-the world]4693-the middle spaces of the world , to where [the amorous South]4695-the amorous south , lying like [a bride]4696-a bride upon [[her]4695-the amorous south blue couch of seas]4697-her blue couch of seas , breathes in sighs made sweet with the odour of myrtles - there shall [thy]4128-my lord power pass and [thy]4128-my lord dominion find a home . Nor sickness , nor icy - fingered fear , nor sorrow , and pale waste of form and mind hovering ever o'er humanity , shall so much as shadow [thee]4128-my lord with the shadow of [their]4698-their wings . As [a God]4699-a god shalt [thou]4128-my lord be , holding good and evil in the hollow of [thy]4128-my lord hand , and [I]114-ayesha , even [I]114-ayesha , [I]114-ayesha humble [myself]114-ayesha before [thee]4128-my lord . Such is the power of Love , and such is the bridal gift [I]114-ayesha give unto [thee]4128-my lord , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , [[my]114-ayesha Lord and Lord of All]4700-my lord and lord of all .[114-ayesha]

" And now it is done ; now for [thee]4128-my lord [I]2761-i loose [my]2761-i virgin zone ; and come storm , come shine , come good , come evil , come life , come death , it never , never can be undone . For , of a truth , that which is , is , and , being done , is done for aye , and can not be altered . [I]2761-i have said - Let [us]2762-we hence , that all things may be accomplished in their order ; "[2761-i] and , taking one of the lamps , [she]2761-i advanced towards the end of the chamber that was roofed in by the swaying stone , where [she]2761-i halted .

[We]2762-we followed [her]2761-i , and perceived that in the wall of the cone there was a stair , or , to be more accurate , that some projecting knobs of rock had been so shaped as to form a good imitation of a stair . Down this [Ayesha]114-ayesha began to climb , springing from step to step , like a chamois , and after [her]2761-i [we]2762-we followed with less grace . When [we]2762-we had descended some fifteen or sixteen steps [we]2762-we found that they ended in a tremendous rocky slope , running first outwards and then inwards - like the slope of an inverted cone , or tunnel . [The slope]2763-the slope was very steep , and often precipitous , but it was nowhere impassable , and by the light of the lamps [we]2762-we went down [it]2763-the slope with no great difficulty , though it was gloomy work enough travelling on thus , [no one of [us]2762-we]2764-no one of us knew whither , into [the dead heart of [a volcano]2766-a volcano]2765-the dead heart of a volcano . As [we]2762-we went , however , [I]0-i took the precaution of noting [our]2762-we route as well as [I]0-i could ; and this was not so very difficult , owing to the extraordinary and most fantastic shape of the rocks that were strewn about , many of which in that dim light looked more like the grim faces carven upon mediæval gargoyles than ordinary boulders .

For a long time [we]2762-we travelled on thus , half an hour [I]0-i should say , till , after [we]2762-we had descended for many hundreds of feet , [I]0-i perceived that [we]2762-we were reaching the point of the inverted cone . In another minute [we]2762-we were there , and found that at the very apex of the funnel was a passage , so low and narrow that [we]2762-we had to stoop as [we]2762-we crept along [it]2767-it in Indian file .
