After some fifty yards of this creeping , [the passage]1645-the passage suddenly widened into [a cave]2769-a cave , so huge that [we]2762-we could see neither the roof nor the sides . [We]2762-we only knew that it was [a cave]2769-a cave by the echo of [our]2762-we tread and the perfect quiet of the heavy air . On [we]2762-we went for many minutes in absolute awed silence , like lost souls in the depths of [Hades]93-hades , [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's white and ghost - like form flitting in front of [us]2762-we , till once more [the place]1059-the place ended in a passage which opened into [a second cavern much smaller than the first]2772-a second cavern much smaller than the first . Indeed , [we]2762-we could clearly make out the arch and stony banks of [this second cave]2773-this second cave , and , from [their]2774-their rent and jagged appearance , discovered that , like the first long passage down which [we]2762-we had passed through [the cliff]723-the cliff before [we]2762-we reached the quivering spur , [it]2767-it had , to all appearance , been torn in the bowels of the rock by the terrific force of some explosive gas . At length [this cave]1964-this cave ended in [a third passage]2777-a third passage , through which gleamed a faint glow of light .

[I]0-i heard [Ayesha]114-ayesha give a sigh of relief as this light dawned upon [us]2762-we .

" It is well , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said ; " prepare to enter [the very womb of [the Earth]94-the earth]4701-the very womb of the earth , wherein [she]114-ayesha doth conceive the Life that [ye]0-i see brought forth in man and beast - ay , and in every tree and flower . "[114-ayesha]

Swiftly [she]114-ayesha sped along , and after [her]114-ayesha [we]2762-we stumbled as best [we]2762-we might , [our]2762-we hearts filled like a cup with mingled dread and curiosity . What were [we]2762-we about to see ? [We]2762-we passed down [the tunnel]1826-the tunnel ; stronger and stronger the light beamed , reaching [us]2762-we in great flashes like the rays from a lighthouse , as one by one they are thrown wide upon the darkness of [the waters]3211-the waters . Nor was this all , for with the flashes came a soul - shaking sound like that of thunder and of crashing trees . Now [we]2762-we were through it , and - oh heavens !

[We]2762-we stood in [a third cavern]2780-a third cavern , some fifty feet in length by perhaps as great a height , and thirty wide . [It]2780-a third cavern was carpeted with fine white sand , and [its]2780-a third cavern walls had been worn smooth by the action of [I]0-i know not what . [The cavern]1056-the cavern was not dark like the others , [it]1056-the cavern was filled with a soft glow of rose - coloured light , more beautiful to look on than anything that can be conceived . But at first [we]2762-we saw no flashes , and heard no more of the thunderous sound . Presently , however , as [we]2762-we stood in amaze , gazing at the marvellous sight , and wondering whence the rosy radiance flowed , a dread and beautiful thing happened . Across the far end of [the cavern]1056-the cavern , with a grinding and crashing noise - a noise so dreadful and awe - inspiring that [we]2762-we all trembled , and [Job]137-job actually sank to [his]137-job knees - there flamed out an awful cloud or pillar of fire , like a rainbow many - coloured , and like the lightning bright . For a space , perhaps forty seconds , it flamed and roared thus , turning slowly round and round , and then by degrees the terrible noise ceased , and with the fire it passed away - [I]0-i know not where - leaving behind it the same rosy glow that [we]2762-we had first seen .

" Draw near , draw near ! "[114-ayesha] cried [Ayesha]114-ayesha , with a voice of thrilling exultation . " Behold the very Fountain and Heart of Life as it beats in the bosom of [the great world]4505-the great world . Behold the substance from which all things draw [their]4703-their energy , the bright Spirit of [the Globe]95-the globe , without which it can not live , but must grow cold and dead as the dead moon . Draw near , and wash [you]4704-your in the living flames , and take [their]4703-their virtue into [your]4704-your poor frames in all its virgin strength - not as it now feebly glows within [your]4704-your bosoms , filtered thereto through all the fine strainers of a thousand intermediate lives , but as it is here in the very fount and seat of earthly Being . "[114-ayesha]

[We]2762-we followed [her]114-ayesha through the rosy glow up to [the head of [the cave]936-the cave]2783-the head of the cave , till at last [we]2762-we stood before the spot where the great pulse beat and the great flame passed . And as [we]2762-we went [we]2762-we became sensible of a wild and splendid exhilaration , of a glorious sense of such a fierce intensity of Life that the most buoyant moments of [our]2762-we strength seemed flat and tame and feeble beside it . It was the mere effluvium of the flame , the subtle ether that it cast off as it passed , working on [us]2762-we , and making [us]2762-we feel strong as [giants and swift as eagles]2785-giants and swift as eagles .

[We]2762-we reached [the head of [the cave]936-the cave]2783-the head of the cave , and gazed at [each other]417-each other in the glorious glow , and laughed aloud - even [Job]137-job laughed , and [he]137-job had not laughed for a week - in the lightness of [our]2762-we hearts and the divine intoxication of [our]2762-we brains . [I]0-i know that [I]0-i felt as though all the varied genius of which the human intellect is capable had descended upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i could have spoken in blank verse of Shakesperian beauty , all sorts of great ideas flashed through [my]0-i mind ; it was as though the bonds of [my]0-i flesh had been loosened and left the spirit free to soar to the empyrean of its native power . The sensations that poured in upon [me]0-i are indescribable . [I]0-i seemed to live more keenly , to reach to a higher joy , and sip the goblet of a subtler thought than ever it had been [my]0-i lot to do before . [I]0-i was [another and most glorified self]2789-another and most glorified self , and all the avenues of the Possible were for a space laid open to the footsteps of [the Real]246-the real .

Then , suddenly , whilst [I]0-i rejoiced in this splendid vigour of a new - found self , from far , far away there came a dreadful muttering noise , that grew and grew to a crash and a roar , which combined in itself all that is terrible and yet splendid in the possibilities of sound . Nearer it came , and nearer yet , till it was close upon [us]2762-we , rolling down like all the thunder - wheels of heaven behind the horses of the lightning . On it came , and with it came the glorious blinding cloud of many - coloured light , and stood before [us]2762-we for a space , turning , as it seemed to [us]2762-we , slowly round and round , and then , accompanied by its attendant pomp of sound , passed away [I]0-i know not whither .

So astonishing was the wondrous sight that one and all of [us]2762-we , save [She]2790-thou , who stood up and stretched [her]2790-thou hands towards the fire , sank down before it , and hid [our]2762-we faces in the sand .

When it was gone , [Ayesha]114-ayesha spoke .

" Now , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , "[2790-thou] [she]2790-thou said , " the mighty moment is at hand . When the great flame comes again [thou]4705-thou must stand in it . First throw aside [thy]4705-thou garments , for it will burn them , though [thee]4705-thou it will not hurt . [Thou]4705-thou must stand in the flame while [thy]4705-thou senses will endure , and when it embraces [thee]4705-thou suck the fire down into [thy]4705-thou very heart , and let it leap and play around [thy]4705-thou every part , so that [thou]4705-thou lose no moiety of its virtue . Hearest [thou]4705-thou [me]2790-thou , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates ? "[2790-thou]

" [I]108-leo hear [thee]2790-thou , [Ayesha]114-ayesha , "[108-leo] answered [Leo]108-leo , " but , of a truth - [I]108-leo am [no coward]4706-no coward - but [I]108-leo doubt [me]108-leo of that raging flame . How know [I]108-leo that it will not utterly destroy [me]108-leo , so that [I]108-leo lose [myself]108-leo and lose [thee]2790-thou also ? Nevertheless will [I]108-leo do it , "[108-leo] [he]108-leo added .

[Ayesha]114-ayesha thought for a minute , and then said -

" It is not wonderful that [thou]2790-thou shouldst doubt . Tell [me]114-ayesha , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates : if [thou]2790-thou seest [me]114-ayesha stand in the flame and come forth unharmed , wilt [thou]2790-thou enter also ? "[114-ayesha]

" Yes , "[108-leo] [he]108-leo answered , " [I]108-leo will enter even if it slay [me]108-leo . [I]108-leo have said that [I]108-leo will enter now . "[108-leo]

" And that will [I]0-i also , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried .

" What , [[my]114-ayesha [Holly]109-holly]3913-my holly ! "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha laughed aloud ; " methought that [thou]2790-thou wouldst naught of length of days . Why , how is this ? "[114-ayesha]

" Nay , [I]0-i know not , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " but there is that in [my]0-i heart that calleth [me]0-i to taste of the flame and live . "[0-i]

" It is well , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said . " [Thou]2790-thou art not altogether lost in folly . See now , [I]114-ayesha will for the second time bathe [me]114-ayesha in [this living bath]4708-this living bath . Fain would [I]114-ayesha add to [my]114-ayesha beauty and [my]114-ayesha length of days if that be possible . If it be not possible , at the least it can not harm [me]114-ayesha .[114-ayesha]

" Also , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha continued , after a momentary pause , " is there another and a deeper cause why [I]114-ayesha would once again dip [me]114-ayesha in the flame . When first [I]114-ayesha tasted of its virtue full was [my]114-ayesha heart of passion and of hatred of that Egyptian Amenartas , and therefore , despite [my]114-ayesha strivings to be rid thereof , have passion and hatred been stamped upon [my]114-ayesha soul from that sad hour to this . But now it is otherwise . Now is [my]114-ayesha mood a happy mood , and filled am [I]114-ayesha with the purest part of thought , and so would [I]114-ayesha ever be . Therefore , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , will [I]114-ayesha once more wash and make [me]114-ayesha pure and clean , and yet more fit for [thee]4709-thy . Therefore also , when [thou]4709-thy dost in turn stand in the fire , empty all [thy]4709-thy heart of evil , and let soft contentment hold the balance of [thy]4709-thy mind . Shake loose [thy]4709-thy spirit 's wings , and take [thy]4709-thy stand upon the utter verge of holy contemplation ; ay , dream upon [[thy]4709-thy mother]4710-thy mother 's kiss , and turn [thee]4709-thy towards the vision of the highest good that hath ever swept on silver wings across the silence of [thy]4709-thy dreams . For from the germ of what [thou]4709-thy art in that dread moment shall grow the fruit of what [thou]4709-thy shalt be for all unreckoned time .[114-ayesha]

" Now prepare [thee]4709-thy , prepare ! even as though [thy]4709-thy last hour were at hand , and [thou]4709-thy wast to cross to [the Land of Shadows]4711-the land of shadows , and not through the Gates of [Glory]96-glory into the realms of Life made beautiful . Prepare , [I]114-ayesha say ! "[114-ayesha]

XXVI

WHAT [WE]2791-we SAW

Then came a few moments ' pause , during which [Ayesha]114-ayesha seemed to be gathering up [her]114-ayesha strength for the fiery trial , while [we]2791-we clung to [each other]417-each other , and waited in utter silence .

At last , from [far far away]2793-far far away , came the first murmur of sound , that grew and grew till it began to crash and bellow in the distance . As [she]114-ayesha heard it , [Ayesha]114-ayesha swiftly threw off [her]114-ayesha gauzy wrapping , loosened the golden snake from [her]114-ayesha kirtle , and then , shaking [her]114-ayesha lovely hair about [her]114-ayesha like a garment , beneath its cover slipped the kirtle off and replaced the snaky belt around [her]114-ayesha and outside the masses of [her]114-ayesha falling hair . There [she]114-ayesha stood before [us]2791-we as [Eve]247-eve might have stood before [Adam]248-adam , clad in nothing but [her]114-ayesha abundant locks , held round [her]114-ayesha by the golden band ; and no words of mine can tell how sweet [she]114-ayesha looked - and yet how divine . Nearer and nearer came the thunder - wheels of fire , and as they came [she]114-ayesha pushed one ivory arm through the dark masses of [her]114-ayesha hair and flung it round [Leo]108-leo 's neck .

" Oh , [my]114-ayesha love , [[my]114-ayesha love]4659-my love ! "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha murmured , " wilt [thou]108-leo ever know how [I]114-ayesha have loved [thee]108-leo ? "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha kissed [him]108-leo on the forehead , and then went and stood in the pathway of the flame of Life .

There was , [I]0-i remember , to [my]0-i mind something very touching about [her]114-ayesha words and that embrace upon the forehead . It was like a [mother]332-mother 's kiss , and seemed to convey a benediction with it .

On came the crashing , rolling noise , and the sound of it was as the sound of [a forest]2795-a forest being swept flat by a mighty wind , and then tossed up like so much grass , and thundered down [a mountain - side]2796-a mountain - side . Nearer and nearer it came ; now flashes of light , forerunners of the revolving pillar of flame , were passing like arrows through the rosy air ; and now the edge of the pillar itself appeared . [Ayesha]114-ayesha turned towards it , and stretched out [her]114-ayesha arms to greet [it]2797-it . On it came very slowly , and lapped [her]114-ayesha round with flame . [I]0-i saw the fire run up [her]114-ayesha form . [I]0-i saw [her]114-ayesha lift it with both hands as though it were water , and pour it over [her]114-ayesha head . [I]0-i even saw [her]114-ayesha open [her]114-ayesha mouth and draw it down into [her]114-ayesha lungs , and a dread and wonderful sight it was .

Then [she]114-ayesha paused , and stretched out [her]114-ayesha arms , and stood there quite still , with a heavenly smile upon [her]114-ayesha face , as though [she]114-ayesha were [the very Spirit of the Flame]2798-the very spirit of the flame .

The mysterious fire played up and down [her]114-ayesha dark and rolling locks , twining and twisting itself through and around them like threads of golden lace ; it gleamed upon [her]114-ayesha ivory breast and shoulder , from which the hair had slipped aside ; it slid along [her]114-ayesha pillared throat and delicate features , and seemed to find a home in the glorious eyes that shone and shone , more brightly even than the spiritual essence .

Oh , how beautiful [she]114-ayesha looked there in the flame ! [No angel out of heaven]2799-no angel out of heaven could have worn a greater loveliness . Even now [my]0-i heart faints before the recollection of it , as [she]114-ayesha stood and smiled at [our]2800-our awed faces , and [I]0-i would give half [my]0-i remaining time upon [this earth]3019-this earth to see [her]114-ayesha once like that again .

But suddenly - more suddenly than [I]0-i can describe - a kind of change came over [her]114-ayesha face , a change which [I]0-i could not define or explain , but none the less a change . The smile vanished , and in its place there came a dry , hard look ; the rounded face seemed to grow pinched , as though some great anxiety were leaving its impress upon it . The glorious eyes , too , lost their light , and , as [I]0-i thought , the form its perfect shape and erectness .

[I]0-i rubbed [my]0-i eyes , thinking that [I]0-i was [the victim of some hallucination]2802-the victim of some hallucination , or that the refraction from the intense light produced an optical delusion ; and , as [I]0-i did so , the flaming pillar slowly twisted and thundered off whithersoever it passes to in [the bowels of [the great earth]2804-the great earth]2803-the bowels of the great earth , leaving [Ayesha]114-ayesha standing where it had been .

As soon as it was gone , [she]114-ayesha stepped forward to [Leo]108-leo 's side - it seemed to [me]0-i that there was no spring in [her]114-ayesha step - and stretched out [her]114-ayesha hand to lay it on [his]108-leo shoulder . [I]0-i gazed at [her]114-ayesha arm . Where was its wonderful roundness and beauty ? It was getting thin and angular . And [her]114-ayesha face - by Heaven ! - [her]114-ayesha face was growing old before [my]0-i eyes ! [I]0-i suppose that [Leo]108-leo saw it also ; certainly [he]108-leo recoiled a step or two .

" What is it , [[my]114-ayesha [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates]4350-my kallikrates ? "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said , and [her]114-ayesha voice - what was the matter with those deep and thrilling notes ? They were quite high and cracked .

" Why , what is it - what is it ? "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said confusedly . " [I]114-ayesha feel dazed . Surely the quality of the fire hath not altered . Can the principle of Life alter ? Tell [me]114-ayesha , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , is there aught wrong with [my]114-ayesha eyes ? [I]114-ayesha see not clear , "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha put [her]114-ayesha hand to [her]114-ayesha head and touched [her]114-ayesha hair - and oh , horror of horrors ! - it all fell upon the floor .

" Oh , look ! - look ! - look ! "[137-job] shrieked [Job]137-job , in a shrill falsetto of terror , [his]137-job eyes nearly dropping out of [his]137-job head , and foam upon [his]137-job lips . " Look ! - look ! - look ! [she]114-ayesha 's shrivelling up ! [she]114-ayesha 's turning into [a monkey]4714-a monkey ! "[137-job] and down [he]137-job fell upon the ground , foaming and gnashing in a fit .

True enough - [I]0-i faint even as [I]0-i write it in the living presence of that terrible recollection - [she]114-ayesha was shrivelling up ; the golden snake that had encircled [her]114-ayesha gracious form slipped over [her]114-ayesha hips and to the ground ; smaller and smaller [she]114-ayesha grew ; [her]114-ayesha skin changed colour , and in place of the perfect whiteness of its lustre it turned dirty brown and yellow , like an piece of withered parchment . [She]114-ayesha felt at [her]114-ayesha head : the delicate hand was nothing but a claw now , a human talon like that of a badly - preserved Egyptian mummy , and then [she]114-ayesha seemed to realise what kind of change was passing over [her]114-ayesha , and [she]114-ayesha shrieked - ah , [she]114-ayesha shrieked ! - [she]114-ayesha rolled upon the floor and shrieked !

Smaller [she]114-ayesha grew , and smaller yet , till [she]114-ayesha was no larger than a monkey . Now the skin was puckered into a million wrinkles , and on the shapeless face was the stamp of unutterable age . [I]0-i never saw anything like it ; [nobody]488-nobody ever saw anything like the frightful age that was graven on that fearful countenance , no bigger now than that of [a two - months ' child]2806-a two - months ' child , though the skull remained the same size , or nearly so , and let [all men]1258-all men pray [they]1258-all men never may , if [they]1258-all men wish to keep [their]1258-all men reason .

At last [she]114-ayesha lay still , or only feebly moving . [She]114-ayesha , who but two minutes before had gazed upon [us]2808-us [the loveliest , noblest , most splendid woman [the world]252-the world has ever seen]2809-the loveliest , noblest , most splendid woman the world has ever seen , [she]114-ayesha lay still before [us]2808-us , near the masses of [her]114-ayesha own dark hair , no larger than a big monkey , and hideous - ah , too hideous for words . And yet , think of this - at that very moment [I]0-i thought of it - it was [the same woman]2811-the same woman !

[She]114-ayesha was dying : [we]2808-us saw it , and thanked [God]134-god - for while [she]114-ayesha lived [she]114-ayesha could feel , and what must [she]114-ayesha have felt ? [She]114-ayesha raised [herself]114-ayesha upon [her]114-ayesha bony hands , and blindly gazed around [her]114-ayesha , swaying [her]114-ayesha head slowly from side to side as a tortoise does . [She]114-ayesha could not see , for [her]114-ayesha whitish eyes were covered with a horny film . Oh , the horrible pathos of the sight ! But [she]114-ayesha could still speak .

" [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates , "[114-ayesha] [she]114-ayesha said in husky , trembling notes . " Forget [me]114-ayesha not , [Kallikrates]118-kallikrates . Have pity on [my]114-ayesha shame ; [I]114-ayesha shall come again , and shall once more be beautiful , [I]114-ayesha swear it - it is true ! Oh - h - h - "[114-ayesha] and [she]114-ayesha fell upon [her]114-ayesha face , and was still .

On the very spot where more than twenty centuries before [she]114-ayesha had slain [[Kallikrates]118-kallikrates [the priest]3061-the priest]2812-kallikrates the priest , [she]114-ayesha [herself]114-ayesha fell down and died .

[I]0-i know not how long [we]2814-we remained thus . Many hours , [I]0-i suppose . When at last [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes , the other two were still outstretched upon the floor . The rosy light yet beamed like a celestial dawn , and the thunder - wheels of the Spirit of Life yet rolled upon their accustomed track , for as [I]0-i awoke the great pillar was passing away . There , too , lay the hideous little monkey frame , covered with crinkled yellow parchment , that once had been the glorious [She]114-ayesha . Alas ! it was no hideous dream - it was an awful and unparalleled fact !

What had happened to bring this shocking change about ? Had the nature of the life - giving Fire changed ? Did it , perhaps , from time to time send forth an essence of Death instead of an essence of Life ? Or was it that the frame once charged with its marvellous virtue could bear no more , so that were the process repeated - it mattered not at what lapse of time - the two impregnations neutralised each other , and left the body on which [they]2815-they acted as it was before it ever came into contact with the very essence of Life ? This , and this alone , would account for the sudden and terrible ageing of [Ayesha]114-ayesha , as the whole length of [her]114-ayesha two thousand years took effect upon [her]114-ayesha . [I]0-i have not the slightest doubt [myself]0-i but that the frame now lying before [me]0-i was just what the frame of [a woman]284-a woman would be if by any extraordinary means life could be preserved in [her]114-ayesha till [she]114-ayesha at length died at the age of two - and - twenty centuries .

But who can tell what had happened ? There was the fact . Often since that awful hour [I]0-i have reflected that it requires no great imagination to see the finger of [Providence]179-providence in the matter . [Ayesha]114-ayesha locked up in [[her]114-ayesha living tomb]2817-her living tomb waiting from age to age for the coming of [[her]114-ayesha lover]316-her lover worked but a small change in the order of [the World]252-the world . But [Ayesha]114-ayesha strong and happy in [her]114-ayesha love , clothed in immortal youth and goddess beauty , and the wisdom of the centuries , would have revolutionised society , and even perchance have changed the destiny of [Mankind]985-mankind . Thus [she]114-ayesha opposed [herself]114-ayesha against the eternal law , and , strong though [she]114-ayesha was , by it was swept back to nothingness - swept back with shame and hideous mockery !

For some minutes [I]0-i lay faintly turning these terrors over in [my]0-i mind , while [my]0-i physical strength came back to [me]0-i , which it quickly did in that buoyant atmosphere . Then [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i of the others , and staggered to [my]0-i feet , to see if [I]0-i could arouse [them]2821-them . But first [I]0-i took up [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's kirtle and the gauzy scarf with which [she]114-ayesha had been wo nt to hide [her]114-ayesha dazzling loveliness from the eyes of [men]516-men , and , averting [my]0-i head so that [I]0-i might not look upon it , covered up that dreadful relic of the glorious dead , that shocking epitome of human beauty and human life . [I]0-i did this hurriedly , fearing lest [Leo]108-leo should recover , and see it again .

Then , stepping over the perfumed masses of dark hair that lay upon the sand , [I]0-i stooped down by [Job]137-job , who was lying upon [his]137-job face , and turned [him]137-job over . As [I]0-i did so [his]137-job arm fell back in a way that [I]0-i did not like , and which sent a chill through [me]0-i , and [I]0-i glanced sharply at [him]137-job . One look was enough . [[Our]2823-we old and faithful servant]2824-our old and faithful servant was dead . [His]137-job nerves , already shattered by all [he]137-job had seen and undergone , had utterly broken down beneath this last dire sight , and [he]137-job had died of terror , or in a fit brought on by terror . [I]0-i had only to look at [his]137-job face to see it .

It was another blow ; but perhaps it may help [people]454-people to understand how overwhelmingly awful was the experience through which [we]2823-we had passed - [we]2823-we did not feel it much at the time . It seemed quite natural that [the poor fellow]2826-the poor fellow should be dead . When [Leo]108-leo came to [himself]108-leo , which [he]108-leo did with a groan and trembling of the limbs about ten minutes afterwards , and [I]0-i told [him]108-leo that [Job]137-job was dead , [he]108-leo merely said , " Oh ! "[108-leo] And , mind [you]2827-you , this was from no heartlessness , for [he]108-leo and [Job]137-job were much attached to [each other]417-each other ; and [he]108-leo often talks of [him]108-leo now with the deepest regret and affection . It was only that [his]108-leo nerves would bear no more . A harp can give out but a certain quantity of sound , however heavily it is smitten .

Well , [I]0-i set [myself]0-i to recovering [Leo]108-leo , who , to [my]0-i infinite relief , [I]0-i found was not dead , but only fainting , and in the end [I]0-i succeeded , as [I]0-i have said , and [he]108-leo sat up ; and then [I]0-i saw another dreadful thing . When [we]2829-we entered [that awful place]2830-that awful place [his]108-leo curling hair had been of the ruddiest gold , now it was turning grey , and by the time [we]2829-we reached the outer air it was snow white . Besides , [he]108-leo looked twenty years older .

" What is to be done , [old fellow]3147-old fellow ? "[108-leo] [he]108-leo said in a hollow , dead sort of voice , when [his]108-leo mind had cleared a little , and a recollection of what had happened forced itself upon it .

" Try and get out , [I]0-i suppose , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " that is , unless [you]108-leo would like to go in there , "[0-i] and [I]0-i pointed to the column of fire that was once more rolling by .

" [I]108-leo would go in if [I]108-leo were sure that it would kill [me]108-leo , "[108-leo] [he]108-leo said with a little laugh . " It was [my]108-leo cursed hesitation that did this . If [I]108-leo had not been doubtful [she]4716-she might never have tried to show [me]108-leo [the road]2480-the road . But [I]108-leo am not sure . The fire might have the opposite effect upon [me]108-leo . It might make [me]108-leo immortal ; and , [old fellow]3147-old fellow , [I]108-leo have not the patience to wait a couple of thousand years for [her]4716-she to come back again as [she]4716-she did for [me]108-leo . [I]108-leo had rather die when [my]108-leo hour comes - and [I]108-leo should fancy that it is n't far off either - and go [my]108-leo ways to look for [her]4716-she . Do [you]3147-old fellow go in if [you]3147-old fellow like . "[108-leo]

But [I]0-i merely shook [my]0-i head , [my]0-i excitement was as dead as ditch - water , and [my]0-i distaste for the prolongation of [my]0-i mortal span had come back upon [me]0-i more strongly than ever . Besides , [we]2831-we neither of [us]2831-we knew what the effects of the fire might be . The result upon [She]2832-she had not been of an encouraging nature , and of the exact causes that produced that result [we]2831-we were , of course , ignorant .

" Well , [[my]0-i boy]3095-my boy , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [we]2831-we can not stop here till [we]2831-we go the way of [those two]4720-those two , "[0-i] and [I]0-i pointed to the little heap under the white garment and to the stiffing corpse of poor [Job]137-job . " If [we]2831-we are going [we]2831-we had better go . But , by the way , [I]0-i expect that the lamps have burnt out , "[0-i] and [I]0-i took one up and looked at it , and sure enough it had .

" There is some more oil in the vase , "[108-leo] said [Leo]108-leo indifferently - " if it is not broken , at least . "[108-leo]

[I]0-i examined the vessel in question - it was intact . With a trembling hand [I]0-i filled the lamps - luckily there was still some of the linen wick unburnt . Then [I]0-i lit them with one of [our]2831-we wax matches . While [I]0-i did so [we]2831-we heard the pillar of fire approaching once more as [it]2833-it went on its never - ending journey , if , indeed , it was the same pillar that passed and repassed in a circle .

" Let 's see it come once more , "[108-leo] said [Leo]108-leo ; " [we]2831-we shall never look upon its like again in [this world]350-this world . "[108-leo]

It seemed a bit of idle curiosity , but somehow [I]0-i shared it , and so [we]2831-we waited till , turning slowly round upon its own axis , it had flamed and thundered by ; and [I]0-i remember wondering for how many thousands of years this same phenomenon had been taking place in [the bowels of [the earth]659-the earth]2834-the bowels of the earth , and for how many more thousands it would continue to take place . [I]0-i wondered also if [any mortal eyes]2836-any mortal eyes would ever again mark its passage , or [any mortal ears]2837-any mortal ears be thrilled and fascinated by the swelling volume of its majestic sound . [I]0-i do not think that [they]2837-any mortal ears will . [I]0-i believe that [we]2831-we are [the last human beings who will ever see that unearthly sight]2838-the last human beings who will ever see that unearthly sight . Presently it had gone , and [we]2831-we too turned to go .

But before [we]2831-we did so [we]2831-we each took [Job]137-job 's cold hand in [ours]2831-we and shook it . It was a rather ghastly ceremony , but it was the only means in [our]2831-we power of showing [our]2831-we respect to [the faithful dead]2839-the faithful dead and of celebrating [his]2839-the faithful dead obsequies . The heap beneath the white garment [we]2831-we did not uncover . [We]2831-we had no wish to look upon that terrible sight again . But [we]2831-we went to the pile of rippling hair that had fallen from [her]2840-her in the agony of that hideous change which was worse than a thousand natural deaths , and each of [us]2831-we drew from it a shining lock , and these locks [we]2831-we still have , the sole memento that is left to [us]2831-we of [Ayesha]114-ayesha as [we]2831-we knew [her]114-ayesha in the fulness of [her]114-ayesha grace and glory . [Leo]108-leo pressed the perfumed hair to [his]108-leo lips .

" [She]114-ayesha called to [me]108-leo not to forget [her]114-ayesha , "[108-leo] [he]108-leo said hoarsely ; " and swore that [we]2831-we should meet again . By Heaven ! [I]108-leo never will forget [her]114-ayesha . Here [I]108-leo swear that if [we]2831-we live to get out of this , [I]108-leo will not for all [my]108-leo days have anything to say to [another living woman]4722-another living woman , and that wherever [I]108-leo go [I]108-leo will wait for [her]114-ayesha as faithfully as [she]114-ayesha waited for [me]108-leo . "[108-leo]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , " if [she]114-ayesha comes back as beautiful as [we]2841-we knew [her]114-ayesha . But supposing [she]114-ayesha came back like that ! "[0-i]

What a terrifying reflection it is , by the way , that nearly all [our]2841-we deep love for [women who are not [our]2841-we kindred]2842-women who are not our kindred depends - at any rate , in the first instance - upon [their]2842-women who are not our kindred personal appearance . If [we]2841-we lost [them]2842-women who are not our kindred , and found [them]2842-women who are not our kindred again dreadful to look on , though otherwise [they]2842-women who are not our kindred were the very same , should [we]2841-we still love [them]2842-women who are not our kindred ? - L. H. H.

Well , and then [we]2841-we went . [We]2841-we went , and left [those two]4720-those two in the presence of the very well and spring of Life , but gathered to the cold company of Death . How lonely [they]4720-those two looked as [they]4720-those two lay there , and how ill assorted ! That little heap had been for two thousand years the wisest , loveliest , proudest creature - [I]0-i can hardly call [[her]2844-her woman]2845-her woman - in [the whole universe]2846-the whole universe . [She]2844-her had been wicked , too , in [her]2844-her way ; but , alas ! such is the frailty of the human heart , [her]2844-her wickedness had not detracted from [her]2844-her charm . Indeed , [I]0-i am by no means certain that it did not add to it . It was after all of a grand order , there was nothing mean or small about [Ayesha]114-ayesha .

And poor Job too ! [His]2844-her presentiment had come true , and there was an end of [him]2844-her . Well , [he]2844-her has a strange burial - place - [no Norfolk hind]2847-no norfolk hind ever had [a stranger]3108-a stranger , or ever will ; and it is something to lie in [the same sepulchre]2849-the same sepulchre as the poor remains of [the imperial She]2850-the imperial she .

[We]2851-we looked [our]2851-we last upon [them]4720-those two and the indescribable rosy glow in which [they]4720-those two lay , and then with hearts far too heavy for words [we]2851-we left [them]4720-those two , and crept [thence broken - down men]2852-thence broken - down men - so broken down that [we]2851-we even renounced the chance of practically immortal life , because all that made life valuable had gone from [us]2851-we , and [we]2851-we knew even then that to prolong [our]2851-we days indefinitely would only be to prolong [our]2851-we sufferings . For [we]2851-we felt - yes , both of [us]2851-we - that having once looked [Ayesha]114-ayesha in the eyes , [we]2851-we could not forget [her]114-ayesha for ever and ever while memory and identity remained . [We]2851-we both loved [her]114-ayesha now and for all time , [she]114-ayesha was stamped and carven on [our]2851-we hearts , and [no other woman]1107-no other woman or interest could ever raze that splendid die . And [I]0-i - there lies the sting - [I]0-i had and have no right to think thus of [her]114-ayesha . As [she]114-ayesha told [me]0-i , [I]0-i was naught to [her]114-ayesha , and never shall be through the unfathomed depths of Time , unless , indeed , conditions alter , and a day comes at last when [two men]1356-two men may love [one woman]2855-one woman , and [all three]2856-all three be happy in the fact . It is the only hope of [my]0-i broken - heartedness , and a rather faint one . Beyond it [I]0-i have nothing . [I]0-i have paid down this heavy price , all that [I]0-i am worth here and hereafter , and that is [my]0-i sole reward . With [Leo]108-leo it is different , and often and often [I]0-i bitterly envy [him]108-leo [his]108-leo happy lot , for if [She]114-ayesha was right , and [her]114-ayesha wisdom and knowledge did not fail [her]114-ayesha at the last , which , arguing from the precedent of [her]114-ayesha own case , [I]0-i think most unlikely , [he]108-leo has some future to look forward to . But [I]0-i have none , and yet - mark the folly and the weakness of the human heart , and let [him]108-leo who is wise learn wisdom from it - yet [I]0-i would not have it otherwise . [I]0-i mean that [I]0-i am content to give what [I]0-i have given and must always give , and take in payment those crumbs that fall from [[my]0-i mistress]2857-my mistress 's table , the memory of a few kind words , the hope one day in the far undreamed future of a sweet smile or two of recognition , a little gentle friendship , and a little show of thanks for [my]0-i devotion to [her]114-ayesha - and [Leo]108-leo .

If that does not constitute true love , [I]0-i do not know what does , and all [I]0-i have to say is that it is a very bad state of affairs for [a man on the wrong side of middle age]2858-a man on the wrong side of middle age to fall into .

XXVII

[WE]2859-we LEAP

[We]2859-we passed through [the caves]3307-the caves without trouble , but when [we]2859-we came to [the slope of [the inverted cone]2862-the inverted cone]2861-the slope of the inverted cone two difficulties stared [us]2859-we in the face . The first of these was the laborious nature of the ascent , and the next the extreme difficulty of finding [our]2859-we way . Indeed , had it not been for the mental notes that [I]0-i had fortunately taken of the shape of various rocks , [I]0-i am sure that [we]2859-we never should have managed it at all , but have wandered about in the dreadful womb of [the volcano]2646-the volcano - for [I]0-i suppose it must once have been something of the sort - until [we]2859-we died of exhaustion and despair . As it was [we]2859-we went wrong several times , and once nearly fell into a huge crack or crevasse . It was terrible work creeping about in the dense gloom and awful stillness from boulder to boulder , and examining it by the feeble light of the lamps to see if [I]0-i could recognise its shape . [We]2859-we rarely spoke , [our]2859-we hearts were too heavy for speech , [we]2859-we simply stumbled about , falling sometimes and cutting [ourselves]2859-we , in a rather dogged sort of way . The fact was that [our]2859-we spirits were utterly crushed , and [we]2859-we did not greatly care what happened to [us]2859-we . Only [we]2859-we felt bound to try and save [our]2859-we lives whilst [we]2859-we could , and indeed a natural instinct prompted [us]2859-we to it . So for some three or four hours , [I]0-i should think - [I]0-i can not tell exactly how long , for [we]2859-we had no watch left that would go - [we]2859-we blundered on . During the last two hours [we]2859-we were completely lost , and [I]0-i began to fear that [we]2859-we had got into the funnel of some subsidiary cone , when at last [I]0-i suddenly recognised [a very large rock which [we]2859-we had passed in descending but a little way from the top]2864-a very large rock which we had passed in descending but a little way from the top . It is a marvel that [I]0-i should have recognised it , and , indeed , [we]2859-we had already passed it going at right angles to the proper path , when something about it struck [me]0-i , and [I]0-i turned back and examined it in an idle sort of way , and , as it happened , this proved [our]2859-we salvation .

After this [we]2859-we gained [the rocky natural stair]2865-the rocky natural stair without much further trouble , and in due course found [ourselves]2859-we back in [the little chamber where [the benighted Noot]2867-the benighted noot had lived and died]2866-the little chamber where the benighted noot had lived and died .

But now a fresh terror stared [us]2859-we in the face . It will be remembered that owing to [Job]137-job 's fear and awkwardness , the plank upon which [we]2859-we had crossed from the huge spur to the rocking - stone had been whirled off into [the tremendous gulf below]2868-the tremendous gulf below .

How were [we]2859-we to cross without the plank ?

There was only one answer - [we]2859-we must try and jump it , or else stop there till [we]2859-we starved . The distance in itself was not so very great , between eleven and twelve feet [I]0-i should think , and [I]0-i have seen [Leo]108-leo jump over twenty when [he]108-leo was [a young fellow at collage]2869-a young fellow at collage ; but then , think of the conditions . [Two weary , worn - out men]2870-two weary , worn - out men , [one of [them]2870-two weary , worn - out men on the wrong side of forty]2871-one of them on the wrong side of forty , a rocking - stone to take off from , a trembling point of rock some few feet across to land upon , and [a bottomless gulf]2872-a bottomless gulf to be cleared in a raging gale ! It was bad enough , God knows , but when [I]0-i pointed out these things to [Leo]108-leo , [he]108-leo put the whole matter in a nutshell , by replying that , merciless as the choice was , [we]2859-we must choose between the certainty of a lingering death in [the chamber]1053-the chamber and the risk of a swift one in the air . Of course , there was no arguing against this , but one thing was clear , [we]2859-we could not attempt that leap in the dark ; the only thing to do was to wait for the ray of light which pierced through [the gulf]2672-the gulf at sunset . How near to or how far from sunset [we]2859-we might be , [neither of [us]2859-we]2875-neither of us had the faintest notion ; all [we]2859-we did know was , that when at last the light came it would not endure more than a couple of minutes at the outside , so that [we]2859-we must be prepared to meet it . Accordingly , [we]2859-we made up [our]2859-we minds to creep on to the top of the rocking - stone and lie there in readiness . [We]2859-we were the more easily reconciled to this course by the fact that [our]2859-we lamps were once more nearly exhausted - indeed , one had gone out bodily , and [the other]882-the other was jumping up and down as the flame of a lamp does when the oil is done . So , by the aid of its dying light , [we]2859-we hastened to crawl out of [the little chamber]1312-the little chamber and clamber up the side of the great stone .

As [we]2859-we did so the light went out .

The difference in [our]2859-we position was a sufficiently remarkable one . Below , in [the little chamber]1312-the little chamber , [we]2859-we had only heard the roaring of the gale overhead - here , lying on [our]2859-we faces on the swinging stone , [we]2859-we were exposed to its full force and fury , as the great draught drew first from this direction and then from that , howling against the mighty precipice and through [the rocky cliffs]2879-the rocky cliffs like [ten thousand despairing souls]2880-ten thousand despairing souls . [We]2859-we lay there hour after hour in terror and misery of mind so deep that [I]0-i will not attempt to describe it , and listened to the wild storm - voices of that Tartarus , as , set to the deep undertone of the spur opposite against which the wind hummed like some awful harp , [they]2881-they called to [each other]417-each other from precipice to precipice . No nightmare dreamed by [man]3189-man , [no wild invention of the romancer]2884-no wild invention of the romancer , can ever equal the living horror of [that place]2885-that place , and the weird crying of those voices of the night , as [we]2859-we clung like shipwrecked mariners to a raft , and tossed on the black , unfathomed wilderness of air . Fortunately the temperature was not a low one ; indeed , the wind was warm , or [we]2859-we should have perished . So [we]2859-we clung and listened , and while [we]2859-we were stretched out upon [the rock]550-the rock a thing happened which was so curious and suggestive in itself , though doubtless a mere coincidence , that , if anything , it added to , rather than deducted from , the burden on [our]2859-we nerves .

It will be remembered that when [Ayesha]114-ayesha was standing on the spur , before [we]2859-we crossed to the stone , the wind tore [her]114-ayesha cloak from [her]114-ayesha , and whirled it away into the darkness of [the gulf]2672-the gulf , [we]2859-we could not see whither . Well - [I]0-i hardly like to tell the story ; it is so strange . As [we]2859-we lay there upon the rocking - stone , this very cloak came floating out of [the black space]2888-the black space , like a memory from the dead , and fell on [Leo]108-leo - so that it covered [him]108-leo nearly from head to foot . [We]2859-we could not at first make out what it was , but soon discovered by its feel , and then poor [Leo]108-leo , for the first time , gave way , and [I]0-i heard [him]108-leo sobbing there upon the stone . No doubt the cloak had been caught upon [some pinnacle of [the cliff]723-the cliff]2889-some pinnacle of the cliff , and was thence blown hither by a chance gust ; but still , it was a most curious and touching incident .

Shortly after this , suddenly , without the slightest previous warning , the great red knife of light came stabbing the darkness through and through - struck the swaying stone on which [we]2859-we were , and rested its sharp point upon the spur opposite .

" Now for it , "[108-leo] said [Leo]108-leo , " now or never . "[108-leo]

[We]2859-we rose and stretched [ourselves]2859-we , and looked at the cloud - wreaths stained the colour of blood by that red ray as they tore through the sickening depths beneath , and then at the empty space between the swaying stone and [the quivering rock]2891-the quivering rock , and , in [our]2859-we hearts , despaired , and prepared for death . Surely [we]2859-we could not clear it - desperate though [we]2859-we were .

" Who is to go first ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Do [you]0-i , [old fellow]3147-old fellow , "[108-leo] answered [Leo]108-leo . " [I]108-leo will sit upon the other side of the stone to steady [it]2891-the quivering rock . [You]0-i must take as much run as [you]0-i can , and jump high ; and [God]134-god have mercy on [us]2859-we , say [I.]108-leo "[108-leo]

[I]0-i acquiesced with a nod , and then [I]0-i did a thing [I]0-i had never done since [Leo]108-leo was [a little boy]2892-a little boy . [I]0-i turned and put [my]0-i arm round [him]108-leo , and kissed [him]108-leo on the forehead . It sounds rather French , but as a fact [I]0-i was taking [my]0-i last farewell of [a man whom [I]0-i could not have loved more if [he]108-leo had been [[my]0-i own son]2894-my own son twice over]2893-a man whom i could not have loved more if he had been my own son twice over .

" Good - bye , [[my]0-i boy]3095-my boy , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i hope that [we]4725-we shall meet again , wherever it is that [we]4725-we go to . "[0-i]

The fact was [I]0-i did not expect to live another two minutes .

Next [I]0-i retreated to [the far side of the rock]2895-the far side of the rock , and waited till one of the chopping gusts of wind got behind [me]0-i , and then [I]0-i ran the length of the huge stone , some three or four and thirty feet , and sprang wildly out into the dizzy air . Oh ! the sickening terrors that [I]0-i felt as [I]0-i launched [myself]0-i at [that little point of rock]2896-that little point of rock , and the horrible sense of despair that shot through [my]0-i brain as [I]0-i realised that [I]0-i had jumped short ! but so it was , [my]0-i feet never touched the point , they went down into space , only [my]0-i hands and body came in contact with it . [I]0-i gripped at it with a yell , but one hand slipped , and [I]0-i swung right round , holding by the other , so that [I]0-i faced the stone from which [I]0-i had sprung . Wildly [I]0-i stretched up with [my]0-i left hand , and this time managed to grasp a knob of rock , and there [I]0-i hung in the fierce red light , with thousands of feet of empty air beneath [me]0-i . [My]0-i hands were holding to either side of the under part of the spur , so that its point was touching [my]0-i head . Therefore , even if [I]0-i could have found the strength , [I]0-i could not pull [myself]0-i up . The most that [I]0-i could do would be to hang for about a minute , and then drop down , down into [the bottomless pit]2897-the bottomless pit . If [any man]965-any man can imagine a more hideous position , let [him]965-any man speak ! All [I]0-i know is that the torture of that half - minute nearly turned [my]0-i brain .

[I]0-i heard [Leo]108-leo give a cry , and then suddenly saw [him]108-leo in mid air springing up and out like a chamois . It was a splendid leap that [he]108-leo took under the influence of [his]108-leo terror and despair , clearing the horrible gulf as if it were nothing , and , landing well on to [the rocky point]2899-the rocky point , [he]108-leo threw [himself]108-leo upon [his]108-leo face , to prevent [his]108-leo pitching off into [the depths]2900-the depths . [I]0-i felt the spur above [me]0-i shake beneath the shock of [his]108-leo impact , and as it did so [I]0-i saw the huge rocking - stone , that had been violently depressed by [him]108-leo as [he]108-leo sprang , fly back when relieved of [his]108-leo weight till , for the first time during all these centuries , it got beyond its balance , fell with a most awful crash right into the rocky chamber which had once served [the philosopher Noot for [a hermitage]2902-a hermitage]2901-the philosopher noot for a hermitage , and , [I]0-i have no doubt , for ever sealed the passage that leads to [the Place of Life]4390-the place of life with some hundreds of tons of rock .

All this happened in a second , and curiously enough , notwithstanding [my]0-i terrible position , [I]0-i noted it involuntarily , as it were . [I]0-i even remember thinking that [no human being]2904-no human being would go down that dread path again .

Next instant [I]0-i felt [Leo]108-leo seize [me]0-i by the right wrist with both hands . By lying flat on the point of rock [he]108-leo could just reach [me]0-i .

" [You]0-i must let go and swing [yourself]0-i clear , "[108-leo] [he]108-leo said in a calm and collected voice , " and then [I]108-leo will try and pull [you]0-i up , or [we]4726-we will both go together . Are [you]0-i ready ? "[108-leo]

By way of answer [I]0-i let go , first with [my]0-i left hand and then with the right , and , as a consequence , swayed out clear of the overshadowing rock , [my]0-i weight hanging upon [Leo]108-leo 's arms . It was a dreadful moment . [He]108-leo was [a very powerful man]2905-a very powerful man , [I]0-i knew , but would [his]108-leo strength be equal to lifting [me]0-i up till [I]0-i could get a hold on the top of the spur , when owing to [his]108-leo position [he]108-leo had so little purchase ?

For a few seconds [I]0-i swung to and fro , while [he]108-leo gathered [himself]108-leo for the effort , and then [I]0-i heard [his]108-leo sinews cracking above [me]0-i , and felt [myself]0-i lifted up as though [I]0-i were [a little child]2906-a little child , till [I]0-i got [my]0-i left arm round the rock , and [my]0-i chest was resting on it . The rest was easy ; in two or three more seconds [I]0-i was up , and [we]2907-we were lying panting side by side , trembling like leaves , and with the cold perspiration of terror pouring from [our]2907-we skins .

And then , as before , the light went out like a lamp .

For some half - hour [we]2907-we lay thus without speaking a word , and then at length began to creep along the great spur as best [we]2907-we might in the dense gloom . As [we]2907-we drew towards the face of [the cliff]723-the cliff , however , from which the spur sprang out like a spike from a wall , the light increased , though only a very little , for it was night overhead . After that the gusts of wind decreased , and [we]2907-we got along rather better , and at last reached [the mouth of [the first cave or tunnel]2910-the first cave or tunnel]2909-the mouth of the first cave or tunnel . But now a fresh trouble stared as in the face : [our]2907-we oil was gone , and the lamps were , no doubt , crushed to powder beneath the fallen rocking - stone . [We]2907-we were even without a drop of water to stay [our]2907-we thirst , for [we]2907-we had drunk the last in [the chamber of [Noot]242-noot]2911-the chamber of noot . How were [we]2907-we to see to make [our]2907-we way through [this last boulder - strewn tunnel]2912-this last boulder - strewn tunnel ?

Clearly all that [we]2907-we could do was to trust to [our]2907-we sense of feeling , and attempt the passage in the dark , so in [we]2907-we crept , fearing that if [we]2907-we delayed to do so [our]2907-we exhaustion would overcome [us]2907-we , and [we]2907-we should probably lie down and die where [we]2907-we were .

Oh , the horrors of [that last tunnel]2913-that last tunnel ! [The place]1059-the place was strewn with rocks , and [we]2907-we fell over them , and knocked [ourselves]2907-we up against [them]2915-them till [we]2907-we were bleeding from a score of wounds . [Our]2907-we only guide was the side of [the cavern]1056-the cavern , which [we]2907-we kept touching , and so bewildered did [we]2907-we grow in the darkness that [we]2907-we were several times seized with the terrifying thought that [we]2907-we had turned , and were travelling the wrong way . On [we]2907-we went , feebly , and still more feebly , for hour after hour , stopping every few minutes to rest , for [our]2907-we strength was spent . Once [we]2907-we fell asleep , and , [I]0-i think , must have slept for some hours , for , when [we]2907-we woke , [our]2907-we limbs were quite stiff , and the blood from [our]2907-we blows and scratches had caked , and was hard and dry upon [our]2907-we skin . Then [we]2907-we dragged [ourselves]2907-we on again , till at last , when despair was entering into [our]2907-we hearts , [we]2907-we once more saw the light of day , and found [ourselves]2907-we outside [the tunnel]1826-the tunnel in the rocky fold on [the outer surface of [the cliff]723-the cliff that , it will be remembered]2918-the outer surface of the cliff that , it will be remembered , led into [it]1826-the tunnel .

It was early morning - that [we]2907-we could tell by the feel of the sweet air and the look of the blessed sky , which [we]2907-we had never hoped to see again . It was , so near as [we]2907-we knew , an hour after sunset when [we]2907-we entered [the tunnel]1826-the tunnel , so it followed that it had taken [us]2907-we the entire night to crawl through [that dreadful place]2675-that dreadful place .

" One more effort , [Leo]108-leo , "[0-i] [I]0-i gasped , " and [we]2907-we shall reach the slope where [Billali]137-job is , if [he]137-job has n't gone . Come , do n't give way , "[0-i] for [he]2922-he had cast [himself]2922-he upon [his]2922-he face . [He]2922-he rose , and , leaning on each other , [we]2907-we got down that fifty feet or so of cliff - somehow , [I]0-i have not the least notion how . [I]0-i only remember that [we]2907-we found [ourselves]2907-we lying in a heap at the bottom , and then once more began to drag [ourselves]2907-we along on [our]2907-we hands and knees towards the grove where [She]2923-she had told [Billali]137-job to wait [her]2923-she re - arrival , for [we]2907-we could not walk another foot . [We]2907-we had not gone fifty yards in this fashion when suddenly [one of [the mutes]1948-the mutes]2924-one of the mutes emerged from the trees on [our]2907-we left , through which , [I]0-i presume , [he]2924-one of the mutes had been taking a morning stroll , and came running up to see what sort of strange animals [we]2907-we were . [He]2924-one of the mutes stared , and stared , and then held up [his]2924-one of the mutes hands in horror , and nearly fell to the ground . Next , [he]2924-one of the mutes started off as hard as [he]2924-one of the mutes could for [the grove]2926-the grove some two hundred yards away . No wonder that [he]2924-one of the mutes was horrified at [our]2907-we appearance , for [we]2907-we must have been a shocking sight . To begin , [Leo]108-leo , with [his]108-leo golden curls turned a snowy white , [his]108-leo clothes nearly rent from [his]108-leo body , [his]108-leo worn face and [his]108-leo hands a mass of bruises , cuts , and blood - encrusted filth , was a sufficiently alarming spectacle , as [he]108-leo painfully dragged [himself]108-leo along [the ground]2927-the ground , and [I]0-i have no doubt that [I]0-i was little better to look on . [I]0-i know that two days afterwards when [I]0-i inspected [my]0-i face in some water [I]0-i scarcely recognised [myself]0-i . [I]0-i have never been famous for beauty , but there was something beside ugliness stamped upon [my]0-i features that [I]0-i have never got rid of until this day , something resembling that wild look with which [a startled person]2928-a startled person wakes from deep sleep more than anything else that [I]0-i can think of . And really it is not to be wondered at . What [I]0-i do wonder at is that [we]2929-we escaped at all with [our]2929-we reason .

Presently , to [my]0-i intense relief , [I]0-i saw [old Billali]190-billali hurrying towards [us]2929-we , and even then [I]0-i could scarcely help smiling at the expression of consternation on [his]190-billali dignified countenance .

" Oh , [[my]190-billali Baboon]3510-my baboon ! [[my]190-billali Baboon]3510-my baboon ! "[190-billali] [he]190-billali cried , " [[my]190-billali dear son]3904-my dear son , is it indeed [thee]3904-my dear son and [the Lion]183-leo ? Why , [his]190-billali mane that was ripe as corn is white like the snow . Whence come [ye]3904-my dear son ? and where is the Pig , and where too [She]4730-she - who - must - be - obeyed ? "[190-billali]

" Dead , both dead , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " but ask no questions ; help [us]2929-we , and give [us]2929-we food and water , or [we]2929-we too shall die before thine eyes . Seest [thou]2929-we not that [our]2929-we tongues are black for want of water ? How , then , can [we]2929-we talk ? "[0-i]

" Dead ! "[190-billali] [he]190-billali gasped . " Impossible . [She]4730-she who never dies - dead , how can it be ? "[190-billali] and then , perceiving , [I]0-i think , that [his]190-billali face was being watched by the mutes who had come running up , [he]190-billali checked [himself]190-billali , and motioned to [them]2930-they to carry [us]2931-us to [the camp]2932-the camp , which [they]2930-they did .

Fortunately when [we]2931-us arrived some broth was boiling on the fire , and with this [Billali]190-billali fed [us]2931-us , for [we]2931-us were too weak to feed [ourselves]2931-us , thereby [I]0-i firmly believe saving [us]2931-us from death by exhaustion . Then [he]190-billali bade [the mutes]1948-the mutes wash the blood and grime from [us]2931-us with wet cloths , and after that [we]2931-us were laid down upon piles of aromatic grass , and instantly fell into the dead sleep of absolute exhaustion of mind and body .

XXVIII

OVER [THE MOUNTAIN]98-the mountain

The next thing [I]0-i recollect is a feeling of the most dreadful stiffness , and a sort of vague idea passing through [my]0-i half - awakened brain that [I]0-i was [a carpet that had just been beaten]2934-a carpet that had just been beaten . [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes , and the first thing [they]2930-they fell on was the venerable countenance of [[our]2931-us old friend]2529-our old friend [Billali]190-billali , who was seated by the side of the improvised bed upon which [I]0-i was sleeping , and thoughtfully stroking [his]190-billali long beard . The sight of [him]190-billali at once brought back to [my]0-i mind a recollection of all that [we]2931-us had recently passed through , which was accentuated by the vision of poor [Leo]183-leo lying opposite to [me]0-i , [his]183-leo face knocked almost to a jelly , and [his]183-leo beautiful crowd of curls turned from yellow to white , and [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes again and groaned .

Curiously enough , [Leo]183-leo 's hair has lately been to some extent regaining its colour - that is to say , it is now a yellowish grey , and [I]0-i am not without hopes that it will in time come quite right . - L. H. H.

" [Thou]4731-thou hast slept long , [[my]190-billali Baboon]3510-my baboon , "[190-billali] said [old Billali]190-billali .

" How long , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" A round of the sun and a round of the moon , a day and a night hast [thou]4731-thou slept , and the Lion also . See , [he]183-leo sleepeth yet . "[190-billali]

" Blessed is sleep , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " for it swallows up recollection . "[0-i]

" Tell [me]190-billali , "[190-billali] [he]190-billali said , " what hath befallen [you]0-i , and what is this strange story of the death of [Her]4734-her who dieth not . Bethink [thee]0-i , [[my]190-billali son]3150-my son : if this be true , then is [thy]0-i danger and the danger of the Lion very great - nay , almost is the pot red wherewith [ye]0-i shall be potted , and the stomachs of those who shall eat [ye]0-i are already hungry for the feast . Knowest [thou]0-i not that [these Amahagger]4736-these amahagger , [[my]190-billali children]3679-my children , [these dwellers in [the caves]3307-the caves]4738-these dwellers in the caves , hate [ye]0-i ? [They]4736-these amahagger hate [ye]0-i as [strangers]3229-strangers , [they]4736-these amahagger hate [ye]0-i more because of [[their]4736-these amahagger brethren]4741-their brethren whom [She]4742-she put to the torment for [your]0-i sake . Assuredly , if once [they]4736-these amahagger learn that there is naught to fear from [Hiya]174-hiya , from [the terrible One - who - must - be - obeyed]4743-the terrible one - who - must - be - obeyed , [they]4736-these amahagger will slay [ye]0-i by the pot . But let [me]190-billali hear [thy]174-hiya tale , [[my]190-billali poor Baboon]3640-my poor baboon . "[190-billali]

This adjured , [I]0-i set to work and told [him]2936-him - not everything , indeed , for [I]0-i did not think it desirable to do so , but sufficient for [my]0-i purpose , which was to make [him]2936-him understand that [She]2937-she was really no more , having fallen into some fire , and , as [I]0-i put it - for the real thing would have been incomprehensible to [him]2936-him - been burnt up . [I]0-i also told [him]2936-him some of the horrors [we]2938-we had undergone in effecting [our]2938-we escape , and these produced a great impression on [him]2936-him . But [I]0-i clearly saw that [he]2936-him did not believe in the report of [Ayesha]114-ayesha 's death . [He]2936-him believed indeed that [we]2938-we thought that [she]2937-she was dead , but [his]2936-him explanation was that it had suited [her]2937-she to disappear for a while . Once , [he]2936-him said , in [[his]2936-him father]3053-his father 's time , [she]2937-she had done so for twelve years , and there was a tradition in [the country]3308-the country that many centuries back [no one]3428-no one had seen [her]2937-she for [a whole generation]2942-a whole generation , when [she]2937-she suddenly reappeared , and destroyed [a woman who had assumed the position of [Queen]2944-queen]2943-a woman who had assumed the position of queen . [I]0-i said nothing to this , but only shook [my]0-i head sadly . Alas ! [I]0-i knew too well that [Ayesha]114-ayesha would appear no more , or at any rate that [Billali]190-billali would never see [her]2937-she again .

" And now , "[190-billali] concluded [Billali]190-billali , " what wouldst [thou]4745-thou do , [[my]190-billali Baboon]3510-my baboon ? "[190-billali]

" Nay , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i know not , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father . Can [we]4748-we not escape from [this country]302-this country ? "[0-i]

[He]190-billali shook [his]190-billali head .

" It is very difficult . By K"r[190-billali] [ye]0-i can not pass , for [ye]0-i would be seen , and as soon as [those fierce ones]2945-those fierce ones found that [ye]0-i were alone , well , " and [he]190-billali smiled significantly , and made a movement as though [he]190-billali were placing a hat on [his]190-billali head . "[2945-those fierce ones] But there is a way over [the cliff]723-the cliff whereof [I]0-i once spake to [thee]2947-ye , where [they]2945-those fierce ones drive the cattle out to pasture . Then beyond [the pastures]2948-the pastures are three days ' journey through [the marshes]1130-the marshes , and after that [I]0-i know not , but [I]0-i have heard that seven days ' journey from thence is [a mighty river]3217-a mighty river , which floweth to [the black water]2951-the black water . If [ye]0-i could come thither , perchance [ye]0-i might escape , but how can [ye]0-i come thither ? "[0-i]

" [Billali]190-billali , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " once , [thou]2947-ye knowest , [I]0-i did save [thy]2947-ye life . Now pay back the debt , [[my]0-i father]3091-my father , and save [me]0-i [mine]0-i and [[my]0-i friend]266-my friend 's , [the Lion]183-leo 's . It shall be a pleasant thing for [thee]2947-ye to think of when thine hour comes , and something to set in the scale against the evil doing of [thy]2947-ye days , if perchance [thou]2947-ye hast done any evil . Also , if [thou]2947-ye be right , and if [She]2947-ye doth but hide [herself]2947-ye , surely when [she]2947-ye comes again [she]2947-ye shall reward [thee]2947-ye . "[0-i]

" [[My]910-the old man son]3150-my son [the Baboon]180-the baboon , "[910-the old man] answered [the old man]910-the old man , " think not that [I]910-the old man have an ungrateful heart . Well do [I]910-the old man remember how [thou]2947-ye didst rescue [me]910-the old man when those dogs stood by to see [me]910-the old man drown . Measure for measure will [I]910-the old man give [thee]2947-ye , and if [thou]2947-ye canst be saved , surely [I]910-the old man will save [thee]2947-ye . Listen : by dawn to - morrow be prepared , for litters shall be here to bear [ye]2947-ye away across [the mountains]3433-the mountains , and through [the marshes beyond]4754-the marshes beyond . This will [I]910-the old man do , saying that it is the word of [She]2947-ye that it be done , and [he]4755-he who obeyeth not the word of [She]2947-ye food is [he]4755-he for [the hyænas]4756-the hyænas . Then when [ye]2947-ye have crossed [the marshes]1130-the marshes , [ye]2947-ye must strike with [your]2947-ye own hands , so that perchance , if good fortune go with [you]2947-ye , [ye]2947-ye may live to come to that black water whereof [ye]2947-ye told [me]910-the old man . And now , see , the Lion wakes , and [ye]2947-ye must eat the food [I]910-the old man have made ready for [you]2947-ye . "[910-the old man]

[Leo]183-leo 's condition when once [he]183-leo was fairly aroused proved not to be so bad as might have been expected from [his]183-leo appearance , and [[we]2953-we both of [us]2953-we]2954-we both of us managed to eat a hearty meal , which indeed [we]2953-we needed sadly enough . After this [we]2953-we limped down to the spring and bathed , and then came back and slept again till evening , when [we]2953-we once more ate enough for five . [Billali]190-billali was away all that day , no doubt making arrangements about litters and [bearers]2955-bearers , for [we]2953-we were awakened in the middle of the night by the arrival of [a considerable number of men in [the little camp]2957-the little camp]2956-a considerable number of men in the little camp .

At dawn [the old man]910-the old man himself appeared , and told [us]2953-we that [he]910-the old man had by using [She]2959-she 's dreadful name , though with some difficulty , succeeded in getting [the necessary men]2960-the necessary men and [two guides]2961-two guides to conduct [us]2953-we across [the swamps]3176-the swamps , and that [he]910-the old man urged [us]2953-we to start at once , at the same time announcing [his]910-the old man intention of accompanying [us]2953-we so as to protect [us]2953-we against treachery . [I]0-i was much touched by this act of kindness on the part of [that wily old barbarian towards [two utterly defenceless strangers]2964-two utterly defenceless strangers]2963-that wily old barbarian towards two utterly defenceless strangers . A three - or in [his]910-the old man case , for [he]910-the old man would have to return , six - days ' journey through [those deadly swamps]2965-those deadly swamps was no light undertaking for [a man of [his]910-the old man age]2966-a man of his age , but [he]910-the old man consented to do it cheerfully in order to promote [our]2953-we safety . It shows that even among [those dreadful [Amahagger]171-the amahagger - who are certainly with [their]2967-those dreadful amahagger - who are certainly with their gloom and their devilish and ferocious rites by far the most terrible savages that i ever heard of gloom and [their]2967-those dreadful amahagger - who are certainly with their gloom and their devilish and ferocious rites by far the most terrible savages that i ever heard of devilish and ferocious rites by far the most terrible savages that [I]0-i ever heard of]2967-those dreadful amahagger - who are certainly with their gloom and their devilish and ferocious rites by far the most terrible savages that i ever heard of - there are [people with kindly hearts]2968-people with kindly hearts . Of course , self - interest may have had something to do with it . [He]910-the old man may have thought that [She]2969-she would suddenly reappear and demand an account of [us]2953-we at [his]910-the old man hands , but still , allowing for all deductions , it was a great deal more than [we]2953-we could expect under the circumstances , and [I]0-i can only say that [I]0-i shall for as long as [I]0-i live cherish a most affectionate remembrance of [[my]0-i nominal parent]2970-my nominal parent , [old Billali]190-billali .

Accordingly , after swallowing some food , [we]2953-we started in the litters , feeling , so far as [our]2953-we bodies went , wonderfully like [[our]2953-we old selves]2971-our old selves after [our]2953-we long rest and sleep . [I]0-i must leave the condition of [our]2953-we minds to the imagination .

Then came a terrible pull up [the cliff]723-the cliff . Sometimes the ascent was more natural , more often it was a zig - zag roadway cut , no doubt , in the first instance by [the old inhabitants of [K"r]56-k"r]4758-the old inhabitants of k"r . [The Amahagger]171-the amahagger say [they]171-the amahagger drive [their]171-the amahagger spare cattle over [it]2973-the great flat top of that mighty wall of rock once a year to pasture outside ; all [I]4758-the old inhabitants of k"r know is that those cattle must be uncommonly active on [their]171-the amahagger feet . Of course the litters were useless here , so [we]2953-we had to walk .[4758-the old inhabitants of k"r]

By midday , however , [we]2953-we reached [the great flat top of that mighty wall of rock]2973-the great flat top of that mighty wall of rock , and grand enough the view was from [it]2973-the great flat top of that mighty wall of rock , with [the plain of [K"r]56-k"r]4759-the plain of k"r , in the centre of which [we]2953-we could clearly make out the pillared ruins of [the Temple of [Truth]240-truth]2523-the temple of truth to the one side , and [the boundless and melancholy marsh on the other]4761-the boundless and melancholy marsh on the other . [This wall of rock]4762-this wall of rock , which had no doubt once formed the lip of [the crater]928-the crater , was about a mile and a half thick , and still covered with clinker . Nothing grew there , and the only thing to relieve [our]2953-we eyes were occasional pools of rain - water for rain had lately fallen wherever there was a little hollow . Over [the flat crest of [this mighty rampart]4765-this mighty rampart]4764-the flat crest of this mighty rampart [we]2953-we went , and then came the descent , which , if not so difficult a matter as the getting up , was still sufficiently break - neck , and took [us]2953-we till sunset . That night , however , [we]2953-we camped in safety upon the mighty slopes that rolled away to [the marsh beneath]4766-the marsh beneath .[4758-the old inhabitants of k"r]

On the following morning , about eleven o'clock , began [our]2953-we dreary journey across [those awful seas of swamps]2974-those awful seas of swamps which [I]0-i have already described .

For three whole days , through stench and mire , and the all - prevailing flavour of fear , did [[our]2953-we bearers]1353-our bearers struggle along , till at length [we]2953-we came to open rolling ground quite uncultivated , and mostly treeless , but covered with game of all sorts , which lies beyond that most desolate , and without guides utterly impracticable , district . And here on the following morning [we]2953-we bade farewell , not without some regret , to [old Billali]190-billali , who stroked [his]190-billali white beard and solemnly blessed [us]2953-we .

" Farewell , [[my]190-billali son]3150-my son [the Baboon]180-the baboon , "[190-billali] [he]190-billali said , " and farewell to [thee]3150-my son too , oh [Lion]183-leo . [I]190-billali can do no more to help [you]3150-my son . But if ever [ye]3150-my son come to [[your]3150-my son country]4768-your country , be advised , and venture no more into lands that [ye]3150-my son know not , lest [ye]3150-my son come back no more , but leave [your]3150-my son white bones to mark the limit of [your]3150-my son journeyings . Farewell once more ; often shall [I]190-billali think of [you]3150-my son , nor wilt [thou]3150-my son forget [me]190-billali , [[my]190-billali Baboon]3510-my baboon , for though [thy]3150-my son face is ugly [thy]3150-my son heart is true . "[190-billali] And then [he]190-billali turned and went , and with [him]190-billali went [the tall and sullen - looking bearers]2976-the tall and sullen - looking bearers , and that was the last that [we]2977-we saw of [the Amahagger]171-the amahagger . [We]2977-we watched [them]2976-the tall and sullen - looking bearers winding away with the empty litters like a procession bearing [dead men from a battle]2978-dead men from a battle , till the mists from [the marsh]730-the marsh gathered round [them]2976-the tall and sullen - looking bearers and hid [them]2976-the tall and sullen - looking bearers , and then , left utterly desolate in [the vast wilderness]2980-the vast wilderness , [we]2977-we turned and gazed round [us]2977-we and at [each other]417-each other .

Three weeks or so before [four men]2982-four men had entered [the marshes of [K"r]56-k"r]4770-the marshes of k"r , and now [two of [us]2977-we]4771-two of us were dead , and [the other two]4772-the other two had gone through adventures and experiences so strange and terrible that death [himself]4773-himself hath not a more fearful countenance . Three weeks - and only three weeks ! Truly time should be measured by events , and not by the lapse of hours . It seemed like thirty years since [we]2977-we saw the last of [[our]2977-we whale - boat]4774-our whale - boat .[183-leo]

" [We]2977-we must strike out for [the Zambesi]73-the zambesi , [Leo]183-leo , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " but [God]134-god knows if [we]2977-we shall ever get [there]3168-there . "[0-i]

[Leo]183-leo nodded . [He]183-leo had become very silent of late , and [we]2983-we started with nothing but the clothes [we]2983-we stood in , a compass , [our]2983-we revolvers and express rifles , and about two hundred rounds of ammunition , and so ended the history of [our]2983-we visit to [the ancient ruins of [mighty and imperial K"r]4777-mighty and imperial k"r]4776-the ancient ruins of mighty and imperial k"r .[0-i]

As for the adventures that subsequently befell [us]2983-we , strange and varied as they were , [I]0-i have , after deliberation , determined not to record them here . In these pages [I]0-i have only tried to give a short and clear account of an occurrence which [I]0-i believe to be unprecedented , and this [I]0-i have done , not with a view to immediate publication , but merely to put on paper while they are yet fresh in [our]2983-we memories the details of [our]2983-we journey and its result , which will , [I]0-i believe , prove interesting to [the world]252-the world if ever [we]2983-we determine to make them public . This , as at present advised , [we]2983-we do not intend should be done during [our]2983-we joint lives .

For the rest , it is of no public interest , resembling as it does the experience of [more than one Central African traveller]2985-more than one central african traveller . Suffice it to say , that [we]2983-we did , after incredible hardships and privations , reach [the Zambesi]73-the zambesi , which proved to be about a hundred and seventy miles south of where [Billali]190-billali left [us]2983-we . There [we]2983-we were for six months imprisoned by [a savage tribe , who believed [us]2983-we to be [supernatural beings]2987-supernatural beings , chiefly on account of [Leo]183-leo 's youthful face and snow - white hair]2986-a savage tribe , who believed us to be supernatural beings , chiefly on account of leo 's youthful face and snow - white hair . From [these people]902-these people [we]2983-we ultimately escaped , and , crossing [the Zambesi]73-the zambesi , wandered off southwards , where , when on the point of starvation , [we]2983-we were sufficiently fortunate to fall in with [a half - cast Portuguese elephant - hunter who had followed a troop of elephants farther inland than [he]2989-a half - cast portuguese elephant - hunter who had followed a troop of elephants farther inland than he had ever been before had ever been before]2989-a half - cast portuguese elephant - hunter who had followed a troop of elephants farther inland than he had ever been before . [This man]4214-this man treated [us]2983-we most hospitably , and ultimately through [his]4214-this man assistance [we]2983-we , after innumerable sufferings and adventures , reached [Delagoa Bay]10-delagoa bay , more than eighteen months from the time when [we]2983-we emerged from [the marshes of [K"r]56-k"r]4770-the marshes of k"r , and the very next day managed to catch [one of the steamboats that run round [the Cape]3-the cape]4779-one of the steamboats that run round the cape to [England]15-england . [Our]2983-we journey [home]648-home was a prosperous one , and [we]2983-we set [our]2983-we foot on [the quay]4781-the quay at [Southampton]102-southampton exactly two years from the date of [our]2983-we departure upon [our]2983-we wild and seemingly ridiculous quest , and [I]4214-this man now write these last words with [Leo]183-leo leaning over [my]4214-this man shoulder in [[my]4214-this man old room]4782-my old room in [[my]4214-this man college]321-my college , the very same into which some two - and - twenty years ago [[my]4214-this man poor friend]365-my poor friend [Vincey]108-leo came stumbling on the memorable night of [his]108-leo death , bearing the iron chest with [him]108-leo .[4214-this man]

And that is the end of this history so far as it concerns science and [the outside world]2991-the outside world . What its end will be as regards [Leo]108-leo and [myself]0-i is more than [I]0-i can guess at . But [we]2992-we feel that is not reached yet . A story that began more than two thousand years ago may stretch a long way into the dim and distant future .

Is [Leo]108-leo really [a reincarnation of [the ancient Kallikrates of whom the inscription tells]2994-the ancient kallikrates of whom the inscription tells]2993-a reincarnation of the ancient kallikrates of whom the inscription tells ? Or was [Ayesha]114-ayesha deceived by some strange hereditary resemblance ? [The reader]298-the reader must form [his]298-the reader own opinion on this as on many other matters . [I]0-i have [mine]0-i , which is that [she]114-ayesha made no such mistake .

Often [I]0-i sit alone at night , staring with the eyes of the mind into the blackness of unborn time , and wondering in what shape and form the great drama will be finally developed , and where the scene of its next act will be laid . And when that final development ultimately occurs , as [I]0-i have no doubt it must and will occur , in obedience to a fate that never swerves and a purpose that can not be altered , what will be the part played therein by [that beautiful Egyptian Amenartas]2996-that beautiful egyptian amenartas , [the Princess of [the royal race of [the Pharaohs]249-the pharaohs]2998-the royal race of the pharaohs]2997-the princess of the royal race of the pharaohs , for the love of whom [the Priest Kallikrates]250-the priest kallikrates broke [his]250-the priest kallikrates vows to [Isis]211-isis , and , pursued by the inexorable vengeance of [the outraged Goddess]2999-the outraged goddess , fled down [the coast of [Libya]103-libya]3000-the coast of libya to meet [his]250-the priest kallikrates doom at [K"r]56-k"r ?
